original: rgyun gyis rtag pa'i dbang gsungs pa /
analyzed: rgyun gyis rtag pa'i dbang gsungs pa /
translated: The statement of the empowerment of the continuum of the basis.

original: nga yi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: nga yi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for ‚Äúmine,‚Äù and so on,

original: byas pa'i dngos po dang / dngos po med pa rnam par spangs pas na zhes bya ba ni de ma yin pa'i phyir se gol gyi sgra la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skad cig pa de ma thag tu mtshams mi sbyor ba ni mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byas pa'i dngos po dang / dngos po med pa rnam par spangs pas na zhes bya ba ni de ma yin pa'i phyir se gol gyi sgra la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skad cig pa de ma thag tu mtshams mi sbyor ba ni mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: since it is free from the entity of the action and the nonentity, it is not that, and because it is a different characteristic, it does not connect to the instant of the sound of a finger snap, and so on.

original: rgyud ma skad cig ma 'dra ba rnam par mi 'chad pas na sems kyi rgyud rtag go zhes skad cig ma 'jig pa rnam par dgongs pa'i don to //üîΩmi gnyis par smra ba rnams kyis phyi rol gyi dngos po @92a * //
analyzed: rgyud ma skad cig ma 'dra ba rnam par mi 'chad pas na sems kyi rgyud rtag go zhes skad cig ma 'jig pa rnam par dgongs pa'i don to // mi gnyis par smra ba rnams kyis phyi rol gyi dngos po @92a * //
translated: Since the continuum of the mind is not interrupted, the continuum of the mind is permanent. The meaning of the instant of destruction is contemplated.

original: med pas rtag par rjes su dpag par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: med pas rtag par rjes su dpag par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Since external things do not exist, it is not logical to infer permanence.

original: 'gyur ba'i grogs byas pas na mi rtag pa yin la /
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i grogs byas pas na mi rtag pa yin la /
translated: Since it assists in change, it is impermanent.

original: ma byas pa'i phyir mi gnyis par rtag go zhes pa phyogs de la rgyu med pas na ri bong gi rva bzhin du med pa kho na ste /
analyzed: ma byas pa'i phyir mi gnyis par rtag go zhes pa phyogs de la rgyu med pas na ri bong gi rva bzhin du med pa kho na ste /
translated: Because it is not made, it is permanent, like a second head. Since that position is causeless, it is just as nonexistent as the horn of a rabbit.

original: de bas na phyi rol gyi dngos po med pas rtag pa rjes su dpag pa'i phyir rtag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na phyi rol gyi dngos po med pas rtag pa rjes su dpag pa'i phyir rtag pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because external things do not exist, they are not permanent because they are inferred to be impermanent.

original: smra ba po gang yang phyi rol med pa'i phyir rtag pa la rjes su dpog pas dngos po rnams rtag pas na rtag pa dang bsam du med pa ste zhes smra ba de rtag pa dang / bsam du med pa de'i rgyu'i rang gi mtshan nyid mi shes te /
analyzed: smra ba po gang yang phyi rol med pa'i phyir rtag pa la rjes su dpog pas dngos po rnams rtag pas na rtag pa dang bsam du med pa ste zhes smra ba de rtag pa dang / bsam du med pa de'i rgyu'i rang gi mtshan nyid mi shes te /
translated: Since the speaker infers permanence because external things do not exist, he says, ‚ÄúThings are permanent and inconceivable because they are permanent.‚Äù He does not know the cause of that permanence and inconceivability, its own characteristic.

original: rmi lam dang mig 'phrul gyi mtshan nyid kyis dngos por gyur pa de med pas na de med do zhes par rgyu med pa'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin med par mi shes so zhes dgongs pa'i don to //
analyzed: rmi lam dang mig 'phrul gyi mtshan nyid kyis dngos por gyur pa de med pas na de med do zhes par rgyu med pa'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin med par mi shes so zhes dgongs pa'i don to //
translated: Since the characteristic of a dream or an illusion does not exist as a thing, it is nonexistent. Since that is causeless, he does not understand that things are essenceless. That is the meaning of the intended basis.

original: gtam byar yang mi rung ngo zhes pa ni smra bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gtam byar yang mi rung ngo zhes pa ni smra bar mi bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not suitable as a topic of discussion‚Äù means it should not be spoken.

original: phyi rol gyi don dngos po rtag pas rtag par rjes su dpag go zhes gang nas de skad du 'byung ba der yang gnyis par smra ba rnams kyis rdul phra mo rnams rtag pa'i rgyu med pas na ri bong gi rva ltar dngos po med ces so //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don dngos po rtag pas rtag par rjes su dpag go zhes gang nas de skad du 'byung ba der yang gnyis par smra ba rnams kyis rdul phra mo rnams rtag pa'i rgyu med pas na ri bong gi rva ltar dngos po med ces so //
translated: The second position is that the atoms are not the cause of permanence, and therefore, like the horn of a rabbit, they are non-existent.

original: tshad mas khyab pa'i tshul spyir gsungs pas gnyis pa dang mi gnyis par smra ba rnams kyis rjes su dpag pa thams cad mkhyen pa sun dbyung ba'i phyir mi gnyis par smra ba rnams kyis rtag pa'i rjes su dpag par ji lta bur mi rung ba ni dpyad
analyzed: tshad mas khyab pa'i tshul spyir gsungs pas gnyis pa dang mi gnyis par smra ba rnams kyis rjes su dpag pa thams cad mkhyen pa sun dbyung ba'i phyir mi gnyis par smra ba rnams kyis rtag pa'i rjes su dpag par ji lta bur mi rung ba ni dpyad
translated: Since the method of pervasion by valid cognition is generally stated, all inferences of the second and non-dualists are refuted by the omniscient one. Therefore, how is it that the non-dualists' inference of permanence is not appropriate?

original: pa'o // gnyis par smra ba rnams kyis dpyad par mi bya ste /
analyzed: pa'o // gnyis par smra ba rnams kyis dpyad par mi bya ste /
translated: It is analyzed. The second position should not be analyzed,

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po rtag pas rjes su dpag pa ni rdul phra mo rnams rtag pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes te ji lta zhes na yan lag can gyi cha'i dngos po med pas so //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po rtag pas rjes su dpag pa ni rdul phra mo rnams rtag pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes te ji lta zhes na yan lag can gyi cha'i dngos po med pas so //
translated: because the inference of external objects is permanent due to the permanence of atoms and the inconceivable. How is it? Because there is no entity of the part of the whole.

original: phyi rol gyi yan lag can gyis thams cad yan lag gi cha dang bral na dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yan lag can gyis thams cad yan lag gi cha dang bral na dngos po med pa ste /
translated: If the external whole is devoid of parts, it is a non-entity.

original: des na mtha'i rdul rnams rtag pa yin pas na rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: des na mtha'i rdul rnams rtag pa yin pas na rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since the ultimate particles are permanent, they are inferred.

original: ji ltar snang ba byed pas smras pa /
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba byed pas smras pa /
translated: The one who speaks of appearances says:üîΩWhen a clod is divided into parts, the distinctions such as soft and very soft are apprehended as parts. That which is without lightness is called a particle.

original: bong ba rnam pa'i char phye ba na 'jam pa dang / cher 'jam pa la sogs par khyad par du cha rnams su bzung ba gang de la yang ba med pa ni rdul zhes bya'o zhes pa'i rtag par smra ba bo'i mu stegs can rnams rtag par smra ba po rnams khong du mi chud pa rnams kyis rtag pa
analyzed: bong ba rnam pa'i char phye ba na 'jam pa dang / cher 'jam pa la sogs par khyad par du cha rnams su bzung ba gang de la yang ba med pa ni rdul zhes bya'o zhes pa'i rtag par smra ba bo'i mu stegs can rnams rtag par smra ba po rnams khong du mi chud pa rnams kyis rtag pa
translated: The non-Buddhist proponents of permanence, who do not understand the permanence of the TathƒÅgata,

original: rjes su dpag pa thams cad mkhyen pas mi 'thad par rgyu med par bstan pa la sogs pa @92b spyir bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa thams cad mkhyen pas mi 'thad par rgyu med par bstan pa la sogs pa @92b spyir bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: all their inferences are taught by the Omniscient One to be untenable, without cause, and so on, as explained in general.

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rnam par rtog pa'i 'jigs pas skrag pa dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni phyi rol gyi don du 'khrul nas gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pas shin tu skrag nas mya ngan las 'da' ba tshol bar byed de /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rnam par rtog pa'i 'jigs pas skrag pa dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni phyi rol gyi don du 'khrul nas gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pas shin tu skrag nas mya ngan las 'da' ba tshol bar byed de /
translated: Those who are frightened by the fear of the discursive thoughts of the sufferings of cyclic existence, etc. means that, having erred in regard to external objects, they are frightened by the impermanence, suffering, etc. of the aggregates of form, etc. and seek nirvana.

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis med pa don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa mi shes so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis med pa don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa mi shes so //
translated: They do not know the nirvana of the perfect knowledge of ultimate truth, which is non-discursive.

original: phyi'i don lam mgon par zhen pas theg pa gsum du rtog par byed ces bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: phyi'i don lam mgon par zhen pas theg pa gsum du rtog par byed ces bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: By clinging to external objects, they imagine the three vehicles. This is the condensed meaning.

original: khyad par mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin bden pa mngon par mi shes pas dngos po la rnams par rtog pa med pa dang / dbang po rnams kyi yul ma 'ongs pa'i rgyun bcad pas srid pa dang longs spyod la skyo ba'i phyir 'gog pa'i dbyings kyi mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin bden pa mngon par mi shes pas dngos po la rnams par rtog pa med pa dang / dbang po rnams kyi yul ma 'ongs pa'i rgyun bcad pas srid pa dang longs spyod la skyo ba'i phyir 'gog pa'i dbyings kyi mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du 'byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase in particular, the ignorance refers to the fact that, because of the non-perception of the reality of the nature, there is no conceptualization of entities, and because of the cessation of the future continuity of the objects of the sense-faculties, there is the direct realization of the nirvana of the realm of cessation, because of the disenchantment with existence and enjoyment.

original: ji ltar 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said in this very text:

original: ting 'dzin dregs pas myos pa ni //
analyzed: ting 'dzin dregs pas myos pa ni //
translated: Those who are intoxicated with the pride of samadhi,

original: de dag zag med dbyangs su gnas //
analyzed: de dag zag med dbyangs su gnas //
translated: they abide in the undefiled realm.

original: so so rang gis rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chud pa'i rang bzhin lus dang longs spyod dang / gnas su snang ba'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i gnas 'phos pa'i mtshan nyid mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis kyi phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog pa spangs pa las 'gyur ba ni mi shes so //
analyzed: so so rang gis rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chud pa'i rang bzhin lus dang longs spyod dang / gnas su snang ba'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i gnas 'phos pa'i mtshan nyid mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis kyi phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog pa spangs pa las 'gyur ba ni mi shes so //
translated: The phrase the individual intuitive knowledge and so forth refers to the fact that the transformation of the alaya-vijnana, which has the nature of the container, and which appears as the body, enjoyment, and abode, into the nature of the two kinds of nirvana, which is characterized by the transference of the basis of the alaya-vijnana, and which is the intuitive knowledge of non-duality, is not understood because of the abandonment of the conceptualization of the error of the two kinds of nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni sems tsam nyid du snang ba med pa ni mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni sems tsam nyid du snang ba med pa ni mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The so-called nirvana is the non-appearance of mind-only; it is called nirvana.

original: ji ltar bdun brgya pa las 'byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar bdun brgya pa las 'byung ba /
translated: As it is said in the Sapta≈õatikƒÅ Praj√±ƒÅpƒÅramitƒÅ:

original: 'di nyid mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: This is nirvana.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: sems pa med pa nyid do zhes te /
analyzed: sems pa med pa nyid do zhes te /
translated: It is the absence of mind.

original: de ltar smra ba por mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar smra ba por mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One does not become a proponent of that.

original: rang gi sems snang ba'i spyod yul du mngon par mi shes pa ste zhes bya ba ni gnyis kyis rnam par sems mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba'i spyod yul du mngon par mi shes pa ste zhes bya ba ni gnyis kyis rnam par sems mi shes pa'o //
translated: One does not understand the domain of experience that appears to one's own mind means one does not understand the two as consciousness.

original: phyi rol gyi snang ba sems kyi spyod yul du mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba ni gzung ba'i cha la phyi rol gyi bar rtog par byed de /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi snang ba sems kyi spyod yul du mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba ni gzung ba'i cha la phyi rol gyi bar rtog par byed de /
translated: One conceives of external appearances as the domain of experience of the mind means one conceives of the objective aspect as external.

original: de dag kyang 'khrul pas na 'khor bar rab 'khor ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang 'khrul pas na 'khor bar rab 'khor ro //
translated: Since those are deluded, one revolves in cyclic existence.

original: gzhan yang chos thams cad ma skyes par ston to zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi skye ba'i rang bzhin med pas gsung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang chos thams cad ma skyes par ston to zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi skye ba'i rang bzhin med pas gsung ngo //
translated: Moreover, it shows that all phenomena are unborn, and so on, which means that it is said that the dependent nature lacks the nature of arising.

original: de'i rgyu gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i rgyu gsungs pa /
translated: The cause of that is stated:

original: rang gi sems snang ba'i dngos po med pa dang zhes pa ste /üîΩrmi lam @93a * //
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba'i dngos po med pa dang zhes pa ste / rmi lam @93a * //
translated: ‚ÄúThe non-existence of things that are appearances of one‚Äôs own mind.‚ÄùüîΩLike the nature of dreams,

original: dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib la sogs pa'i rang bzhin bzhin no //
analyzed: dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib la sogs pa'i rang bzhin bzhin no //
translated: illusions, and floaters, and so on.

original: ji ltar na ma skyes zhes pa dang / rigs pa gzhan gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar na ma skyes zhes pa dang / rigs pa gzhan gsungs pa /
translated: How is it non-arisen? Another reason is stated:

original: med pa las skye ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes so //
analyzed: med pa las skye ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes so //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause there is no arising from non-existence.‚Äù

original: yod pa na dngos por yod pa'i phyir skye ba med do //
analyzed: yod pa na dngos por yod pa'i phyir skye ba med do //
translated: When something exists, it does not arise because it already exists.

original: med pa yang bskyed mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa yang bskyed mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And when something does not exist, it cannot be produced.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa la byed pa po dang / las dang byed pa mngon par 'brel ba med de /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa la byed pa po dang / las dang byed pa mngon par 'brel ba med de /
translated: An agent, action, and instrument are not manifestly related to an existent or an absence.

original: ji ltar dbu ma las 'byung ba //üîΩyod dang med pa'i don la ni //
analyzed: ji ltar dbu ma las 'byung ba // yod dang med pa'i don la ni //
translated: As it is said in the Madhyamaka:üîΩWith respect to existent and absent objects,

original: rkyen rnams yod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: rkyen rnams yod pa ma yin te //
translated: conditions do not exist.

original: med na rkyen ni su yi yin //
analyzed: med na rkyen ni su yi yin //
translated: If they do not exist, whose conditions are they?

original: yod pa rkyen gyis ci zhig bya //
analyzed: yod pa rkyen gyis ci zhig bya //
translated: What would conditions do for an existent?

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams gyis  yang dag pa ma yin par so sor brtags pa'i rang bzhin du rnam par brtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyi rol gyi don yongs suüîΩrtog par byed do //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams gyis  yang dag pa ma yin par so sor brtags pa'i rang bzhin du rnam par brtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyi rol gyi don yongs su rtog par byed do //
translated: This means that childish ordinary beings imagine external objects that do not exist.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin la yang rtag pa dang / mdzes pa dang / gtsang ba la sogs par byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis yang dag pa ma yin par kun tu brtags pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin la yang rtag pa dang / mdzes pa dang / gtsang ba la sogs par byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis yang dag pa ma yin par kun tu brtags pa ste /
translated: In that kind of nature, childish ordinary beings imagine what is unreal, such as permanence, beauty, purity, and so on.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu brtags pa'i rang bzhin rnam par brtags pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu brtags pa'i rang bzhin rnam par brtags pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has the imagined nature of what is unreal is called that.

original: don dam pa'i rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba grub pa mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa las gsungs pa /
analyzed: don dam pa'i rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba grub pa mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa las gsungs pa /
translated: The ultimate dependent origination is taught in the Acintyavimok·π£a S≈´tra:

original: 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtag pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang gis gnyis kyi rnam pa'i dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin med pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtag pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang gis gnyis kyi rnam pa'i dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin med pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The object of the wisdom of the noble ones' individual investigation, etc. is the nature of the ultimate truth, which is the absence of nature of all things that have the aspect of the two, the dependent and the imaginary.

original: de nyid gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid du skye'o //
analyzed: de nyid gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid du skye'o //
translated: That very [nature] arises as the characteristic of non-duality.

original: mtshan nyid ni de nyid skye ba grub pa'i mtshan ma ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni de nyid skye ba grub pa'i mtshan ma ste /
translated: The characteristic is the sign of the establishment of that very arising.

original: rtog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rtog par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the imagination.

original: de nyid dngos po yin pas na gzhan dag ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du mi skye ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid dngos po yin pas na gzhan dag ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du mi skye ba ste /
translated: Since that very [nature] is a thing, others do not arise like the horns of a rabbit, etc.

original: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rnams shes rab kyis dpyad pa na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni mi ring ngo //
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rnams shes rab kyis dpyad pa na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni mi ring ngo //
translated: When the dependent origination is examined by the wisdom that has the aspect of the two, it does not originate.

original: de'i 'og tu 'byung zhes bya ba yang rang bzhin med pas na rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'byung zhes bya ba yang rang bzhin med pas na rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: Since what arises after that also lacks nature, it is not dependently originated.

original: byis pa rnams la rang bzhin gyi 'khrul pa yod pas na byis pa rang bzhin du rnam par brtags pas mi gnyis @93b pa'i rang bzhin spyod yul du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byis pa rnams la rang bzhin gyi 'khrul pa yod pas na byis pa rang bzhin du rnam par brtags pas mi gnyis @93b pa'i rang bzhin spyod yul du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since childish beings have natural error, the nature of non-duality does not become the object of childish beings who are imagined to be natural.

original: de don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par chud pa'i rang bzhin gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i yul ma yin zhes pa'i bar du'o //üîΩlus dang longs spyod dang / gnas su snang ba'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa'i lta bar lhung ba'i bsam pa zhes bya ba de la byis pa rnams 'dzin pa dang gzung ba gnyis la mngon par zhen pas rab rib can rnams rnam pa gnyis su 'khrul pa bzhin du skye ba dang /
analyzed: de don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par chud pa'i rang bzhin gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i yul ma yin zhes pa'i bar du'o // lus dang longs spyod dang / gnas su snang ba'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa'i lta bar lhung ba'i bsam pa zhes bya ba de la byis pa rnams 'dzin pa dang gzung ba gnyis la mngon par zhen pas rab rib can rnams rnam pa gnyis su 'khrul pa bzhin du skye ba dang /
translated: Up to: The nature of ultimate truth, which is non-duality, is not an object of apprehended and apprehender.

original: gnas pa dang / 'jig pa rnams rtog go //
analyzed: gnas pa dang / 'jig pa rnams rtog go //
translated: The consciousness of the ground-of-all that appears as the body, enjoyments, and abode, with the thought that falls into the view of arising, abiding, and destruction, in that, childish beings, due to strong attachment to the two, apprehended and apprehender, like those with cataracts, imagine arising, abiding, and destruction as two.

original: don dam par ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang gis 'khrul pa'i rnam pa rnams la skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa med do //
analyzed: don dam par ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang gis 'khrul pa'i rnam pa rnams la skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa med do //
translated: But in the ultimate sense, like a dream, an illusion, etc., there is no origination, no duration, and no cessation of the aspects of error due to the other-dependent nature.

original: mtshan nyid yongs su 'dris par bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni spyi dang khyad par gyi mtshan nyid rab tu rtogs pa de'i shes pa 'jug go //
analyzed: mtshan nyid yongs su 'dris par bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni spyi dang khyad par gyi mtshan nyid rab tu rtogs pa de'i shes pa 'jug go //
translated: The knowledge of the general and specific characteristics is the entry into the knowledge of that.

original: de la spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The general characteristics are impermanence, selflessness, suffering, etc.

original: khyad par gyi mtshan nyid ni rten pa la sogs pa'i las dang / sra ba dang / rlan pa dang / dro ba dang / g-yo bar grub pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi mtshan nyid ni rten pa la sogs pa'i las dang / sra ba dang / rlan pa dang / dro ba dang / g-yo bar grub pa'o //
translated: The specific characteristics are the functions of support, etc., and the establishment of solidity, fluidity, heat, and motility.

original: yang 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid la /üîΩgzugs ni dbang po lnga dang don //
analyzed: yang 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid la / gzugs ni dbang po lnga dang don //

original: rnam gnyis rnam pa nyi shu sgra //
analyzed: rnam gnyis rnam pa nyi shu sgra //

original: brgyad po ro ni rnam pa drug //
analyzed: brgyad po ro ni rnam pa drug //

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung bar 'jug pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa dang / nan tan bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung bar 'jug pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa dang / nan tan bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The engagement in dependent origination is from the formation up to the performance of the action.

analyzed: 'jug pa des rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba zab mo mi gnyis pa'i mtshan nyid la nan tan mi byed pa'o //
translated: By that engagement, one does not perform the practice of the profound dependent origination with the characteristic of non-duality.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa mngon par rtogs pa'i lta bas zhes bya ba ni bdag gi don du lta bas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi rnam pa nyid la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang /

analyzed: bdag med pa dang / stong pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas 'dod chags dang bral nas /
translated: emptiness, and no-self, and so on.

analyzed: gyis mi khyab pa'i 'pho ba dang ldan pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa ste /

original: gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes nas skad cig mar 'jig pa yongs su shes pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i nyan thos rnams phung por snang ba rnams las skyo bar 'gyur ro //

translated: Others, having understood that suffering arises from causes, become inclined toward nirvana. Those who are free from external attachment, such as the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas, do not see the selflessness of phenomena.

original: 'du 'dzi med pa'i rkyen ni bden pa'i dngos po la mngon par gnas te rang sangs rgyas kyi mngon par shes pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: 'du 'dzi med pa'i rkyen ni bden pa'i dngos po la mngon par gnas te rang sangs rgyas kyi mngon par shes pa skyed par byed do //
translated: The condition of being free from worldly concerns is to abide in the reality of the noble truths and to generate the superknowledges of the pratyekabuddhas.

analyzed: rang rang gi lus kyi rdzu 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs rnam pa mang pos ni nam mkhar 'phags pa la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: zung gi cho 'phrul ni 'bar ba dang char pa 'bebs pa la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i cho 'phrul de lta bu bshad pa na dga' bar 'gyur ro //

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i theg pa mngon par rtogs pa la sogs pa ni phung po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin med par shes pa ste /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i theg pa mngon par rtogs pa la sogs pa ni phung po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin med par shes pa ste /

translated: The stage of thorough preparation is so called because it is the stage of thorough preparation for the path of insight.

analyzed: de bzhin du yang bsgrub par mdzad pa so so rang gi kun gzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
