translated: but they speak of the nondual reality.

original: de'i rgyur gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i rgyur gsungs pa /
translated: The cause of that is stated:

original: dam pa'i don gyi sgo mo la sogs pa ni sems tsam don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa la dngos po dang / dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa'i bsam gtan la sogs pa de dag thams cad med do //
analyzed: dam pa'i don gyi sgo mo la sogs pa ni sems tsam don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa la dngos po dang / dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa'i bsam gtan la sogs pa de dag thams cad med do //
translated: The doors of the ultimate and so on are the ultimate reality of mind only, the nondual perfect cognition. In that, all those concentrations and so on that are conceptualized as things and nonthings do not exist.

original: sems can thams cad la ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po yod pas ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa rnams kyis de dag thams cad sangs rgyas su dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po yod pas ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa rnams kyis de dag thams cad sangs rgyas su dgod par bya'o //
translated: Since the essence of the tathƒÅgata exists in all sentient beings, those who have generated the mind of enlightenment should establish all of them in buddhahood.

original: dus kyi rim pa la ltos te /
analyzed: dus kyi rim pa la ltos te /
translated: In dependence on the passage of time,

original: rigs dang rigs med par rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: rigs dang rigs med par rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: the existence and nonexistence of the potential is posited.

original: ji ltar / ting nge 'dzin @95b gyi rgyal po las 'byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar / ting nge 'dzin @95b gyi rgyal po las 'byung ba /
translated: As it is said in the SamaÃÑdhiraÃÑja:

original: 'gro ba 'di kun sangs rgyas 'gyur //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'di kun sangs rgyas 'gyur //
translated: All these beings will become Buddhas

original: snod min sems can gang yang med //
analyzed: snod min sems can gang yang med //
translated: There are no sentient beings who are notüîΩfit vessels.

original: ces pa'o // 'dod chen pa rnams thar bar 'gyur kyang /
analyzed: ces pa'o // 'dod chen pa rnams thar bar 'gyur kyang /
translated: Even though those of the vehicle of the Disciple and the vehicle of the Solitary Sage are liberated,

original: de dag thar bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag thar bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: they are not liberated,

original: log pa'i shes pas mngon pa'i nga rgyal can dam pa'i chos spong bas dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: log pa'i shes pas mngon pa'i nga rgyal can dam pa'i chos spong bas dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because, through the pride of manifest knowledge, they abandon the holy Dharma, and thus abandon all roots of virtue.

original: gnyis pa ni sems can gyi don du smon lam btab pas btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams thar pa mi 'chad do //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni sems can gyi don du smon lam btab pas btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams thar pa mi 'chad do //
translated: The second is that the holy Bodhisattvas do not interrupt liberation, because they make prayers for the sake of sentient beings.

original: shin tu mya ngan las mi 'da' zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos thams cad thog ma nas mya ngan las 'das par shes rab kyis shes nas de'i don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa
analyzed: shin tu mya ngan las mi 'da' zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos thams cad thog ma nas mya ngan las 'das par shes rab kyis shes nas de'i don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa
translated: ‚ÄúNot at all passing into Nirvana‚Äù and so forth, is that, having understood with wisdom that all phenomena are primordially in Nirvana, the ultimate truth, which is the non-dual perfect knowledge of that, is not at all in Nirvana.

original: yin gyi / nyan thos ltar yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: yin gyi / nyan thos ltar yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da'o //
translated: but not like the Sravakas, he does not enter into complete Nirvana.

original: ma yin zhes bya ba ni nyan thos 'dod chen pa ste /
analyzed: ma yin zhes bya ba ni nyan thos 'dod chen pa ste /
translated: The word not refers to the Sravakas who are attached to the Dharma.

original: ji skad ces smras pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad ces smras pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is it that they say?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis dge ba che nas nam zhig de mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis dge ba che nas nam zhig de mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro //
translated: The Sravakas say: The Bodhisattva, who has not yet attained the stage of joy, will enter into Nirvana through the grace of the Tathagata, when he has accumulated a great deal of merit.

original: rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtag pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid gsum la mkhas par bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtag pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid gsum la mkhas par bya'o //
translated: The three natures, etc. One should be skilled in the three natures: the imagined, the relative, and the perfect.

original: de dag ji lta bur 'byung ba de ltar ston te /üîΩkun tu brtags pa'i rang bzhin ni mtshan ma las 'byung ste zhes pa sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i mtshan ma las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de dag ji lta bur 'byung ba de ltar ston te / kun tu brtags pa'i rang bzhin ni mtshan ma las 'byung ste zhes pa sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i mtshan ma las 'byung ngo //
translated: They are taught in accordance with the way in which they occur.üîΩThe imagined nature occurs from signs, i.e., from the signs of blue, yellow, etc.

original: gzhan gyi dbang mtshan ma yin par bsgrub par mdzad pa de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang mtshan ma yin par bsgrub par mdzad pa de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The relative is established as the sign, as is said beginning with the words: In that regard, etc.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin ci 'dra ba zhig ces pa dang gsungs pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin ci 'dra ba zhig ces pa dang gsungs pa /
translated: What is the nature of the other-dependent?

original: dngos po'i mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid lta bu'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the characteristic of the sign of an entity.

original: dngos por so sor snang ba na gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid dang / dma' ba dang ma tho ba la sogs pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs par de de ltar rnam pa de lta bu ni gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dngos por so sor snang ba na gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid dang / dma' ba dang ma tho ba la sogs pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs par de de ltar rnam pa de lta bu ni gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin zhes bya'o //
translated: When it appears as a separate entity, it is the characteristic of the sign of form and so on, and it is like the characteristic of the sign of an entity that is low, vile, and so on, and virtuous, nonvirtuous, and so on. That is the nature of the other-dependent.

original: blo gros chen po de la dngos po'i mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: blo gros chen po de la dngos po'i mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: MahƒÅmati, the attachment to the characteristic of the sign of an entity is like this.

original: ji ltar rnam pa gnyis zhes pa dang / de nyid gsungs pa'i ming la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid dang / dngos po'i mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa gnyis zhes pa dang / de nyid gsungs pa'i ming la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid dang / dngos po'i mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
translated: How is it twofold? It is said to be the characteristic of attachment to the name and the characteristic of attachment to the sign of an entity.

original: de la dngos po'i @96a * //
analyzed: de la dngos po'i @96a * //
translated: Therein, the characteristic of attachment to the name is the characteristic of attachment to the sign of an entity.

original: mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid ni nang dang phyi'i chos la mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid ni nang dang phyi'i chos la mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of attachment to signs is attachment to internal and external phenomena.

original: ming la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid ni nang dang phyi rol gyi skye mched de dag nyid la ste /
analyzed: ming la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid ni nang dang phyi rol gyi skye mched de dag nyid la ste /
translated: The characteristic of attachment to names is those very internal and external sense bases.

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par gyi mtshan nyid du rnam par rtog go //
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par gyi mtshan nyid du rnam par rtog go //
translated: One conceptualizes them as having the characteristics of specific individual and general characteristics.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni sra ba dang / rlan pa dang / dro ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni sra ba dang / rlan pa dang / dro ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Individual characteristics are solidity, fluidity, heat, etc.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: General characteristics are impermanence, selflessness, etc.

original: yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The nature of the perfected is...

original: mtshan ma dang ming gi dngos po'i mtshan nyid rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba ni ma grub pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang ming gi dngos po'i mtshan nyid rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba ni ma grub pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The nature of the perfected is the suchness of non-establishment, free from the conceptualization of the characteristics of signs and names.

original: mtshan ma ni 'jug pa'i mtshan ma ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma ni 'jug pa'i mtshan ma ste /
translated: Signs are the characteristics of engagement,

original: rigs dang yon tan dang / byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rigs dang yon tan dang / byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: having the characteristics of lineage, qualities, and actions.

original: dngos po'i mtshan nyid der mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan nyid der mi 'jug ste /
translated: The characteristic of an entity does not engage in that.

original: de bzhin du rnam par rtog pa lam yang ba dkar mo 'gro'o zhes sgra brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par rtog pa lam yang ba dkar mo 'gro'o zhes sgra brjod do //
translated: In the same way, the path of conceptualization is expressed as the word ‚Äúcow.‚Äù

original: nu ma dang / skra dang ldan pa ni bud med /
analyzed: nu ma dang / skra dang ldan pa ni bud med /
translated: One who possesses breasts and hair is a woman.

original: ces pa dang / khre ser skya zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa dang / khre ser skya zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: And, ‚ÄúOne who is yellow-skinned is a K·π£atriya,‚Äù and so on.

original: rnam pa de lta bur 'jug pa'i mtshan ma'i dngos po dang ming du rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba ni de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bur 'jug pa'i mtshan ma'i dngos po dang ming du rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba ni de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Freedom from the conceptualization of such aspects as entities and names is called ‚Äúsuchness.‚Äù

original: byed pa po dang / las dang byed pa dang / rjod pa dang / brjod pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang / yod pa dang / med pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba de bzhin du mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: byed pa po dang / las dang byed pa dang / rjod pa dang / brjod pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang / yod pa dang / med pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba de bzhin du mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: Freedom from all conceptualization of agent, object, action, expression, expression-base, apprehender, apprehended, existence, and nonexistence is called ‚Äúsignlessness.‚Äù

original: snang ba med pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa'i rang bzhin ni de bzhin nyid yin no //
analyzed: snang ba med pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa'i rang bzhin ni de bzhin nyid yin no //
translated: The nature of correct understanding of signlessness, nonappearance, and nonduality of ultimate truth is suchness.

original: ming dang mtshan ma dang / kun tu rtog pa ni rtag pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin gnyis kyi mtshan nyid du gtogs so //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma dang / kun tu rtog pa ni rtag pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin gnyis kyi mtshan nyid du gtogs so //
translated: Name, sign, and conceptualization belong to the characteristic of the two realities of the imagined and the other-dependent.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes dang de bzhin nyid dag ni grub par gtogs so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes dang de bzhin nyid dag ni grub par gtogs so //
translated: Correct direct intuition and thusness belong to the perfected reality.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa ni ming dang / mtshan ma dang / rnam par rtog pa gsum du gtogs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa ni ming dang / mtshan ma dang / rnam par rtog pa gsum du gtogs so //
translated: The truths of suffering and of the causal process belong to the three: name, sign, and conceptualization.

original: lam dang 'gog pa'i bden pa ni yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: lam dang 'gog pa'i bden pa ni yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The truths of the path and of cessation belong to correct direct intuition and thusness.

original: slob dpon ba su ban dhus dbus mtha' rnam par 'byed pa ni theg pa chen po'i tshul kun rdzob dang don dam par bsdus so //
analyzed: slob dpon ba su ban dhus dbus mtha' rnam par 'byed pa ni theg pa chen po'i tshul kun rdzob dang don dam par bsdus so //
translated: Vasubandhu, the master, in the MadhyƒÅntavibhƒÅga, includes the MahƒÅyƒÅna in the conventional and the ultimate.

original: bdag cag gis ni chos lnga bsdu ba la yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin pa nyid do //
analyzed: bdag cag gis ni chos lnga bsdu ba la yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin pa nyid do //
translated: We, in the Pa√±caskandhaprakara·πáa, include correct direct intuition and thusness in the ultimate.

original: rim pa'i @96b khyad par du ste /
analyzed: rim pa'i @96b khyad par du ste /
translated: The difference is in the order.

original: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las nyan thos rnams kyi lam gyi rnam par shes pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thams cad mkhyen ba nyid dar la phra mo'i sgrib pas g-yags pa lta bu dang /
analyzed: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las nyan thos rnams kyi lam gyi rnam par shes pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thams cad mkhyen ba nyid dar la phra mo'i sgrib pas g-yags pa lta bu dang /
translated: Just as the Perfection of Wisdom and the Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning explain that the path consciousness of sravakas and the omniscience of bodhisattvas are obscured by subtle obscurations,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa la sgrib pa med par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa la sgrib pa med par bshad pa ste /
translated: and that the unobstructed omniscience of the Bhagavan Buddhas is unobscured.

original: des na snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du 'byed pa'i khyad par gnyis kyi yang dag pa'i ye shes dang de bzhin pa nyid bye brag tu dbye'o zhes dam pa'i chos rgyas pa'i don du thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs par brtag go //
analyzed: des na snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du 'byed pa'i khyad par gnyis kyi yang dag pa'i ye shes dang de bzhin pa nyid bye brag tu dbye'o zhes dam pa'i chos rgyas pa'i don du thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs par brtag go //
translated: Therefore, the omniscient one should be understood to have intended that the distinction between the two types of correct wisdom and thusness be made in terms of the distinction between the concentration with appearances and the concentration without appearances for the sake of elaborating upon the excellent teaching.

original: gzhan yang blo gros chen po byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdag med pa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid shes pa rab tu dbye ba la mkhas par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bdag dang bdag gi med pa zhes bya ba ni bdag rtag par
analyzed: gzhan yang blo gros chen po byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdag med pa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid shes pa rab tu dbye ba la mkhas par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bdag dang bdag gi med pa zhes bya ba ni bdag rtag par
translated: Here, ‚Äúself and ‚Äòmine‚Äô do not exist‚Äù means that a permanent self is

original: mi rung ste /
analyzed: mi rung ste /
translated: not tenable.

original: rtag pa ma skyes pas na ri bong gi rva ltar dngos po med do //
analyzed: rtag pa ma skyes pas na ri bong gi rva ltar dngos po med do //
translated: Since the permanent is unarisen, it is non-existent like the horn of a rabbit.

original: rtag pa la ni rim dang cig car don byed par 'gal te /
analyzed: rtag pa la ni rim dang cig car don byed par 'gal te /
translated: For the permanent, it is contradictory to function sequentially or simultaneously.

original: rim gyis ji ltar na byed ltos pa'i rgyu med pas na gzhan gyi khyad par du bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rim gyis ji ltar na byed ltos pa'i rgyu med pas na gzhan gyi khyad par du bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How could it function sequentially? Because it is independent, it cannot be distinguished from others.

original: cig car yang don byed par mi rigs te /
analyzed: cig car yang don byed par mi rigs te /
translated: It is also not tenable for it to function simultaneously.

original: thang cig tu byas pa dus gsum du bya ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thang cig tu byas pa dus gsum du bya ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the function in one moment is not observed in the three times.

original: cig car du byas na yang dus gzhan du byed pa med par gnas par mi rung ste /
analyzed: cig car du byas na yang dus gzhan du byed pa med par gnas par mi rung ste /
translated: Even if it functions simultaneously, it is not tenable to remain without functioning at another time.

original: de bzhin du yang dus kyi rim par dbye ba na shing dang thal ba la sogs pa bzhin du mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dus kyi rim par dbye ba na shing dang thal ba la sogs pa bzhin du mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, if it is divided into temporal stages, it becomes impermanent, like a tree, ashes, etc.

original: skra dang rtsva la sogs pa bcad nas phyir skyes pa la yang so sor bshes pa'i don rab tu 'jug ste /
analyzed: skra dang rtsva la sogs pa bcad nas phyir skyes pa la yang so sor bshes pa'i don rab tu 'jug ste /
translated: And the meaning of ‚Äúdiscernment‚Äù is applicable to the hair, grass, etc., which are cut and grow again.

original: des na so sor bshes pas rtag par bsgrub pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: des na so sor bshes pas rtag par bsgrub pa mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to prove that the self is permanent by means of discernment.

original: gang yod pa de thams cad ni skad cig pa ste /
analyzed: gang yod pa de thams cad ni skad cig pa ste /
translated: Everything that exists is momentary,

original: se gol gyi sgra dang / glog dang / me lce dang / chu'i rgyun 'brel pa dang / rgyun chad med pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: se gol gyi sgra dang / glog dang / me lce dang / chu'i rgyun 'brel pa dang / rgyun chad med pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like the sound of a finger snap, lightning, a flame, a stream, a river, etc.

original: des na mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes par bsgoms pas 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams spang ste 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal yongs su zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes par bsgoms pas 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams spang ste 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal yongs su zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, by meditating on impermanence, suffering, and ugliness, one abandons the afflictions such as desire, and the suffering of sa·πÉsƒÅra is completely exhausted.

original: rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / las dang / gtsang bar phyin ci log pa'i mtshan nyid ni log pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / las dang / gtsang bar phyin ci log pa'i mtshan nyid ni log pa'i shes pa ste /
translated: The characteristics of the error of permanence, pleasure, self, and purity are mistaken consciousnesses.

original: @97a * // 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal sbyor ro //
analyzed: @97a * // 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal sbyor ro //
translated: It is the cause of the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: de ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bsgoms pas spong ste /
analyzed: de ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bsgoms pas spong ste /
translated: It is abandoned through the cultivation of the four noble truths.

original: sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya ba dang / kun 'byung spang bar bya ba dang / 'gog pa mngon du bya ba dang / lam bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya ba dang / kun 'byung spang bar bya ba dang / 'gog pa mngon du bya ba dang / lam bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should fully understand suffering, abandon the origin, manifest the cessation, and cultivate the path.

original: de la sdug bsngal ni 'khor ba'i phung po rnams te /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal ni 'khor ba'i phung po rnams te /
translated: Here, suffering is the aggregates in cyclic existence.

original: gzugs kyi phung po dang / tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po dang / tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
translated: They are the form aggregate, the feeling aggregate, the perception aggregate, the formation aggregate, and the consciousness aggregate.

original: de la gzugs kyi phung po ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga rnams kyi yul gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi phung po ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga rnams kyi yul gang yin pa'o //
translated: Here, the form aggregate is the object of the five consciousnesses, such as the eye consciousness.

original: tshor ba'i phung po ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin par tshor ba ste /
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin par tshor ba ste /
translated: The feeling aggregate is the experience of pleasure, pain, and neither pleasure nor pain.

original: de 'dus pa ni phung po'o //
analyzed: de 'dus pa ni phung po'o //
translated: The collection of these is the aggregate.

original: 'du shes ni yul la mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: 'du shes ni yul la mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The nature of perception is to apprehend the sign of the object.

original: bud med dang / skyes pa dang / bum pa dang / snam bu la sogs par 'du shes so //
analyzed: bud med dang / skyes pa dang / bum pa dang / snam bu la sogs par 'du shes so //
translated: It is the perception of woman, man, vase, cloth, etc.

original: bum pa'i 'du shes kyang mig la sogs pa'i shes pa thog mar byas pa las 'byung ste /
analyzed: bum pa'i 'du shes kyang mig la sogs pa'i shes pa thog mar byas pa las 'byung ste /
translated: The perception of a vase, etc., also arises from the eye consciousness, etc., as the primary factor.

original: 'dus pa las phung por gdags so //
analyzed: 'dus pa las phung por gdags so //
translated: The aggregate is designated from the collection.

original: tshor ba dang 'du shes ma gtogs par sems las byung ba'i chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: tshor ba dang 'du shes ma gtogs par sems las byung ba'i chos thams cad ni /
translated: All mental factors except for feeling and perception are

original: 'du byed kyi phung po ste /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po ste /
translated: the formation aggregate.

original: de la kun tu 'phro ba tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'dod pa dang / reg pa dang / blo gros dang / dran pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / mos pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sems ni kun la yod do //
analyzed: de la kun tu 'phro ba tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'dod pa dang / reg pa dang / blo gros dang / dran pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / mos pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sems ni kun la yod do //
translated: Among them, the mind that is scattered everywhere, feeling, perception, desire, contact, intelligence, memory, mental activity, aspiration, and concentration exist everywhere.

original: zhib tu ni chos mngon pa las chud par bya'o //
analyzed: zhib tu ni chos mngon pa las chud par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood in detail in the Abhidharma.

original: gang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs mang po yin pa ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: gang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs mang po yin pa ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po 'dus pa ste /
translated: The aggregate of consciousness is the collection of the many groups of consciousness.

original: nam gzugs la mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes par shes pas de'i tshe gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes pas rtse mo nyi shur 'phags pa 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri ye shes rdo rjes bcom ste /
analyzed: nam gzugs la mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes par shes pas de'i tshe gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes pas rtse mo nyi shur 'phags pa 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri ye shes rdo rjes bcom ste /
translated: When one understands form as impermanent, selfless, suffering, and ugly, then one understands the selflessness of the person.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byed do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byed do //
translated: With the vajra of wisdom, one destroys the mountain of the view of the transitory collection, and one actualizes the state of an arhat.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rtogs par bya ba'i phyir chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa rab tu shes par bya ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rtogs par bya ba'i phyir chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa rab tu shes par bya ste /
translated: In order to realize the wisdom of omniscience, one should understand the selflessness of phenomena and the selflessness of persons.

original: chos thams cad sgyu ma dang 'dra ba dang / rmi lam dang 'dra ba dang / mig yor dang 'dra bar yang dag pa ji @97b lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad sgyu ma dang 'dra ba dang / rmi lam dang 'dra ba dang / mig yor dang 'dra bar yang dag pa ji @97b lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: One should understand all phenomena as they are, as like an illusion, like a dream, and like a mirage.

original: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
analyzed: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
translated: The body, enjoyments, and the appearance of the abode

original: kun gzhi kun tu 'byung ba ste //
analyzed: kun gzhi kun tu 'byung ba ste //
translated: are the all-base, which arises in all ways.

original: rnam brgyad rnam dgu de bzhin du //
analyzed: rnam brgyad rnam dgu de bzhin du //
translated: In the same way, there are eight and nine,

original: rgya mtsho rlabs rnams bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho rlabs rnams bzhin du'o //
translated: like waves in the ocean.

original: phyi rol gyi don med par rang gi sems snang ba tsam zhig brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du snang ngo //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don med par rang gi sems snang ba tsam zhig brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du snang ngo //
translated: Without external objects, it is just one‚Äôs own mind that appears, like fainting and so on.

original: rmi lam gyi dus na gzugs la sogs pa'i yul dang / mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa med par rnam pa du ma'i rnam par shes pa snang ba bzhin du rnam pa sna tshogs kyi 'khrul pa 'ba' zhig gis btab pa'i rnam par shes pa gcig po nyid rnam pa du mar snang ngo ;
analyzed: rmi lam gyi dus na gzugs la sogs pa'i yul dang / mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa med par rnam pa du ma'i rnam par shes pa snang ba bzhin du rnam pa sna tshogs kyi 'khrul pa 'ba' zhig gis btab pa'i rnam par shes pa gcig po nyid rnam pa du mar snang ngo ;
translated: At the time of a dream, without objects such as forms and consciousnesses such as the eye consciousness, many kinds of consciousness appear. In the same way, it is just the single consciousness that is affected by the imprints of the various illusions that appear in many ways.

original: / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba thog ma med pa'i 'khor bas bdag dang gzhan gyi mthu dang / dam pa dang dam pa ma yin pa'i bag chags bsgos pas mngon par snang zhing mgo 'khor ba dang brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du lus dang /
analyzed: / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba thog ma med pa'i 'khor bas bdag dang gzhan gyi mthu dang / dam pa dang dam pa ma yin pa'i bag chags bsgos pas mngon par snang zhing mgo 'khor ba dang brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du lus dang /
translated: The so-called foundation consciousness, due to beginningless samsara, is affected by the power of self and other, the sacred and the profane, and appears as the whirling and fainting and so on.

original: longs spyod dang / gnas rnam pa sna tshogs mang po'i rnam par smin par 'gyur ba snang ba na yang byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis snang ba 'jug pa khong du mi chud pas rtag pa dang / bdag dang phyi rol gyi gzugs yongs su rtog par byed do //
analyzed: longs spyod dang / gnas rnam pa sna tshogs mang po'i rnam par smin par 'gyur ba snang ba na yang byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis snang ba 'jug pa khong du mi chud pas rtag pa dang / bdag dang phyi rol gyi gzugs yongs su rtog par byed do //
translated: When the ripening of karma appears in the form of various enjoyments and abodes, childish ordinary beings do not understand the engagement of appearances and imagine permanent, external forms of self.

original: gang gi tshe shes rab kyis dpyad de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes rab kyis dpyad de /
translated: When, through wisdom,

original: shes par bya ba sbom po dang phra mo rnam par gzhig ste mi dmigs pa de'i tshe chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes pas bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog
analyzed: shes par bya ba sbom po dang phra mo rnam par gzhig ste mi dmigs pa de'i tshe chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes pas bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog
translated: the objects of knowledge, coarse and subtle, are destroyed and not observed, then, through the complete understanding of the selflessness of phenomena and persons, without thought and without appearance, the ultimate truth is not imagined as a nonentity.

original: go // gnyis su med par chud pa'i btsun gtso'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: go // gnyis su med par chud pa'i btsun gtso'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das su 'gyur ro //
translated: One becomes the BhagavƒÅn Buddha, the foremost of the pure, who has penetrated nonduality.

original: snying rje'i bag chags kyis bskul te mchog tu yongs su dag pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba thams cad mkhyen cing gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang po rnams gzhan gyi don du sad par 'gyur ba de ni lan du mar bshad pa ma yin
analyzed: snying rje'i bag chags kyis bskul te mchog tu yongs su dag pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba thams cad mkhyen cing gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang po rnams gzhan gyi don du sad par 'gyur ba de ni lan du mar bshad pa ma yin
translated: and who, urged on by the instinct for compassion, are freed from the most perfect passionlessness, who, omniscient, are awakened to the yoga of the various forms for the sake of others.

original: no // chos la bdag med pa de phyi'i don sun dbyung ba sbyor bar bya'o //
analyzed: no // chos la bdag med pa de phyi'i don sun dbyung ba sbyor bar bya'o //
translated: The selflessness of phenomena is to be established by the refutation of external objects.

original: gang zag la bdag med par yang skad cig tu 'jig par rab tu bsgrub par bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med par yang skad cig tu 'jig par rab tu bsgrub par bya ba ste /
translated: The selflessness of persons is to be established by the refutation of momentariness.

original: ji ltar 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba /
translated: As it is said in the noble Perfection of Wisdom:

original: nang stong pa nyid dang phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang gi stong pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dang phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang gi stong pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúInner emptiness, outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness.‚Äù

original: phung por mi gnyis @98a * //
analyzed: phung por mi gnyis @98a * //
translated: The person is not the aggregates,

original: pa dang / rnam par mi 'jig pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa dang / rnam par mi 'jig pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not be different and would be subject to annihilation.

original: phyi rol gyi ni cung zad kyang phung por gnas pa med do //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi ni cung zad kyang phung por gnas pa med do //
translated: There is no external object that is different from the aggregates.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yan lag dang bcas pa rnam par dbye ba na /
analyzed: yan lag dang bcas pa rnam par dbye ba na /
translated: When the aggregates are analyzed,

original: khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong par 'gyur ba ni dam pa'i chos kyi 'grel pa lang ka 'di nyid du gsungs pa'i bshad pa 'di dang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong par 'gyur ba ni dam pa'i chos kyi 'grel pa lang ka 'di nyid du gsungs pa'i bshad pa 'di dang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: they are empty, like a house, an army, a forest, and so on. This is to be applied to the explanation that is taught in this very commentary on the excellent teaching of LankƒÅ.

original: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
analyzed: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
translated: Form is the analysis of atoms.

original: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
analyzed: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
translated: Atoms have no parts.

original: ci zhig snang zhes pa la /
analyzed: ci zhig snang zhes pa la /
translated: What appears?

original: phyi yi dngos po med par yang //
analyzed: phyi yi dngos po med par yang //
translated: External things do not exist.

original: sems ni rnam pa gnyis su snang //
analyzed: sems ni rnam pa gnyis su snang //
translated: The mind appears in two aspects.

original: zhes pa'o // rnam par mi 'jig pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi 'jig pa'i rtag pa gang yang med de /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // rnam par mi 'jig pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi 'jig pa'i rtag pa gang yang med de /
translated: Because there is no non-disintegration. There is no permanence of non-disintegration at all.

original: de ma skyes pa ni mo gsham gyi bu dang / ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med do //
analyzed: de ma skyes pa ni mo gsham gyi bu dang / ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med do //
translated: That which is not arisen is non-existent, like the son of a barren woman, the horn of a rabbit, and so on.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas dam pa'i chos kyi 'grel pa 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas dam pa'i chos kyi 'grel pa 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: The Omniscient One taught this in the commentary on the excellent teaching of LankƒÅ.

original: rgyu med par 'byung ba su yang med do zhes te chos la bdag med par bsgrub par gsungs pa /
analyzed: rgyu med par 'byung ba su yang med do zhes te chos la bdag med par bsgrub par gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, it is said that the selflessness of phenomena is established.

original: blo gros chen po de la chos la bdag med par shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: blo gros chen po de la chos la bdag med par shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: Mahamati, what is the knowledge of the selflessness of phenomena?üîΩIt is the realization of the nature of the imagined characteristics of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: 'di lta ste phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyi kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la kun brtags pa ni ji ltar phyi rol gyi rdul phra mo las brtsams te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyi kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la kun brtags pa ni ji ltar phyi rol gyi rdul phra mo las brtsams te /
translated: The imagined does not exist as it is conceived, beginning with the external subtle particles.

original: yan lag can gyi rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang khyad par la sogs pa de ltar med de /
analyzed: yan lag can gyi rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang khyad par la sogs pa de ltar med de /
translated: It does not exist as wholes, substances, qualities, actions, universals, particulars, and so forth.

original: ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa /
translated: As it was said by the Omniscient One:

original: ji bzhin du byis pa rnams kyi dngos por rnam par brtags pa de bzhin du med do zhes te /
analyzed: ji bzhin du byis pa rnams kyi dngos por rnam par brtags pa de bzhin du med do zhes te /
translated: Just as it is imagined by the childish as entities, it does not exist in that way.

original: phyogs kyi cha tha dad pas dbye ba na rdul phra mo nyid kyang med na de las brtsams pa'i yan lag gi rdzas sbom po lta ga la yod /
analyzed: phyogs kyi cha tha dad pas dbye ba na rdul phra mo nyid kyang med na de las brtsams pa'i yan lag gi rdzas sbom po lta ga la yod /
translated: If, when divided by the different directions, even the subtle particle does not exist, how could the coarse substance of the parts, which are based on it, exist?

original: tshon gyis btsos pa dang / ma btsos pa dang / bsgul ba dang / ma sgul ba dang / bsgribs pa dang / ma bsgribs pa la sogs pa ni tha dad par dbye ba na /
analyzed: tshon gyis btsos pa dang / ma btsos pa dang / bsgul ba dang / ma sgul ba dang / bsgribs pa dang / ma bsgribs pa la sogs pa ni tha dad par dbye ba na /
translated: When divided into different categories, such as dyed and not dyed, shaken and not shaken, covered and uncovered,

original: khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du gcig par mi rigs na yon tan dang las la sogs pa yang de la gnas pa lta ga la 'gyur /üîΩphung po dag rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dang yang bral ba zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams las 'byung @98b ba bzhi las 'byung bar kun tu rtog go //
analyzed: khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du gcig par mi rigs na yon tan dang las la sogs pa yang de la gnas pa lta ga la 'gyur / phung po dag rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dang yang bral ba zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams las 'byung @98b ba bzhi las 'byung bar kun tu rtog go //
translated: it is not reasonable to posit them as one, like a house, a village, a forest, and so on. How could the qualities, actions, and so on be based on them?üîΩThe aggregates are also devoid of general and specific characteristics.

original: spyi'i 'byung ba rnams kyi rig par bya ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: spyi'i 'byung ba rnams kyi rig par bya ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The specific characteristics of the elements are known from the four great elements.

original: khyad par gyi mtshan nyid sra ba dang / gsher ba dang / dro ba dang / g-yo ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: khyad par gyi mtshan nyid sra ba dang / gsher ba dang / dro ba dang / g-yo ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The specific characteristics are the nature of solidity, fluidity, heat, and mobility.

original: de dag gi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid ni rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa la yang so sor snang ste /
analyzed: de dag gi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid ni rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa la yang so sor snang ste /
translated: The specific and general characteristics of these are perceived individually even in dreams, illusions, and so forth.

original: de'i phyir phung po rnams ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po rnams ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the aggregates are devoid of specific and general characteristics.üîΩThe form is devoid of self because it is devoid of the characteristics of the imagined self and mine. The form is not the self, the self does not have form, the self does not have form, and form does not have the self.

original: rtag pa dang bdag dang / bdag gir kun tu brtags pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral bas gzugs bdag med pa dang / gzugs can bdag dang / bdag gi gzugs dang / bdag la gzugs zhes par kun tu mthong ba de tshor ba la sogs pa'i phung po yang rtse mo nyi shur 'phags pa 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri ye shes rdo rjes bcom ste /
analyzed: rtag pa dang bdag dang / bdag gir kun tu brtags pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral bas gzugs bdag med pa dang / gzugs can bdag dang / bdag gi gzugs dang / bdag la gzugs zhes par kun tu mthong ba de tshor ba la sogs pa'i phung po yang rtse mo nyi shur 'phags pa 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri ye shes rdo rjes bcom ste /
translated: In this way, the twenty peaks of the mountain of the view of the transitory collection are destroyed by the vajra of wisdom with regard to the aggregates of feeling and so forth.

original: gang zag la bdag med par khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med par khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: One comes to understand the selflessness of persons.

original: btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' ni byed pa dang / byed pa po dang / las dang bral zhing g-yo ba med pa'i phung po rnams la /
analyzed: btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' ni byed pa dang / byed pa po dang / las dang bral zhing g-yo ba med pa'i phung po rnams la /
translated: The bodhisattva who is the chief of the monks understands that the aggregates, which are devoid of an agent, an experiencer, and an action,

original: mi shes pa dang / sred pa dang / las kyi rgyu dang / nye bar 'brel ba rnams snang ba'i mtshan nyid du shes so //
analyzed: mi shes pa dang / sred pa dang / las kyi rgyu dang / nye bar 'brel ba rnams snang ba'i mtshan nyid du shes so //
translated: are the appearance of the characteristics of ignorance, craving, and the causes of action, and are connected to the body.üîΩMahƒÅmati, the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva who meditates on all phenomena as devoid of mind, mentality, and mental consciousness, and the five dharmas and the nature, is skilled in the selflessness of phenomena.

original: blo gros chen po chos thams cad la sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / chos lnga dang / rang bzhin dang bral bar rnam par bsgom pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos la bdag med pa la mkhas pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rjes su mthun pa bzhin du bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po chos thams cad la sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / chos lnga dang / rang bzhin dang bral bar rnam par bsgom pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos la bdag med pa la mkhas pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rjes su mthun pa bzhin du bshad par bya ste /
translated: This and so forth should be explained in accordance with the s≈´tra.

original: ji ltar 'dir gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dir gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said here:

original: sems ni kun gzhi rnam shes te //
analyzed: sems ni kun gzhi rnam shes te //
translated: The mind is the foundation consciousness.

original: ngar sems nyid ni yid yin no //
analyzed: ngar sems nyid ni yid yin no //
translated: The very thought of ‚ÄúI‚Äù is the mental consciousness.

original: gang gis yul rnams 'dzin pa ni //
analyzed: gang gis yul rnams 'dzin pa ni //
translated: That by which objects are apprehended

original: de ni rnam par shes zhes bya //
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes zhes bya //
translated: is called the mental consciousness.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid rmi lam gyi dus su mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug gi rang bzhin du snang ngo //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid rmi lam gyi dus su mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug gi rang bzhin du snang ngo //
translated: The storehouse consciousness itself appears as the six consciousnesses of the eye, etc., during the dream state.

original: drug pa rnams 'das de ma thag / rnam shes de gang yid ces bya //
analyzed: drug pa rnams 'das de ma thag / rnam shes de gang yid ces bya //
translated: The sixth consciousness is the immediately antecedent condition of the storehouse consciousness.

original: nyon mongs pa'i yid kyang gang gi tshe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i yid kyang gang gi tshe na /
translated: The defiled mind also arises with the pride of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: nga rgyal dang ldan par skye ba de'i tshe phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched du snang ba'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gcig pu nyid du yin zhes par byed do //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang ldan par skye ba de'i tshe phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched du snang ba'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gcig pu nyid du yin zhes par byed do //
translated: At that time, the storehouse consciousness, which appears as the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, is the single cause of the pride of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: chos lnga yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid de /
analyzed: chos lnga yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid de /
translated: The five dharmas are also the storehouse consciousness itself.

original: ming dang mtshan ma la sogs par @99a * //üîΩbrtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i chos kyi khyad par du dbye ba ni /
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma la sogs par @99a * // brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i chos kyi khyad par du dbye ba ni /
translated: The imagined nature is the imagination of the unreal, which is the imagination of names, signs, etc.üîΩThe dependent nature is the storehouse consciousness itself, which is the cause of the imagined nature.üîΩThe perfected nature is the emptiness of the imagined nature in the dependent nature.

original: thog ma med pa'i 'khor bar bdag dang gzhan gyi dbang gi mthu las byung ba dri ma dang bcas pa dang / dri ma med pa yin te /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i 'khor bar bdag dang gzhan gyi dbang gi mthu las byung ba dri ma dang bcas pa dang / dri ma med pa yin te /
translated: The five dharmas are the three natures, the nonexistence of the duality, and the existence of that nonexistence.

original: gang gi tshe na shes par bya ba sbom po dang / phra mo rnam par gzhigs te mi dmigs pa de'i tshe bsam pas med ces snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe na shes par bya ba sbom po dang / phra mo rnam par gzhigs te mi dmigs pa de'i tshe bsam pas med ces snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one does not perceive the coarse and subtle objects of cognition, then one is said to be ‚Äúwithout thought,‚Äù and one is said to ‚Äúhave no appearance.‚Äù One is said to ‚Äúhave correct understanding of non-dual ultimate truth.‚Äù

original: de de ltar dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rig pa nyid chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes nas snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po 'thob po //
analyzed: de de ltar dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rig pa nyid chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes nas snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po 'thob po //
translated: In this way, one who has correct understanding of the existence and non-existence of things, who has thoroughly understood the selflessness of persons and phenomena, and who has attained the samƒÅdhi of no appearance, attains the first bodhisattva ground.

original: snang ba med pa'i rab tu dbye ba 'thob pas /
analyzed: snang ba med pa'i rab tu dbye ba 'thob pas /
translated: By attaining the divisions of the samƒÅdhi of no appearance,

original: sa'i mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba khong du chud pa'i phyir rab tu dga' ba'i 'og tu rim gyis sa dgu la yang mkhas par byas nas chos kyi sprin rab tu 'thob po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyis dpyod nas chos dang gang zag
analyzed: sa'i mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba khong du chud pa'i phyir rab tu dga' ba'i 'og tu rim gyis sa dgu la yang mkhas par byas nas chos kyi sprin rab tu 'thob po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyis dpyod nas chos dang gang zag
translated: one thoroughly understands the divisions of the characteristics of the grounds. After the ground of joy, one gradually becomes skilled in the nine grounds and attains the ground Cloud of Dharma.

original: la bdag med pa yongs su shes nas snang ba med pa rab tu rtogs pa'i sa dang po gang gi tshe na thob pa de'i tshe de las gong ma'i sa'i snang ba'i yon tan gyi don rgya cher te /
analyzed: la bdag med pa yongs su shes nas snang ba med pa rab tu rtogs pa'i sa dang po gang gi tshe na thob pa de'i tshe de las gong ma'i sa'i snang ba'i yon tan gyi don rgya cher te /
translated: When one has fully understood selflessness and attained the first stage, the stage of the Joyful One, which is the realization of the absence of appearances, then one has the vast aim of the good qualities of the appearances of the stages that are higher than that.

original: ji ltar 'dis bcu las 'byung ba de bdag nyid kyang mi dmigs na bdag gis lta ci smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dis bcu las 'byung ba de bdag nyid kyang mi dmigs na bdag gis lta ci smos te /
translated: Just as one does not apprehend the ten from the self, how much less does one apprehend an ‚ÄúI‚Äù?

original: bdag dang bdag gir chags pa dang bral te bdag gi thams cad yongs su gtong bas rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir chags pa dang bral te bdag gi thams cad yongs su gtong bas rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Free from attachment to ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù one is joyful because one has given up everything.

original: de'i 'dus pa ni sa dang por spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'dus pa ni sa dang por spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The assembly of those is abandoned on the first stage.

original: dri ma med pa ni tshul khrims yongs su 'dag ste /
analyzed: dri ma med pa ni tshul khrims yongs su 'dag ste /
translated: The stainless one is pure morality,

original: gnyis su mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis su mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one does not apprehend duality.

original: rnam par rtog pa yongs su spong ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yongs su spong ste /
translated: One abandons discursive thought.

original: rgyun du mnyam par 'jog pa gsum par ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dag go //
analyzed: rgyun du mnyam par 'jog pa gsum par ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dag go //
translated: On the third stage, one is constantly in equipoise, and the perfection of patience is purified.

original: gnyis su med pa'i rnal 'byor la gnas pas mi gnyis pa'i sems kyi nan tan ni brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i rnal 'byor la gnas pas mi gnyis pa'i sems kyi nan tan ni brtson 'grus so //
translated: The practice of the perfection of effort is the earnest practice of the nondual mind of the bodhisattva who is established in the yoga of nonduality.

original: bsam gtan gyi mi gnyis pa'i rnal 'byor gyis gnas so //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi mi gnyis pa'i rnal 'byor gyis gnas so //
translated: The practice of the perfection of meditation is the establishment in the yoga of nonduality.

original: shes rab kyis dpyad pas gnyis stong par yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyis dpyad pas gnyis stong par yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The practice of the perfection of wisdom is the thorough knowledge of the emptiness of duality through the analysis of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyis mkhas pa dang / snying rje'i bag chags kyis bskul bas gzhan la phan par byed do //
analyzed: shes rab kyis mkhas pa dang / snying rje'i bag chags kyis bskul bas gzhan la phan par byed do //
translated: The practice of the perfection of skill in means is the benefit of others through the wisdom of skill in means and the urging of the instinct for compassion.

original: smon lam gyis 'phangs te /
analyzed: smon lam gyis 'phangs te /
translated: The practice of the perfection of vow is the projection of the vow.

original: bdag dang gzhan la phan @99b pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis mnyam par bsam pa'i bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la phan @99b pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis mnyam par bsam pa'i bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: The practice of the perfection of power is the fulfillment of the vow of good conduct, the accumulation of merit and knowledge for the benefit of self and others, and the even-mindedness of thought.

original: stobs kyang de ltar bsam pa yongs su dag pas gzhan gyi sems su shes pa'i phyir yongs su mthun pa bzhin du chos kyi sbyin pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: stobs kyang de ltar bsam pa yongs su dag pas gzhan gyi sems su shes pa'i phyir yongs su mthun pa bzhin du chos kyi sbyin pa byed pa'o //
translated: The practice of the perfection of knowledge is the giving of the gift of the Dharma in accordance with the minds of others through the knowledge of the thoughts of others, because of the purity of thought.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i bdag dang gzhan gyi phan pa 'byung ba'i chos kyi sprin du dbang bskur bas sa bcur rnal 'byor gyi dbang po kho nar ro //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i bdag dang gzhan gyi phan pa 'byung ba'i chos kyi sprin du dbang bskur bas sa bcur rnal 'byor gyi dbang po kho nar ro //
translated: The consecration of the cloud of Dharma, which is the source of benefit for oneself and others, is the consecration of the tenth stage.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa bcus ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs te /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa bcus ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs te /
translated: The ten perfections, generosity and so forth, are the accumulations of merit and knowledge.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don nus pas ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sangs rgyas kyi sar gshegs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don nus pas ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sangs rgyas kyi sar gshegs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The ability to benefit oneself and others is the attainment of omniscience on the buddha stage.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis lang kar gsungs pa'i 'grel pa'i tshul du nyon mongs pa med pa'i mi shes pa ma lus par spangs nas sa bcu gnyis su sgrib pa med pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa kho na bar 'phags pa sa bcu pa las rgyas par chud par bya'o
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis lang kar gsungs pa'i 'grel pa'i tshul du nyon mongs pa med pa'i mi shes pa ma lus par spangs nas sa bcu gnyis su sgrib pa med pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa kho na bar 'phags pa sa bcu pa las rgyas par chud par bya'o
translated: The complete abandonment of all ignorance, which is the absence of afflictions, is the omniscience that is free from obscurations on the twelfth stage. This should be understood in detail from the noble Dashabhumika-sutra, according to the method of the Lankavatara-sutra-tika.

original: // dam pa'i chos kyi 'grel pa lang kar gsungs pa 'dir ni bdag dang gzhan gyi mthar grub pa'i rtsod pa rnams rtog par lta ba rnams kyi sems kyis sems can rnams la gtan la dbab pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pas chos bshad par mdzad pas kun gzhi rnam
analyzed: // dam pa'i chos kyi 'grel pa lang kar gsungs pa 'dir ni bdag dang gzhan gyi mthar grub pa'i rtsod pa rnams rtog par lta ba rnams kyi sems kyis sems can rnams la gtan la dbab pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pas chos bshad par mdzad pas kun gzhi rnam
translated: In this teaching of the excellent Dharma inüîΩLa·πÖkƒÅ, the Omniscient One taught the Dharma in order to determineüîΩfor sentient beings the disputes about the establishment of self andüîΩother that are the views of conceptual thought. Therefore, the all-baseüîΩis not the cause of the world.üîΩ

original: par shes pa mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas rab tu bsgrub pa dang / chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa tshad mas rtogs par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis kyang bsgrubs so //
analyzed: par shes pa mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas rab tu bsgrub pa dang / chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa tshad mas rtogs par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis kyang bsgrubs so //
translated: In this Sutra of the Descent into Lanka, the Omniscient One taught the Dharma in order to settle the minds of sentient beings who are attached to views, by means of refuting the arguments of the proponents of the existence of self and other, and by means of establishing the foundation consciousness through direct perception and inference, and by means of establishing the selflessness of phenomena and persons through valid cognition.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas bdag dang gzhan gyi sems rnam par sbyong ba'i don sa bcu rnams kyis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas bdag dang gzhan gyi sems rnam par sbyong ba'i don sa bcu rnams kyis bstan pa'o //
translated: The Omniscient One taught the ten grounds in order to purify the minds of self and others.

original: chos la bdag med par mthong bas blo gros chen po 'di ni sa bcu pa'i dbang po dang / chos kyi sku la mnga' dbang mdzad pa'i de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur te zhes pa de ni dam pa'i chos la mngon par 'grub pa rnams kyi yon tan gyi don rgya che ba ste /
analyzed: chos la bdag med par mthong bas blo gros chen po 'di ni sa bcu pa'i dbang po dang / chos kyi sku la mnga' dbang mdzad pa'i de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur te zhes pa de ni dam pa'i chos la mngon par 'grub pa rnams kyi yon tan gyi don rgya che ba ste /
translated: Through seeing the selflessness of phenomena, O Great-minded One, one becomes a tathƒÅgata who has attained the faculties of the tenth stage and sovereignty over the dharmakƒÅya.

original: mdo sde thams cad du rig par bya'o //üîΩthams cad mkhyen pa'i snang ba dang bcas pa dang snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob nas bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs par nus pa'i shes rab dang / snying rje dang ldan pas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs las 'byung ba'i phyir chos kyi sku la mnga' @100a * //
analyzed: mdo sde thams cad du rig par bya'o // thams cad mkhyen pa'i snang ba dang bcas pa dang snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob nas bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs par nus pa'i shes rab dang / snying rje dang ldan pas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs las 'byung ba'i phyir chos kyi sku la mnga' @100a * //
translated: This is the vast meaning of the qualities of those who have accomplished the excellent Dharma, and it should be known in all the s≈´tras.

original: dbang mdzad pa de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang mdzad pa de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having attained the samƒÅdhi of the light of omniscience and the absence of light, and having the wisdom and compassion that are able to benefit oneself and others, one becomes a tathƒÅgata who has attained sovereignty over the dharmakƒÅya, because it arises from the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa rtsa ba nas bton pas thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa rtsa ba nas bton pas thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Since all afflictions and their latent tendencies are uprooted, one becomes omniscient.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams ni spyod yul ma nges pa'i ye shes kyi sgrib pa yang yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams ni spyod yul ma nges pa'i ye shes kyi sgrib pa yang yin te /
translated: Afflictions such as desire are also obscurations to the wisdom that is not confined to a specific domain.

original: gang gis 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams zil gyis mnan pas mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa'i gzugs nye bar gnas kyang mi mthong zhing rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba'i rnams chud par byed de /
analyzed: gang gis 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams zil gyis mnan pas mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa'i gzugs nye bar gnas kyang mi mthong zhing rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba'i rnams chud par byed de /
translated: Since one is overcome by afflictions such as desire, one does not see the forms of impermanence, suffering, and ugliness that are present, and one is made to perceive permanence, self, bliss, and purity.

original: de bas na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas mig gi ling tog dang bral ba bzhin du mchog tu yongs su dag pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnal 'byor gyi dbang po thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni shes par bya ba'i dkyil 'khor
analyzed: de bas na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas mig gi ling tog dang bral ba bzhin du mchog tu yongs su dag pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnal 'byor gyi dbang po thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni shes par bya ba'i dkyil 'khor
translated: Therefore, by abandoning afflictions such as desire, like being free from eye floaters, the wisdom of omniscience of the lord of yogis, who is utterly pure and free from desire, is the mandala of the object of knowledge.

original: thams cad du rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: thams cad du rab tu 'jug go //
translated: It is present everywhere.

original: de ltar na gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi cho 'phrul rnams kyis skye bo thams cad mgu bar mdzad cing chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro //
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi cho 'phrul rnams kyis skye bo thams cad mgu bar mdzad cing chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro //
translated: Thus, by means of the various miracles of form, he delights all beings and turns the wheel of the Dharma.

original: de de lta bu ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid ni dri ma dang bcas pa dang dri ma med pa'i rim pas 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang ldan par rnam par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de de lta bu ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid ni dri ma dang bcas pa dang dri ma med pa'i rim pas 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang ldan par rnam par shes par bya ste /
translated: In this way, the store consciousness itself should be understood as samsara and nirvana, according to whether it is associated with the stages of impurity and purity.

original: shes rab kyi stobs kyi rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal zhing bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs nus pa'i sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi stobs kyi rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal zhing bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs nus pa'i sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: It becomes the state of buddhahood, which is clear light by nature through the power of wisdom and is capable of benefiting oneself and others.

original: ji ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said in the Sandhinirmocana Sutra:

original: len pa'i rnam par shes pa zab cing phra //
analyzed: len pa'i rnam par shes pa zab cing phra //
translated: The appropriating consciousness is deep and subtle;

original: 'bab las ji ltar 'byung ba'i sa bon kun //
analyzed: 'bab las ji ltar 'byung ba'i sa bon kun //
translated: All the seeds in it flow like a river.

original: byis pa rnams la nga yis de ma bshad //
analyzed: byis pa rnams la nga yis de ma bshad //
translated: I have not revealed this to the childish.

original: bdag tu rtog par ma gyur cig par ro //
analyzed: bdag tu rtog par ma gyur cig par ro //
translated: I fear they will imagine it to be a self.

original: thog ma med pa'i dus kyi khams //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus kyi khams //
translated: The realm of beginningless time

original: thams cad chos kyi gnas yin te //
analyzed: thams cad chos kyi gnas yin te //
translated: Is the basis of all phenomena.üîΩBecause of its existence,

original: de yod pas na 'gro ba kun //
analyzed: de yod pas na 'gro ba kun //
translated: The entire world

original: mya ngan 'da' ba'ang mthong 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mya ngan 'da' ba'ang mthong 'gyur ro //
translated: And even nirvana are perceived.

original: de la mu stegs byed pa rnams kyis sgro 'dogs dang / skur pa ni bdag rtag go zhes bskyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa thams cad rgyun chad pas rgyun du 'byung ba'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yang rgyun chad do zhes skur du dogs nas blo gros chen pos @100b thams cad mkhyen pa la yongs su gsol nas /
analyzed: de la mu stegs byed pa rnams kyis sgro 'dogs dang / skur pa ni bdag rtag go zhes bskyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa thams cad rgyun chad pas rgyun du 'byung ba'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yang rgyun chad do zhes skur du dogs nas blo gros chen pos @100b thams cad mkhyen pa la yongs su gsol nas /
translated: The tƒ´rthikas superimpose and deny the self as permanent and all consciousnesses are interrupted, so they fear that the foundation consciousness that arises continuously is also interrupted.üîΩMahƒÅmati asked the omniscient one,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dogs pa thams cad rnam par bcad pa'i slad du bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dogs pa thams cad rnam par bcad pa'i slad du bka' stsal pa /
translated: and the Bhagavat said,üîΩSuperimposition and denial

original: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba dag / sems tsam la ni yod pa min //üîΩzhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba dag / sems tsam la ni yod pa min // zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: Do not exist in mind only.

original: mu stegs byed pa rnams kyis bdag rtag pa'o zhes bskyed pa dang skur pa yang sems kyi rgyud la mi rung ste /
analyzed: mu stegs byed pa rnams kyis bdag rtag pa'o zhes bskyed pa dang skur pa yang sems kyi rgyud la mi rung ste /
translated: The superimposition of the tƒ´rthikas that the self is permanent and the denial that it is interrupted are not tenable in the continuum of mind.

original: sems kyi rgyud la 'chad pa med pas gser lta bu'i sems kyi rgyud dus thams cad du rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud la 'chad pa med pas gser lta bu'i sems kyi rgyud dus thams cad du rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the continuum of mind is uninterrupted, the continuum of mind is like gold, remaining the same at all times.

original: gang gis sems kyi rnam par gnas pa nyid mi shes pa des rtag par sgro 'dogs pa dang / mi rtag par chad par rtog pa'i mthar rtog go //
analyzed: gang gis sems kyi rnam par gnas pa nyid mi shes pa des rtag par sgro 'dogs pa dang / mi rtag par chad par rtog pa'i mthar rtog go //
translated: Those who do not understand the abiding of the mind imagine permanence in superimposition and imagine annihilation in denial.

original: gang dag gis lus dang longs spyod dang gnas su snang ba'i sems mi shes nas bskyed pa dang skur pa spyod pa de dag ni mkhas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dag gis lus dang longs spyod dang gnas su snang ba'i sems mi shes nas bskyed pa dang skur pa spyod pa de dag ni mkhas pa ma yin no //
translated: Those who do not understand the mind that appears as the body, enjoyments, and abode, and who engage in the practices of superimposition and denial, are not wise.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang gi khyad par gyi stobs las shes pa dang / gser rin po che dri mas 'bags par 'gyur ba lta bu'ang dri ma med par 'gyur ba ni rgyud kyi rgyud du gnas pa'i shes pa thal ba dang / sa'i se'ur btsos pa lta bu'i shes rab kyi rnal 'byor gyis mgo 'khor ba dang brgyal ba dang bral ba lta bu dang /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang gi khyad par gyi stobs las shes pa dang / gser rin po che dri mas 'bags par 'gyur ba lta bu'ang dri ma med par 'gyur ba ni rgyud kyi rgyud du gnas pa'i shes pa thal ba dang / sa'i se'ur btsos pa lta bu'i shes rab kyi rnal 'byor gyis mgo 'khor ba dang brgyal ba dang bral ba lta bu dang /
translated: The knowledge that is like the head of a person who is free from dizziness and fainting through the yoga of wisdom that is cooked in the oven of the earth is the knowledge that arises from the power of the continuum of the tantra.

original: mig gi ling tog dang bal ba lta bur nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya dang / las kyi sgrib pa dang / snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa gnyis dang / mi gnyis pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam par dag pa mchog tu yongs su dag pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba thams cad mkhyen cing gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang po bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dod spyod pa'i sangs rgyas kyi dngos po thob par
analyzed: mig gi ling tog dang bal ba lta bur nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya dang / las kyi sgrib pa dang / snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa gnyis dang / mi gnyis pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam par dag pa mchog tu yongs su dag pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba thams cad mkhyen cing gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang po bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dod spyod pa'i sangs rgyas kyi dngos po thob par
translated: The buddhas, who are omniscient and have attained the state of a buddha, who are masters of yoga in the various forms, and who act with the desire to benefit themselves and others, are completely purified in the highest way.

original: 'gyur ro // blo gros chen po med pa la sgro 'dogs pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // blo gros chen po med pa la sgro 'dogs pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, there are four kinds of superimposition on what does not exist.

original: rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the four kinds? They are as follows:

original: med pa'i mtshan nyid la sgro 'dogs pa dang zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang / bdag la sogs par sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: med pa'i mtshan nyid la sgro 'dogs pa dang zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang / bdag la sogs par sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: Superimposition on the characteristic of non-existence, which is superimposition on permanence, self, and so forth.

original: med pa'i lta bar sgro 'dogs pa ni bde ba dang gtsang ba la sogs par sgro 'dogs pa'o //üîΩrgyu ma yin par sgro 'dogs pa ni tshangs pa dang / dbang po dang / gtso bo dang / byung @101a * //
analyzed: med pa'i lta bar sgro 'dogs pa ni bde ba dang gtsang ba la sogs par sgro 'dogs pa'o // rgyu ma yin par sgro 'dogs pa ni tshangs pa dang / dbang po dang / gtso bo dang / byung @101a * //
translated: The reification of the view of non-existence is the reification of pleasure, purity, etc.

original: ba dang / dus dang / nges pa'i tshul dang / lha la sogs pa'i rgyu yin par sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: ba dang / dus dang / nges pa'i tshul dang / lha la sogs pa'i rgyu yin par sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: The reification of the non-cause is the reification of Brahma, Ishvara, Prajapati, the primal nature, time, the nature of necessity, God, etc. as the cause of the world.

original: med pa'i dngos por sgro 'dogs pa ni rdul phra mo las brtsams pa'i yan lag can dang / yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang / khyad par dang / 'brel pa dang tshig gi don drug tu 'brum bu zab pa rnams rtog go //
analyzed: med pa'i dngos por sgro 'dogs pa ni rdul phra mo las brtsams pa'i yan lag can dang / yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang / khyad par dang / 'brel pa dang tshig gi don drug tu 'brum bu zab pa rnams rtog go //
translated: The reification of the non-existent entity is the postulation of the whole, quality, action, universal, particular, inherence, and the six categories of the VaiSeshika, beginning with the atom.

original: tshad ma dang / gzhal ba ma gtogs pa dogs pa dang / dgos pa dang / grub pa'i mtha' dang / dpe dang / yan lag dang / rtog pa dang / nges pa dang / rtsod pa dang / zug zug tu smra ba dang / mtho ba btsams pa dang /
analyzed: tshad ma dang / gzhal ba ma gtogs pa dogs pa dang / dgos pa dang / grub pa'i mtha' dang / dpe dang / yan lag dang / rtog pa dang / nges pa dang / rtsod pa dang / zug zug tu smra ba dang / mtho ba btsams pa dang /
translated: The reification of the non-existent means of valid knowledge and the object of valid knowledge is the postulation of doubt, purpose, philosophy, example, member, reason, ascertainment, disputation, quibble, and the like.

original: rgyur snang ba dang / klan ka dang / rigs dang tshar gcod pa'i gnas rnams rkang mig gi slob ma rnams kyis med pa la sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyur snang ba dang / klan ka dang / rigs dang tshar gcod pa'i gnas rnams rkang mig gi slob ma rnams kyis med pa la sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: The appearance of a cause, the refutation, the reason, and the point of defeat are the superimpositions of the blind on the nonexistent.

original: grangs can rnams kyis de kho na nyid nyi shu rtsa lnga ni med pa la sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: grangs can rnams kyis de kho na nyid nyi shu rtsa lnga ni med pa la sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: The twenty-five principles of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya are the superimpositions of the blind on the nonexistent.

original: skyes bu'i rang bzhin ni tshor ba can te /
analyzed: skyes bu'i rang bzhin ni tshor ba can te /
translated: The nature of the person is to experience.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i yul du longs spyod pas na rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rgyun gyis gzugs la rtag pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i yul du longs spyod pas na rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rgyun gyis gzugs la rtag pa mi rigs so //
translated: Since it experiences objects such as pleasure and pain, it is not tenable that it is permanent due to the continuum of various types.

original: sems can dang / rdul dang / mun pa rnams mnyam pa'i dus na gtso bo ste /
analyzed: sems can dang / rdul dang / mun pa rnams mnyam pa'i dus na gtso bo ste /
translated: When the equality of sentient beings, particles, and darkness occurs, it is the principal.

original: de yang rtag cing ma skyes so zhes pa rim pa'i khyad par du dbye bas na shing dang thal ba la sogs pa bzhin du gtso bo rig pa med pas blo dang / yid dang / nga rgyal chud pa'i rang bzhin rnams mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de yang rtag cing ma skyes so zhes pa rim pa'i khyad par du dbye bas na shing dang thal ba la sogs pa bzhin du gtso bo rig pa med pas blo dang / yid dang / nga rgyal chud pa'i rang bzhin rnams mi rung ngo //
translated: Moreover, it is permanent and unarisen. Since it is divided into different stages, like a tree, ashes, and so on, it is not tenable that the principal is the nature of the mind, the intellect, and the ahamkƒÅra, since it is not conscious.

original: spyi'i don med par yang sgra la sogs pa yul de tsam lnga dang / blo'i dbang po lnga dang / las kyi dbang po rnams kyang mi rung ba ni rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du chud pa'i rang bzhin gyi snang ba nyid do //
analyzed: spyi'i don med par yang sgra la sogs pa yul de tsam lnga dang / blo'i dbang po lnga dang / las kyi dbang po rnams kyang mi rung ba ni rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du chud pa'i rang bzhin gyi snang ba nyid do //
translated: Without the general meaning, the five objects such as sound, the five intellectual faculties, and the faculties of action are also not possible, like a dream, an optical illusion, etc.

original: de bzhin du rdzas dang / yon tan la sogs pa de lta bur de dag gi khyad par yongs su shes pas kyang thar par mi rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rdzas dang / yon tan la sogs pa de lta bur de dag gi khyad par yongs su shes pas kyang thar par mi rung ste /
translated: In the same way, substance, quality, etc., are not suitable for liberation by the thorough knowledge of their distinctions,

original: rtsva stan dang rtsig pa la sogs pa'i khyad par yongs su shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rtsva stan dang rtsig pa la sogs pa'i khyad par yongs su shes pa bzhin no //
translated: like the thorough knowledge of the distinctions of a grass mat, a wall, etc.

original: ksha pa na ka med par sgro btags pa yang thar pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: ksha pa na ka med par sgro btags pa yang thar pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: The imputation of a non-existent person is also not a cause of liberation.

original: spyi'i bdag nyid du yod par 'gyur ba dang / khyad par gyi bdag nyid du med par 'gyur ba dang / spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du yod pa dang @101b med par 'gyur pa dang / spyi'i bdag nyid du yod par 'gyur ba yang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du yod par smra bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: spyi'i bdag nyid du yod par 'gyur ba dang / khyad par gyi bdag nyid du med par 'gyur ba dang / spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du yod pa dang @101b med par 'gyur pa dang / spyi'i bdag nyid du yod par 'gyur ba yang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du yod par smra bar mi bya'o //
translated: It would be both the universal and the particular, and it would be neither the universal nor the particular.

original: khyad par gyi bdag nyid du med par 'gyur ba yang spyi'i bdag nyid du smra bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi bdag nyid du med par 'gyur ba yang spyi'i bdag nyid du smra bar mi bya'o //
translated: It would be the universal, but it would not be the particular.üîΩIt would be both the universal and the particular, and it would be neither the universal nor the particular.üîΩIt would be all, but it would not be all.üîΩIt would be all, but it would not be all.üîΩIt would be all, but it would not be all.

original: spyi'i dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du yod kyang yod la med kyang med par 'gyur ba yang cig car smra bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: spyi'i dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du yod kyang yod la med kyang med par 'gyur ba yang cig car smra bar mi bya ste /
translated: It would be all, but it would not be all.üîΩIt would be all, but it would not be all.üîΩIt would be all, but it would not be all.

original: yul dang / dus dang / rim pa dang / rnam pa la ltos te thams cad smra bar mi bya'o zhes pa de kho na nyid kyi tshig gi don du nyes pa med de /üîΩsom nyi dang bcas pas ni thar par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: yul dang / dus dang / rim pa dang / rnam pa la ltos te thams cad smra bar mi bya'o zhes pa de kho na nyid kyi tshig gi don du nyes pa med de /üîΩsom nyi dang bcas pas ni thar par mi rung ngo //
