original: rtag pa dang bdag la chags pas bslad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtag pa dang bdag la chags pas bslad pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of the error of attachment to permanence and self,

original: sdug bsngal gyi gnas su lhung ba ni mar mer phye ma leb lhung ba ni 'khor bar yang skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / mya ngan dang 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal gyis dkrugs par bdag tu chags pa'i log pa'i shes pas lhung ngo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi gnas su lhung ba ni mar mer phye ma leb lhung ba ni 'khor bar yang skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / mya ngan dang 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal gyis dkrugs par bdag tu chags pa'i log pa'i shes pas lhung ngo //
translated: the falling of the moth into the flame is the arising of birth, old age, sickness, sorrow, and death in cyclic existence. The falling of the moth into the flame is the falling of the error of attachment to self into the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: sred pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyin ci log gis skyes ba yin te /üîΩ'dod chags dang bral ba la skyes pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //üîΩskyes ma thag pa la yul kha cig tu dga' ba dang / 'jigs pa dang mya ngan rtogs pas sngon gyi goms pa rjes su dpag par bya ste /
analyzed: sred pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyin ci log gis skyes ba yin te / 'dod chags dang bral ba la skyes pa mthong ba'i phyir ro // skyes ma thag pa la yul kha cig tu dga' ba dang / 'jigs pa dang mya ngan rtogs pas sngon gyi goms pa rjes su dpag par bya ste /
translated: The falling of the moth into the flame is the arising of the error of attachment to self, because of the error of attachment to self.

original: spong ba dang / len pa dang / btang snyoms kyi blo rnams la bde ba dang / sdug bsngal bar bsgrub pa gdon mi za ba sngar byas pa'i phyir ro //

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag par mi gnyis par smra ba rnams kyis med pa dngos por sgro 'dogs pa yang grol ba dang / ma grol ba dang / phyug dbul la sogs pa gcig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag par mi gnyis par smra ba rnams kyis med pa dngos por sgro 'dogs pa yang grol ba dang / ma grol ba dang / phyug dbul la sogs pa gcig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who speak of non-duality, who superimpose non-existence as an entity, also incur the error of identity in regard to liberation and non-liberation, the wealthy and the poor, and so forth.

original: de de bzhin du khrus dang / sbyin sreg dang / gad pa dang / g-yang sa dang / bkra shis dang / bkra shis ma yin pa dang / rtsa ba dang / 'bras bu dang / lo ma dang / lo ma ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: de de bzhin du khrus dang / sbyin sreg dang / gad pa dang / g-yang sa dang / bkra shis dang / bkra shis ma yin pa dang / rtsa ba dang / 'bras bu dang / lo ma dang / lo ma ma yin pa dang /
translated: Likewise, they incur the error of identity in regard to bathing, fire sacrifice, the pure and the impure, the abyss, auspicious and inauspicious, roots, fruits, leaves, and non-leaves,

original: rin po che dang / gser 'phyang ba dang / gar dang / glu dang / sil khrol dang / ral pa dang / spyi phud kyis brgyan pa dang / thal bas skud pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / de bkru ba dang / dbugs thub pa la sogs pa cha byad sna tshogs dang /
analyzed: rin po che dang / gser 'phyang ba dang / gar dang / glu dang / sil khrol dang / ral pa dang / spyi phud kyis brgyan pa dang / thal bas skud pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / de bkru ba dang / dbugs thub pa la sogs pa cha byad sna tshogs dang /
translated: jewels, gold, dancing, singing, cymbals, hair, ornaments, smearing with ashes, holding, washing, and so forth, various costumes,

original: ba glang gi brtul zhugs dang / rma bya'i @102a * //
analyzed: ba glang gi brtul zhugs dang / rma bya'i @102a * //
translated: the practice of the bull, the peacock,

original: brtul zhugs la sogs pa bdag tu chags pa yongs su ma zad par thar par mi rung ste /
analyzed: brtul zhugs la sogs pa bdag tu chags pa yongs su ma zad par thar par mi rung ste /
translated: It is not possible to be liberated without completely eliminating attachment to the self, such as through yogic discipline.

original: de de ltar thar par smra ba rnams kyis med pa'i dngos por sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: de de ltar thar par smra ba rnams kyis med pa'i dngos por sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: Those who claim that one is liberated in this way superimpose a nonexistent thing.

original: 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa dang / kun du lta ba dang / spyod pa can rnams phyi'i don med par phyi'i don du sgro 'dogs pa ni med pa dngos por sgro 'dogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa dang / kun du lta ba dang / spyod pa can rnams phyi'i don med par phyi'i don du sgro 'dogs pa ni med pa dngos por sgro 'dogs pa ste /
translated: The LokƒÅyatas, the Samkhyas, and the followers of the Carakas superimpose external objects as external objects, although they do not exist.

original: rtog pa'i rgyun du sgra tshangs pa dpyad pa la sogs par bdag dang gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' zhib tu dpyad kyis /
analyzed: rtog pa'i rgyun du sgra tshangs pa dpyad pa la sogs par bdag dang gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' zhib tu dpyad kyis /
translated: In the Tattvasiddhi, the TƒÅmra≈õƒÅ·π≠ƒ´ya, and so on, the proponents of our own and other schools analyze in detail the continuum of conceptuality and the analysis of sound and BrahmƒÅ.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should apply the same approach here as well.

original: khyad par du dgongs pa'i don ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par du dgongs pa'i don ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid tshad ma yin te /
translated: In particular, the meaning of the intention is that omniscience is valid knowledge.

original: bdag gis ni rtog pa dang sgra'i rjes su 'brang ste bshad par sbyar ro //
analyzed: bdag gis ni rtog pa dang sgra'i rjes su 'brang ste bshad par sbyar ro //
translated: I have explained it by following the words and concepts.

original: blo gros chen po 'di ni sgro 'dogs pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po 'di ni sgro 'dogs pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: MahƒÅmati, these are the four superimpositions.

original: sgro 'dogs pa'i lta ba ngan pa 'di nyid mi dmigs par rab tu 'byed pa na med pa'i phyir skur par 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i skur pa'i bshad pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis mdzad pa ni 'di lta ste sgro 'dogs pa'i lta ba ngan paüîΩla sogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa'i lta ba ngan pa 'di nyid mi dmigs par rab tu 'byed pa na med pa'i phyir skur par 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i skur pa'i bshad pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis mdzad pa ni 'di lta ste sgro 'dogs pa'i lta ba ngan pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: When one analyzes the non-apprehension of this bad view of superimposition, one deprecates because it does not exist. The explanation of deprecation by the Omniscient One is as follows: ‚ÄúThe bad view of superimposition, etc.‚Äù

original: mi dmigs te rab tu 'byed pa na med pa'i phyir skur par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi dmigs te rab tu 'byed pa na med pa'i phyir skur par 'gyur te /
translated: ‚ÄúOne analyzes the non-apprehension‚Äù because it does not exist.

original: de zhes bya ba la dmigs pa ni shes rab kyis dpyad pa na'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba la dmigs pa ni shes rab kyis dpyad pa na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the object of apprehension when one analyzes with wisdom.

original: 'di yod pa dang 'di med pa'o zhes gnyis yod na sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur par rnam par rtog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di yod pa dang 'di med pa'o zhes gnyis yod na sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur par rnam par rtog par 'gyur ro //
translated: When there is the duality of ‚Äúthis exists‚Äù and ‚Äúthat does not exist,‚Äù there is the conceptualization of superimposition and deprecation.

original: lta ba thams cad las bral bar byed pa ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: lta ba thams cad las bral bar byed pa ni stong pa nyid do //
translated: Emptiness is what frees one from all views.

original: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is the emptiness of the internal, the emptiness of the external, the emptiness of the internal and the external, and so on.

original: phung por mi gnas pa dang / rnam par mi 'jig pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: phung por mi gnas pa dang / rnam par mi 'jig pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it does not abide in the aggregates, and because it is not subject to destruction.

original: stong pa nyid kyi lta ba thams cad spong bar 'gyur pa'i chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes pas so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi lta ba thams cad spong bar 'gyur pa'i chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes pas so //
translated: By means of the full understanding of the selflessness of phenomena and of the person, which is the relinquishment of all views of emptiness.

original: med pa'i mtshan nyid la sgro 'dogs pa'i bshad pa ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen pa'o zhes te /
analyzed: med pa'i mtshan nyid la sgro 'dogs pa'i bshad pa ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen pa'o zhes te /
translated: The explanation of the superimposition of the characteristic of non-existence is the adherence to the specific and general characteristics of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: gzugs dang tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa'i phung po rnams ni gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa gnyis kyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa'i phung po rnams ni gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa gnyis kyi rnam pa ste /
translated: The aggregates of form, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are the aspects of the duality of object and subject.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du skye mched dang / khams kyi bye brag tu chud pa'i rang bzhin gyi @102b snang ba nyid so sor snang ngo //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du skye mched dang / khams kyi bye brag tu chud pa'i rang bzhin gyi @102b snang ba nyid so sor snang ngo //
translated: Like a dream, etc., the appearances of the nature that is included in the distinctions of the sense bases and elements appear individually.

original: de la spyi'i mtshan nyid ni gzugs su 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid pas na gzugs so //
analyzed: de la spyi'i mtshan nyid ni gzugs su 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid pas na gzugs so //
translated: Regarding that, the general characteristic is form because it has the characteristic of becoming form.

original: khyad par gyi mtshan nyid ni rten pa la sogs pa'i lus su grub pa dang / sra ba dang / gsher ba dang / dro ba dang / g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi mtshan nyid ni rten pa la sogs pa'i lus su grub pa dang / sra ba dang / gsher ba dang / dro ba dang / g-yo ba'o //
translated: The specific characteristics are the bodies that are based on them, and the qualities of solidity, fluidity, heat, and mobility.

original: tshor ba myong ba'i mtshan nyid ni spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: tshor ba myong ba'i mtshan nyid ni spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The general characteristic of feeling is the experience of pleasure, pain, and neither pleasure nor pain.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa ni khyad par gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa ni khyad par gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The specific characteristics are the feelings of pleasure, pain, and neither pleasure nor pain.

original: 'du shes mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid ni spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'du shes mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid ni spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The general characteristic of perception is the apprehension of signs.

original: phra ba dang / rgya che ba dang / chung ba dang / chen por song ba dang / bud med dang / skyes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan mar 'du shes pa ni khyad par gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: phra ba dang / rgya che ba dang / chung ba dang / chen por song ba dang / bud med dang / skyes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan mar 'du shes pa ni khyad par gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The specific characteristics are the perceptions of signs that are subtle, extensive, small, large, female, male, and so forth.

original: rnam par rig pa ni so sor rnam par chud pa ste /üîΩde la don mthong rnam par shes //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa ni so sor rnam par chud pa ste / de la don mthong rnam par shes //
translated: Consciousness is the individual awareness of objects.

original: de yi khyad par sems las byung //
analyzed: de yi khyad par sems las byung //
translated: The general characteristic of formations is the mental factors that are associated with the mind.üîΩThe specific characteristics are the mental factors of the five omnipresent factors, the five object-ascertaining factors, the eleven virtuous factors, the six root afflictions, the twenty secondary afflictions, and the four changeable factors.

original: zhes pa 'du byed kyi phung po'i sgrar brjod pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa 'du byed kyi phung po'i sgrar brjod pa ste /
translated: The general characteristic of consciousness is the individual awareness of objects.üîΩThe specific characteristics are the six consciousnesses of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: de dag gi khyad par ni tshor ba dang / sems pa dang / 'du shes dang / 'dod pa dang / reg pa dang / blo gros dang / dran pa dang / mos pa dang / ting nge 'dzin ni sems thams cad la ste /
analyzed: de dag gi khyad par ni tshor ba dang / sems pa dang / 'du shes dang / 'dod pa dang / reg pa dang / blo gros dang / dran pa dang / mos pa dang / ting nge 'dzin ni sems thams cad la ste /
translated: The difference between them is as follows: feeling, conception, volition, contact, attention, resolve, mindfulness, concentration, and discernment are found in all minds.

original: zhib tu ni chos mngon pa las rig par bya ste /
analyzed: zhib tu ni chos mngon pa las rig par bya ste /
translated: They should be understood in detail in the Abhidharma.

original: shes pa rnams 'dus pa ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: shes pa rnams 'dus pa ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
translated: The aggregate of consciousness is the collection of consciousnesses.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa thams cad dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i yul yang rmi lam gyi dus na yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gcig po ma gtogs par gzhan med de /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa thams cad dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i yul yang rmi lam gyi dus na yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gcig po ma gtogs par gzhan med de /
translated: All consciousnesses of the eye, etc., and the objects such as form, etc., do not exist apart from the one fundamental consciousness in a dream state.

original: phyi rol gyi don du sgro btags te mtshan nyid med pa la mngon par zhen pa 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don du sgro btags te mtshan nyid med pa la mngon par zhen pa 'ba' zhig go //
translated: They are only the superimposition of external objects, the adherence to that which lacks characteristics.

original: 'di ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ni 'di lta ste /
translated: This is as follows:

original: de bzhin gyis gzhan du ma yin no zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin la phyi rol gyi bar sgro 'dogs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gyis gzhan du ma yin no zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin la phyi rol gyi bar sgro 'dogs so //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is just like this, not otherwise.‚Äù This is the superimposition of external objects onto the nature of blue, etc.

original: rmi lam dang rab rib la sogs pa'i rang bzhin la yang de lta bu'i rnam pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: rmi lam dang rab rib la sogs pa'i rang bzhin la yang de lta bu'i rnam pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: The nature of dreams, eye disease, and so on is also like that.

original: de lta bur na gnyid kyis ma log pa'i dus na ni yod la rmi lam gyi dus na ni med do zhes par rnam par rtog pa ni slad ma'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i mthu las skyes pa de dag thams cad mtshungs so zhes thams cad mkhyenüîΩpas bsgrub pa mdzad pa blo gros chen po med pa'i mtshan nyid la sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'di ni thog ma med @103a * //
analyzed: de lta bur na gnyid kyis ma log pa'i dus na ni yod la rmi lam gyi dus na ni med do zhes par rnam par rtog pa ni slad ma'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i mthu las skyes pa de dag thams cad mtshungs so zhes thams cad mkhyen pas bsgrub pa mdzad pa blo gros chen po med pa'i mtshan nyid la sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'di ni thog ma med @103a * //
translated: Thus, the thought that ‚Äúit exists at the time of not being asleep but does not exist at the time of dreaming‚Äù is the same for all of them, which arise from the power of the ripening of latent propensities.üîΩThe omniscient one has established this.

original: pa'i dus kyi spros pa gnas ngan len gyi bag chags sna tshogs la mngon par zhen pa las 'byung zhes pa ste /
analyzed: pa'i dus kyi spros pa gnas ngan len gyi bag chags sna tshogs la mngon par zhen pa las 'byung zhes pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúO MahƒÅmati, this conceptual thought that superimposes the characteristic of nonexistence on the characteristic of existence arises from the various latent propensities of the habit-pattern of conceptual thought that has been beginningless.

original: thog ma med pa'i dus kyi skad cig ma'i rgyun 'brel par 'byung ba'i sems bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang gi rkyen gyi khyad par gyis dkrugs te /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus kyi skad cig ma'i rgyun 'brel par 'byung ba'i sems bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang gi rkyen gyi khyad par gyis dkrugs te /
translated: The mind that arises in a continuous stream of moments that has no beginning is disturbed by the specific conditions of the power of one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô continua.

original: mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pa'i gnas ngan len pa sna tshogs bag chags yongs su smin pa'i mthu las rmi lam bzhin du 'dzin pa dang / gzung bar snang ba'i 'khor bar snang ngo //
analyzed: mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pa'i gnas ngan len pa sna tshogs bag chags yongs su smin pa'i mthu las rmi lam bzhin du 'dzin pa dang / gzung bar snang ba'i 'khor bar snang ngo //
translated: Due to the power of the ripening of various latent propensities of the negative tendencies of ignorance that does not rest in equipoise, there is the appearance of the apprehender and the apprehended, like a dream.

original: gang gi tshe na shes rab kyis dpyad de shes par bya ba sbom po dang phra mo rnam par phye ste mi dmigs pa de'i che snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas thams cad mkhyen pa sems can thams cad la phan par 'jug pa ni lan du mar bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe na shes rab kyis dpyad de shes par bya ba sbom po dang phra mo rnam par phye ste mi dmigs pa de'i che snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas thams cad mkhyen pa sems can thams cad la phan par 'jug pa ni lan du mar bshad pa yin no //
translated: When one analyzes with wisdom and distinguishes the coarse and subtle objects of knowledge and does not observe them, then one attains the samƒÅdhi with appearance and without appearance, and one engages in omniscience and benefiting all sentient beings. This has been explained many times.

original: blo gros chen po gang phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched de dag nyid la bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag tu lta ba ngan par sgro 'dogs pa yin te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po gang phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched de dag nyid la bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag tu lta ba ngan par sgro 'dogs pa yin te /
translated: MahƒÅmati, those who superimpose the bad views of self, sentient being, life, nourished being, person, and individual onto those aggregates, elements, and sense bases

original: blo gros chen po 'di ni med pa'i lta bar sgro 'dogs pa zhes bya'o zhes pa ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched du so sor snang ba la phyi rol gyi don du mngon par zhen pa ni med pa'i mtshan nyid la sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen po 'di ni med pa'i lta bar sgro 'dogs pa zhes bya'o zhes pa ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched du so sor snang ba la phyi rol gyi don du mngon par zhen pa ni med pa'i mtshan nyid la sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: The superimposition of the characteristic of nonexistence is the adherence to the appearance of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases as external objects.

original: der yang rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bdag gir mngon par zhen pa ni lta ba ngan par sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: der yang rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bdag gir mngon par zhen pa ni lta ba ngan par sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: The superimposition of bad views is the adherence to permanence, self, and what belongs to the self.

original: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba'i dngos por phyin ci log rnams kyis log pa'i shes pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba'i dngos por phyin ci log rnams kyis log pa'i shes pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'o //
translated: The superimposition of the cause of nonexistence is the mistaken consciousness that arises from the four errors of permanence, self, bliss, and purity.

original: blo gros chen po med pa'i rgyur sgro 'dogs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po med pa'i rgyur sgro 'dogs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, the superimposition of the cause of nonexistence is as follows:

original: sngon rgyu las ma skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa phyis sgyu ma lta bur sngon ma byung zhing med pa las mig dang / gzugs dang / snang ba'i rgyu dang / dran pa sngon du 'jug pas 'byung ngo zhes pa la ;
analyzed: sngon rgyu las ma skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa phyis sgyu ma lta bur sngon ma byung zhing med pa las mig dang / gzugs dang / snang ba'i rgyu dang / dran pa sngon du 'jug pas 'byung ngo zhes pa la ;
translated: A consciousness that did not arise from a previous cause arises later like an illusion, and it arises from a cause that did not exist previously, such as the eye, form, light, and the prior mental faculty.

original: sngon ma skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba med pa'i rgyur sgro 'dogs pa 'di ni log pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin te /
analyzed: sngon ma skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba med pa'i rgyur sgro 'dogs pa 'di ni log pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin te /
translated: This is a false conception that superimposes a cause for what does not exist, a so-called consciousness that did not arise previously.

original: gal te sngon rnam par shes pa thog ma med pa'i dus rgyun du rnam par gnas pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba med na ni dran pa dang so sor ba shes pa la @103b sogs pa ji ltar na yongs su shes par 'gyur //
analyzed: gal te sngon rnam par shes pa thog ma med pa'i dus rgyun du rnam par gnas pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba med na ni dran pa dang so sor ba shes pa la @103b sogs pa ji ltar na yongs su shes par 'gyur //
translated: If there is no so-called foundation consciousness that has existed continuously since beginningless time, how could memory, recognition, and so on occur?

original: skyes ma thag pa rnams la yul kha cig tu dga' ba dang / 'jig pa dang / mya ngan 'byung ba snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes ma thag pa rnams la yul kha cig tu dga' ba dang / 'jig pa dang / mya ngan 'byung ba snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is observed that immediately after birth, some beings feel joy, some feel aversion, and some feel sorrow.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dran pa dang / gzugs dang / snang ba'i rgyu la stos te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dran pa dang / gzugs dang / snang ba'i rgyu la stos te /
translated: The consciousnesses of the eye, etc., are remembered in dependence on form and light.

original: des na thog ma dang tha mar stong pa yang sgyu ma dang 'dra bar rnam par shes pa skye ba ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen gcig gi rgyu gcig yin pa las 'byung ste /
analyzed: des na thog ma dang tha mar stong pa yang sgyu ma dang 'dra bar rnam par shes pa skye ba ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen gcig gi rgyu gcig yin pa las 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore, the emptiness of the beginning and end is like an illusion. The arising of consciousness occurs from the single condition of the immediately preceding condition and the single cause.

original: sems kyi rgyud kyi rgyun ji lta ji ltar mi 'chad pa ltar sngar bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud kyi rgyun ji lta ji ltar mi 'chad pa ltar sngar bsgrubs zin to //
translated: As the continuum of the mind is uninterrupted, it was previously established.

original: blo gros chen po med pa'i dngos por sgro 'dogs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po med pa'i dngos por sgro 'dogs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Mahamati, the superimposition of non-existent things is as follows:

original: nam mkha' dang / 'gog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa ma byas pa'i dngos por mngon par zhen cing sgro 'dogs pa'o zhes bya ba la ma byas pa ni nam mkha' rtag go zhes so //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang / 'gog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa ma byas pa'i dngos por mngon par zhen cing sgro 'dogs pa'o zhes bya ba la ma byas pa ni nam mkha' rtag go zhes so //
translated: The clinging and superimposition to space, cessation, and nirvana as unfabricated things. The unfabricated is said to be the permanence of space.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la yang de bzhin du rtag pa'o zhes mngon par zhen pa ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la yang de bzhin du rtag pa'o zhes mngon par zhen pa ste /
translated: And also in nirvana, there is the clinging to permanence.

original: de'i dngos po med par dngos por mngon par chags pa ni med pa'i dngos por sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dngos po med par dngos por mngon par chags pa ni med pa'i dngos por sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: The attachment to the non-existence of that entity as an entity is the superimposition of the non-existence of an entity.

original: 'dus ma byas pa'i dngos po la rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa'i dngos po la rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of non-compounded entities:

original: ji ltar nam mkha' dang / so sor brtags te 'gog pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' dang / so sor brtags te 'gog pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: space, non-analytical cessation, and analytical cessation.

original: gang 'dus ma byas pa de ni ma skyes pas na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dang / mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med do zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o /üîΩdes na rtag pa dang rdul phra mos brtsams te /
analyzed: gang 'dus ma byas pa de ni ma skyes pas na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dang / mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med do zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o / des na rtag pa dang rdul phra mos brtsams te /
translated: The Omniscient One intended that whatever is non-compounded is unproduced, and therefore non-existent like the horns of a rabbit and the son of a barren woman.üîΩTherefore, we previously stated that the superimposition of the non-existence of an entity is the superimposition of an entity that is permanent or composed of subtle particles,

original: yan lag can gyi rdzas la sogs pas gang rtag pa gzhan yang med pa'i dngos por sgro 'dogs pa'o zhes de la sngar smras so //
analyzed: yan lag can gyi rdzas la sogs pas gang rtag pa gzhan yang med pa'i dngos por sgro 'dogs pa'o zhes de la sngar smras so //
translated: and that is a partless substance, etc.

original: blo gros chen po chos 'di dag thams cad ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa las rnam par log pa ri bong dang / rta dang / bong bu dang / rnga mo'i rva dang / skra shad 'dzings pa lta bu yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po chos 'di dag thams cad ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa las rnam par log pa ri bong dang / rta dang / bong bu dang / rnga mo'i rva dang / skra shad 'dzings pa lta bu yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs dang bral ba ste /
translated: All these phenomena, Mahamati, are the opposite of being and nonbeing, like the horns of a rabbit, a horse, a donkey, or a camel, or like matted hair. They are free from the positions of existence and nonexistence.

original: blo gros chen po byis pa rang gi sems snang ba tsam du ma rtogs pa'i blo can rnams sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur bas rnam par rtog ste /üîΩ'phags pa rnams kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni thams cad mkhyen pas rin po che'i 'byung gnas las bdud rtsi bton bzhin du don dam pa'i snying po chos kyi de @104a * //
analyzed: blo gros chen po byis pa rang gi sems snang ba tsam du ma rtogs pa'i blo can rnams sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur bas rnam par rtog ste / 'phags pa rnams kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni thams cad mkhyen pas rin po che'i 'byung gnas las bdud rtsi bton bzhin du don dam pa'i snying po chos kyi de @104a * //
translated: Mahamati, the childish, whose minds are not aware that [all things] are mere appearances of their own minds, imagine them through superimposition and denial.

original: kho na nyid dbu ma'i bsam gtan gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: kho na nyid dbu ma'i bsam gtan gsungs pa'o //
translated: But the noble ones do not. This is the ultimate essence, the reality of phenomena, the middle way meditation, taught by the Omniscient One, like nectar extracted from the source of jewels.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa las rnam par log pa la byis pa rnams kyis sgo 'dogs pa dang / skur pa rnams kyis rnam par rtog par byed do //üîΩrang gi sems snang ba tsam du ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i 'khor bar bdag dang gzhan gyi rkyen gyi dbang gis btab pa'i 'du byed yongs su smin pa las rnam pa sna tshogs kyi sems su 'byung ba mgo 'khor ba dang /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa las rnam par log pa la byis pa rnams kyis sgo 'dogs pa dang / skur pa rnams kyis rnam par rtog par byed do // rang gi sems snang ba tsam du ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i 'khor bar bdag dang gzhan gyi rkyen gyi dbang gis btab pa'i 'du byed yongs su smin pa las rnam pa sna tshogs kyi sems su 'byung ba mgo 'khor ba dang /
translated: The world is the appearance of one‚Äôs own mind, but the childish, whose minds are ignorant of that, imagine that it is either existent or nonexistent.üîΩThe world is the appearance of one‚Äôs own mind, but the childish, whose minds are ignorant of that, imagine that it is either existent or nonexistent.üîΩThe world is the appearance of one‚Äôs own mind, but the childish, whose minds are ignorant of that, imagine that it is either existent or nonexistent.üîΩThe world is the appearance of one‚Äôs own mind, but the childish, whose minds are ignorant of that, imagine that it is either existent or nonexistent.üîΩThe world is the appearance of one‚Äôs own mind, but the childish, whose minds are ignorant of that, imagine that it is either existent or nonexistent.üîΩThe world is the appearance of one‚Äôs own mind, but the childish, whose minds are ignorant of that, imagine that it is either existent or nonexistent.üîΩThe world is the appearance of one‚Äôs own mind, but the childish, whose minds are ignorant of that, imagine that it is either existent or nonexistent.üîΩThe world is the appearance of one‚Äôs own mind, but the childish, whose minds are ignorant of that, imagine that it is either existent or nonexistent.üîΩThe world is the appearance of one‚Äôs own mind, but the childish, whose minds are ignorant of that, imagine that it is either existent or nonexistent.üîΩThe world is the appearance of one‚Äôs own mind, but the childish, whose minds are ignorant of that, imagine that it is either existent or nonexistent.üîΩThe world is the appearance of one‚Äôs own mind, but the childish, whose minds are ignorant of that, imagine that it is either existent or nonexistent.

original: brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du snang ba der rang gi sems snang bar byis pa ma rtogs pa'i blo can rnams kyis yod pa dang med par sgro 'dogs par byed do //üîΩgang gi tshe na shes rab kyis dpyad de sbom po dang phra mo /
analyzed: brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du snang ba der rang gi sems snang bar byis pa ma rtogs pa'i blo can rnams kyis yod pa dang med par sgro 'dogs par byed do // gang gi tshe na shes rab kyis dpyad de sbom po dang phra mo /
translated: The world is the appearance of one‚Äôs own mind, but the childish, whose minds are ignorant of that, imagine that it is either existent or nonexistent.

original: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //üîΩrdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
analyzed: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //üîΩrdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
translated: The world is the appearance of one‚Äôs own mind, but the childish, whose minds are

original: zhes par shes pa de'i tshe khang pa dang / sde dang / nags la sogs pa bzhin du thams cad stong par mthong ngo //
analyzed: zhes par shes pa de'i tshe khang pa dang / sde dang / nags la sogs pa bzhin du thams cad stong par mthong ngo //
translated: When one knows that, then one sees everything as empty, like a house, a village, a forest, and so on.

original: rab rib can la ska shad 'dzings pa'i rang bzhin lta bur stong pa yin pa bslad pa'i mthus ri bong dang / rta dang / bong bu dang / rnga mo'i rva lta bu 'ba' zhig go zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rab rib can la ska shad 'dzings pa'i rang bzhin lta bur stong pa yin pa bslad pa'i mthus ri bong dang / rta dang / bong bu dang / rnga mo'i rva lta bu 'ba' zhig go zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
translated: The Omniscient One thinks that, because of the power of the error, the empty, which has the nature of a tangled skein of thread, is just like the horn of a rabbit, a horse, an ass, or a camel.

original: de yang shes rab kyis dpyad de mthong yang mi mthong ba ni ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba /
analyzed: de yang shes rab kyis dpyad de mthong yang mi mthong ba ni ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba /
translated: Moreover, although one sees by investigating with wisdom, one does not see. As it is said in the Perfection of Wisdom:

original: rnam par bsngos pa dang / rnam par dmar ba dang / rnam par gzhigs pa la sogs pa mi mdzes par bsgom pa de yang mi dmigs pa'i tshul du'o //
analyzed: rnam par bsngos pa dang / rnam par dmar ba dang / rnam par gzhigs pa la sogs pa mi mdzes par bsgom pa de yang mi dmigs pa'i tshul du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne should meditate on the unattractive, such as the bloated, the livid, and the decomposed, but not by apprehending anything.‚Äù

original: sems kyis bslad pa'i snang ba ma gtogs par phyi rol gyi nyid mi dmigs na mdzes pa dang mi mdzes pa rnam par rtog pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: sems kyis bslad pa'i snang ba ma gtogs par phyi rol gyi nyid mi dmigs na mdzes pa dang mi mdzes pa rnam par rtog pa lta ci smos /
translated: If one does not apprehend anything external except for the appearance of the error of the mind, then what need is there to mention the concepts of attractive and unattractive?

original: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa yang mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du 'khrul pa las nye bar skyes pa shes rab kyis gnyis kyi rnam pa stong par mthong ngo //
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa yang mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du 'khrul pa las nye bar skyes pa shes rab kyis gnyis kyi rnam pa stong par mthong ngo //
translated: The consciousness that has the aspect of duality is seen by wisdom to be empty of the aspect of duality, just as the consciousness that has the aspect of whirling firebrand is seen to be empty of the aspect of whirling firebrand.

original: gang gi tshe na phyi rol gyi bar zhen te rnam pa rnams shes pa ma gtogs par skye ba med pa de'i tshe mnyam par 'jog pa med pa'i ma rig pas nye bar bslad pas skyes pa de dag stong pa nyid du khong du chud de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na phyi rol gyi bar zhen te rnam pa rnams shes pa ma gtogs par skye ba med pa de'i tshe mnyam par 'jog pa med pa'i ma rig pas nye bar bslad pas skyes pa de dag stong pa nyid du khong du chud de /
translated: When one realizes that external objects do not exist and that the aspects are not produced apart from consciousness, then, since they are produced by the ignorance that is not in meditative equipoise, one understands that they are empty.

original: shes rab mnyam par gzhag pas mtshan ma mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: shes rab mnyam par gzhag pas mtshan ma mi mthong ngo //
translated: Wisdom in meditative equipoise does not see any signs.

original: sems la smon pa med de /
analyzed: sems la smon pa med de /
translated: The mind has no aspirations.

original: de bzhin du bslad @104b pa'i rnams la lhag par chags pas yid la byed pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du bslad @104b pa'i rnams la lhag par chags pas yid la byed pa med do //
translated: Likewise, because of attachment to the contaminated, there is no mental activity.

original: yid la byed pa med par rtog par gyur pa na bsam pa med pa mi gnyis pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa'i chud pa rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur te /
analyzed: yid la byed pa med par rtog par gyur pa na bsam pa med pa mi gnyis pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa'i chud pa rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur te /
translated: When there is no mental activity, there is no thought. When there is no thought, there is no duality. The ultimate truth, which is nonduality, is the attainment of perfect buddhahood.

original: thugs rje'i bag chags kyis bskul nas snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin brnyes nas mchog tu yongs su dag pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba thams cad mkhyen pa gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi dbang po yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang /
analyzed: thugs rje'i bag chags kyis bskul nas snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin brnyes nas mchog tu yongs su dag pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba thams cad mkhyen pa gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi dbang po yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang /
translated: Having been urged by the habitual tendencies of compassion, they attain the samƒÅdhi of appearance and no appearance, and they are free from attachment to the completely pure supreme.

original: dpag bsam gyi shing lta bu dang / sprin chen po ltar gzhan gyi don du 'phags pa'i bdag nyid gdung pa thams cad sel ba dang / pha dang sman pa'i rgyal po bzhin du gzhan gyi don mdzad do //
analyzed: dpag bsam gyi shing lta bu dang / sprin chen po ltar gzhan gyi don du 'phags pa'i bdag nyid gdung pa thams cad sel ba dang / pha dang sman pa'i rgyal po bzhin du gzhan gyi don mdzad do //
translated: They are omniscient, like a wish-fulfilling jewel that is the sense faculty of various forms, like a wish-fulfilling tree, and like a great cloud. For the benefit of others, they dispel all the distress of the noble ones and act for the benefit of others like a father and the king of physicians.

original: yongs su dag pa rang bzhin gyis gnyen des spyod pa rgyu gang yang med pa'i gnyen yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa rang bzhin gyis gnyen des spyod pa rgyu gang yang med pa'i gnyen yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: The completely pure natural friend is the perfect, complete Buddha, the BhagavƒÅn, who is a friend without any cause for conduct.

original: gzhan gyi don du 'khor bar mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la bzhugs so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du 'khor bar mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la bzhugs so //
translated: For the benefit of others, they remain in nirvƒÅ·πáa, which is not remaining in sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: blo gros chen po gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / chos lnga dang / rang bzhin dang / bdag med pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid khong du chud par rtogs nas gzhan la phan pa'i phyir gzugs dang cha byad du ma 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba ni lan du mar bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / chos lnga dang / rang bzhin dang / bdag med pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid khong du chud par rtogs nas gzhan la phan pa'i phyir gzugs dang cha byad du ma 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba ni lan du mar bshad pa yin te /
translated: Again, Mahamati, the bodhisattvas, having realized the mind, the mental factor, the mental consciousness, the five dharmas, the natures, and the characteristics of selflessness, take on various forms and appearances in order to benefit others. This has been explained many times.

original: da ni gzhung gi bshad pa sbyar bar bya ba ni /
analyzed: da ni gzhung gi bshad pa sbyar bar bya ba ni /
translated: Now, I will apply the explanation of the treatise.

original: sems ni kun gzhi rnam shes te //
analyzed: sems ni kun gzhi rnam shes te //
translated: The mind is the foundation consciousness.

original: ngar sems nyid ni yid yin no //
analyzed: ngar sems nyid ni yid yin no //
translated: The mental factor is the mind itself.

original: gang gis yul rnams 'dzin pa ni //
analyzed: gang gis yul rnams 'dzin pa ni //
translated: That which apprehends objects

original: de ni rnam par shes zhes bya //
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes zhes bya //
translated: is called the mental consciousness.

original: tshigs su bcad pa bsdus pa 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa bsdus pa 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: This is stated in the summary verse:

original: chos lnga rnams dang rang bzhin dang // rnam par shes pa brgyad rnams dang // bdag med gnyis kyi nang du ni //
analyzed: chos lnga rnams dang rang bzhin dang // rnam par shes pa brgyad rnams dang // bdag med gnyis kyi nang du ni //
translated: The five dharmas, the natures, the eight consciousnesses, and the two kinds of selflessness

original: theg pa chen po thams cad 'dus //
analyzed: theg pa chen po thams cad 'dus //
translated: contain the entire Mahayana.

original: sems ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: sems ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Mind is the store-consciousness.

original: lus dang longs spyod dang / gnas su rnam pa brgyad dang / rnam pa dgur 'byung ngo zhes de bshad zin to //
analyzed: lus dang longs spyod dang / gnas su rnam pa brgyad dang / rnam pa dgur 'byung ngo zhes de bshad zin to //
translated: The body, the enjoyments, and the abode are the eight and nine aspects.

original: ming dang mtshan ma la sogs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid de chos lnga yang bshad zin to //üîΩrang @105a * //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma la sogs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid de chos lnga yang bshad zin to // rang @105a * //
translated: Name, sign, etc., imagination, correct knowledge, and reality‚Äîthese five dharmas have been explained.

original: bzhin ni chos kyi dbyings te /
analyzed: bzhin ni chos kyi dbyings te /
translated: The nature is the dharma-dhƒÅtu.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i rgyud 'brel par gnas pa la dgongs par brtag go //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i rgyud 'brel par gnas pa la dgongs par brtag go //
translated: It is to be understood that the intention is to explain the naturally luminous mind, which is the cause of both affliction and purification, as the continuum.

original: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa gnyis kyang bshad zin to //
analyzed: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa gnyis kyang bshad zin to //
translated: The two kinds of selflessness of persons and things have been explained.

original: de de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byad pa'i rgyu sems yin pa dang / yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs las rnam par bral ba rnam par rtog pa med cing chags pa dang bral bar shes nas snang ba dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: de de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byad pa'i rgyu sems yin pa dang / yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs las rnam par bral ba rnam par rtog pa med cing chags pa dang bral bar shes nas snang ba dang bcas pa dang /
translated: Thus, knowing that the mind is the cause of both the thoroughly afflicted and the completely purified, and that it is free from the positions of existence and nonexistence, free from conceptuality and attachment, one will have illumination.üîΩ

original: snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpas thob nas gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang po rnams kyis gzhan gyi don byed do //
analyzed: snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpas thob nas gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang po rnams kyis gzhan gyi don byed do //
translated: Having understood that mind is the cause of both affliction and purification, and that it is free from the extremes of existence and nonexistence, free from conceptualization and attachment, the bodhisattva who has attained the samƒÅdhi of appearance and nonappearance, with the various faculties of yoga of form, acts for the benefit of others.

original: rmi lam dang / sgyu ma dang / mig yor dang / gzugs brnyan dang / chu zla'i tshul gyis chos skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / rtag pa dang / chad pa dang / bral ba thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad las mngon du nyan zhing zhes bya ba dang 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: rmi lam dang / sgyu ma dang / mig yor dang / gzugs brnyan dang / chu zla'i tshul gyis chos skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / rtag pa dang / chad pa dang / bral ba thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad las mngon du nyan zhing zhes bya ba dang 'brel pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúall phenomena are free from arising and destruction, permanence and annihilation, like a dream, an illusion, a mirage, a reflection of the moon in water‚Äù is connected to the phrase ‚Äúlistens directly to all the tathƒÅgatas.‚Äù

original: stong pa dang skad cig pa'i chos gnyis rnam pa de dag sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang mig yor la sogs pa bzhin pas na skye ba dang 'jig pa'i rnam par snang ba tsam du so sor snang ngo //
analyzed: stong pa dang skad cig pa'i chos gnyis rnam pa de dag sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang mig yor la sogs pa bzhin pas na skye ba dang 'jig pa'i rnam par snang ba tsam du so sor snang ngo //
translated: Since emptiness and momentary phenomena are like illusions, dreams, and optical illusions, they appear individually as mere appearances of arising and ceasing.

original: rtag pa dang bral ba ni rgyun 'brel par 'byung ba'i rnams te /
analyzed: rtag pa dang bral ba ni rgyun 'brel par 'byung ba'i rnams te /
translated: Since they are free from permanence, they occur in a continuous series.

original: des na rtag pa dang chad pa dang bral ba chud pa'i rang bzhin gyis chos thams cad 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i mnyam pa nyid thob pa rnam pa de lta bu rnams thams cad mkhyen pa thams cad las btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams
analyzed: des na rtag pa dang chad pa dang bral ba chud pa'i rang bzhin gyis chos thams cad 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i mnyam pa nyid thob pa rnam pa de lta bu rnams thams cad mkhyen pa thams cad las btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattvas, who are the most venerable of all because they are omniscient, listen to all phenomena, which are by nature empty and free from permanence and annihilation, and attain the sameness of sa·πÉsƒÅra and nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: kyis mnyan te yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs las rnam par bsgo ba'i phyir rang gi sems snang ba tsam la bzung bas phyi'i don dngos po med par gzhan la ston te /
analyzed: kyis mnyan te yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs las rnam par bsgo ba'i phyir rang gi sems snang ba tsam la bzung bas phyi'i don dngos po med par gzhan la ston te /
translated: In order to liberate them from the positions of existence and nonexistence, they teach others that external referents are unreal because they apprehend [phenomena] as mere appearances of their own mind.

original: sems tsam yang bdag dang gzhan gyi dbang gi mthu las mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa snang ngo //üîΩshes rab kyis dpyad cing chos 'chad do //
analyzed: sems tsam yang bdag dang gzhan gyi dbang gi mthu las mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa snang ngo // shes rab kyis dpyad cing chos 'chad do //
translated: It appears in various aspects.

original: gang gi tshe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na /
translated: When?

original: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
analyzed: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
translated: Form is analyzed into particles.

original: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
analyzed: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
translated: Particles are without parts.

original: phyi yi dngos po med par yang //
analyzed: phyi yi dngos po med par yang //
translated: Even though external things do not exist,

original: sems ni rnam pa gnyis su snang //
analyzed: sems ni rnam pa gnyis su snang //
translated: mind appears in two aspects.üîΩThat is also the appearance of mind empty of the aspect of duality.üîΩWithout appearance, the ultimate truth is nondual.

original: zhes pa de yang @105b gnyis kyi rnam pa stong pa'i sems snang ba med cing don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i dbu ma'i ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par
analyzed: zhes pa de yang @105b gnyis kyi rnam pa stong pa'i sems snang ba med cing don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i dbu ma'i ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par
translated: Correctly knowing that, one rests in equipoise in the middle way samƒÅdhi free from the concepts of things and nonthings.

original: 'jog go // snying rje'i bag chags kyis rab tu sad de /
analyzed: 'jog go // snying rje'i bag chags kyis rab tu sad de /
translated: Awakened by the latent tendencies of compassion,

original: sgyu ma'i rnam par thar par dag pa 'jig rten gyi ting nge 'dzin la gnas te chos 'chad do //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i rnam par thar par dag pa 'jig rten gyi ting nge 'dzin la gnas te chos 'chad do //
translated: He teaches the Dharma while abiding in the mundane meditative stabilization that is purified by the liberation of illusion.

original: snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob nas gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang po zhes bya ba de ni lan du ma bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob nas gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang po zhes bya ba de ni lan du ma bshad pa yin no //
translated: Having attained the meditative stabilization with appearance and without appearance, he is the lord of the yoga of various forms. This has been explained many times.

original: da ni stong pa nyid du rab tu 'byed pa'i bshad pa sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: da ni stong pa nyid du rab tu 'byed pa'i bshad pa sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: Now, the explanation of the differentiation into emptiness should be applied.

original: kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyi tshig ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyi tshig ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The words of the imagined nature, etc.

original: stong pa nyid rnams kyi khyad par ni kun tu brtags pas 'byed do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid rnams kyi khyad par ni kun tu brtags pas 'byed do //
translated: The difference between the emptinesses is differentiated by the imagined.

original: don dam pa'i stong pa nyid ni 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i rnam pa gnyis kyi rang bzhin gyis stong zhing sems pa med pa dang / snang ba med pa'i don dam pa'i ldan pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: don dam pa'i stong pa nyid ni 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i rnam pa gnyis kyi rang bzhin gyis stong zhing sems pa med pa dang / snang ba med pa'i don dam pa'i ldan pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa'i chos nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of the ultimate is empty of the nature of the two aspects of apprehender and apprehended, is without thought, and is the reality of the nondual ultimate that is the object of the non-appearance of the mind.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba de la tha dad par snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pa las rnam par rtog pas sgro btags pa rnam par bcad pas dbye ba 'ba' zhig ste /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba de la tha dad par snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pa las rnam par rtog pas sgro btags pa rnam par bcad pas dbye ba 'ba' zhig ste /
translated: In that which is free from the conceptual thoughts of entity and non-entity, there is no conceptual thought of the appearance of difference.  The mere division is the elimination of the superimposition by conceptual thought.

original: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bdag gi dang / byed pa po dang / las dang / byed pa dang / bskyed pa dang / skyed pa dang / brjod pa dang / rjod pa la sogs pa'i phyi rol gyi don du sgro btags pa'i tha snyad rnam par gcad par bya ba ni ji ltar tshad ma'i gtam las 'byung ba /
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bdag gi dang / byed pa po dang / las dang / byed pa dang / bskyed pa dang / skyed pa dang / brjod pa dang / rjod pa la sogs pa'i phyi rol gyi don du sgro btags pa'i tha snyad rnam par gcad par bya ba ni ji ltar tshad ma'i gtam las 'byung ba /
translated: The elimination of the conventional designations of external objects such as permanence, self, mine, agent, action, activity, production, producer, expression, and expressed, is as it occurs in the Triskandhaka:

original: ji tsam char ni sgro 'dogs pa //
analyzed: ji tsam char ni sgro 'dogs pa //
translated: To the extent that there is superimposition,

original: de bsal phyir ni gdon mi za //
analyzed: de bsal phyir ni gdon mi za //
translated: to that extent there is the elimination of it.üîΩTo that extent there are words and expressions,

original: de snyed de bzhin sgra rnams dang // des na de dag tha dad yul //
analyzed: de snyed de bzhin sgra rnams dang // des na de dag tha dad yul //
translated: and therefore they are different objects.

original: zhes pa'o // ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba /
translated: And as it occurs in the Perfection of Wisdom:

original: nang dang phyi'i dngos po'i phyin ci log tu sgro btags pa mtha' med pa rnam par bcad pa'i mdo'i don du mdor brjod na nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /üîΩde bzhin du 'dir yang stong pa tshig gi don la mi shes @106a * //
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i dngos po'i phyin ci log tu sgro btags pa mtha' med pa rnam par bcad pa'i mdo'i don du mdor brjod na nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ste / de bzhin du 'dir yang stong pa tshig gi don la mi shes @106a * //
translated: In brief, the meaning of the sutra is to eliminate the limitless superimpositions of the internal and external things as erroneous.

original: pa 'dzin pa rnam par dgag pa'i phyir sems can rnams la stong pa nyid rnam pa bdun gsungs pa ni mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / dngos po'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / srid pa stong pa nyid dang / mi srid pa stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: pa 'dzin pa rnam par dgag pa'i phyir sems can rnams la stong pa nyid rnam pa bdun gsungs pa ni mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / dngos po'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / srid pa stong pa nyid dang / mi srid pa stong pa nyid dang /
translated: In the same way, here, in order to eliminate the grasping of ignorance with respect to the meaning of the words of emptiness, the seven types of emptiness are taught to sentient beings: the emptiness of characteristics, the emptiness of the nature of nonentities, the emptiness of the nature of entities, the emptiness of nonproduction, the emptiness of noncessation, the emptiness of the primordially peace, and the emptiness of the nature of nontransformation.

original: chos thams cad brjod du med pa stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa 'phags pa'i ye shes stong pa nyid chen po nyid dang / gcig gis gcig stong pa nyid dang / bdun no zhes te /
analyzed: chos thams cad brjod du med pa stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa 'phags pa'i ye shes stong pa nyid chen po nyid dang / gcig gis gcig stong pa nyid dang / bdun no zhes te /
translated: The emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of the ultimate, the emptiness of the great, the emptiness of one in the other, and the seventh is the emptiness of emptiness.

original: ji ltar mi shes pa sbom po kun las nyon mongs pa bzlog pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pas rnam par dbye bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar mi shes pa sbom po kun las nyon mongs pa bzlog pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pas rnam par dbye bar gsungs pa /
translated: In order to reverse the afflictions of all the gross forms of ignorance, the Omniscient One taught the classifications.

original: blo gros chen po de la mtshan nyid stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: blo gros chen po de la mtshan nyid stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: MahƒÅmati, what is the emptiness of characteristics?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: dngos po thams cad ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis stong ngo //üîΩblo gros chen po phan tshun du 'dus pa la ltos pa dang / rab tu dbye ba'i khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis stong ngo // blo gros chen po phan tshun du 'dus pa la ltos pa dang / rab tu dbye ba'i khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: All things are empty of their own and general characteristics.

original: 'jug pa med de /
analyzed: 'jug pa med de /
translated: MahƒÅmati, the general characteristic does not engage because of the mutual dependence on each other, and because there is no difference in the distinctions of the divisions.üîΩMahƒÅmati, because of the absence of self, other, and both, there are no characteristics. Therefore, all things are said to be empty of characteristics.

original: blo gros chen po bdag dang / pha rol dang / gnyis ka med pa'i phyir mtshan nyid med pas na de'i phyir dngos po thams cad mtshan nyid stong pa zhes bya'o zhes pa la rang gi mtshan nyid ni bdag gi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: blo gros chen po bdag dang / pha rol dang / gnyis ka med pa'i phyir mtshan nyid med pas na de'i phyir dngos po thams cad mtshan nyid stong pa zhes bya'o zhes pa la rang gi mtshan nyid ni bdag gi mtshan nyid de /
translated: Here, the own characteristic is the characteristic of self.

original: ji ltar 'byung ba rnams kyis rang gi mtshan nyid ni sra ba dang / gsher ba dang / dro ba dang / g-yo ba rnams dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid ni reg par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'byung ba rnams kyis rang gi mtshan nyid ni sra ba dang / gsher ba dang / dro ba dang / g-yo ba rnams dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid ni reg par bya'o //
translated: Just as the elements have their own characteristics: solidity, fluidity, heat, and motility, and the general characteristic of being touchable.

original: de dag ni /
analyzed: de dag ni /
translated: They are as follows:

original: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
analyzed: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
translated: Form is analyzed by breaking down the gross into particles.

original: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste // zhes pa ste /
translated: The particle has no parts.üîΩWhen the gross is divided into parts, there is no external reality.

original: sbom po dang / phra mo phyogs kyi cha tha dad par 'byed pas dbye ba na phyi rol nyid du med pas ji ltar na stong pa la rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid yod par rigs /
analyzed: sbom po dang / phra mo phyogs kyi cha tha dad par 'byed pas dbye ba na phyi rol nyid du med pas ji ltar na stong pa la rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid yod par rigs /
translated: How can emptiness have its own and general characteristics?

original: 'dus pa ltos pa na yang mtshan nyid ji ltar na rigs te /
analyzed: 'dus pa ltos pa na yang mtshan nyid ji ltar na rigs te /
translated: When the collection is analyzed, how can the characteristics be tenable?

original: 'dus pa rnam par phye ba na khang pa dang / sde dang nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong pa nyid de de bas na sbom po dang / phra mo'i mtshan nyid la rab tu dbye ba'i khyad par med do //
analyzed: 'dus pa rnam par phye ba na khang pa dang / sde dang nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong pa nyid de de bas na sbom po dang / phra mo'i mtshan nyid la rab tu dbye ba'i khyad par med do //
translated: When the collection is broken up, it is empty like a house, an army, a forest, and so on. Therefore, there is no difference in the characteristics of the gross and the subtle.

original: rab tu dbye ba'i khyad par med pa'i phyir yang bdag dang / pha rol dang / gnyis ka med pas mtshan nyid gnas pa med do //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba'i khyad par med pa'i phyir yang bdag dang / pha rol dang / gnyis ka med pas mtshan nyid gnas pa med do //
translated: Because there is no difference in their differentiation, there is no establishment of a characteristic by way of self, other, or both.

original: nang dang phyi rol gyi rnams la bdag dang / phyi rol dang / gnyi ga'i rang bzhin @106b med pa'i phyir gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i dngos por rang gi mtshan nyid ma grub po //
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol gyi rnams la bdag dang / phyi rol dang / gnyi ga'i rang bzhin @106b med pa'i phyir gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i dngos por rang gi mtshan nyid ma grub po //
translated: Because of the absence of a nature of self, other, or both in the internal and external, the nature of the characteristic of the apprehended and the apprehender is not established.

original: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rang bzhin med pa nyid la mtshan ma'i gnas dang / mtshan ma'i dngos po kun rtog par byed de /
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rang bzhin med pa nyid la mtshan ma'i gnas dang / mtshan ma'i dngos po kun rtog par byed de /
translated: In the absence of a nature of duality, one imagines the basis of signs and the entity of signs.

original: de dag ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib la sogs pa snang ba bzhin du rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib la sogs pa snang ba bzhin du rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa'o //
translated: They are like appearances in a dream, an optical illusion, or blurred vision, and so forth, and are not essentially arisen.

original: rang bzhin du grub na ni pha rol po'i dngos po rnam par bcad par yang 'gyur na /
analyzed: rang bzhin du grub na ni pha rol po'i dngos po rnam par bcad par yang 'gyur na /
translated: If they were established as a nature, then the entity of other would be eliminated.

original: gang gis rang gi mtshan nyid ma grub na de la gzhan gyi mtshan nyid ji ltar na rnam par gcad /
analyzed: gang gis rang gi mtshan nyid ma grub na de la gzhan gyi mtshan nyid ji ltar na rnam par gcad /
translated: But if they are not established by way of their own characteristics, how could the characteristic of other be eliminated?

original: gang gi tshe na shes par bya ba sbom po dang phra mo mtshan nyid med pa de'i tshe shes pa de gcod pa po'i mtshan nyid kyang med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe na shes par bya ba sbom po dang phra mo mtshan nyid med pa de'i tshe shes pa de gcod pa po'i mtshan nyid kyang med pa nyid do //
translated: When the object to be known, whether gross or subtle, has no characteristic, then that knowledge also has no characteristic as an agent of elimination.

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid kyang gcig dang tha dad par 'grub ba med de /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid kyang gcig dang tha dad par 'grub ba med de /
translated: The basis of characteristic and the characteristic are not established as either the same or different.

original: ji ltar dbu ma las 'byung ba //
analyzed: ji ltar dbu ma las 'byung ba //
translated: As it is said in the Madhyamaka:

original: mtshon bya mtshan nyid gal te gzhan //
analyzed: mtshon bya mtshan nyid gal te gzhan //
translated: If the characterized and the characteristic were different,

original: mtshan la mtshan nyid med par 'gyur //
analyzed: mtshan la mtshan nyid med par 'gyur //
translated: the characteristic would be without a characterized.

original: gcig na'ang de gnyis mi 'grub ste //
analyzed: gcig na'ang de gnyis mi 'grub ste //
translated: If they were the same, those two would not be established.

original: tha dad na yang gzhan du med //
analyzed: tha dad na yang gzhan du med //
translated: If they were different, there would be no other.

original: ces pa'o // tsha ba la tsha ba nyid dang tsha ba'i yon tan gang yang rung ste /
analyzed: ces pa'o // tsha ba la tsha ba nyid dang tsha ba'i yon tan gang yang rung ste /
translated: If heat and the quality of heat were different,

original: gal te tha dad pa yin na me las tsha ba med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa yin na me las tsha ba med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: the error would arise that heat would not exist in fire.

original: rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / gzugs can dang / gzugs med dang / chos dang / chos can la sogs pa gzhan pa yin na ni skyon 'di nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / gzugs can dang / gzugs med dang / chos dang / chos can la sogs pa gzhan pa yin na ni skyon 'di nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If permanence, impermanence, form, formlessness, phenomena, and the possessor of phenomena, and so on, were different, this very error would arise.

original: des na chos thams cad rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'o zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na chos thams cad rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'o zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the Omniscient One intended that all phenomena are free from specific and general characteristics.

original: ji ltar tshad ma'i gtam las 'byung //
analyzed: ji ltar tshad ma'i gtam las 'byung //
translated: As it occurs in the treatise on valid cognition:

original: der yang gzhan ni ldog pas na //
analyzed: der yang gzhan ni ldog pas na //
translated: There, the other is excluded,

original: gzhan ni ldog gyur zhes pa yang //
analyzed: gzhan ni ldog gyur zhes pa yang //
translated: And the other becomes excluded.

original: sgra dang blo rnams de bzhin du //
analyzed: sgra dang blo rnams de bzhin du //
translated: Sound and cognition are like that.

original: btags pa'i rjes su thogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: btags pa'i rjes su thogs par 'gyur //
translated: They follow the designation.

original: sbyor med tha dad med pa ni //
analyzed: sbyor med tha dad med pa ni //
translated: Without connection, without difference,

original: don dam don ni bdag nyid kyis //
analyzed: don dam don ni bdag nyid kyis //
translated: The ultimate meaning is the nature itself.üîΩForm is one and many,

original: gzugs ni gcig dang du ma dang // de ni blo yi 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni gcig dang du ma dang // de ni blo yi 'khrul pa'o //
translated: That is the error of cognition.

original: mi gnyis pa dang brjod du med pa de dag la chos dang chos can gyi dngos por mtshan nyid brtags te /
analyzed: mi gnyis pa dang brjod du med pa de dag la chos dang chos can gyi dngos por mtshan nyid brtags te /
translated: In those non-dual and inexpressible [phenomena], the nature of the subject and object is imagined.

original: spyir sgro btags pas brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: spyir sgro btags pas brjod par bya'o //
translated: In general, it should be expressed through superimposition.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la rang bzhin gyi dngos po skye ba med pa'i phyir zhes pa ni de la @107a * //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la rang bzhin gyi dngos po skye ba med pa'i phyir zhes pa ni de la @107a * //
translated: In the emptiness of the nature of things, etc., the nature of things is unborn. That is

original: dngos po rnams rang gis thog ma dang tha mar stong pa nyid du skye ba ste /
analyzed: dngos po rnams rang gis thog ma dang tha mar stong pa nyid du skye ba ste /
translated: Things are empty of arising in the beginning and end by themselves.

original: skyes pa ni gang nas kyang mi 'ong la /
analyzed: skyes pa ni gang nas kyang mi 'ong la /
translated: That which has arisen does not come from anywhere.

original: 'gags pa na yang gar yang tshogs su 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: 'gags pa na yang gar yang tshogs su 'gyur ba med de /
translated: When it ceases, it does not go anywhere to accumulate.

original: 'bras bu yang gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rang bzhin gyi stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rang bzhin gyi stong pa nyid de /
translated: The effect is also empty of the nature of duality.

original: gang dag gnyis kyi rnam pa can yin pa de dag ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib la sogs pa snang ba bzhin du don dam par skye ba'i rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag gnyis kyi rnam pa can yin pa de dag ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib la sogs pa snang ba bzhin du don dam par skye ba'i rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: Those that have the aspect of duality are like appearances in a dream, an illusion, or blurred vision. They do not have the nature of arising ultimately.

original: blo gros chen po srid pa'i stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: blo gros chen po srid pa'i stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, what is the emptiness of existence?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: bdag dang / bdag gi dang bral ba'i phung po rnams rgyu dang ldan pa dang / byed pa dang las 'byor pa las skye zhing 'byung ste /
analyzed: bdag dang / bdag gi dang bral ba'i phung po rnams rgyu dang ldan pa dang / byed pa dang las 'byor pa las skye zhing 'byung ste /
translated: The aggregates, which are devoid of an ‚ÄòI‚Äô and ‚Äòmine,‚Äô arise and occur from the combination of causes, actions, and objects.

original: de'i phyir srid pa'i stong pa nyid ces bya'o zhes bya ba la srid pa'i phung po rnams ni mnyam par 'jog pa med pa'i ma rig pa dang / las las 'byung ba rnams te /
analyzed: de'i phyir srid pa'i stong pa nyid ces bya'o zhes bya ba la srid pa'i phung po rnams ni mnyam par 'jog pa med pa'i ma rig pa dang / las las 'byung ba rnams te /
translated: The aggregates of existence arise from karma and ignorance, which is the absence of meditative equipoise.

original: de dag la bdag dang / bdag gi mi rigs pa ni ma skyes pas na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag la bdag dang / bdag gi mi rigs pa ni ma skyes pas na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: The self and what belongs to the self are illogical because they are unborn, like the son of a barren woman and so on.

original: bdag gi yang phyi rol gyi rnam par phye ba na rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba'i dngos por phyin ci log tu brtags pas stong par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi yang phyi rol gyi rnam par phye ba na rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba'i dngos por phyin ci log tu brtags pas stong par 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, the self is empty because it is imputed as permanent, blissful, and pure in the external classification.

original: rgyu dang ldan pa'i 'dus pa'i mthu las mi rtag pa dang / stong pa'i phung po rnams rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du rab tu 'byung bar snang ngo //
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa'i 'dus pa'i mthu las mi rtag pa dang / stong pa'i phung po rnams rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du rab tu 'byung bar snang ngo //
translated: The impermanent and empty aggregates arise from the power of the assembly of causes, appearing like dreams and so on.

original: 'du byed thams cad skad cig pa //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad skad cig pa //
translated: All formations are momentary.üîΩHow can the unstable be a creator?

original: mi brtan byed pa ga la zhig / gang 'byung byed pa de nyid de //üîΩbyed pa por yang de nyid brjod //
analyzed: mi brtan byed pa ga la zhig / gang 'byung byed pa de nyid de // byed pa por yang de nyid brjod //
translated: That which arises is the creator.üîΩIt is also called the agent.

original: ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ste /
translated: This is what is said.

original: de bas na rgyu dang ldan pa dang / byed pa de nyid dang / byed pa po yang de nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na rgyu dang ldan pa dang / byed pa de nyid dang / byed pa po yang de nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the cause is the same as the action, and the agent is the same as the action.

original: de'i phyir rgyu dang ldan pa dang / byed pa dang / las ni snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod pas na 'di yod par 'gyur ro zhes par rnam par gzhag gi /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu dang ldan pa dang / byed pa dang / las ni snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod pas na 'di yod par 'gyur ro zhes par rnam par gzhag gi /
translated: Therefore, the cause, the action, and the object are established as follows: ‚ÄúBecause this exists, that comes to be.‚Äù

original: skad cig pa la tha dad pa skyes pa dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog par byed pa'i byed pa dang / byed pa po dang / las su kun tu brtags pa'i chos rnams med do zhes sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: skad cig pa la tha dad pa skyes pa dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog par byed pa'i byed pa dang / byed pa po dang / las su kun tu brtags pa'i chos rnams med do zhes sngar bshad zin to //
translated: However, in the case of momentariness, the action of arising, enduring, and ceasing, and the imputed phenomena of the agent, action, and object do not exist, as was explained earlier.

original: mi srid pa'i stong pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mi srid pa'i stong pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The emptiness of the impossible and so on.

original: phung po rnams la mya ngan las 'das pa la sngon srid pa ma yin te zhes pa ni gnyis kyi rnam pa stong pa @107b nyid dang / bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa ni mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa ni de'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: phung po rnams la mya ngan las 'das pa la sngon srid pa ma yin te zhes pa ni gnyis kyi rnam pa stong pa @107b nyid dang / bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa ni mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa ni de'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The absence of thought and the absence of appearance, and the ultimate truth, are the nondual correct understanding of that.

original: blo gros chen po brjod du med pa'i stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: blo gros chen po brjod du med pa'i stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: Mahamati, what is the inexpressible emptiness?

original: chos thams cad brjod du med pa zhes te /
analyzed: chos thams cad brjod du med pa zhes te /
translated: It is the inexpressibility of all phenomena.

original: don dang sgra yi khyad par la //
analyzed: don dang sgra yi khyad par la //
translated: The difference between meaning and sound

original: phan tshun brjod brjod 'dod pa min //
analyzed: phan tshun brjod brjod 'dod pa min //
translated: is not mutually expressible.

original: de sngar mthong ba med pas na //üîΩspyir ni nye bar brjod par bya //
analyzed: de sngar mthong ba med pas na // spyir ni nye bar brjod par bya //
translated: Since it is not seen before,

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: it is generally to be expressed.

original: chos gang dag rig par bya ba de dag mngon par brjod pa dang 'brel pa med de /
analyzed: chos gang dag rig par bya ba de dag mngon par brjod pa dang 'brel pa med de /
translated: The phenomena that are to be known are not related to verbal expression.

original: bde la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: bde la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni //
translated: The nature of pleasure and so forth

original: bsnyad par mi nus gzhan mi bsten //
analyzed: bsnyad par mi nus gzhan mi bsten //
translated: cannot be expressed, nor does it depend on another.

original: de phyir de dag rang rig pa //
analyzed: de phyir de dag rang rig pa //
translated: Therefore, they are self-cognizant.

original: mngon par brjod dang 'brel ba med //
analyzed: mngon par brjod dang 'brel ba med //
translated: It is not related to verbal expression.

original: ces pa'o // thams cad mkhyen pa'i don 'di nyid slob dpon dign'a ga dang / dharma k'irti la sogs pas rab tu snang bar byas so //
analyzed: ces pa'o // thams cad mkhyen pa'i don 'di nyid slob dpon dign'a ga dang / dharma k'irti la sogs pas rab tu snang bar byas so //
translated: This very meaning of omniscience was illuminated by the masters DignƒÅga, Dharmakƒ´rti, and so on.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: kun tu brtags pa'i rang bzhin brjod du med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni kun tu brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyis rang gi mtshan nyid brjod du med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: kun tu brtags pa'i rang bzhin brjod du med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni kun tu brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyis rang gi mtshan nyid brjod du med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the imagined nature is inexpressible, the intrinsic identity of the imagined nature is inexpressible.üîΩThe object of the sense faculty is different,

original: dbang don de ni gzhan nyid dang // sgra yi spyod yul gzhan yin te //
analyzed: dbang don de ni gzhan nyid dang // sgra yi spyod yul gzhan yin te //
translated: and the domain of words is different.

original: sgra las mig med mthong ba ste //
analyzed: sgra las mig med mthong ba ste //
translated: The eye is not seen through words.

original: mngon sum du ni mthong ba med //
analyzed: mngon sum du ni mthong ba med //
translated: It is not seen directly.

original: med dang 'brel pas gzhan du ni //
analyzed: med dang 'brel pas gzhan du ni //
translated: Through the connection with the nonexistent,

original: bdag tshig ces ni sems pa ste //üîΩtshig pa'i sgras ni gzhan du yang //
analyzed: bdag tshig ces ni sems pa ste // tshig pa'i sgras ni gzhan du yang //
translated: it is thought to be ‚Äúmine.‚ÄùüîΩThrough the word ‚Äúburned,‚Äù

original: tshig pa'i don ni shes par byed //üîΩces pa ste /
analyzed: tshig pa'i don ni shes par byed //üîΩces pa ste /
translated: the meaning of ‚Äúburned‚Äù is understood elsewhere.

original: gnyis kyi rnam par gsal pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyang sgras brjod par mi nus na gnyis kyi stong pa nyid lta ci smos te /
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam par gsal pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyang sgras brjod par mi nus na gnyis kyi stong pa nyid lta ci smos te /
translated: If the intrinsic identity of the appearance of duality cannot be expressed by words, what need is there to mention the emptiness of duality?

original: gang gis de la brjod pa med pa des na brjod du med pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis de la brjod pa med pa des na brjod du med pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Since it is inexpressible by any means, it is called ‚Äúthe emptiness of the inexpressible.‚Äù

original: blo gros chen po don dam pa 'phags pa'i ye shes stong pa nyid chen po nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: blo gros chen po don dam pa 'phags pa'i ye shes stong pa nyid chen po nyid gang zhe na /
translated: Mahamati, what is the ultimate, the great emptiness of the wisdom of the noble ones?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: bdag gi so so rang gi 'phags pa'i ye shes khong du chud pa ni lta ba thams cad kyi nyes pa'i bag chags kyis stong ste /
analyzed: bdag gi so so rang gi 'phags pa'i ye shes khong du chud pa ni lta ba thams cad kyi nyes pa'i bag chags kyis stong ste /
