translated: The realization of one‚Äôs own individual noble wisdom is empty of the habitual tendencies of the faults of all views.üîΩTherefore, in the ultimate, the wisdom of the noble ones is said to be the great emptiness.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir don dam pa na 'phags pa'i ye shes stong pa chen po med ces bya'o zhes pa ni gang gi tshe na rnal 'byor can gyi shes rab kyis dpyad de phyi rol gyi dngos po la rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam pa na 'phags pa'i ye shes stong pa chen po med ces bya'o zhes pa ni gang gi tshe na rnal 'byor can gyi shes rab kyis dpyad de phyi rol gyi dngos po la rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang /
translated: When the yogin analyzes with wisdom and does not see external things as imputed to be permanent, a self, happiness, and purity,

original: gtsang bas sgro btags pa mi mthong ba de'i tshe @108a * //
analyzed: gtsang bas sgro btags pa mi mthong ba de'i tshe @108a * //
translated: at that time,

original: de'i sems yul gang du yang mdzes pa'i rang bzhin du rab tu mi 'jug pa ni de las gzhan pa'i nyes par 'jug pa'i dbang po'i shes pa dang / dbugs thub pa yang dag par rig pa bzhin du sems pa med cing snang ba med pa'i don dam pa mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa bdag nyid kyis gnas so //
analyzed: de'i sems yul gang du yang mdzes pa'i rang bzhin du rab tu mi 'jug pa ni de las gzhan pa'i nyes par 'jug pa'i dbang po'i shes pa dang / dbugs thub pa yang dag par rig pa bzhin du sems pa med cing snang ba med pa'i don dam pa mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa bdag nyid kyis gnas so //
translated: Its mind does not engage in any object whatsoever as beautiful by nature, and it abides in the ultimate nonduality, which is the meaning of the absence of thought and appearance, like the perfect knowledge of the control of breath.

original: rgyun du mnyam par 'jog cing dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pa dang chags pa med pa de'i tshe de'i log pa'i shes pa'i bag chags ma lus par spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyun du mnyam par 'jog cing dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pa dang chags pa med pa de'i tshe de'i log pa'i shes pa'i bag chags ma lus par spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: When one is always in equipoise, nonconceptual with regard to things and nonthings, and free of attachment, at that time one will completely eliminate the latent tendencies of mistaken consciousness.

original: des na don dam pa 'phags pa'i ye shes stong pa chen po nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: des na don dam pa 'phags pa'i ye shes stong pa chen po nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the ultimate, the wisdom of the noble ones, is called ‚Äúgreat emptiness.‚Äù

original: blo gros chen po gcig gis gcig stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: blo gros chen po gcig gis gcig stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: MahƒÅmati, what is one emptiness of another?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: gang gang na med pa de ni des stong zhes bya'o zhes pa ni dngos po thams cad gcig la gcig rnam par log pa'i rang bzhin pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gang na med pa de ni des stong zhes bya'o zhes pa ni dngos po thams cad gcig la gcig rnam par log pa'i rang bzhin pa yin te /

original: bum pa la snam bu med de /
analyzed: bum pa la snam bu med de /
translated: A cloth is absent in a pot.

original: ji ltar ba tri ka las 'byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar ba tri ka las 'byung ba /
translated: As it is said in the Vatsagotrƒ´ya S≈´tra:

original: dngos po thams cad rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad rang bzhin gyis //

original: bdag gi dngos por rnam par gnas //üîΩrang gi dngos po gzhan dngos kyis //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos por rnam par gnas // rang gi dngos po gzhan dngos kyis //
translated: Dwelling in their own nature.üîΩBecause of the aspect of being

original: rnam par log pa'i cha yi phyir //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par log pa'i cha yi phyir // zhes pa ste /
translated: Excluded from other natures,

original: thams cad mkhyen pas gzhan bstsal ba rgya cher dgongs pas na 'dir rab tu bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas gzhan bstsal ba rgya cher dgongs pas na 'dir rab tu bshad pa yin te /

original: de bas na 'di skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bas na 'di skad du gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: blo gros chen po mri ga ra'i mi'i khang pa na glang po dang / ba lang dang / lug la sogs pa med kyang dge slong gis stong pa ma yin no zhes ngas bshad de /
analyzed: blo gros chen po mri ga ra'i mi'i khang pa na glang po dang / ba lang dang / lug la sogs pa med kyang dge slong gis stong pa ma yin no zhes ngas bshad de /

original: de ni de dag gis stong zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: de ni de dag gis stong zhes bya ba yang /

analyzed: blo gros chen po khang pa'i dngos por med pa ma yin /

analyzed: dge slong rnams kyang dge slong gi ngo bor med pa ma yin te /

original: blo gros chen po ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas ma gtogs par rang yang mi skye la /
analyzed: blo gros chen po ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas ma gtogs par rang yang mi skye la /
translated: MahƒÅmati, apart from the basis of samƒÅdhi, they do not arise by themselves.

original: mi skye ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mi skye ba yang ma yin te /

original: de'i phyir ma skyes pa dang / rang bzhin med pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma skyes pa dang / rang bzhin med pa ste /

analyzed: skye ba med pa la dgongs nas dngos po thams cad rang bzhin med pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: blo gros chen po skad cig @108b ma'i rgyud kyi rgyun med pa dang / gzhan du 'gyur bar snang ba'i phyir chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa ste /
translated: MahƒÅmati, all things are essenceless because of the appearance of the nonexistence of the continuum of momentary continua and of transformation.

original: de'i phyir dngos po thams cad ni rang bzhin med pa'o zhes bya ba la rang yang mi skye ba ni rgyu la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po thams cad ni rang bzhin med pa'o zhes bya ba la rang yang mi skye ba ni rgyu la ltos pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: mi skye ba yang ma yin pa ni snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod pa las 'di yod par 'gyur zhes pa ste /

analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba'i rang bzhin med pa la dgongs te /

analyzed: rgyun 'brel pa'i rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba la de skad ces bya'o //

analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas rgya cher dgongs pa'i sgra'i don ni sa dang po'i dbang pos dbu mar smras pa yin te /

original: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //

analyzed: gnyis dang rgyu med pa las min //

original: gar yang gang zhig dngos po rnams //
analyzed: gar yang gang zhig dngos po rnams //

analyzed: nams kyang skye ba med pa'o //
translated: is ever produced.

analyzed: zhes so // blo gros chen po mi gnyis pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

analyzed: grib ma dang / nyi ma lta bu dang / ring po dang thung ngu /
translated: Like a shadow and the sun, long and short,

original: blo gros chen po de bzhin du 'khor ba dang mya nga las 'das pa ltar chos thams cad mi gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po de bzhin du 'khor ba dang mya nga las 'das pa ltar chos thams cad mi gnyis pa ste /
translated: MahƒÅmati, in the same way, all phenomena are nondual, like sa·πÉsƒÅra and nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: blo gros chen po de ni mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo gros chen po de ni mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: MahƒÅmati, this is because they are causes of different characteristics.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa gang na ba de na 'khor ba med /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa gang na ba de na 'khor ba med /
translated: Where there is nirvƒÅ·πáa, there is no sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: 'khor ba gang na ba de na mya ngan las 'das pa med de /
analyzed: 'khor ba gang na ba de na mya ngan las 'das pa med de /
translated: Where there is sa·πÉsƒÅra, there is no nirvƒÅ·πáa.

translated: Therefore, all phenomena are said to be nondual, like sa·πÉsƒÅra and nirvƒÅ·πáa.‚Äù

original: sems can rnams kyi sems ni gser lta bu ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi sems ni gser lta bu ste /
translated: The minds of sentient beings are like gold.

original: dri ma dang bcas pa dang / dri ma med pa'i dus na skad cig ma'i rgyun tha dad pas na 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa phan tshun du tha dad pa'i rang bzhin du yin te /
analyzed: dri ma dang bcas pa dang / dri ma med pa'i dus na skad cig ma'i rgyun tha dad pas na 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa phan tshun du tha dad pa'i rang bzhin du yin te /

analyzed: de dag nyid mi gnyis pa nyid ni sems can nam /
translated: The nonduality of those two is the sentient being orüîΩthe self.

analyzed: gcig nyid gcig gi rang bzhin gang yin pa de gnyis po'i ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is the nature of one is not the nature of the other.

original: rtag pa dang gcig pa'o zhes mi gnyis par smra ba rnams la ni grol ba dang ma grol ba dang / phyug dbul ba la sogs pa gcig tu 'gyur ro zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang gcig pa'o zhes mi gnyis par smra ba rnams la ni grol ba dang ma grol ba dang / phyug dbul ba la sogs pa gcig tu 'gyur ro zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
translated: The Omniscient One intended that for those who propound nonduality, such as permanence and unity, liberation and nonliberation, and wealth and poverty, would be the same.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mi skye ba dang / @109a * //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mi skye ba dang / @109a * //

translated: The two kinds of non-self and the characteristic of realitylessness which are included in the sutras should be understood in this very meaning. This is the explanation of the seven kinds of emptiness, beginning with the characteristic.

analyzed: mi skye ba yang gnyis kyi rnam pa rnams te /

analyzed: mi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin no //

analyzed: skad cig pa la skye ba dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos tha dad pa ma yin te /

analyzed: des na yongs su grub pa'i chud pa rnams kyis gnyis kyi rnam pa mi skye bas na rang bzhin med pa'o //

original: de'i phyir dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa la sogs pa'i mdo sder yang don 'di nyid do //

analyzed: sems pa med pa dang / snang ba med pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa rnams ni rnam pa thams cad du stong pa nyid do //

original: de la nang dang phyi rol du so sor snang ba'i gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid mtha' med pa dang zhal du med pa ste byis pa rnams la mdor bsdus pa'i don rnam par phye ba'i stong pa nyid khyad par 'ba'üîΩzhig bshad do //
analyzed: de la nang dang phyi rol du so sor snang ba'i gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid mtha' med pa dang zhal du med pa ste byis pa rnams la mdor bsdus pa'i don rnam par phye ba'i stong pa nyid khyad par 'ba' zhig bshad do //
translated: To the childish, the emptiness of the meaning of the brief explanation is explained as only a special emptiness.

original: de ni lan du mar yang smras so //
analyzed: de ni lan du mar yang smras so //

original: 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par ni /
analyzed: 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par ni /

original: sems can gyi log pa'i shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa ji tsam yod pa de rnam par bcad pa'i phyir de tsam nyid du stong pa nyid kyi rim pa gsungs pas na stong pa nyid la mtha' med do //
analyzed: sems can gyi log pa'i shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa ji tsam yod pa de rnam par bcad pa'i phyir de tsam nyid du stong pa nyid kyi rim pa gsungs pas na stong pa nyid la mtha' med do //
translated: the stages of emptiness are taught to the extent that there are conceptual thoughts of sentient beings‚Äô wrong consciousnesses. Therefore, emptiness is limitless.

original: don dam pa'i stong pa nyid ni mi gnyis pa rtog pa'i chos nyid de /
analyzed: don dam pa'i stong pa nyid ni mi gnyis pa rtog pa'i chos nyid de /
translated: The emptiness of the ultimate is nondual, the reality of thought.

original: dngos po dang / dngos po med pa rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas na de la tha dad par snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa med do //
analyzed: dngos po dang / dngos po med pa rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas na de la tha dad par snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa med do //
translated: Since it is free from the conceptual thoughts of things and nonthings, there is no conceptual thought of different appearances in it.

original: sems can rnams kyi log pa'i shes pa'i dpe'i don du thams cad mkhyen pas smig rgyu la sogs pa gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi log pa'i shes pa'i dpe'i don du thams cad mkhyen pas smig rgyu la sogs pa gzhag pa ni /
translated: The Omniscient One posits mirages and so forth as examples of the mistaken consciousnesses of sentient beings.

original: blo gros chen po 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: blo gros chen po 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: MahƒÅmati, it is like this:

original: smig rgyu ba ni ri dags slu ba yin te /
analyzed: smig rgyu ba ni ri dags slu ba yin te /

original: chu'i dngos por mngon par zhen pas mngon par zhen par byed pa de de la chu med do //
analyzed: chu'i dngos por mngon par zhen pas mngon par zhen par byed pa de de la chu med do //

original: blo gros chen po de bzhin du mdo sde bstan pa'i chos thams cad kyang byis pa rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa mgu bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po de bzhin du mdo sde bstan pa'i chos thams cad kyang byis pa rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa mgu bar bya ba yin te /
translated: MahƒÅmati, likewise, all the Dharma teachings of the s≈´tras are to please the conceptual thoughts of the childish.üîΩThey are not the talk of the arrangement of the wisdom of the ƒÅryas.

original: de ni 'phags pa'i ye shes rnam par dgod pa'i gtam ni ma yin no zhes bya ba phyi'i @109b don la ltos te mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa la sogs pa dang / phung po la sogs par bstan pa lta bu ni byis pa rnams mgu bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'phags pa'i ye shes rnam par dgod pa'i gtam ni ma yin no zhes bya ba phyi'i @109b don la ltos te mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa la sogs pa dang / phung po la sogs par bstan pa lta bu ni byis pa rnams mgu bar bya ba yin te /
translated: The teachings on impermanence, suffering, ugliness, and so on, and the teachings on the aggregates and so on are to please the childish.

analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i sems can gzud par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa mtha' med do //

original: ji ltar t'i ka las 'byung ba //
analyzed: ji ltar t'i ka las 'byung ba //

original: yang dag don la gzigs med par //
analyzed: yang dag don la gzigs med par //

original: glang po btsun pa mdzad nas ni //üîΩ'jig rten blo ni 'ba' zhig gi //
analyzed: glang po btsun pa mdzad nas ni // 'jig rten blo ni 'ba' zhig gi //
translated: the noble elephantüîΩis only a mental fabrication

analyzed: phyi yi sems pa spros par mdzad //

analyzed: gang zag la bdag med par bstan pas bdag la chags pa log pa'i phyir 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal yang bzlog go //

analyzed: de'i 'og tu chos la bdag med pa bstan pas snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / sa'i khyad par thams cad bsgom pa dang / byang chub tu bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam gyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i bdag dang gzhan gyi don du zhugs pa'i 'phags pa de dag gi phyir bsgom pa'i gtam de ma yin no //
translated: After that, by teaching the selflessness of phenomena, the cultivation of all the stages of meditative concentration, both with and without appearances, and the cultivation of the prayers of noble conduct for the sake of oneself and others for the sake of omniscience, that is not the teaching of cultivation for those noble ones.

original: de kho na rnam par gzhag pa'i gtam ma yin pa ni don dam par ma yin no zhes dgongs par rtog go //

analyzed: chos thams cad yongs su shes pa dang / de kho na nyid la gdon mi za ba'i phyir rtsod pa'i khyad par med do //
translated: There is no difference in dispute because of the thorough knowledge of all things and because of the certainty of reality.

analyzed: de bas na don gyi rjes su 'brang par bya'i /

analyzed: // / de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bshad par brtsams pa de la thams cad mkhyen pa la blo gros chen pos gsol pa /
translated: In the explanation of the TathƒÅgatagarbha, MahƒÅmati asked the Omniscient One:

analyzed: gtogs 'dod dang / lha chen po dang / tshangs pa la sogs pa rnams la yang chud pa'i khyab pa'i bstan pa mchis na thams cad mkhyen pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i snying po la khyad par ci zhig gsungs par gyur /
translated: If the teachings of the Vedas, the great gods, and Brahma, etc. are also included in the all-pervading, then what is the special teaching of the Omniscient One regarding the essence of the essence of the Tathagata?

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa khyod kyis @110a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa khyod kyis @110a * //
translated: If you say that the all-pervading is naturally luminous,

original: gsungs na gang gis sangs rgyas pa'i chud pa mi gnyis pa'i the tshom ldog cing gdon mi za bar 'gyur bar de'i khyad par bshad du gsol /
analyzed: gsungs na gang gis sangs rgyas pa'i chud pa mi gnyis pa'i the tshom ldog cing gdon mi za bar 'gyur bar de'i khyad par bshad du gsol /
translated: please explain its distinction, which will undoubtedly remove the doubts of those who are enlightened regarding the all-pervading.

original: sems can thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'o zhes 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs par klag pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'o zhes 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs par klag pa'o //
translated: It is said in the noble Perfection of Wisdom and other scriptures, All sentient beings have the essence of the Tathagata.

original: lha chen pos smra ba ni /
analyzed: lha chen pos smra ba ni /
translated: The teaching of the great god is:

original: ji ltar shing la me yod dang // sa yi nang du chu yod pa //üîΩde ltar thams cad lus rnams su //
analyzed: ji ltar shing la me yod dang // sa yi nang du chu yod pa // de ltar thams cad lus rnams su //
translated: Just as fire exists in wood and water in the earth,üîΩso

original: zhi ba dag pa rnam par gnas //
analyzed: zhi ba dag pa rnam par gnas //
translated: the peaceful and pure abides in all bodies.

original: thams cad 'di ni zhi bdag ste //
analyzed: thams cad 'di ni zhi bdag ste //
translated: All this is peace,

original: zhi ba las ni rab tu 'byung //
analyzed: zhi ba las ni rab tu 'byung //

original: 'byung po kun la zhi ba yod //
analyzed: 'byung po kun la zhi ba yod //
translated: Peace exists for all beings,

original: zhi ba gang yin de nga nyid //
analyzed: zhi ba gang yin de nga nyid //

original: brtan zhing phyin 'gro de bzhin du //
analyzed: brtan zhing phyin 'gro de bzhin du //

original: cung zad gang ni sa la yod //
analyzed: cung zad gang ni sa la yod //

analyzed: de kun mchog gi dbang po yis //

original: bdag nyid khyab ste rab tu gnas //
analyzed: bdag nyid khyab ste rab tu gnas //
translated: and is well established in me.

original: sngags kyi bdag dang sems pa can //
analyzed: sngags kyi bdag dang sems pa can //
translated: The lord of mantras and the sentient being

original: skyes bu rnam pa gnyis zhes bya //
analyzed: skyes bu rnam pa gnyis zhes bya //
translated: are said to be the two kinds of person.üîΩBeyond mantra and mantra itself,

original: sngags las 'das dang sngags nyid dang // dbang phyug mchog la rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: sngags las 'das dang sngags nyid dang // dbang phyug mchog la rnam pa gnyis //
translated: the supreme lord is twofold.

original: gtogs 'dod yang smra ba /
analyzed: gtogs 'dod yang smra ba /
translated: The one who desires to belong,

original: nga yi skye gnas tshangs chen te //
analyzed: nga yi skye gnas tshangs chen te //
translated: my birthplace is the great BrahmƒÅ,

original: der bu 'jog pa nga yin no //
analyzed: der bu 'jog pa nga yin no //
translated: and there I place my son.

original: 'byung po thams cad 'byung ba ni //
analyzed: 'byung po thams cad 'byung ba ni //

analyzed: ba rad de las 'byung bar 'gyur // bdag ni 'byung po kun la gnas //

original: 'byung po kun kyang bdag la ste //
analyzed: 'byung po kun kyang bdag la ste //

original: bdag ldan de ltar sus rig pa //
analyzed: bdag ldan de ltar sus rig pa //

original: kun tu mnyam pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: kun tu mnyam pa mthong ba'o //

analyzed: su zhig nga la kun tu mthong //

analyzed: kun kyang nga las mthong ba yang //

original: de ltar nga la sus shes pa //
analyzed: de ltar nga la sus shes pa //

original: de ni las kyis mi gos te //
analyzed: de ni las kyis mi gos te //

original: zhes bya ba rgya cher ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgya cher ro //

original: tshangs par smra ba po bha ta ha ri la sogs pa yang smra ba /
analyzed: tshangs par smra ba po bha ta ha ri la sogs pa yang smra ba /
translated: The Brahmins who speak of Brahma, such as Bhrgu, say:üîΩBrahma is beginningless, eternal,

original: thog ma med pa'i tshangs pa rtag / yang dag sgra ni yig 'bru gang //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i tshangs pa rtag / yang dag sgra ni yig 'bru gang //
translated: The true sound, the syllable,üîΩFrom whom the real world arises,

original: gang la don dngos 'byung ba dang // 'gro ba'i rab tu byed pa yang //
analyzed: gang la don dngos 'byung ba dang // 'gro ba'i rab tu byed pa yang //

original: gang yongs rtog pa thams cad la //
analyzed: gang yongs rtog pa thams cad la //

analyzed: bar snang yang ni mi gnas te //

analyzed: rtog pa'i lung dang rjes dpag pas //

original: rnam pa du mar kun brtags pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa du mar kun brtags pa'o //

original: thar pa rab tu grol ba'o //
analyzed: thar pa rab tu grol ba'o //

analyzed: grol 'dod rnams kyis bstan par byed //

original: de yis tshor ba gcig po yang //
analyzed: de yis tshor ba gcig po yang //

original: rnam pa mang po rab tu 'byed //
analyzed: rnam pa mang po rab tu 'byed //

analyzed: 'jigs pa 'byung ba'i me ma dag dang // chu yi phung por chu bzhin du //

analyzed: de phyir nga rod rigs gnas pa //

original: rlung las 'byung ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rlung las 'byung ba bzhin du'o //

analyzed: gsum gyi gzugs su de snang ba //

analyzed: mchog gi yongs su 'gyur ba ste //

analyzed: zhi zhing ri bdag tshangs pa ste //

analyzed: de las byung ba'i ma rig pa //

analyzed: des ni srin po bzhin du med //

analyzed: gang smra mi nus rnam dag go //

analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' rnam dag par //

original: tha dad gzugs su snang ba ste //
analyzed: tha dad gzugs su snang ba ste //

analyzed: lha sa rlung dang nam mkha' dang // ri dang chu dang phyogs rnams kyang // nang du byed pa'i yang dag gi //

analyzed: zhes rgya cher ro //

translated: ‚ÄúBhagav

original: rtag pa ni ma yin pas na ri bong gi rva ltar dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa ni ma yin pas na ri bong gi rva ltar dngos po med pa'o //
translated: It is not permanent, and so it is not a real entity, like the horn of a rabbit.

original: khyab pa gcig po sems can thams cad kyi nang na yod pa mi rigs te /
analyzed: khyab pa gcig po sems can thams cad kyi nang na yod pa mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable that the one all-pervading self should exist in all sentient beings,

original: grol ba dang / ma grol ba dang phyug dbul la sogs pa gcig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grol ba dang / ma grol ba dang phyug dbul la sogs pa gcig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: because the error would arise that the liberated and the non-liberated, the rich and the poor, etc., would be the same.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na sems can mang po rnams kyis chud pa mi gnyis pa'i rgyun skad cig pa yin par sangs rgyas pa rnams smra bas na de'i phyir gleng pa 'di mi rung ngo //

translated: Since the Buddhists maintain that the stream of consciousness, which is not a duality in the state of samsara and nirvana, is momentary, this discussion is not appropriate.üîΩAffection and aversion toward self and others,

original: bdag dang gzhan la byams sdang dang // rjod pa brjod pa dgongs pa ni //üîΩrmi lam du ni sems gcig la //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la byams sdang dang // rjod pa brjod pa dgongs pa ni // rmi lam du ni sems gcig la //
translated: and the intention to speak and the spoken words,üîΩare like the forms in a dream,

original: 'gal ba'i gzugs ni bzhin du'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i gzugs ni bzhin du'o //

original: zhes pa rig sngags 'dzin pa'i mthar smra ba po rnams kyis gang smra ba de yang ma rig pas glongs pa la ni rigs kyi mi gnyis pa yang dag pa'i chud pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes pa rig sngags 'dzin pa'i mthar smra ba po rnams kyis gang smra ba de yang ma rig pas glongs pa la ni rigs kyi mi gnyis pa yang dag pa'i chud pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: The proponents of the end of mantra say that this is so, but that is due to the ignorance of those who are not of the two highest lineages.

original: sangs rgyas rnams la ni sems can rnams kyi chud pa mang po ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams la ni sems can rnams kyi chud pa mang po ste /
translated: The buddhas have many ways of teaching sentient beings.

original: phan tshun gyi dbang gis phan par bya ba dang / phan par byed pa'i dngos po'i rgyun 'brel par 'byung ba de dag la kun @111b nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar rnam par gzhag par rigs so //
analyzed: phan tshun gyi dbang gis phan par bya ba dang / phan par byed pa'i dngos po'i rgyun 'brel par 'byung ba de dag la kun @111b nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar rnam par gzhag par rigs so //
translated: It is reasonable to posit that the continuum of the relationship between the object of benefit and the benefactor, which is due to the power of each other, is afflicted or purified.

original: 'khor ba'i tshe na mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pa bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang las skyes pas rtag pa dang / bdag dang bde ba dang / gtsang ba'i dngos por phyin ci log pa rnams gang gi tshe na chos bstan pa'i tshe gzhan gyi dbang dang /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i tshe na mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pa bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang las skyes pas rtag pa dang / bdag dang bde ba dang / gtsang ba'i dngos por phyin ci log pa rnams gang gi tshe na chos bstan pa'i tshe gzhan gyi dbang dang /
translated: When in samsara, the ignorance of non-equipoise arises from the power of one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô continua. It is reasonable that the four errors of permanence, self, bliss, and purity are taught to be the four errors of impermanence, no-self, suffering, and impurity.

original: shes rab kyis dpyad pa na mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pas sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa dang / stong par yongs su shes nas phyin ci log pa'i rnams spangs te /
analyzed: shes rab kyis dpyad pa na mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pas sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa dang / stong par yongs su shes nas phyin ci log pa'i rnams spangs te /
translated: When one examines with wisdom, one understands that the body is impermanent, painful, impure, and empty. One abandons the four errors.

original: mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one understands through wisdom that the body is impermanent, painful, impure, and empty, one abandons the four errors and attains nirvana.

original: de nas bdag med par 'jig par 'gyur ba'i sems can rnams la sems kyi rgyud nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying por ston to //
analyzed: de nas bdag med par 'jig par 'gyur ba'i sems can rnams la sems kyi rgyud nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying por ston to //
translated: Then, for those beings who are frightened by the idea of selflessness, the continuum of mind itself is taught to be the essence of the Tathagata.

original: rtag pa dang / khyab pa dang / gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi dbang po ni sems tsam rang gi mtshan nyid du 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa spyir rjes su song ba dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba /
analyzed: rtag pa dang / khyab pa dang / gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi dbang po ni sems tsam rang gi mtshan nyid du 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa spyir rjes su song ba dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba /
translated: The permanent, the pervasive, and the various forms of the sense faculties are the mind only, which is the nature of samsara and nirvana, endowed with the general characteristics of the luminous nature.

original: rkyen gyi khyad par gyi sa btab pa'i tshogs rnams kyi dri ma dang bcas pa dri ma med par 'byed par thams cad mkhyen pas shes rab dang / thabs la mkhas pas bshad do //
analyzed: rkyen gyi khyad par gyi sa btab pa'i tshogs rnams kyi dri ma dang bcas pa dri ma med par 'byed par thams cad mkhyen pas shes rab dang / thabs la mkhas pas bshad do //
translated: The omniscient one, through wisdom and skillful means, explains that the seeds of the various conditions, with and without stains, are the distinctions of the stainless.

original: blo gros chen po nga'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bstan pa ni mu stegs byed pa'i bdag tu smra ba dang mtshungs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyis chud pa nyid rgyun 'brel par 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po nga'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bstan pa ni mu stegs byed pa'i bdag tu smra ba dang mtshungs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyis chud pa nyid rgyun 'brel par 'byung ba yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, my teaching of the tathƒÅgatagarbha is not the same as the tƒ´rthikas‚Äô doctrine of self.‚Äù This is because the tathƒÅgatagarbha is the cause of the continuity of the stream of sentient beings‚Äô own minds.

original: de bas na mu stegs byed pa'i bdag tu smra ba dang mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mu stegs byed pa'i bdag tu smra ba dang mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the same as the tƒ´rthikas‚Äô doctrine of self.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas de bsgrub par gsungs pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas de bsgrub par gsungs pa /
translated: The omniscient one taught that it is to be accomplished:

original: blo gros chen po de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni stong pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: blo gros chen po de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni stong pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, the tathƒÅgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas teach the tathƒÅgatagarbha to be empty, the perfect limit, nirvƒÅ·πáa, non-arising, signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa la sogs pa'i tshig gi don rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying por bstan par byas na byis pa rnams bdag med pas 'jig par 'gyur ba'i gnas rnam par spong ba'i don du de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i sgo bstan pas rnam par mi
analyzed: smon pa med pa la sogs pa'i tshig gi don rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying por bstan par byas na byis pa rnams bdag med pas 'jig par 'gyur ba'i gnas rnam par spong ba'i don du de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i sgo bstan pas rnam par mi
translated: If the meanings of the terms such as emptiness were taught as the tathiigatagarbha, childish beings would be frightened by selflessness and would reject it.üîΩ

original: rtog pa'i gnas snang ba med pa'i spyod yul ston te zhes @112a * //
analyzed: rtog pa'i gnas snang ba med pa'i spyod yul ston te zhes @112a * //
translated: If the meanings of the words such as ‚Äúsignless‚Äù were taught as the essence of the TathƒÅgata, then the childish would abandon the state of emptiness out of fear of selflessness. For the sake of that, the door of the essence of the TathƒÅgata is taught, in order to show the state of non-conceptuality, the domain free from appearances.

original: bya ba la 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i rnam pas stong pa /
analyzed: bya ba la 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i rnam pas stong pa /
translated: The emptiness of the aspects of apprehender and apprehended,

original: bsam pa med cing don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i sgrar brjod pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa med cing don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i sgrar brjod pa'o //
translated: the absence of thought, and the ultimate truth that is non-dual perfect knowledge are expressed by the term ‚Äúessence of the TathƒÅgata.‚Äù

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' ni don dam pa mi gnyis pa'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' ni don dam pa mi gnyis pa'i chos nyid do //
translated: The limit of reality is the ultimate truth that is the nature of non-duality.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: NirvƒÅ·πáa is because all the appearances of afflictions and conceptuality are completely abandoned.

original: ma skyes pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: ma skyes pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ste /
translated: The unarisen is dependent origination.üîΩSince all phenomena are devoid of activity, they are devoid of relation.

original: chos thams cad la byed pa med pa'i phyir 'brel pa med pa'o zhes pa dang ma zhig pa las 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad la byed pa med pa'i phyir 'brel pa med pa'o zhes pa dang ma zhig pa las 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa ste /
translated: The non-disintegrated does not generate the effect.

original: ji ltar slob dpon klu pos bstod pa las /
analyzed: ji ltar slob dpon klu pos bstod pa las /
translated: As the master Nagarjuna says in the Praise of the Transcendent One:

original: byed pa dgag par smras pa yis //üîΩzhig dang rnam par ma zhig pa'i //
analyzed: byed pa dgag par smras pa yis // zhig dang rnam par ma zhig pa'i //
translated: By refuting activity,

original: sa bon las ni myug 'byung med //
analyzed: sa bon las ni myug 'byung med //
translated: The sprout does not arise from the disintegrated or non-disintegrated seed.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: And so on.

original: ma zhig pa 'ba' zhig gi 'og tu 'bras bu 'byung ste 'di yod na 'di zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: ma zhig pa 'ba' zhig gi 'og tu 'bras bu 'byung ste 'di yod na 'di zhes bya bar ro //
translated: The effect arises only after the non-disintegrated [seed]. If this exists, that comes into being.

original: gang gi tshe na skad cig pa gcig yod pa de'i tshe gnyis po med do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe na skad cig pa gcig yod pa de'i tshe gnyis po med do //
translated: When one moment exists, the second does not exist.

original: gcig po nyid ni byed pa dang / byed pa po gang dang yang 'brel pa med do //
analyzed: gcig po nyid ni byed pa dang / byed pa po gang dang yang 'brel pa med do //
translated: The single moment is not related to any activity or agent.

original: gang zag la bdag med pa'i skad cig pa gcig la skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa'i chos gud na med do //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa'i skad cig pa gcig la skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa'i chos gud na med do //
translated: In the single moment devoid of the self of the person, the phenomena of arising, enduring, and ceasing do not exist separately.

original: chos la bdag med pa la yang gnyis kyi rnam pa rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib la sogs pa snang ba bzhin bas ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa la yang gnyis kyi rnam pa rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib la sogs pa snang ba bzhin bas ma skyes pa'o //
translated: The selflessness of phenomena is also like a dream, an illusion, a magical creation, a mirage, and so on, which appear but are not born.

original: de ltar stong pa dang ma skyes pa'i chos rnams la shes rab kyis dpyad de nang dang phyi rol gyi sbom po dang / phra mo'i mtshan ma rnam par phye ba na tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin par kun mi mthong ba'i tshe na mi gnyis pa'i sems mtshan ma med pa'i bdag nyid kyis gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar stong pa dang ma skyes pa'i chos rnams la shes rab kyis dpyad de nang dang phyi rol gyi sbom po dang / phra mo'i mtshan ma rnam par phye ba na tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin par kun mi mthong ba'i tshe na mi gnyis pa'i sems mtshan ma med pa'i bdag nyid kyis gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, when one examines with wisdom the empty and unborn phenomena, and when one analyzes the internal and external coarse and subtle signs, and does not see them as either different or not different, then the nondual mind abides in the nature of signlessness.

original: smon pa med pa ni de'i tshe sems kyis mi smon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smon pa med pa ni de'i tshe sems kyis mi smon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The absence of expectancy is because at that time the mind does not expect anything.

original: snang ba med pa dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog cing kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dri ma kun dang rnam par bral ba gser lta bu rnam par dag cing rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i sgrar brjod pa ste
analyzed: snang ba med pa dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog cing kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dri ma kun dang rnam par bral ba gser lta bu rnam par dag cing rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i sgrar brjod pa ste
translated: The absence of appearances and the absence of entities are non-conceptual and completely free from all the stains of the afflictions. Like gold, it is pure and naturally luminous. This is called the essence of the TathƒÅgata.

original: / stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgor thams cad mkhyen pa @112b rnams kyis gzud pa'i phyir zhes pa la lan du ma bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: / stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgor thams cad mkhyen pa @112b rnams kyis gzud pa'i phyir zhes pa la lan du ma bshad pa yin no //
translated: Because it is the gateway to liberation through emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, it is taught in many ways by the Omniscient Ones.

original: chos la bdag med pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad rnam par log pa de nyid shes rab dang thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying por bstan pa'am /
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad rnam par log pa de nyid shes rab dang thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying por bstan pa'am /
translated: That very reversal of all the characteristics of the conceptualization of the selflessness of phenomena, endowed with the skill in wisdom and means, is taught as the essence of the TathƒÅgata,

original: bdag med par bstan par yang rung ste /
analyzed: bdag med par bstan par yang rung ste /
translated: or it is suitable to be taught as selflessness.

original: rdza mkhan bzhin du tshig dang yi ge'i rnam grangs rnam pa sna tshogs kyis ston to zhes bya ba'i bsdus pa'i don ni rdza mkhan gyi 'dzim pa'i gong bu la yo byad du ma'i ming du 'dogs pa bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs
analyzed: rdza mkhan bzhin du tshig dang yi ge'i rnam grangs rnam pa sna tshogs kyis ston to zhes bya ba'i bsdus pa'i don ni rdza mkhan gyi 'dzim pa'i gong bu la yo byad du ma'i ming du 'dogs pa bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs
translated: The concise meaning is that just as the potter applies various names to the lump of clay, the omniscient ones apply various terms and words to the tathƒÅgata heart.üîΩ

original: pa'i snying po rnam grangs du mas ston to //
analyzed: pa'i snying po rnam grangs du mas ston to //
translated: Like a potter, he teaches with various enumerations of words and letters. The summarized meaning is that just as a potter gives various names to a lump of clay, the Omniscient Ones teach the Tathagata Essence with many enumerations.

original: stsogs pa'i sgra ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / chos kyi dbyings dang de bzhin nyid la sogs pa'i tshig rnams nye bar brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: stsogs pa'i sgra ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / chos kyi dbyings dang de bzhin nyid la sogs pa'i tshig rnams nye bar brtag par bya'o //
translated: The word etc. should be taken to include the words inconceivable, Dharmadhatu, and tathata.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba yang 'khor ba ni dri ma dang bcas pa'i chud pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba yang 'khor ba ni dri ma dang bcas pa'i chud pa'o //
translated: Naturally luminous means that samsara is defiled water.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na gser gyi 'byung khungs su gser gyi khams btso ba la sogs pa'i cho gas dri ma med par 'gyur ba bzhin du de nyid ma rig pas glongs pa'i nyes pa dri ma thams cad shes rab kyi tshul gyis spangs te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na gser gyi 'byung khungs su gser gyi khams btso ba la sogs pa'i cho gas dri ma med par 'gyur ba bzhin du de nyid ma rig pas glongs pa'i nyes pa dri ma thams cad shes rab kyi tshul gyis spangs te /
translated: Just as gold is purified by the process of smelting the gold ore in a source of gold, and so on, in the same way, the reality of the Tathagata is purified by the process of eliminating all the faults of defilement that are covered by ignorance by means of wisdom.

original: rnam par dag pa'i sangs rgyas nyid 'thob par 'gyur ba de spyir bdag dang tshangs pa dang / dbang po la sogs par sma ba dang khyad par du bdag rtag pa dang / khyad par la sogs par brtag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i sangs rgyas nyid 'thob par 'gyur ba de spyir bdag dang tshangs pa dang / dbang po la sogs par sma ba dang khyad par du bdag rtag pa dang / khyad par la sogs par brtag par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not imagine that the attainment of the pure state of Buddhahood is the self, Brahma, Isvara, and so on, in general, or that it is a permanent self, a particular self, and so on.

original: chud pa'i rgyud de nyid la sems can gzud pa'i phyir rtag pa dang / bdag dang byed pa por smra ba mngon par zhen pa rnams mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa dang / stong pa'i chos de kho na nyid yongs su shes par bya ba dang /
analyzed: chud pa'i rgyud de nyid la sems can gzud pa'i phyir rtag pa dang / bdag dang byed pa por smra ba mngon par zhen pa rnams mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa dang / stong pa'i chos de kho na nyid yongs su shes par bya ba dang /
translated: In order to introduce sentient beings to the continuum of reality, those who are attached to the belief in permanence, self, and an agent should be made to understand the reality of impermanence, selflessness, suffering, ugliness, and emptiness.

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal zad par bya ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba dang / bdag dang gzhan la phan par bya ba dang / byang chub kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / bsod nams dang ye shes mngon par spel bar bya ba'i phyir shes rab dang thabs la mkhas par bstan to //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal zad par bya ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba dang / bdag dang gzhan la phan par bya ba dang / byang chub kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / bsod nams dang ye shes mngon par spel bar bya ba'i phyir shes rab dang thabs la mkhas par bstan to //
translated: In order to exhaust the sufferings of cyclic existence, to attain the pristine wisdom of omniscience, to benefit oneself and others, to perfect the requisites for enlightenment, and to increase merit and pristine wisdom, it is taught that one should be skilled in wisdom and means.

original: rnam par shes pa ma gtogs par tshig gi don gzhan med do zhes @113a * //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ma gtogs par tshig gi don gzhan med do zhes @113a * //
translated: Apart from consciousness, there is no other meaning of the words.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas ston par mdzad pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas ston par mdzad pa /
translated: The Omniscient One taught this.üîΩThe continuum of the person, the aggregates,üîΩLikewise, conditions, atoms,

original: gang zag rgyun dang phung po dang // de bzhin rkyen dang rdul dag dang // gtso bo dpa' ba byed pa por //
analyzed: gang zag rgyun dang phung po dang // de bzhin rkyen dang rdul dag dang // gtso bo dpa' ba byed pa por //
translated: Primordial matter, heroes, and creators

original: sems tsam po la rnam par brtags //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: sems tsam po la rnam par brtags // zhes pa ste /
translated: Are imagined in the mind only.

original: gang zag ni skyes bu dang rig pa po la sogs par sems nyid la ming tha dad par 'dogs so //
analyzed: gang zag ni skyes bu dang rig pa po la sogs par sems nyid la ming tha dad par 'dogs so //
translated: The person is the mind itself, to which different names are given, such as ‚Äúperson,‚Äù ‚Äúknower,‚Äù and so forth.

original: chud pa'i rgyun ma gtogs par yang rtag pa dang / bdag dang / dbang po dang / phyi rol gyi dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chud pa'i rgyun ma gtogs par yang rtag pa dang / bdag dang / dbang po dang / phyi rol gyi dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not permanent, not a self, not a sense-faculty, and not an external object, except for the stream of consciousness.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal du yang dag par tshor bar 'byed pas dbye ba na rtag pa por mi rigs te /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal du yang dag par tshor bar 'byed pas dbye ba na rtag pa por mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable that it is permanent, because it is divided into the experience of pleasure and pain.

original: shing dang thal ba la sogs pa bzhin du rang bzhin gzhan 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shing dang thal ba la sogs pa bzhin du rang bzhin gzhan 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the arising of another nature, like a tree, ashes, etc.

original: blo yang skad cig ba gzhan du mi gnas te grangs can 'dod pa ltar rgyun gyi yul la gcig par lhag par chags par mi rigs te /
analyzed: blo yang skad cig ba gzhan du mi gnas te grangs can 'dod pa ltar rgyun gyi yul la gcig par lhag par chags par mi rigs te /
translated: The mind also does not remain as another moment, as the SƒÅ·πÉkhya believes. It is not reasonable to be attached to the one object of the stream,

original: sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa bzhin du blo rnams tha dad pa'i phyir 'jig rten byung nas 'jig pa'i mthar thug gi bar du blo gcig go zhes grangs can smra ba dang / skyes bu yang grang ba dang dro ba la sogs pa bzhin pas na gcig bar mi rung ba ste tshor ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa bzhin du blo rnams tha dad pa'i phyir 'jig rten byung nas 'jig pa'i mthar thug gi bar du blo gcig go zhes grangs can smra ba dang / skyes bu yang grang ba dang dro ba la sogs pa bzhin pas na gcig bar mi rung ba ste tshor ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the minds are different, like blue, yellow, etc. The SƒÅ·πÉkhya says that the mind is one from the beginning of the world until the end of its destruction. And the person is not reasonable as one, like cold, heat, etc., because of the difference of feeling.

original: phyi'i don yang rnam par shes pa ma gtogs par dngos po yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi'i don yang rnam par shes pa ma gtogs par dngos po yod pa ma yin te /
translated: External objects also do not exist as things apart from consciousness,

original: rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib la sogs pa'i snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib la sogs pa'i snang ba bzhin no //
translated: like the appearances in a dream, a magical creation, or an eye disease.

original: phung po rnams kyi sbom po dang / phra mo rang bzhin rnam par gzhigs pa na khang pa dang nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi sbom po dang / phra mo rang bzhin rnam par gzhigs pa na khang pa dang nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the gross and subtle natures of the aggregates are analyzed, they are empty, like a house or a forest, etc.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag kyang du mar mi rigs pa dang / shes pa yang rnam pa gcig par mi rung ste /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag kyang du mar mi rigs pa dang / shes pa yang rnam pa gcig par mi rung ste /
translated: Moreover, the manifold is not reasonable as subject and object, and consciousness is not reasonable as a single aspect,

original: sna tshogs pa gcig par yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa gcig par yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a single manifold is not tenable.

original: de'i phyir bslad pa'i mthus rnam pa sna tshogs rnams kyi dbang po so sor snang ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bslad pa'i mthus rnam pa sna tshogs rnams kyi dbang po so sor snang ste /
translated: Therefore, by the power of the defilement, the various aspects appear as the individual sense organs.

original: shes rab kyis dben par yongs su shes pa na dri ma med pa mi gnyis par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyis dben par yongs su shes pa na dri ma med pa mi gnyis par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one fully understands them as devoid of wisdom, they become stainless and nondual.

original: rkyen rnams ni gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa la rgyu dang / dmigs pa dang / de ma thag pa dang / dbang gi rkyen du kun brtags pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen rnams ni gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa la rgyu dang / dmigs pa dang / de ma thag pa dang / dbang gi rkyen du kun brtags pa'o //
translated: The conditions are imagined as causes, objects, immediate antecedents, and dominant influences for the cognition that has the aspect of the two.

original: phyi rol gyi don med pa'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag kyang med de cis na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don med pa'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag kyang med de cis na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: Since external objects do not exist, the grasped and grasper do not exist. Why would one grasp them as the entity of cause and effect?

original: bsam pa med cing snang @113b ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa ni bdag la yang rig par bya ba dang / rig pa po'i dngos por mi 'dzin na tha dad par lta ci smos /
analyzed: bsam pa med cing snang @113b ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa ni bdag la yang rig par bya ba dang / rig pa po'i dngos por mi 'dzin na tha dad par lta ci smos /
translated: The ultimate truth, which is the non-dual perfect knowledge that is without thought and appearance, is not grasped as the entity of the object of knowledge and the knower even in regard to itself, let alone as different.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ni med la /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ni med la /
translated: The past and future do not exist.

original: mi snang na ji ltar na rnam par rtog par 'gyur /
analyzed: mi snang na ji ltar na rnam par rtog par 'gyur /
translated: If they do not appear, how could they be conceptualized?

original: snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod pas 'di yod par 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig go zhes snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi dbang po rnams ston te /
analyzed: snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod pas 'di yod par 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig go zhes snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi dbang po rnams ston te /
translated: The masters of yoga who abide in samƒÅdhi with appearance teach that this alone exists because this exists after the previous one.

original: der yang gang gi tshe na skad cig ma snga ma yod pa de'i tshe na skad cig ma phyi ma med de 'brel pa med pas na su'i rgyu yin ji ltar byed pa dbu ma las bkag pa /
analyzed: der yang gang gi tshe na skad cig ma snga ma yod pa de'i tshe na skad cig ma phyi ma med de 'brel pa med pas na su'i rgyu yin ji ltar byed pa dbu ma las bkag pa /
translated: Moreover, when the former moment exists, the latter moment does not exist. Since they are not related, how could the former moment be the cause of the latter?üîΩThe Centrists have refuted this in the following way:

original: yod dang med pa'i don la ni //
analyzed: yod dang med pa'i don la ni //
translated: In the case of an existent or a nonexistent object,

original: rkyen rnams yod par mi rung ste //
analyzed: rkyen rnams yod par mi rung ste //
translated: conditions are not tenable.

original: med na rkyen ni su yi yin //
analyzed: med na rkyen ni su yi yin //
translated: If they are nonexistent, whose conditions are they?

original: yod na rkyen gyis ci zhig bya //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: yod na rkyen gyis ci zhig bya // zhes pa ste /
translated: If they are existent, what do the conditions do?üîΩImmediately after that, the Centrists have said:

original: de'i 'og tsam gyi 'di yod na 'di yod ces bya ba 'ba' zhig ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tsam gyi 'di yod na 'di yod ces bya ba 'ba' zhig ste /
translated: If this exists, that comes to be.

original: gzhan gyi khyad par med kyang rkyen 'ga' zhig las rang bzhin nges pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi khyad par med kyang rkyen 'ga' zhig las rang bzhin nges pa'o //
translated: Although there is no other distinction, the nature is ascertained from some conditions.

original: phyi rol dang nang gi 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba med pas na phyi rol gyi don med de ji ltar 'di nyid du bsgrub par mdzad pa /
analyzed: phyi rol dang nang gi 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba med pas na phyi rol gyi don med de ji ltar 'di nyid du bsgrub par mdzad pa /
translated: Since there is no external or internal grasping and no object of grasping, external objects do not exist. How is this established?

original: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
analyzed: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
translated: Form is analyzed into atoms.

original: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
analyzed: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
translated: The atom is without parts.

original: zhes pa'o // des na tshon gyis btsos pa dang / ma btsos pa dang / sgul ba dang / ma sgul ba dang / bsgribs pa dang / ma bsgribs pa la sogs pas dbye ba na yan lag gi rdzas med par ma zad kyi rdul phra mo yang med do //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // des na tshon gyis btsos pa dang / ma btsos pa dang / sgul ba dang / ma sgul ba dang / bsgribs pa dang / ma bsgribs pa la sogs pas dbye ba na yan lag gi rdzas med par ma zad kyi rdul phra mo yang med do //
translated: Therefore, when one distinguishes the atoms by way of the color, whether cooked or uncooked, whether moved or unmoved, whether covered or uncovered, etc., not only is there no substance of the parts, but there is no subtle atom either.

original: gang dag yang phyogs tha dad par phye ba na khang ba dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang dag yang phyogs tha dad par phye ba na khang ba dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong pa nyid do //
translated: And when one distinguishes them by way of the different directions, they are empty like a house, an army, a forest, etc.

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / gti mug gi bdag nyid du gtso bo la yon tan gsum du su dag kun tu rtog pa de la yang dag par rig pa'i rang bzhin bar yongs su bsal ba nyid do //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / gti mug gi bdag nyid du gtso bo la yon tan gsum du su dag kun tu rtog pa de la yang dag par rig pa'i rang bzhin bar yongs su bsal ba nyid do //
translated: And for those who imagine the three qualities of goodness, passion, and darkness in the primal substance, which has the nature of pleasure, pain, and delusion, there is the refutation of the nature of the three valid cognitions.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i sim pa dang yongs su gdung ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin bas na bar ti ka la rtsod pa rgya cher te /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i sim pa dang yongs su gdung ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin bas na bar ti ka la rtsod pa rgya cher te /
translated: And there is the extensive discussion of the barti, because of the nature of the pleasure, pain, etc., of the satisfaction, frustration, etc.

original: des na khams gsum pa sems tsam mo //
analyzed: des na khams gsum pa sems tsam mo //
translated: Therefore, the three realms are mind only.

original: dbang po yang chud pa'i rang bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: dbang po yang chud pa'i rang bzhin nyid de /
translated: The sense faculties are also of the nature of being consumed.

original: byed pa po dang / las dang / byed pa la sogs pa yongs su shes pa'i khyad par ni chud pa'i @114a * //üîΩbdag nyid kyi yin no //üîΩdbang po yang yul gyi rnam pa sna tshogs su yang dag par rig par 'byed pas phye ba na ji ltar na rtag pa yin /
analyzed: byed pa po dang / las dang / byed pa la sogs pa yongs su shes pa'i khyad par ni chud pa'i @114a * // bdag nyid kyi yin no // dbang po yang yul gyi rnam pa sna tshogs su yang dag par rig par 'byed pas phye ba na ji ltar na rtag pa yin /
translated: The difference in the complete understanding of the agent, action, instrument, etc. is due to the difference in the nature of being consumed.üîΩThe sense faculties are also distinguished by the differentiation of the correct knowledge of the various aspects of the object.

original: shing dang thal ba la sogs pa bzhin du rim gyi khyad par gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: shing dang thal ba la sogs pa bzhin du rim gyi khyad par gyi phyir ro //
translated: How can they be permanent, like a piece of wood, ashes, etc.?

original: gal te 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig na ni gzhan la gnod pa ji ltar byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig na ni gzhan la gnod pa ji ltar byed par 'gyur /
translated: If he is free from attachment, how can he harm others?

original: 'on te 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin na ni bdag nyid nor pa'i shes pas gti mug gis rnyog ste /
analyzed: 'on te 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin na ni bdag nyid nor pa'i shes pas gti mug gis rnyog ste /
translated: But if he is not free from attachment, he is confused by the knowledge of his own error.

original: bdag nyid la phan par mi nus na gzhan la phan par cis na byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag nyid la phan par mi nus na gzhan la phan par cis na byed par 'gyur /
translated: If he is unable to benefit himself, how can he benefit others?

original: gang yang dbyibs kyi khyad par yod pa thams cad ji lta ba bzhin gyi dbyibs byed pa pos sngar byas pa'i rnam pa ji lta bur bzung ba de lta bur gling gi bar gyi sgang dang / 'brog dang shing la sogs pa de dag thams cad ni blo can gyi skyes bus sngar byas par mi bzung ste /
analyzed: gang yang dbyibs kyi khyad par yod pa thams cad ji lta ba bzhin gyi dbyibs byed pa pos sngar byas pa'i rnam pa ji lta bur bzung ba de lta bur gling gi bar gyi sgang dang / 'brog dang shing la sogs pa de dag thams cad ni blo can gyi skyes bus sngar byas par mi bzung ste /
translated: Moreover, all things that have the distinction of shape are apprehended in accordance with the shape that the creator has previously made. In that way, all of those mountains, islands, plains, forests, trees, and so on are not apprehended as previously created by an intelligent person.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa de lta bu'i 'bras bu las rnam pa de lta bu'i rgyu la rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa de lta bu'i 'bras bu las rnam pa de lta bu'i rgyu la rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: Therefore, from an effect that has that kind of aspect, a cause that has that kind of aspect is inferred.

original: lha khang la sogs pa'i 'bras bu las thig btab pa la sogs pa rjes su dpag pa bzhin pa 'brel pa bzung nas rnam pa de lta bu la ni chud par bya ba dang / chud par byed pa'i dngos por rung ngo //
analyzed: lha khang la sogs pa'i 'bras bu las thig btab pa la sogs pa rjes su dpag pa bzhin pa 'brel pa bzung nas rnam pa de lta bu la ni chud par bya ba dang / chud par byed pa'i dngos por rung ngo //
translated: Having grasped the relation, like inferring the layout and so on from the effect, a temple and so on, it is suitable for that kind of aspect to be the thing that is contained and the container.

original: de la ci tsam khyad bar med pa nyid las khyad par du rjes su dpag par bya ba ni gnam 'phang du bkar ba la sogs pa tsam gyis tshub ma dang na bun la sogs par gtogs pa'i chos 'dra ba tsam gyis mer rjes su dpag pa ltaüîΩbu ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la ci tsam khyad bar med pa nyid las khyad par du rjes su dpag par bya ba ni gnam 'phang du bkar ba la sogs pa tsam gyis tshub ma dang na bun la sogs par gtogs pa'i chos 'dra ba tsam gyis mer rjes su dpag pa lta bu ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not logical to infer fire from mere similarity to smoke and mist, which are included among the phenomena that are high in the sky and so on.

original: de bzhin du lus dang / byed pa dang / gnas kyi gzhi blo can khyad par gyi skyes bus sngar byas par mi 'dzin pas na ji ltar na de las dbang por rjes su dpag tu rung /
analyzed: de bzhin du lus dang / byed pa dang / gnas kyi gzhi blo can khyad par gyi skyes bus sngar byas par mi 'dzin pas na ji ltar na de las dbang por rjes su dpag tu rung /
translated: Similarly, since the intelligent one who is the basis of the body, action, and abode is not apprehended as a special person who was created before, how could it be possible to infer a self from that?

original: mi gnyis pa'i phyogs kyi dbang po yang rtag pa dang / gcig pa dang khyab pa'i dngos pos dngos po thams cad de'i rang bzhin pa yin te /
analyzed: mi gnyis pa'i phyogs kyi dbang po yang rtag pa dang / gcig pa dang khyab pa'i dngos pos dngos po thams cad de'i rang bzhin pa yin te /
translated: Also, the self of the non-Buddhists is permanent, singular, and pervasive, and all things are of its nature.

original: zhi ba pa smra ba lta bur dbang po'i rang bzhin pa'i dngos po rnam pa la tha dad pa med par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: zhi ba pa smra ba lta bur dbang po'i rang bzhin pa'i dngos po rnam pa la tha dad pa med par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: Like the proponents of peace, things that are of the nature of the self would not be different in type.üîΩThe self is not the body,

original: brtan dang 'gro can de bzhin du //
analyzed: brtan dang 'gro can de bzhin du //
translated: nor is it the nature of the mind.

original: sa la yod pa cung zad gang //
analyzed: sa la yod pa cung zad gang //
translated: Whatever little exists on the earth

original: thams cad de ni dbang mchog ste //
analyzed: thams cad de ni dbang mchog ste //
translated: is all of the highest power

original: bdag nyid khyab nas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid khyab nas gnas pa'o //
translated: pervading and abiding in oneself.

original: zhes pa de'i tshe dbang po ma yin par su yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes pa de'i tshe dbang po ma yin par su yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, no one would be without a sense organ.

original: grol ba dang / ma grol ba dang / phyug pa dang / dbul ba la sogs pa rnams kyi khyad @114b par dmigs su med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: grol ba dang / ma grol ba dang / phyug pa dang / dbul ba la sogs pa rnams kyi khyad @114b par dmigs su med par 'gyur la /
translated: The distinctions of the liberated and the unliberated, the rich and the poor, and so on, would not be observed,

original: thams cad kyang zhi ba'i rang bzhin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: thams cad kyang zhi ba'i rang bzhin par 'gyur te /
translated: and all would be of the nature of peace.

original: de ni rtog pa'i rgyan du tshangs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rtog pa'i rgyan du tshangs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is the ornament of thought of Brahma and so on.

original: rtsod pa zhib mor 'dir sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa zhib mor 'dir sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in detail to the debate.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa le'u gnyis pa ye shes dpal bzang pos bshad pa sbyar ba las gsol ba'i lan dang / kun gzhi dang / stong pa nyid rtsod pa'i gnas kyi 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i dpyad pa bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa le'u gnyis pa ye shes dpal bzang pos bshad pa sbyar ba las gsol ba'i lan dang / kun gzhi dang / stong pa nyid rtsod pa'i gnas kyi 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i dpyad pa bzhi pa'o /
translated: In the second chapter of the noble Descent into La·πÖkƒÅ, in the commentary composed by J√±ƒÅna≈õrƒ´bhadra, after the reply to the question and the debate on the foundation consciousness and emptiness, this is the fourth analysis of the tathƒÅgatagarbha.

original: // / de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos ma 'ongs pa'i skye bo'i tshogs la bltas nas /
analyzed: // / de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos ma 'ongs pa'i skye bo'i tshogs la bltas nas /
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva MahƒÅmati, looking at the assembly of future generations,

original: yang bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba btab pa /
analyzed: yang bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba btab pa /
translated: again requested the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, how is one called a bodhisattva? and so on.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas kyang bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas kyang bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Omniscient One replied:

original: rgyu bzhis na rnal 'byor chen po'i rnal 'byor can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu bzhis na rnal 'byor chen po'i rnal 'byor can du 'gyur ro //
translated: By four causes, one becomes a practitioner of the great yoga.

original: 'di lta ste rang gi sems snang ba rnam par bsgom pa dang zhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste rang gi sems snang ba rnam par bsgom pa dang zhes pa ste /
translated: Namely, by cultivating the appearances of one's own mind,

original: rang gi sems ma gtogs par phyi rol gyi rnam pa dmigs su med pa ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib la sogs pa'i snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rang gi sems ma gtogs par phyi rol gyi rnam pa dmigs su med pa ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib la sogs pa'i snang ba bzhin no //
translated: except for one's own mind, external aspects are not observed, like the appearances of dreams, illusions, and floaters, and so on.

original: skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa'i lta ba rnam par spong ba ni skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams skad cig pa la med do //
analyzed: skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa'i lta ba rnam par spong ba ni skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams skad cig pa la med do //
translated: Abandoning the views of arising, abiding, and destruction, arising, abiding, and destruction, and so on, do not exist in the momentary.

original: gang gi tshe na skad cig pa gcig yod pa de'i tshe na skad cig pa gcig gnyis po med do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe na skad cig pa gcig yod pa de'i tshe na skad cig pa gcig gnyis po med do //
translated: When one moment exists, then two moments do not exist.

original: snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod na 'di yod do zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig gi byed pa dang byed pa po dang mngon par 'brel te /
analyzed: snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod na 'di yod do zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig gi byed pa dang byed pa po dang mngon par 'brel te /
translated: Only the activity of the agent is connected with the activity, as in ‚ÄúWhen this exists, that exists.‚Äù

original: skye ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skye ba ni ma yin te /
translated: But arising is not so.

original: byed pa po dang / las dang / byed pa mngon par 'brel pa rnams ni rgyun la btags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: byed pa po dang / las dang / byed pa mngon par 'brel pa rnams ni rgyun la btags pa yin gyi /
translated: The connection of the agent, action, and activity is imputed to a continuum,

original: skad cig pa gcig la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig pa gcig la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not to a single moment.

original: de ltar skad cig par 'jig ba de ni chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa la spyir bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar skad cig par 'jig ba de ni chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa la spyir bshad pa'o //
translated: Thus, the destruction of the momentary is a general explanation of the selflessness of persons and of phenomena.

original: chos la bdag med pa'i khyad par ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib la sogs par snang ba bzhin du don dam par gnyis kyi rnam pa thams cad skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa'i khyad par ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib la sogs par snang ba bzhin du don dam par gnyis kyi rnam pa thams cad skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: The particular selflessness of phenomena is that, like appearances in a dream, an illusion, or with an eye disease, ultimately all aspects of duality are free from arising, enduring, and ceasing.

original: ji ltar dbu ma las 'byung ba //
analyzed: ji ltar dbu ma las 'byung ba //
translated: As it is said in the Madhyamaka:

original: rang bzhin med pa'i @115a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i @115a * //
translated: Without intrinsic reality,

original: dngos po rnams //
analyzed: dngos po rnams //
translated: Things do not exist

original: gang phyir yod pa ma yin pas //
analyzed: gang phyir yod pa ma yin pas //
translated: Because they do not exist.

original: 'di yod pas na 'di yod ces //
analyzed: 'di yod pas na 'di yod ces //
translated: ‚Äú Because this exists, that exists‚Äù

original: 'di ni 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not tenable.

original: zhes pa gzhan gyi dbang gi dbang du byas nas slob dpon klu bos kyis bsams pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa gzhan gyi dbang gi dbang du byas nas slob dpon klu bos kyis bsams pa ste /
translated: This is the thought of Master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna, who composed the Treatise on the Middle Way from the perspective of the dependent nature.

original: ji ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
analyzed: ji ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
translated: As the S≈´tra Unraveling the Intention says:

original: rang bzhin med pa rnam pa gsum //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa rnam pa gsum //
translated: The three types of naturelessness

original: zhes pa'o // de der gzhan gyi dbang gis gnyis kyi rnam pa sna tshogs pas na skye ba'i rang bzhin med pa na khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de der gzhan gyi dbang gis gnyis kyi rnam pa sna tshogs pas na skye ba'i rang bzhin med pa na khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: The dependent nature is natureless in terms of production, because it arises in the aspect of the duality of a perceived object and a perceiving subject, like a reflection.

original: grub pa las sna tshogs pas gnod pa med do //
analyzed: grub pa las sna tshogs pas gnod pa med do //
translated: It is not natureless in terms of the ultimate, because it is the basis of the ultimate.

original: gal te bskyed pa 'dus byas nas //
analyzed: gal te bskyed pa 'dus byas nas //
translated: If production is conditioned,

original: mtshan nyid gsum ldan der rig ste //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum ldan der rig ste //
translated: It is known to have the three characteristics.

original: 'on te bskyed pa 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: 'on te bskyed pa 'dus ma byas //
translated: But if production is unconditioned,

original: 'dus byas mtshan nyid ji ltar rung //
analyzed: 'dus byas mtshan nyid ji ltar rung //
translated: How could it have the characteristics of a conditioned phenomenon?

original: skye ba skye ba ji lta bur //
analyzed: skye ba skye ba ji lta bur //
translated: How could production produce itself?

original: bdag nyid gzhan gyis ma yin pa //
analyzed: bdag nyid gzhan gyis ma yin pa //
translated: It is not produced by another.

original: 'gog pa la ni 'gog pa yang //
analyzed: 'gog pa la ni 'gog pa yang //
translated: Cessation is also like that.

original: bdag nyid gzhan gyis ma yin par //
analyzed: bdag nyid gzhan gyis ma yin par //
translated: I am not another.üîΩ

original: gal te skye ba sngar yod la //üîΩrga ba 'chi ba 'phyis na ni //
analyzed: gal te skye ba sngar yod la // rga ba 'chi ba 'phyis na ni //
translated: If birth were not produced by another,

original: skye la rga ba 'chi ba med //
analyzed: skye la rga ba 'chi ba med //
translated: and aging and death were not produced by birth,üîΩthen birth would be without aging and death.

original: skyes kyang 'chi bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes kyang 'chi bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And even though born, one would not die.

original: rga ba 'chi bar mi 'gyur ba'i //
analyzed: rga ba 'chi bar mi 'gyur ba'i //
translated: And aging and death would be without birth.üîΩAnd all things would be produced

original: thams cad chos la thams cad du //
analyzed: thams cad chos la thams cad du //
translated: from all things, everywhere.

original: spro bar byed pa skye ba ci //
analyzed: spro bar byed pa skye ba ci //
translated: What is the use of the production of birth?

original: de la rga ba 'chi ba'am ci //
analyzed: de la rga ba 'chi ba'am ci //
translated: What is the use of aging and death?üîΩThe investigation of external things and non-things is as follows:

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po dang dngos po med par rtog pa ni phyi rol gyi sbom po dang / phra mo kun ji ltar rtog par byed pa de ltar /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po dang dngos po med par rtog pa ni phyi rol gyi sbom po dang / phra mo kun ji ltar rtog par byed pa de ltar /
translated: Just as gross external things and subtle things are imagined,

original: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
analyzed: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
translated: so also form is imagined

original: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
analyzed: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
translated: when the atom is divided, the atom is without parts.

original: zhes bya bar dngos po rnam par phye ba na sde dang nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du rtogs so //
analyzed: zhes bya bar dngos po rnam par phye ba na sde dang nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du rtogs so //
translated: When a thing is analyzed in this way, it is understood to be like an army, like a forest, and so on.

original: 'phags pa so so rang gi ye shes khong du chud pa tha dad pa med pa'i mtshan nyid de gang gi tshe na shes par bya ba sbom po dang / phra mo shes rab kyis mi dmigs pa de'i tshe na bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig pa ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi rnal 'byor du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa so so rang gi ye shes khong du chud pa tha dad pa med pa'i mtshan nyid de gang gi tshe na shes par bya ba sbom po dang / phra mo shes rab kyis mi dmigs pa de'i tshe na bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig pa ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi rnal 'byor du 'gyur ro //
translated: The noble one‚Äôs own wisdom is the characteristic of non-difference. When the coarse and subtle objects of knowledge are not observed by wisdom, at that time, without thought and without appearance, the correct knowledge of ultimate truth is the yoga of yogins.

original: ji ltar dbu ma las spros pa med cing mi gnyis pa'i mtshan nyid du bshad pa na /
analyzed: ji ltar dbu ma las spros pa med cing mi gnyis pa'i mtshan nyid du bshad pa na /
translated: As it is explained in the Madhyamaka, when the characteristic of non-duality free from conceptual elaborations is taught,

original: rnam rtog med cing snang ba med //
analyzed: rnam rtog med cing snang ba med //
translated: without conceptualization and without appearance,

original: spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa //üîΩ'di ni 'jig rten mgon po yis //
analyzed: spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa // 'di ni 'jig rten mgon po yis //
translated: not elaborated by conceptual elaborations,üîΩthis is the nectar-like teaching of the Lord of the World,

original: sangs rgyas bstan pa bdud rtsi yi //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bstan pa bdud rtsi yi //
translated: the Buddha,

original: mi gnyis pa yi chud pa nyid //
analyzed: mi gnyis pa yi chud pa nyid //
translated: the non-dual truth.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa dang snang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa dang snang ba med pa'o //
translated: It is non-conceptuality and non-appearance.

original: de ni rtag pa @115b dang gzhan dbang mo gsham gyi bu lta bur grub pa'i ye shes med do zhes bha byas gleng du med do //
analyzed: de ni rtag pa @115b dang gzhan dbang mo gsham gyi bu lta bur grub pa'i ye shes med do zhes bha byas gleng du med do //
translated: It is not a permanent or independent wisdom, like the son of a barren woman.

original: yang dag par rig pa tsam so sor rang gis rig pa dang rig par byed pa'i dngos por bstan du med pa snang ba dang bral ba /
analyzed: yang dag par rig pa tsam so sor rang gis rig pa dang rig par byed pa'i dngos por bstan du med pa snang ba dang bral ba /
translated: It is not taught to be an object of awareness or something that can be known, free from appearances,

original: dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pa'i sems don dam pa'i bden par bdag nyid la'ang mi rgyu na yi ge dang sgras brjod pa lta ci smos te /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pa'i sems don dam pa'i bden par bdag nyid la'ang mi rgyu na yi ge dang sgras brjod pa lta ci smos te /
translated: and nonconceptual with regard to things and nonthings. If the ultimate truth does not even operate for oneself, what need is there to mention that it cannot be expressed by letters and words?

original: tha dad pa med pa'i 'phags pa'i ye shes mngon par rtogs pas na de las gzhan pa nges par 'jug pa'i dbang po shes pa dang / dbugs rngub pa myong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa'i 'phags pa'i ye shes mngon par rtogs pas na de las gzhan pa nges par 'jug pa'i dbang po shes pa dang / dbugs rngub pa myong ba bzhin no //
translated: Since it is realized as the nondifferent wisdom of the noble ones, it is like the knowledge of the sense organ that definitely engages its object, or the experience of inhalation.

original: yang dag par rig pa tsam ni 'di'o zhes yod pa dang med pa smrar med de /
analyzed: yang dag par rig pa tsam ni 'di'o zhes yod pa dang med pa smrar med de /
translated: Since it is mere correct knowledge, it cannot be said to exist or not exist.

original: thog ma dang tha mar stong pa dang / dbus su yang rang bzhin gnyis kyis stong ste /
analyzed: thog ma dang tha mar stong pa dang / dbus su yang rang bzhin gnyis kyis stong ste /
translated: It is empty in the beginning and end, and also in the middle, by way of the two kinds of emptiness.

original: skad cig ma'i rgyun tha dad pa yin yang /
analyzed: skad cig ma'i rgyun tha dad pa yin yang /
translated: Although the continuum of moments is different,üîΩthe noble ones know it to be nondual, as a single moment.

original: skad cig ma gcig tha mi dad pa 'phags pa rnams kyis gnyis su med par yang dag par rig pa'o zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig tha mi dad pa 'phags pa rnams kyis gnyis su med par yang dag par rig pa'o zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the intention of the Omniscient One.

original: de ni bstan pa'i tshig bsdu ba'i don du bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de ni bstan pa'i tshig bsdu ba'i don du bshad pa ste /
translated: This is explained for the purpose of summarizing the words of the teaching.

original: rgya cher ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis ston par mdzad pas na der bshad du med do //
analyzed: rgya cher ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis ston par mdzad pas na der bshad du med do //
translated: But since the Omniscient One teaches it extensively, it cannot be explained here.
