original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la phyi nang gi dpe ni snang ba ji bzhin par thams cad mkhyen pas sems can rnams la khong du chud par mdzad pa'i don du yin gyi bum pa dang
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la phyi nang gi dpe ni snang ba ji bzhin par thams cad mkhyen pas sems can rnams la khong du chud par mdzad pa'i don du yin gyi bum pa dang
translated: The characteristics of the cause of dependent origination are twofold, and so on. The outer and inner examples are for the purpose of the Omniscient One's understanding of sentient beings just as they appear, in order to make them understand. The potüîΩand cloth are not the cause of the eye consciousness, but they are the cause of the eye consciousness that is the object of the term pot and the object of the term cloth.

original: / snam bu la sogs pa phyi rol gyi rdul dang / rgyu spun gyis bskyed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: / snam bu la sogs pa phyi rol gyi rdul dang / rgyu spun gyis bskyed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not produced from external particles, such as threads, or from causes such as a stick.

original: ma rig pa dang sred pa dang / las las gzugs la sogs pa'i phung por snang ba skyes pa ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang sred pa dang / las las gzugs la sogs pa'i phung por snang ba skyes pa ste /
translated: The appearance of the aggregates of form, etc., is produced from ignorance, craving, and karma.

original: don dam par ni rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du ma skyes pa nyid de /
analyzed: don dam par ni rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du ma skyes pa nyid de /
translated: But ultimately, like dreams, etc., it is not produced at all.

original: thog ma med pa'i nyes pa'i bag chags kyis bslad pa yongs su smin pa'i mthu las sna tshogs kyi rnam pa phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i khyad par rnams so sor snang ba 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i nyes pa'i bag chags kyis bslad pa yongs su smin pa'i mthu las sna tshogs kyi rnam pa phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i khyad par rnams so sor snang ba 'ba' zhig go //
translated: It is only the various aspects of the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and dependent origination that appear due to the ripening of the power of the contamination by beginningless faults and habitual tendencies.üîΩRegarding that, the analysis of causes is taught by the Omniscient One like the appearance of distinctions.

original: de la rgyur 'byed pa ni thams cad mkhyen pas snang ba'i khyad par bzhin du ston par mdzad pa blo gros chen po de la rgyu ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: de la rgyur 'byed pa ni thams cad mkhyen pas snang ba'i khyad par bzhin du ston par mdzad pa blo gros chen po de la rgyu ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: MahƒÅmati, there are six types of causes:

original: 'di ltar 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang / 'brel @116a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang / 'brel @116a * //
translated: the cause of what is to come, the cause of connection,

original: pa'i rgyu dang / mtshan nyid kyi rgyu dang / byed pa'i rgyu dang / snang ba med pa'i rgyu dang / ltos pa'i rgyu dang drug go //
analyzed: pa'i rgyu dang / mtshan nyid kyi rgyu dang / byed pa'i rgyu dang / snang ba med pa'i rgyu dang / ltos pa'i rgyu dang drug go //
translated: the cause of arising, the cause of characteristics, the cause of function, the cause of non-appearance, and the cause of dependence.üîΩThe cause of the arising of the great mind is the cause of the omniscient one's discernment and teaching. The cause of the arising of the great mind is the cause of the omniscient one's discernment and teaching.üîΩThe cause of the arising of the great mind is the cause of the omniscient one's discernment and teaching. The cause of the arising of the great mind is the cause of the omniscient one's discernment and teaching.üîΩThe cause of the arising of the great mind is the cause of the omniscient one's discernment and teaching. The cause of the arising of the great mind is the cause of the omniscient one's discernment and teaching.

original: de la thams cad mkhyen pas rnam par phye ste ston pa de la blo gros chen po 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu ni phyi nang gi chos rnams skye ba'i phyir rgyu'i bya ba byed do zhes thams cad mkhyen pas der ci yang dgongs pa de rjes su dpagüîΩpar bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi rnam pa sna tshogs pa ni las las 'byung bas na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de la thams cad mkhyen pas rnam par phye ste ston pa de la blo gros chen po 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu ni phyi nang gi chos rnams skye ba'i phyir rgyu'i bya ba byed do zhes thams cad mkhyen pas der ci yang dgongs pa de rjes su dpag par bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi rnam pa sna tshogs pa ni las las 'byung bas na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The cause of the arising of the great mind is the cause of the omniscient one's discernment and teaching. The cause of the arising of the great mind is the cause of the omniscient one's discernment and teaching.üîΩThe cause of the arising of the great mind is the cause of the omniscient one's discernment and teaching. The cause of the arising of the great mind is the cause of the omniscient one's discernment and teaching.üîΩThe cause of the arising of the great mind is the cause of the omniscient one's discernment and teaching. The cause of the arising of the great mind is the cause of the omniscient one's discernment and teaching.üîΩThe cause of the arising of the great mind is the cause of the omniscient one's discernment and teaching. The cause of the arising of the great mind is the cause of the omniscient one's discernment and teaching.üîΩThe cause of the arising of the great mind is the cause of the omniscient one's discernment and teaching. The cause of the arising of the great mind is the cause of the omniscient one's discernment and teaching.üîΩThe cause of the arising of the great mind is the cause of the omniscient one's discernment and teaching. The cause of the arising of the great mind is the cause of the omniscient one's discernment and teaching.

original: lus dang 'jig rten rnam pa sna tshogs nang dang phyi'i sbom po dang / phra ba snang ba la dgongs na ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid tshad ma'o //
analyzed: lus dang 'jig rten rnam pa sna tshogs nang dang phyi'i sbom po dang / phra ba snang ba la dgongs na ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid tshad ma'o //
translated: The cause of the arising of the great mind is the cause of the omniscient one's discernment and teaching. The cause of the arising of the great mind is the cause of the omniscient one's discernment and teaching.üîΩThe cause

original: blo gros chen po 'brel pa'i rgyu ni phyi nang gi phung po dang sa bon la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir dmigs pa'i bya ba byed do zhes pa gzugs la sogs pa snang ba ni dmigs pas na dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po 'brel pa'i rgyu ni phyi nang gi phung po dang sa bon la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir dmigs pa'i bya ba byed do zhes pa gzugs la sogs pa snang ba ni dmigs pas na dmigs pa ste /
translated: The appearance of form, etc., is the objective, because it appears.

original: snang ba nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa'o //
translated: The appearance itself is the causal entity, as intended by the Lord.üîΩThe causal condition of characteristics, Mahamati, is the production of the characteristics in relation to the immediately preceding.üîΩThe characteristic of the activity of the immediately preceding is that which, in relation to the characteristics, is to be investigated by what.

original: blo gros chen po mtshan nyid kyi rgyu ni de ma thag tu byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang 'brel par bskyed do zhes pa de ma thag tu byed pa'i las kyi mtshan nyid gang 'brel nas mtshan nyid gang gis gang la brtag par bya ba de mtshan nyid kyi
analyzed: blo gros chen po mtshan nyid kyi rgyu ni de ma thag tu byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang 'brel par bskyed do zhes pa de ma thag tu byed pa'i las kyi mtshan nyid gang 'brel nas mtshan nyid gang gis gang la brtag par bya ba de mtshan nyid kyi
translated: That is the causal condition of characteristics.

original: rgyu'o // ji ltar lung ston pa'i gtsug lag las byed pa po rang dbang ngo zhes kun tu rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'o // ji ltar lung ston pa'i gtsug lag las byed pa po rang dbang ngo zhes kun tu rtog pa'o //
translated: As in the scriptures of the Vaibhasikas, the notion of an independent agent is imagined.

original: blo gros chen po byed pa'i rgyu ni dbang por gtogs pa'i bya ba byed do //
analyzed: blo gros chen po byed pa'i rgyu ni dbang por gtogs pa'i bya ba byed do //
translated: The causal condition of activity, Mahamati, is the activity of the sense faculties.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po bzhin no zhes pa de ni sbyor ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po bzhin no zhes pa de ni sbyor ba'i rgyu ste /
translated: Like a universal monarch.

original: ji ltar lhas byin gyis mchod sbyin bum pa byed du bzung ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar lhas byin gyis mchod sbyin bum pa byed du bzung ba'o //
translated: This is the causal condition, just as Devadatta is the instigator of Yajnadatta.üîΩLike a universal monarch.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po bzhin zhes pa ni ji ltar 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal pos rgyal po gzhan dag byed par gzung ba de ltar gtso bo'i rgyu de dbang du byed pa'i rgyur brtag go //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po bzhin zhes pa ni ji ltar 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal pos rgyal po gzhan dag byed par gzung ba de ltar gtso bo'i rgyu de dbang du byed pa'i rgyur brtag go //
translated: Just as a universal monarch is the instigator of other kings, so the primary cause is considered the dominant condition.

original: khyad par du brtag pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid tshad ma'o //
analyzed: khyad par du brtag pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid tshad ma'o //
translated: The specific investigation is the valid knowledge of omniscience.

original: blo gros chen po snang bar byed pa'i rgyu ni rnam par rtog pa'i dngos po skyes pa'i mtshan nyid snang ba'i bya ba byed de gzugs la sogs pa la mar me bzhin no zhes pa ji ltar mar me bum pa dang / snam bu la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i dngos po rnams kyis snang bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pa de ltar sngar skyes pa'i khyad par snang ba ni snang ba @116b byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen po snang bar byed pa'i rgyu ni rnam par rtog pa'i dngos po skyes pa'i mtshan nyid snang ba'i bya ba byed de gzugs la sogs pa la mar me bzhin no zhes pa ji ltar mar me bum pa dang / snam bu la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i dngos po rnams kyis snang bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pa de ltar sngar skyes pa'i khyad par snang ba ni snang ba @116b byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Just as a lamp is the cause of the illumination of conceptual things such as a pot, a cloth, and so on, in the same way, the appearance of the arising of distinctions is called illumination.

original: de yang dag par na byed pa nyid de 'dra ba'i skad cig pa gzhan las ltos te skad cig ma rgyun du 'byung ba las gang gis mtshan nyid mi mthun par mi byed pa ni snang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de yang dag par na byed pa nyid de 'dra ba'i skad cig pa gzhan las ltos te skad cig ma rgyun du 'byung ba las gang gis mtshan nyid mi mthun par mi byed pa ni snang bar byed pa'o //
translated: And that is the very act of illumination, in dependence on another moment like it, from the arising of a continuum of moments, by which it does not make the characteristics dissimilar, that is illumination.

original: blo gros chen po ltos pa'i rgyu ni rnam par bzlog pa'i dus na rnam par mi rtog pa'i dngos po 'byung ba'i phyir bya ba rgyun chad par byed do zhes pa ni rgyu 'dus pa gang yod par gyur nas de'i 'og tu 'bras bu gang mod dma' bar
analyzed: blo gros chen po ltos pa'i rgyu ni rnam par bzlog pa'i dus na rnam par mi rtog pa'i dngos po 'byung ba'i phyir bya ba rgyun chad par byed do zhes pa ni rgyu 'dus pa gang yod par gyur nas de'i 'og tu 'bras bu gang mod dma' bar
translated: This is the causal dependence that is said to be the cause that exists, and then after that, whatever effect is produced.

original: 'gyur ba de de lta bu ni ltos pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba de de lta bu ni ltos pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called causal dependence.

original: ji ltar me la ltos te shing thal ba'i dngos por 'byung ba na rnam par mi rtog pa ste sngon gyi shing gi dngos por rnam par mi rtog ces bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: ji ltar me la ltos te shing thal ba'i dngos por 'byung ba na rnam par mi rtog pa ste sngon gyi shing gi dngos por rnam par mi rtog ces bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: For example, when the thing of wood ash arises in dependence on fire, it is nonconceptual, not conceptualizing the previous thing of wood.

original: 'di dag ni blo gros chen po byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis rang gi sems kyis rnam par rtog pas brtags te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni blo gros chen po byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis rang gi sems kyis rnam par rtog pas brtags te /
translated: Mahamati, these are conceptualized by the conceptual thoughts of their own minds by foolish ordinary beings.

original: rim gyis 'jug pas kyang ma yin /
analyzed: rim gyis 'jug pas kyang ma yin /
translated: They do not arise gradually,

original: cig car yang mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: cig car yang mi 'byung ngo //
translated: nor do they arise all at once.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: blo gros chen po gal te cig car 'byung na ni /
analyzed: blo gros chen po gal te cig car 'byung na ni /
translated: Mahamati, if they arose all at once,

original: bya ba dang byed pa'i bye brag kyang med par 'gyur ro zhes pa thams cad mkhyen pas ci dgongs she na /
analyzed: bya ba dang byed pa'i bye brag kyang med par 'gyur ro zhes pa thams cad mkhyen pas ci dgongs she na /
translated: What did the Omniscient One intend when he said this?

original: gnyis kas kyang bdag 'byung ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis kas kyang bdag 'byung ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both are obtained by the arising of the self.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dus mtshungs pa dang / phan par bya ba dang / phan par byed pa med pas na dus gcig tu bye brag tu dbye bar mi nus so //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dus mtshungs pa dang / phan par bya ba dang / phan par byed pa med pas na dus gcig tu bye brag tu dbye bar mi nus so //
translated: Since there is no simultaneity of cause and effect and no benefit and benefactor, they cannot be distinguished as simultaneous.

original: rgyu'i mtshan nyid du ma red pa'i phyir zhes pa ni rgyu 'bras bu la phan par byed pas mtshan nyid thob par 'gyur na phan par byed pa med pas na rgyu rgyu'i mtshan nyid mi thob po //
analyzed: rgyu'i mtshan nyid du ma red pa'i phyir zhes pa ni rgyu 'bras bu la phan par byed pas mtshan nyid thob par 'gyur na phan par byed pa med pas na rgyu rgyu'i mtshan nyid mi thob po //
translated: Because it is not the characteristic of a cause, if a cause obtains the characteristic of benefiting an effect, since there is no benefit, a cause does not obtain the characteristic of a cause.

original: gzhan par yang bshad na 'bras bu gang gi rgyu las mtshan nyid du ma red pa'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: gzhan par yang bshad na 'bras bu gang gi rgyu las mtshan nyid du ma red pa'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: If it is explained otherwise, any effect that is not characterized by a cause is an effect.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas sgra'i don la sbyar ba'i tshig gnyis kar yang brtag pa ni chos nyid du 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas sgra'i don la sbyar ba'i tshig gnyis kar yang brtag pa ni chos nyid du 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the two terms applied to the meaning of the word by the Omniscient One are not contradictory in reality, they are investigated.

original: de ste rim gyis 'jug pas 'byung na ni mtshan nyid du ma red pa'i bdag nyid pas zhes bya ba ni bya ba'i mtshan nyid du red pa med pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ste rim gyis 'jug pas 'byung na ni mtshan nyid du ma red pa'i bdag nyid pas zhes bya ba ni bya ba'i mtshan nyid du red pa med pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: If it arises gradually, then it is not the nature of the characteristic, because it does not exist as the nature of the characteristic of activity.

original: gang gi tshe na rgyu'i skad cig pa yod pa de'i tshe na 'bras bu'i skad cig pa med de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na rgyu'i skad cig pa yod pa de'i tshe na 'bras bu'i skad cig pa med de /
translated: When there is the momentariness of the cause, at that time there is not the momentariness of the effect.

original: yod pa dang med pa dag kyang ji ltar na 'brel /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dag kyang ji ltar na 'brel /
translated: How can existence and nonexistence be related?

original: skad cig pa gcig ni su dang yang 'brel pa med do //üîΩzhig pa dang ma zhig pa 'bras bu skye ba la @117a * //
analyzed: skad cig pa gcig ni su dang yang 'brel pa med do // zhig pa dang ma zhig pa 'bras bu skye ba la @117a * //
translated: One moment is not related to anything at all.

original: byed pa med de /
analyzed: byed pa med de /
translated: Neither the destroyed nor the nondestroyed can be the cause of the arising of the effect.

original: der thams cad mkhyen pas byed pa dgag par dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der thams cad mkhyen pas byed pa dgag par dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Omniscient One has the intention to refute activity in that.

original: de ma thag pa tsam gyis dngos po so sor nges pa 'ba' zhig ste /
analyzed: de ma thag pa tsam gyis dngos po so sor nges pa 'ba' zhig ste /
translated: It is merely the mere immediate antecedent that is the specific cause of things.

original: de bzhin du yang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba kun rdzob dang / don dam pa'i bden pa gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba rnam pa gnyis la sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba kun rdzob dang / don dam pa'i bden pa gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba rnam pa gnyis la sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: Likewise, the thoroughly afflicted and the completely purified are to be applied to the two kinds of dependent origination, the conventional and the ultimate truths, and the other-dependent and the thoroughly established natures.

original: des na rim gyis 'jug pa mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: des na rim gyis 'jug pa mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, the gradual engagement does not occur.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas de nyid la dper gsungs pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas de nyid la dper gsungs pa /
translated: The Omniscient One has stated this very point as an example:üîΩ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, just as the designation ‚Äòvase-born‚Äô is similar to the conceptualizations of those who engage gradually, the way of connection is also not tenable.‚Äù

original: blo gros chen po bum skyes par pa zhes gdags pa dang 'dra ba rtog pa po rnams kyis rim gyis 'jug pas 'brel ba'i tshul yang mi rung ngo zhes pa 'di'i pha 'di yin no zhes bum skyes par yang phar 'dogs pa ji lta bu rung zhes thams
analyzed: blo gros chen po bum skyes par pa zhes gdags pa dang 'dra ba rtog pa po rnams kyis rim gyis 'jug pas 'brel ba'i tshul yang mi rung ngo zhes pa 'di'i pha 'di yin no zhes bum skyes par yang phar 'dogs pa ji lta bu rung zhes thams
translated: How is it tenable to impute a vase-born as a father, saying ‚ÄúThis is his father‚Äù?

original: cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the intention of the Omniscient One.

original: snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod na 'di yod par 'gyur ro zhes rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'ba' zhig ste /
analyzed: snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod na 'di yod par 'gyur ro zhes rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'ba' zhig ste /
translated: If this exists, that will occur subsequently, is only dependent origination.

original: de ma thag pa tsam gyis kha cig tu las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa'i rang bzhin du so sor nges so //
analyzed: de ma thag pa tsam gyis kha cig tu las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa'i rang bzhin du so sor nges so //
translated: By that alone, in some cases, the nature of the connection between action and effect is ascertained individually.

original: de bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba bzhag pa yang kha cig kha cig gi de ma thag tu dag pa dang ma dag par yang snang gi /
analyzed: de bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba bzhag pa yang kha cig kha cig gi de ma thag tu dag pa dang ma dag par yang snang gi /
translated: Similarly, the presentation of defilement and purification appears as pure and impure in some cases and in some cases.

original: bdag nyid las ma yin la gzhan thams cad las kyang ma yin pa dang / gnyi ga las kyang ma yin te ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa bdag dang gzhan dang gnyis ka dang / yod pa dang / med pa las skyes pa med do zhes pa dang /
analyzed: bdag nyid las ma yin la gzhan thams cad las kyang ma yin pa dang / gnyi ga las kyang ma yin te ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa bdag dang gzhan dang gnyis ka dang / yod pa dang / med pa las skyes pa med do zhes pa dang /
translated: It is not from itself, nor from another, nor from both, nor without cause, as the Omniscient One taught: ‚ÄúThere is no arising from self, from another, from both, or from the existent or non-existent.‚Äù

original: de bas na slob dpon klu bos kyi bstod pa las smras pa /
analyzed: de bas na slob dpon klu bos kyi bstod pa las smras pa /
translated: Therefore, as stated by Master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna in the Praise:

original: zhig dang rnam par ma zhig pa'i //
analyzed: zhig dang rnam par ma zhig pa'i //
translated: From a seed that is destroyed or not destroyed,

original: sa bon las ni myug 'byung med //
analyzed: sa bon las ni myug 'byung med //
translated: A sprout does not arise.

original: rmi 'byung bzhin du 'byung ba de //
analyzed: rmi 'byung bzhin du 'byung ba de //
translated: That arising is like an illusion,

original: de ltar kun ni khyod gsung mdzad //
analyzed: de ltar kun ni khyod gsung mdzad //
translated: Thus you have taught, O Omniscient One.

original: ces so // yod dang med pa las byed pas rgyu'i 'bras bu spyod par mi byed de /
analyzed: ces so // yod dang med pa las byed pas rgyu'i 'bras bu spyod par mi byed de /
translated: Thus, the effect of a cause is not experienced by one who acts from existence and nonexistence.

original: ji ltar btsun gtso byams pas bsgrub par mdzad pa skye ba dang 'jig pa dus mtshungs te srang mda'i mtho dman bzhin no zhes so //üîΩrgyu med pa las kyang ma yin /
analyzed: ji ltar btsun gtso byams pas bsgrub par mdzad pa skye ba dang 'jig pa dus mtshungs te srang mda'i mtho dman bzhin no zhes so // rgyu med pa las kyang ma yin /
translated: As the Lord Maitreya has established: ‚ÄúArising and destruction are simultaneous, like the high and low of a scale pan.‚ÄùüîΩNor is it causeless.

original: dbang po las kyang ma yin /
analyzed: dbang po las kyang ma yin /
translated: Nor is it from the sense faculties.

original: rang bzhin las kyang ma yin /
analyzed: rang bzhin las kyang ma yin /
translated: Nor is it from intrinsic nature.üîΩNor is it from the transference of qualities.

original: yon @117b tan 'pho ba las kyang ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yon @117b tan 'pho ba las kyang ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: 'di yod na 'di yod par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yod na 'di yod par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen this exists, that comes to be,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi tshe na rgyu sngar yod pa de'i 'og tu 'bras bu 'byung gi /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na rgyu sngar yod pa de'i 'og tu 'bras bu 'byung gi /
translated: When the cause exists first, then the effect arises.

original: skad cig pas bar chad pa ni med do //
analyzed: skad cig pas bar chad pa ni med do //
translated: There is no interruption by a moment.

original: rgyu 'jig pa'i dus nyid na 'bras bu 'byung gi 'jig pa dang / skye ba la sogs par yang lhag pa'i chos gzhan med do //
analyzed: rgyu 'jig pa'i dus nyid na 'bras bu 'byung gi 'jig pa dang / skye ba la sogs par yang lhag pa'i chos gzhan med do //
translated: At the time of the destruction of the cause, the effect arises. There is no other phenomenon remaining, such as the destruction of the cause and the arising of the effect.

original: thog ma dang tha ma'i skad cig pa nyid kyi dngos po yang de ma thag tu brtags pa'o //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma'i skad cig pa nyid kyi dngos po yang de ma thag tu brtags pa'o //
translated: The entity of the first and last moments is also just as has been previously examined.

original: de bzhin du chos dang chos can gyi tha snyad byed par yid ches pa bzhin du btsun gtso sangs rgyas su 'gyur bas dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos dang chos can gyi tha snyad byed par yid ches pa bzhin du btsun gtso sangs rgyas su 'gyur bas dgongs pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the intention is that the chief of the holy ones, the Buddha, will become a conventional expression of the relation between a phenomenon and its quality.

original: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa gnyis la yang rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba mi 'byung bar bdag gis dbu ma lta bur bsgrub pa ni /
analyzed: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa gnyis la yang rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba mi 'byung bar bdag gis dbu ma lta bur bsgrub pa ni /
translated: The two selflessnesses of phenomena and persons are also established by me as the middle way, which is the non-occurrence of dependent origination.

original: 'gog med skye ba med pa dang // rtag med chad pa med pa dang // gcig don du ma'i don smin dang // 'ong ba med pa 'gro ba med //
analyzed: 'gog med skye ba med pa dang // rtag med chad pa med pa dang // gcig don du ma'i don smin dang // 'ong ba med pa 'gro ba med //
translated: The non-occurrence of birth, the non-existence of permanence, the non-existence of annihilation, the ripening of the meaning of the one as the meaning of the many, the non-coming, the non-going,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni //
translated: dependent origination,

original: spros pa nyer zhi zhi ba yang //
analyzed: spros pa nyer zhi zhi ba yang //
translated: the pacification of elaborations, peace,

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gsungs gyur pa //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gsungs gyur pa //
translated: is spoken of by the perfect Buddha.

original: gsung mchog de la phyag 'tshal te //
analyzed: gsung mchog de la phyag 'tshal te //
translated: I pay homage to that supreme speech.

original: zhes pas / sa dang po'i dbang pos dbu ma'i gtsug lag gi lus su bsdus par gyur na ni byed pa dang byed pa por 'brel pa de nyid gsal ba'i phyir gtsug lag las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes pas / sa dang po'i dbang pos dbu ma'i gtsug lag gi lus su bsdus par gyur na ni byed pa dang byed pa por 'brel pa de nyid gsal ba'i phyir gtsug lag las 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, when the power of the first stage has been gathered into the body of the scripture of the middle, the relationship of action and agent is clarified, and so it is taught in the scripture.

original: 'brum bu za ba pa dang / kham pa pa dang / rkang mig pa dang / spel ba pa dang / mdze'i mi ni pa dang / tsa ra ka pa dang / lung ston pa rnams kyis kun tu brtags pa'i 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang /
analyzed: 'brum bu za ba pa dang / kham pa pa dang / rkang mig pa dang / spel ba pa dang / mdze'i mi ni pa dang / tsa ra ka pa dang / lung ston pa rnams kyis kun tu brtags pa'i 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang /
translated: The grasping and the grasped, which are imagined by the followers of the various schools, such as the followers of Ka·πáƒÅda, Kanada, Ak·π£apƒÅda, Ka·πáva, BhƒÅrgava, ƒÄsuri, and the followers of the Upani·π£ads,

original: byed pa dang byed pa por 'brel te rjod pa dang brjod pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i 'dzings pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa bsal bar zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa dang byed pa por 'brel te rjod pa dang brjod pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i 'dzings pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa bsal bar zhugs pa'o //
translated: are related as action and agent, and are expressed as the expression and so on.

original: de dag las kyang skye bar bya ba skye ba pos bskyed pa ni byed pa po 'brel pa de thog mar spong bar byed do //
analyzed: de dag las kyang skye bar bya ba skye ba pos bskyed pa ni byed pa po 'brel pa de thog mar spong bar byed do //
translated: Among them, the one who is to be born, who is generated by the one who causes birth, first abandons the relationship of agent.

original: byed pa po la mngon par chags pas 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rab tu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: byed pa po la mngon par chags pas 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rab tu 'byung ngo //
translated: By attachment to the agent, the suffering of sa·πÉsƒÅra arises.

original: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bdag gi dang / byed pa po dang / las dang byed pa la mngon par chags pa log na sdug bsngal bzlog go zhes so //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bdag gi dang / byed pa po dang / las dang byed pa la mngon par chags pa log na sdug bsngal bzlog go zhes so //
translated: If one turns away from attachment to permanence, to self, to mine, to the agent, to action, and to activity, then suffering is turned away from.

original: gang la skye ba med pa de la gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang la skye ba med pa de la gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos yod pa ma yin te /
translated: For that which does not arise, there is no dharma such as enduring, ceasing, and so on.

original: de ltar dbu ma nyid du sgrub @118a * //üîΩpar byed pa /
analyzed: de ltar dbu ma nyid du sgrub @118a * // par byed pa /
translated: Thus, it is established as the middle way.

original: gal te skye ba 'dus byas na //
analyzed: gal te skye ba 'dus byas na //
translated: If arising were conditioned,

original: mtshan nyid gsum ldan der rig ste //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum ldan der rig ste //
translated: it would have the three characteristics.

original: 'on te skye ba 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: 'on te skye ba 'dus ma byas //
translated: But if arising were unconditioned,

original: 'dus byas mtshan nyid ji ltar rung //
analyzed: 'dus byas mtshan nyid ji ltar rung //
translated: how could it be a characteristic of the conditioned?

original: skye ba skye ba ji lta bur //
analyzed: skye ba skye ba ji lta bur //
translated: How could arising arise

original: bdag nyid gzhan gyis ma yin pa //
analyzed: bdag nyid gzhan gyis ma yin pa //
translated: by itself or by another?

original: 'gog pa la ni 'gog pa yang //üîΩbdag nyid gzhan gyis ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa la ni 'gog pa yang // bdag nyid gzhan gyis ma yin pa'o //
translated: And cessation is notüîΩby itself or by another.

original: gang zag bdag la med pa yang //
analyzed: gang zag bdag la med pa yang //
translated: The person does not exist in the self,

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba la skye ba la sogs pa'i chos lhag pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba la skye ba la sogs pa'i chos lhag pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: and arising and so on do not exist in dependent origination.

original: ji ltar 'phags pa dge 'dun chen po pa dag klog pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa dge 'dun chen po pa dag klog pa /
translated: As the noble MahƒÅsƒÅ·πÉghika reciters recite:

original: 'dus byas thams cad skad cig pa //üîΩmi brtan byed pa ga la zhig gang 'byung byed pa de nyid de //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad skad cig pa // mi brtan byed pa ga la zhig gang 'byung byed pa de nyid de //
translated: All conditioned things are momentary.üîΩHow can something unstable be a creator?

original: byed pa por yang de nyid brjod //
analyzed: byed pa por yang de nyid brjod //
translated: That which arises is a creator, and it is also called an agent.

original: ces so // rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i skad cig pa'i rgyu la rtag pa dang chad pa med do //
analyzed: ces so // rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i skad cig pa'i rgyu la rtag pa dang chad pa med do //
translated: In the context of dependent origination, there is neither permanence nor annihilation.

original: gcig don ma yin zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa dang / las rnam par smin pa'i rmi lam la sogs pa snang ba bzhin du rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis don du ma'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig don ma yin zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa dang / las rnam par smin pa'i rmi lam la sogs pa snang ba bzhin du rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis don du ma'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot a single thing‚Äù means that the twelve factors of dependent origination are not a single thing, like the appearances in a dream, which are due to the ripening of ignorance and karma.

original: du ma'i don ma yin zhes bya ba ni don dam pa gnyis kyi rnam pa med pas na mi gnyis pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du ma'i don ma yin zhes bya ba ni don dam pa gnyis kyi rnam pa med pas na mi gnyis pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot many things‚Äù means that there are not many things, because there is no duality in the ultimate.

original: 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba dang bral ba ni thog ma dang tha ma'i mtha' stong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba dang bral ba ni thog ma dang tha ma'i mtha' stong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfree from coming and going‚Äù means that there is no beginning or end, because there is emptiness of the extremes of beginning and end.

original: de'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi chos kyi rnam grangs skye ba na gang nas kyang mi 'ong la /
analyzed: de'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi chos kyi rnam grangs skye ba na gang nas kyang mi 'ong la /
translated: Therefore, when the Dharma discourse on emptiness arises, it does not come from anywhere.

original: 'gag pa na yang gar yang stsogs su mi 'gro'o zhes so //
analyzed: 'gag pa na yang gar yang stsogs su mi 'gro'o zhes so //
translated: And when it ceases, it does not go anywhere.

original: bar du yang gnyis kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: bar du yang gnyis kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: In the middle, it is empty of the nature of the two.

original: des na thams cad mkhyen pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba spros pa nye bar zhi bas na zhi bar gsungs so //
analyzed: des na thams cad mkhyen pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba spros pa nye bar zhi bas na zhi bar gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the Omniscient One has said that dependent origination is peace, because conceptual elaboration is pacified.

original: sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba'i sa dang po'i dbang pos kyang dbu ma'i gtsug lag du gtogs pa las /
analyzed: sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba'i sa dang po'i dbang pos kyang dbu ma'i gtsug lag du gtogs pa las /
translated: The first stage of the path to Buddhahood is called the path of vision. The Buddha has said in the Madhyamaka-Agama-Shastra:

original: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: Not from self, not from other,

original: gnyis dang rgyu med las kyang min //
analyzed: gnyis dang rgyu med las kyang min //
translated: Not from both, nor without cause,

original: dngos po rnams ni skye ba yang //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni skye ba yang //
translated: Do things and events ever come into being.

original: 'ga' zhig gar yang yod min no //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gar yang yod min no // zhes pa ste /
translated: Nowhere and at no time do they ever arise.

original: bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi ga las ji ltar mi skye ba de ltar thams cad mkhyen pas dam pa'i chos kyi 'grel ba las sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi ga las ji ltar mi skye ba de ltar thams cad mkhyen pas dam pa'i chos kyi 'grel ba las sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The Omniscient One has already explained in the Abhidharma-Shastra how things and events do not arise from self, from other, from both, or without cause.

original: 'phags pa btsun gtso byams pa'i s'a lu ljang ba'i mdo sde las 'byung ba rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i rtsod pa'i gnas rnams kyang bdag gis dam pa'i chos kyi @118b 'grel pa bshad pa na dbang po dang / gtso bo la sogs pa dpyad pa sngar byas te /
analyzed: 'phags pa btsun gtso byams pa'i s'a lu ljang ba'i mdo sde las 'byung ba rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i rtsod pa'i gnas rnams kyang bdag gis dam pa'i chos kyi @118b 'grel pa bshad pa na dbang po dang / gtso bo la sogs pa dpyad pa sngar byas te /
translated: The topics of dispute in the dependent origination that occur in the S≈´tra of the Rice Seedling Taught by the Noble Maitreya, the Foremost of the Holy Ones, are also analyzed in my commentary on the excellent Dharma, where I have already analyzed the self, the primal substance, and so on.üîΩThe continuum of mind does not arise from a permanent cause.üîΩIt does not arise from an impermanent cause.üîΩIt does not arise from a cause that is both permanent and impermanent.

original: sems kyi rgyud rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba rtag pa las kyang ma yin /üîΩchad pa las kyang ma yin /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba rtag pa las kyang ma yin / chad pa las kyang ma yin /
translated: It does not arise from a cause that is neither permanent nor impermanent.üîΩIt does not arise from a cause that is both permanent and impermanent.

analyzed: rgyu med pa las kyang ma yin / dbang po las kyang ma yin /
translated: It does not arise from a cause that is neither permanent nor impermanent.üîΩIt does not arise from a cause that is both permanent and impermanent.üîΩIt does not arise from a cause that is neither permanent nor impermanent.üîΩIt does not arise from a cause that is both permanent and impermanent.üîΩIt does not arise from a cause that is neither permanent nor impermanent.üîΩIt does not arise from a cause that is both permanent and impermanent.üîΩIt does not arise from a cause that is neither permanent nor impermanent.üîΩIt does not arise from a cause that is both permanent and impermanent.üîΩIt does not arise from a cause that is neither permanent nor impermanent.üîΩIt does not arise from a cause that is both permanent and impermanent.üîΩIt does not arise from a cause that is neither permanent nor impermanent.üîΩIt does not arise from a cause that is both permanent and impermanent.üîΩIt does not arise from a cause that is neither permanent nor impermanent.üîΩIt does not arise from a cause that is both permanent and impermanent.üîΩIt does not arise from a cause that is neither permanent nor impermanent.

original: rang bzhin las kyang ma yin /
analyzed: rang bzhin las kyang ma yin /
translated: It does not arise from a cause that is both permanent and impermanent.üîΩIt does not arise from a cause that is neither permanent nor impermanent.üîΩIt does not arise from a cause that is both permanent and impermanent.üîΩIt does not arise from a cause that is neither permanent nor impermanent.üîΩIt does not arise from a cause that is both permanent and impermanent.üîΩIt does not arise from a cause that is neither permanent nor impermanent.

original: yon tan 'phos pa las kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa s'a lu ljang ba'i mdo las zhib tu 'byung ba'i phyir rtag pa ni ma skyes pas ni mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med de /
analyzed: yon tan 'phos pa las kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa s'a lu ljang ba'i mdo las zhib tu 'byung ba'i phyir rtag pa ni ma skyes pas ni mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med de /
translated: It does not arise from a cause that is both permanent and impermanent.

original: rtag pa dang / dbang po dang / gtso bo la sogs pa la yang tshul 'di nyid do //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / dbang po dang / gtso bo la sogs pa la yang tshul 'di nyid do //
translated: It does not arise from a cause that is neither permanent nor impermanent.üîΩIt does not arise from a cause that

original: sems la rgyu med pas ma yin pa ni 'byung ba rnams las mi skye ste /
analyzed: sems la rgyu med pas ma yin pa ni 'byung ba rnams las mi skye ste /
translated: It is not the case that mind arises from the elements, because it has no cause.

original: skyes ma thag pa la rga ba dang / 'jig pa dang / mya ngan snang ste /
analyzed: skyes ma thag pa la rga ba dang / 'jig pa dang / mya ngan snang ste /
translated: As soon as it arises, it is subject to aging, destruction, and sorrow.

original: des na sngon gyi goms pa yod par rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: des na sngon gyi goms pa yod par rjes su dpag go //
translated: Therefore, it is inferred that there is prior habituation.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bshad pas 'jig rten phyi ma bsgrub pa na de ni bshad zin mod kyi /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bshad pas 'jig rten phyi ma bsgrub pa na de ni bshad zin mod kyi /
translated: Although the establishment of the next world is explained by the explanation of the foundation consciousness,

original: mdor na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni mi 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: mdor na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni mi 'byung ba ste /
translated: in brief, dependent origination is not non-arising.

original: byed pa dang / byed pa po dang mngon par 'brel nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med de /
analyzed: byed pa dang / byed pa po dang mngon par 'brel nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med de /
translated: The state of being cause and effect is not related to an agent or action.

original: ji ltar na snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod pas na 'di yod par 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya'i yod pa dang med pa las skye bar ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar na snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod pas na 'di yod par 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya'i yod pa dang med pa las skye bar ni mi rung ngo //
translated: How can it be taught that this exists after that exists? It is not suitable to arise from existence or nonexistence.

original: ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pa'i dam pa'i chos kyi 'grel ba'i bshad pa dang dbu ma las /
analyzed: ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pa'i dam pa'i chos kyi 'grel ba'i bshad pa dang dbu ma las /
translated: As it is said in the commentary on the true Dharma of the Omniscient One and in the Madhyamaka:

original: yod dang med pa'i don la ni //
analyzed: yod dang med pa'i don la ni //
translated: The meaning of existence and nonexistence

original: rkyen rnams yod par mi rung ste //
analyzed: rkyen rnams yod par mi rung ste //
translated: Conditions are not tenable as existent.

original: med na rkyen ni su yi yin //
analyzed: med na rkyen ni su yi yin //
translated: If not, whose are they?

original: yod na'ang rkyen gyis ci zhig bya //
analyzed: yod na'ang rkyen gyis ci zhig bya //
translated: If existent, what do conditions do?

original: zhes bya ba las na yod pa dang med pa yang skye bar mi rung ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba las na yod pa dang med pa yang skye bar mi rung ste /
translated: Therefore, existence and nonexistence are not tenable as arising,

original: dngos po la byar med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po la byar med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is nothing to be done with respect to an existent thing.

original: dngos po med pa byed ces pa yang ci yang mi byed pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa byed ces pa yang ci yang mi byed pa yin te /
translated: Also, with respect to the statement ‚Äúnonexistent things are made,‚Äù nothing is done,

original: byed pa 'gag par byas par gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: byed pa 'gag par byas par gyur pa nyid do //
translated: because the activity of making is ceased.

original: de bas na cig car dang / rim gyis 'jug par byed pa dang / byed pa por 'brel te mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na cig car dang / rim gyis 'jug par byed pa dang / byed pa por 'brel te mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, the simultaneous and successive engagement of the agent and action are not tenable.

original: rgyu rnam pa drug po yang byis pas kun brtags pa'o //üîΩkun brtags pa zhes bya ba ni byed pa po dang / las dang byed pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin la'ang mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyis zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa drug po yang byis pas kun brtags pa'o // kun brtags pa zhes bya ba ni byed pa po dang / las dang byed pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin la'ang mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyis zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The six causes are also imagined by the childish.üîΩ‚ÄúImagined‚Äù means that the nature of the agent, action, instrument, and so on is conceived to exist.

original: snang bar byed pa dang ltos pa'i @119a * //
analyzed: snang bar byed pa dang ltos pa'i @119a * //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúcharacterized by‚Äù is ‚Äúilluminated‚Äù and ‚Äúdependent.‚Äù

original: rgyu yang 'bras bu de ma thag pa'i rgyu nyid du thams cad mkhyen pas sbyar te /
analyzed: rgyu yang 'bras bu de ma thag pa'i rgyu nyid du thams cad mkhyen pas sbyar te /
translated: The cause is also the immediately preceding condition of that effect.üîΩThe Omniscient One has applied the cause, the objective support, the immediately preceding, and the dominant conditions to all four kinds of conditions.

original: rgyu dang dmigs pa dang / de ma thag pa dang dbang gi rgyu yang rnam pa bzhi mdo sde 'dir phye nas gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu dang dmigs pa dang / de ma thag pa dang dbang gi rgyu yang rnam pa bzhi mdo sde 'dir phye nas gsungs so //
translated: The four kinds of conditions have been distinguished and taught in this Sutra.

original: dbu mar yang slob dpon gyis kyang de bzhin du ston pa /
analyzed: dbu mar yang slob dpon gyis kyang de bzhin du ston pa /
translated: The Master has also taught in the Madhyamaka

original: rkyen bzhi rnams la rgyu dang ni //
analyzed: rkyen bzhi rnams la rgyu dang ni //
translated: that the four conditions are the causal condition,üîΩthe objective support, the immediately preceding,

original: dmigs dang de ma thag pa dang // de bzhin du yang dbang gi ste //
analyzed: dmigs dang de ma thag pa dang // de bzhin du yang dbang gi ste //
translated: and the dominant condition.

original: rkyen ni lnga pa med pa'o //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: rkyen ni lnga pa med pa'o // zhes pa ste /
translated: There is no fifth condition.

original: dngos po thams cad la rim dang cig car du skye ba dang / skyed pa'i dngos por mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad la rim dang cig car du skye ba dang / skyed pa'i dngos por mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not possible for any thing to arise either successively or simultaneously, or for any thing to be produced.

original: dbu ma las mdor bshad pa ni //üîΩdngos po rang bzhin med rnams la //
analyzed: dbu ma las mdor bshad pa ni // dngos po rang bzhin med rnams la //
translated: The brief explanation in the Madhyamaka isüîΩthat things are without intrinsic nature.

original: yod pa min pas gang las ni //
analyzed: yod pa min pas gang las ni //
translated: Since they do not exist,üîΩhow could it be tenable to say

original: 'di yod pas na 'dir 'gyur zhes //üîΩde ni 'thad pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yod pas na 'dir 'gyur zhes //üîΩde ni 'thad pa med pa'o //
translated: that because this exists, that occurs?

original: zhes pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa la gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa la gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be harmful to the various aspects.

original: rang bzhin med pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa sna tshogs kyi gzhan gyi dbang rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa sna tshogs kyi gzhan gyi dbang rnams kyi ste /
translated: The absence of intrinsic nature is that of the various dependent entities.

original: gang dag 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang / brjod pa dang / rjod pa po so sor snang ba'i rnam par rtog par 'byed pa'i yod pa de dag ni gnyis kyi rnam pa stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang dag 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang / brjod pa dang / rjod pa po so sor snang ba'i rnam par rtog par 'byed pa'i yod pa de dag ni gnyis kyi rnam pa stong pa nyid de /
translated: Those who are divided by the conceptual thought that perceives the apprehender, the apprehended, the expression, and the object of the expression, they are empty of the aspect of duality.

original: rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib la sogs pa snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib la sogs pa snang ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the appearance of a dream, a magical creation, or an optical illusion.

original: rnam par rtog pa med cing snang ba med pa gnyis su med pa'i chud pa rnams la tha dad pa snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag 'dzin pa med do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med cing snang ba med pa gnyis su med pa'i chud pa rnams la tha dad pa snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag 'dzin pa med do //
translated: For those who are absorbed in the nonconceptual, nonappearance, nondual state, there is no apprehension of the distinction of cause and effect, because there is no conceptual thought that perceives a difference.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i mi gnyis pa'i mtshan nyid du'ang rgyu ba med na /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i mi gnyis pa'i mtshan nyid du'ang rgyu ba med na /
translated: If there is no movement even toward the nondual characteristic,

original: 'di yod na 'di yod par 'gyur ro zhes yi ge dang sgra lta ci smos /
analyzed: 'di yod na 'di yod par 'gyur ro zhes yi ge dang sgra lta ci smos /
translated: What need is there to mention letters and words?

original: ji ltar dbu ma'i gtsug lag tu sa dang po'i dbang pos gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar dbu ma'i gtsug lag tu sa dang po'i dbang pos gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said in the Madhyamaka treatise,üîΩThose of little intelligence see things

original: gang gis dngos po mthong ba dang // med par mthong ba blo chung rnams //
analyzed: gang gis dngos po mthong ba dang // med par mthong ba blo chung rnams //
translated: And see nonexistence.

original: nyer zhi zhi ba blta bya ba //
analyzed: nyer zhi zhi ba blta bya ba //
translated: The pacified and the peaceful are to be seen

original: de dag gis ni mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de dag gis ni mi mthong ngo //
translated: But they do not see them.

original: rnam rtog med cing snang ba med //
analyzed: rnam rtog med cing snang ba med //
translated: Free of conceptualization, free of appearances,

original: spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa //üîΩ'di ni 'jig rten mgon rnams kyi //
analyzed: spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa // 'di ni 'jig rten mgon rnams kyi //
translated: Not elaborated by elaborations,üîΩThis is the nectar-like teaching

original: sangs rgyas bstan pa bdud rtsi'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bstan pa bdud rtsi'o //
translated: Of the protectors of the world, the buddhas.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni sems nyid la rigs te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni sems nyid la rigs te /
translated: The phenomena of conceptual and nonconceptual and so forth are included in the mind itself.

original: des na dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs te /
analyzed: des na dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs te /
translated: Therefore, having abandoned the conceptualizations of things and nonthings,

original: mi gnyis @119b pa yang sems nyid la rigs so //
analyzed: mi gnyis @119b pa yang sems nyid la rigs so //
translated: The nondual is also included in the mind itself.

original: ji ltar 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said here,

original: spros las 'das pa mi gnyis pa //
analyzed: spros las 'das pa mi gnyis pa //
translated: Beyond elaboration, nondual,

original: yang dag sangs rgyas spros par byed //
analyzed: yang dag sangs rgyas spros par byed //
translated: The perfect Buddha is elaborated.

original: de dag spros nyams glen pa rnams //
analyzed: de dag spros nyams glen pa rnams //
translated: Those who are impaired by elaboration, dullards,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mi mthong ngo //
translated: Do not see the TathƒÅgata.

original: stong pa zhes par smra mi bya //
analyzed: stong pa zhes par smra mi bya //
translated: One should not say ‚Äúempty,‚Äù

original: mi stong par yang ma yin te //
analyzed: mi stong par yang ma yin te //
translated: Nor ‚Äúnot empty,‚Äù

original: gnyis dang mi gnyis zhes pa yang //
analyzed: gnyis dang mi gnyis zhes pa yang //
translated: Nor ‚Äúboth‚Äù or ‚Äúneither.‚ÄùüîΩHow could there be any aspect in peace?

original: zhi la rnam pa ga la zhig / de bas na dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pa'i chud pa nyid du dbu ma'i ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: zhi la rnam pa ga la zhig / de bas na dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pa'i chud pa nyid du dbu ma'i ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: Therefore, the middle way samƒÅdhi is the very non-conceptualization of entity and non-entity.

original: sa bdun dag ni sems yin te //
analyzed: sa bdun dag ni sems yin te //
translated: The seven grounds are mind,

original: snang ba med pa brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba med pa brgyad pa'o //
translated: The eighth is non-appearance.

original: sa gnyis dag ni gnas yin te //
analyzed: sa gnyis dag ni gnas yin te //
translated: The two grounds are abodes,

original: sa gzhan nga yi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sa gzhan nga yi rang bzhin no //
translated: The other grounds are my nature.

original: phyi yi dngos po bstsal nas su //
analyzed: phyi yi dngos po bstsal nas su //
translated: Having relinquished external entities,

original: shes pa tsam la 'jug pa ni //
analyzed: shes pa tsam la 'jug pa ni //
translated: One enters into mere cognition.

original: 'di nyid dbu ma'i nan tan te //
analyzed: 'di nyid dbu ma'i nan tan te //
translated: This is the practice of the middle way,

original: da dang gzhan gyis bstan pa'o //üîΩdngos po med dang dngos med min //
analyzed: da dang gzhan gyis bstan pa'o // dngos po med dang dngos med min //
translated: Taught by me and others.üîΩNeither entity nor non-entity,

original: yod dang med par mi dmigs pa //
analyzed: yod dang med par mi dmigs pa //
translated: Neither existent nor non-existent‚Äî

original: 'di ni dbu ma'i nan tan te //
analyzed: 'di ni dbu ma'i nan tan te //
translated: This is the practice of the middle way,

original: nga dang gzhan gyis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nga dang gzhan gyis bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught by me and others.

original: zhes so // thams cad mkhyen pas lang kar gshegs par sa bdun gyi dbang pos ye shes la chags pa yongs su spangs te /
analyzed: zhes so // thams cad mkhyen pas lang kar gshegs par sa bdun gyi dbang pos ye shes la chags pa yongs su spangs te /
translated: The Omniscient One, in the LankaÃÑvataÃÑra-suÃÑtra, says that the faculties of the seventh grounder, having abandoned attachment to wisdom,

original: sa brgyad kyi dbang po rnams dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pa ni dbu ma'i ting nge 'dzin du gsungs te /
analyzed: sa brgyad kyi dbang po rnams dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pa ni dbu ma'i ting nge 'dzin du gsungs te /
translated: the faculties of the eighth grounder do not conceptualize things and non-things, and that this is the middle path of meditative equipoise.

original: gang na nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / mu stegs can dang / sa bdun du phyin pa rnams kyi yang spyod yul ma yin no //
analyzed: gang na nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / mu stegs can dang / sa bdun du phyin pa rnams kyi yang spyod yul ma yin no //
translated: It is not the domain of the sÃÅraÃÑvakas, the pratyekabuddhas, the tirthikas, or even those who have attained the seventh ground.

original: mi skye ba'i mtshan nyid de ni rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa lta bur skad cig ma'i 'du byed rnams la skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams gzhan du mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i mtshan nyid de ni rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa lta bur skad cig ma'i 'du byed rnams la skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams gzhan du mi mthong ngo //
translated: The characteristic of non-arising is not seen as the arising, enduring, and ceasing of momentary compounded phenomena, which are like a dream, an optical illusion, and so on.

original: bdag med pa gnyis la yang rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba sgyu ma dang 'dra bar mthong ngo //
analyzed: bdag med pa gnyis la yang rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba sgyu ma dang 'dra bar mthong ngo //
translated: The two selflessnesses are seen as being like an illusion, in the sense of being dependently originated.

original: de de lta bur bsam par byed cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa las /
analyzed: de de lta bur bsam par byed cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa las /
translated: Thus, having contemplated in this way, he is roused from the non-appearance of ultimate truth, from the non-dual perfect knowledge,

original: bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa rnams kyi thugs rje'i bag chags kyis bskul te sems can thams cad kyi don gyi phyir bslang bar mdzad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa rnams kyi thugs rje'i bag chags kyis bskul te sems can thams cad kyi don gyi phyir bslang bar mdzad do //
translated: by the Blessed One, the Omniscient One, through the imprints of compassion, for the sake of all sentient beings.

original: gang gis snang ba dang bcas pa dag pa 'jig rten pa ting nge 'dzin @120a * //
analyzed: gang gis snang ba dang bcas pa dag pa 'jig rten pa ting nge 'dzin @120a * //
translated: By whom, having appearances, he abides in pure mundane meditative concentration,

original: la gnas te sems can gyi phyir rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la gnas te sems can gyi phyir rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: and engages for the sake of sentient beings.

original: gal te dus gzhan du bdag nyid rab tu sad par 'gyur na ni sems can gyi don du byang chub kyi tshogs kyi bar chad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dus gzhan du bdag nyid rab tu sad par 'gyur na ni sems can gyi don du byang chub kyi tshogs kyi bar chad du 'gyur ro //
translated: If he were to awaken by himself at another time, it would be an obstacle to the accumulation of enlightenment for the sake of sentient beings.

original: 'di la gang yang rkyen rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa yang byed pa dang / byed pa po dang 'brel te mi skye'o //
analyzed: 'di la gang yang rkyen rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa yang byed pa dang / byed pa po dang 'brel te mi skye'o //
translated: Here, the statement beginning with In this, nothing arises through conditions means that the other-dependent and the accomplished are not produced in connection with an agent and action.

original: sna tshogs kyi phyir gzhan gyi dbang skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi phyir gzhan gyi dbang skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The dependent is the nature of non-arising because of its variety.

original: sna tshogs dang rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sna tshogs dang rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like a variety of things and dreams, etc.

original: grub pa yang gnyis kyi rnam pas stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: grub pa yang gnyis kyi rnam pas stong pa nyid de /
translated: And the accomplished is emptiness in the aspect of duality.

original: chos thams cad nges par 'jug pa'i dbang po'o zhes pa yang dag par rig pa bzhin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad nges par 'jug pa'i dbang po'o zhes pa yang dag par rig pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the correct knowing of the organ that definitely engages all phenomena.

original: des ni tshigs su bcad pa'i don bshad zin to //
analyzed: des ni tshigs su bcad pa'i don bshad zin to //
translated: This explains the meaning of the verse.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i bshad pa yi shes dpal bzang pos sbyar ba las le'u gnyis pa las rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dpyad pa lnga pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i bshad pa yi shes dpal bzang pos sbyar ba las le'u gnyis pa las rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dpyad pa lnga pa'o /
translated: This is the fifth chapter in the glorious Zurpoche's commentary on the La·πÖkƒÅvatƒÅra S≈´tra, called A Precious Garland, an analysis of cause and effect.

original: // / de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos gsol pa /
analyzed: // / de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos gsol pa /
translated: Then again the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva MahƒÅmati made a request:

original: tshig gi rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi snying po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshig gi rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi snying po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The essence of the characteristics of verbal concepts... and so forth.

original: gsol ba de'i lan bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gsol ba de'i lan bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied to that request:üîΩMahƒÅmati, the essence of the characteristics of verbal concepts is as follows...

original: blo gros chen po tshig gi rnam par rtog pa mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: blo gros chen po tshig gi rnam par rtog pa mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhi yod de /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, there are four kinds of conceptualized characteristics of words.

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid kyi tshig dang zhes pa la mtshan nyid ni mtshan ma ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid kyi tshig dang zhes pa la mtshan nyid ni mtshan ma ste /
translated: Thus, the words of characteristics‚Äù means that characteristics are signs.

original: sgra rnams 'byung ba'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: sgra rnams 'byung ba'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: They are the signs from which sounds arise.

original: ji ltar sgra'i 'grel pa byas pas sgrub par byed pa sgra rnams gsum gyi phyir 'jug ste /
analyzed: ji ltar sgra'i 'grel pa byas pas sgrub par byed pa sgra rnams gsum gyi phyir 'jug ste /
translated: Just as by composing a commentary on sound, one engages in the three kinds of sounds that establish.

original: 'di ltar rigs pa dang / yon tan dang / byed par 'jug pa'i mtshan ma rnams kyi sgra rnams 'jug go //
analyzed: 'di ltar rigs pa dang / yon tan dang / byed par 'jug pa'i mtshan ma rnams kyi sgra rnams 'jug go //
translated: Thus, sounds engage in the signs of reasoning, qualities, and actions.

original: bzhi'i phyir sgra rnams 'jug pa ni shes pa'i sgra rnams yod do zhes te /
analyzed: bzhi'i phyir sgra rnams 'jug pa ni shes pa'i sgra rnams yod do zhes te /
translated: Sounds engage for four reasons, as there are sounds of cognition.

original: dngos po yod pa de las brjod pa dang rkyen du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa de las brjod pa dang rkyen du 'gyur ro //
translated: From that existence of an existent thing, there is expression and conditionality.

original: tshig gsum yod par byed pa'i yod pa ni /
analyzed: tshig gsum yod par byed pa'i yod pa ni /
translated: The existence that makes the three words exist

original: rdzas yod pa dang / yon tan yod pa dang / las yod pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas yod pa dang / yon tan yod pa dang / las yod pa'o //
translated: is the existence of substance, the existence of qualities, and the existence of actions.

original: sgra 'jug pa ni rigs kyi mtshan ma med de des na sgra rnams kyi spyi'i brjod pa'o //
analyzed: sgra 'jug pa ni rigs kyi mtshan ma med de des na sgra rnams kyi spyi'i brjod pa'o //
translated: The engagement of sounds does not have the sign of a type, and therefore the sounds are the general expressions.

original: gang yang ming du btags pa rnams ni ding tho dang / da the wing tha dang / lha sbyin dang / mchod sbyin no //
analyzed: gang yang ming du btags pa rnams ni ding tho dang / da the wing tha dang / lha sbyin dang / mchod sbyin no //
translated: The names that are given to them are Ding-tho, Da-the-ving-tha, Lha-jin, and Choe-jin.

original: @120b spyir sgro btags te 'jug pa'i mtshan ma yul dang / dus dang ldan pa zhes so //
analyzed: @120b spyir sgro btags te 'jug pa'i mtshan ma yul dang / dus dang ldan pa zhes so //
translated: In general, the signs that are imputed and applied are the object and the time that is possessed.

original: kha cig smra ba ni zla ba dang nyi ma zhes bya la /
analyzed: kha cig smra ba ni zla ba dang nyi ma zhes bya la /
translated: Some say that it is called the moon and the sun.

original: gang me tog ku mu da rnams rgyas par byed pa dang / gang yang sim par byed pa de ni zla ba'i zla ba kho na'o //
analyzed: gang me tog ku mu da rnams rgyas par byed pa dang / gang yang sim par byed pa de ni zla ba'i zla ba kho na'o //
translated: That which causes the kumuda flowers to open and which also brings coolness is the moon of the moon alone.

original: gang pad mo rnams rgyas par byed pa dang / gang snang bar byed pa de ni nyi ma'i nyi ma kho na'o //
analyzed: gang pad mo rnams rgyas par byed pa dang / gang snang bar byed pa de ni nyi ma'i nyi ma kho na'o //
translated: That which causes the lotuses to open and which brings light is the sun of the sun alone.

original: yang na dngos po thams cad rang gi dngos por yod pa de dag gi dngos po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na dngos po thams cad rang gi dngos por yod pa de dag gi dngos po zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, all things exist in their own nature, and that is called their nature.

original: de brjod pa'i phyir kho na 'am nyid yin te /
analyzed: de brjod pa'i phyir kho na 'am nyid yin te /
translated: It is just that or alone in order to express that.

original: gang rtsva za ba dang / shing rta 'dren pa de ni ba lang gi ba lang kho na'o //
analyzed: gang rtsva za ba dang / shing rta 'dren pa de ni ba lang gi ba lang kho na'o //
translated: That which eats grass and pulls a cart is the cow of the cow alone.

original: de bzhin du nam mkha'i yang nam mkha' kho na ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du nam mkha'i yang nam mkha' kho na ste /
translated: Likewise, space is only space.

original: bro ba la sogs pa du ma dang sbyor bas yul tha dad par brtags pa ste /
analyzed: bro ba la sogs pa du ma dang sbyor bas yul tha dad par brtags pa ste /
translated: It is imagined to be different objects by the combination of many tastes, etc.

original: mang po'i gnas pas na nam mkha' kho na'o zhes bha dra ha ris smras pa'o //
analyzed: mang po'i gnas pas na nam mkha' kho na'o zhes bha dra ha ris smras pa'o //
translated: Since it is the abode of many, it is only space. This is what Bhadrahari says.

original: slob dpon chos skyong gis kyang sgrub par byed pa nam mkha' la mtshan ma mang po'i tshig 'jug pas na rnam pa mang po der nam mkha' kho na'o zhes kun brtags pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon chos skyong gis kyang sgrub par byed pa nam mkha' la mtshan ma mang po'i tshig 'jug pas na rnam pa mang po der nam mkha' kho na'o zhes kun brtags pa'o //
translated: Master Dharmapala also says that since many words of signs are applied to space as the probandum, it is imagined to be many aspects, only space.üîΩTherefore,

original: des na / tshig don rnams kyi rigs dang ni //
analyzed: des na / tshig don rnams kyi rigs dang ni //
translated: the class of words and meanings

original: snang ba nyid kyang dgar te 'am //
analyzed: snang ba nyid kyang dgar te 'am //
translated: and even the appearance itself are imagined.

original: sgra kun ni tshig don du de ltar rtag tu bshad pa'o //
analyzed: sgra kun ni tshig don du de ltar rtag tu bshad pa'o //
translated: All sounds are always explained as the meaning of words.

original: tshig tu smras pa rnams tshig gi don gyi tshig bzung nas brjod pa'i rjod pa ni 'dus pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: tshig tu smras pa rnams tshig gi don gyi tshig bzung nas brjod pa'i rjod pa ni 'dus pa brjod pa'o //
translated: Words are spoken by taking the words of the meaning of words. The expression of expression is the expression of the collection.

original: brjod pa smra ba rnams ni brjod pa nyid don rjod par byed pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: brjod pa smra ba rnams ni brjod pa nyid don rjod par byed pa'o zhes so //
translated: The speakers of expression are the expressers of the meaning of expression itself.

original: la las tshig ni tha dad gnyis //
analyzed: la las tshig ni tha dad gnyis //
translated: Some say that words are two different things.

original: rnam bzhi rnam pa lnga par yang //
analyzed: rnam bzhi rnam pa lnga par yang //
translated: The fourfold is also fivefold.

original: rjod pa rnams las brten nas ni //
analyzed: rjod pa rnams las brten nas ni //
translated: Based on the expressions,

original: rang bzhin rkyen la sogs pa bzhin //
analyzed: rang bzhin rkyen la sogs pa bzhin //
translated: like nature, conditions, and so on.

original: zhes rab tu 'thor ba'i tshig gi rgyud las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes rab tu 'thor ba'i tshig gi rgyud las 'byung ngo //
translated: This is stated in the Tantra of Scattered Words.

original: brjod pa dpyad pa las ni /üîΩtshig ces bya ba cung zad kyang //
analyzed: brjod pa dpyad pa las ni / tshig ces bya ba cung zad kyang //
translated: Regarding the analysis of expressions,üîΩthere is not even the slightest

original: rang bzhin gar yang nges pa med //
analyzed: rang bzhin gar yang nges pa med //
translated: nature of words anywhere.

original: tshig rnams dngos po don dag kyang //
analyzed: tshig rnams dngos po don dag kyang //
translated: Words and things

original: brjod don gnyis las byung ba ste //
analyzed: brjod don gnyis las byung ba ste //
translated: arise from the two meanings of expression.

original: zhes brjod pa ma rtogs par tshig gis the tshom du 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes brjod pa ma rtogs par tshig gis the tshom du 'gyur te /
translated: Without understanding expression, words lead to doubt.

original: des na brjod pa nyid kyi don brjod de mngon par brjod pa 'dus pa gang yin pa brjod pa nyid las dgar bar bya'o //
analyzed: des na brjod pa nyid kyi don brjod de mngon par brjod pa 'dus pa gang yin pa brjod pa nyid las dgar bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of expression is expressed. Whatever is the collection of expressions should be distinguished from mere expression.

original: brjod pa'i nang gi yan lag dang mtshungs pa'i chos dang lhag pa bton te tshig gi don ni don gyi bye brag las de ltar rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: brjod pa'i nang gi yan lag dang mtshungs pa'i chos dang lhag pa bton te tshig gi don ni don gyi bye brag las de ltar rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The meaning of words is established from the particulars of meaning by extracting the dharma and special that are similar to the internal parts of expression.

original: la lig dkar po dang / ras dkar @121a * //
analyzed: la lig dkar po dang / ras dkar @121a * //
translated: For example, white cloth and white cotton.

original: po dang / gos dkar po dang / ba dkar mo 'gro ba dang / ba nag mo 'dug pa ste /
analyzed: po dang / gos dkar po dang / ba dkar mo 'gro ba dang / ba nag mo 'dug pa ste /
translated: white cows, black cows, and so on.

original: de de ltar brjod pa'i nang gi yan lag dang / chos mtshungs pa dang / chos mi mtshungs pas tshig gi don rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de de ltar brjod pa'i nang gi yan lag dang / chos mtshungs pa dang / chos mi mtshungs pas tshig gi don rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Thus, the meaning of the words is established by the internal branches of speech, by the similarity of the phenomena, and by the dissimilarity of the phenomena.

original: tshig dang brjod pa'i dpyad pa zhib mo ni sgra'i gtsug lag las thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: tshig dang brjod pa'i dpyad pa zhib mo ni sgra'i gtsug lag las thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
translated: The detailed analysis of words and speech is the intention of the Omniscient One in the treatise on grammar.

original: mtshan nyid kyi tshig ces bya ba ni smra ba rnams kyi brjod pa'i don du 'byed pas na rtsod pa yang mang ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi tshig ces bya ba ni smra ba rnams kyi brjod pa'i don du 'byed pas na rtsod pa yang mang ste /
translated: The words of the definition are as follows: Since the meaning of the expression of the speakers is divided, there are many disputes.

original: yi ge ma gtogs tshig gzhan ni //üîΩyod pa ma yin brjod pa ni //üîΩyi ge tshig ni ma gtogs par //
analyzed: yi ge ma gtogs tshig gzhan ni // yod pa ma yin brjod pa ni // yi ge tshig ni ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from the letters, there are no other words.üîΩThe expression

original: chung zad kyang ni yod pa min //
analyzed: chung zad kyang ni yod pa min //
translated: Apart from the letters, there is not even the slightest word.

original: zhes dpyod pa can gyi rjes su mthun par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes dpyod pa can gyi rjes su mthun par bya ste /
translated: This should be in accordance with the analysis of the NaiyƒÅyikas.

original: bha dra ha ris bshad pa /
analyzed: bha dra ha ris bshad pa /
translated: Bhadrahari explains:

original: smras pa'i sgra kun 'dus pa ni //
analyzed: smras pa'i sgra kun 'dus pa ni //
translated: All the collected sounds of speech

original: rigs ni 'jug par 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: rigs ni 'jug par 'gyur ba ste //
translated: Become the entry into the categories.

original: gcig pu yan lag med pa'i sgra //
analyzed: gcig pu yan lag med pa'i sgra //
translated: The sound is single and partless.

original: blo yis rigs su bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: blo yis rigs su bsdu ba'o //
translated: The intellect collects it into a type.

original: thog ma'i tshig ni so sor kun //üîΩltos dang bcas te de ltar yang //
analyzed: thog ma'i tshig ni so sor kun // ltos dang bcas te de ltar yang //
translated: The initial word is a universal.üîΩIt is related as dependent.

original: brjod pa'i phyir na tha dad blo //
analyzed: brjod pa'i phyir na tha dad blo //
translated: Thus, the different intellects

original: tshul smra rnams kyi rnam pa mang //
analyzed: tshul smra rnams kyi rnam pa mang //
translated: are the various ways of the philosophers.

original: zhes te / byed pa dang byed pa por mngon par 'brel pa brjod pa'i don ni thams cad la 'khrul pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes te / byed pa dang byed pa por mngon par 'brel pa brjod pa'i don ni thams cad la 'khrul pa ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of the expression ‚Äúthe connection of the agent and action‚Äù is not mistaken in all cases.

original: de lta bur na don yang rjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bur na don yang rjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the meaning is also expressed.

original: gzhon nu can gyi mur byed pas smras pa /üîΩji snyed ji 'dra gang dag ni //
analyzed: gzhon nu can gyi mur byed pas smras pa / ji snyed ji 'dra gang dag ni //
translated: Kumarila says:üîΩThe letters that are able to show

original: don gang ston nus yi ge rnams //üîΩmthu rnams rab tu shes gyur pa //
analyzed: don gang ston nus yi ge rnams // mthu rnams rab tu shes gyur pa //
translated: the extent, the kind, and the thingüîΩthat is the meaning,

original: de dag de ltar don rtogs byed //
analyzed: de dag de ltar don rtogs byed //
translated: those who know the power will understand the meaning in that way.

original: ces so // rtag par smra ba rnams kyis ni //
analyzed: ces so // rtag par smra ba rnams kyis ni //
translated: The eternalists say:

original: yi ge 'brum bu gcig gis kyang //
analyzed: yi ge 'brum bu gcig gis kyang //
translated: Even a single letter

original: ston par byed de de tshig dang // brjod pa'i don chud par byed la /
analyzed: ston par byed de de tshig dang // brjod pa'i don chud par byed la /
translated: shows the meaning of the expression and the word.

original: byed pa dang byed pa por mngon par 'brel par yang chud par byed do //
analyzed: byed pa dang byed pa por mngon par 'brel par yang chud par byed do //
translated: and he also understands the connection between the agent and the action.

original: rnam pa de lta bu ni ya rabs dang / ma rabs rnams kyi mtshan ma ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su chud par bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu ni ya rabs dang / ma rabs rnams kyi mtshan ma ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su chud par bsgrub pa'o //
translated: This is the way to understand the characteristics of the noble and the ignoble.

original: rmi lam gyi tshig ni thams cad snang bar 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi tshig ni thams cad snang bar 'byed pa ste /
translated: The words of dreams are all illuminating.

original: tha snyad du 'byed pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: tha snyad du 'byed pa'i dpe'o //
translated: This is an example of the differentiation of conventions.

original: chud pa ma gtogs par yang sgra'i don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chud pa ma gtogs par yang sgra'i don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no meaning of words apart from the understanding.

original: gnas ngan len la mngon par zhen pa'i tshig ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams la goms pa'i rjes su byed pas rlom pa dang / sdod la phod pa la sogs pa'i gtam mo //
analyzed: gnas ngan len la mngon par zhen pa'i tshig ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams la goms pa'i rjes su byed pas rlom pa dang / sdod la phod pa la sogs pa'i gtam mo //
translated: The words of attachment to bad habits are the talk of pride, arrogance, and so forth, which are the result of being accustomed to the afflictions such as desire.

original: @121b thog ma med pa'i dus kyi rnam par rtog pa'i tshig ni byis pa rnams la yang sgra'i don mngon par rjod pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: @121b thog ma med pa'i dus kyi rnam par rtog pa'i tshig ni byis pa rnams la yang sgra'i don mngon par rjod pa 'byung ste /
translated: The words of conceptual thoughts since beginningless time are the arising of the expression of the meaning of words to the childish.

original: nang gi byed par bzhag pa ni //
analyzed: nang gi byed par bzhag pa ni //
translated: The internal agent is

original: sgra kun gang du rgyu byed pa //
analyzed: sgra kun gang du rgyu byed pa //
translated: where all sounds function.

original: gnas rnams su ni thog med kyang //
analyzed: gnas rnams su ni thog med kyang //
translated: In the various places, though beginningless,

original: sgra la ma goms mi rung ste //
analyzed: sgra la ma goms mi rung ste //
translated: It is not proper to be unfamiliar with the sounds,

original: des na 'jig rten gzhan gyi goms pa'i rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: des na 'jig rten gzhan gyi goms pa'i rjes su dpag go //
translated: Therefore, one infers in accordance with the familiarity of other worlds.

original: zhib tu ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis bsgrub par mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: zhib tu ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis bsgrub par mdzad pa yin te /
translated: In detail, it is accomplished by omniscience itself,

original: mdo sde'i don bdag gis rnam par phye bar zad do //
analyzed: mdo sde'i don bdag gis rnam par phye bar zad do //
translated: I have merely analyzed the meaning of the sutras.

original: da dung yang bcom ldan 'das kyis mi rnams kyi tshig gi rnam par rig pa rtog pa zhes pa la sogs pa la thams cad mkhyen pas kyang gsungs pa /
analyzed: da dung yang bcom ldan 'das kyis mi rnams kyi tshig gi rnam par rig pa rtog pa zhes pa la sogs pa la thams cad mkhyen pas kyang gsungs pa /
translated: Even now, the Blessed One has spoken of the conceptualization of human verbal cognition, and so on, even the Omniscient One has said:

original: mgo dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste thams cad mkhyen pas bslab pa'i rim pa bstan pa /
analyzed: mgo dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste thams cad mkhyen pas bslab pa'i rim pa bstan pa /
