translated: Head and so on, the Omniscient One has taught the stages of training,

original: yi ge rnams kyi gnas brgyad de //
analyzed: yi ge rnams kyi gnas brgyad de //
translated: The eight places of the letters,

original: brang dang mgul dang de bzhin mgo //
analyzed: brang dang mgul dang de bzhin mgo //
translated: The chest, the throat, and likewise the head,üîΩThe sides of the tongue, the teeth,

original: lce drung rnams dang so rnams dang // sna dang mchu dang rkan yang ngo //
analyzed: lce drung rnams dang so rnams dang // sna dang mchu dang rkan yang ngo //
translated: The nose, the lips, and the palate as well.

original: blo gros chen pos gsol pa /
analyzed: blo gros chen pos gsol pa /
translated: Mahamati said:

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par rtog pa dang / tshig tha dad dam 'on te gcig gam ci lags zhes pa ni yid kyi rnam par rtog pa dang / rkan la sogs pa'i las kyis sgra 'byung ba yi ge'i chos dang mtshungs pas de gnyis gcig par kha cig kun tu rtog par byed do zhes 'phags pa blo gros chen pos rnam par rtog pa la thams cad mkhyen pas kyang bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par rtog pa dang / tshig tha dad dam 'on te gcig gam ci lags zhes pa ni yid kyi rnam par rtog pa dang / rkan la sogs pa'i las kyis sgra 'byung ba yi ge'i chos dang mtshungs pas de gnyis gcig par kha cig kun tu rtog par byed do zhes 'phags pa blo gros chen pos rnam par rtog pa la thams cad mkhyen pas kyang bka' stsal pa /
translated: Some imagine that the two are the same because the phenomena of letters, which are sounds produced by the actions of the palate and so on, are similar to mental concepts.

original: blo gros chen po tshig ni rnam par rtog pa dang tha dad pa yang ma yin gcig pa yang ma yin no zhes so //
analyzed: blo gros chen po tshig ni rnam par rtog pa dang tha dad pa yang ma yin gcig pa yang ma yin no zhes so //
translated: The noble MahƒÅmati imagined that the Omniscient One also said, ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, words are neither different from concepts nor the same.‚ÄùüîΩHow is it that being different and being the same are not tenable?üîΩThis is established by the omniscient lord of speech, who is completely free from attachment and is supremely pure.

original: tha dad pa dang gcig par ji ltar mi rung ba de mchog tu yongs su dag pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba thams cad mkhyen pa tshig gi dbang pos sgrub par mdzad pa de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: tha dad pa dang gcig par ji ltar mi rung ba de mchog tu yongs su dag pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba thams cad mkhyen pa tshig gi dbang pos sgrub par mdzad pa de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: de'i rgyu las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir blo gros chen po tshig ni rnam par rtog pa las 'byung ngo zhes te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir blo gros chen po tshig ni rnam par rtog pa las 'byung ngo zhes te /
translated: Because it is the characteristic that arises from its cause, MahƒÅmati, words arise from conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu las tshig 'byung ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu las tshig 'byung ste /
translated: Words arise from the cause of conceptualization,

original: 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
translated: because they are the nature of the result.

original: blo gros chen po de ste tshig 'di rnam par rtog pa dang tha dad pa zhig yin na ni rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu las 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo gros chen po de ste tshig 'di rnam par rtog pa dang tha dad pa zhig yin na ni rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu las 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: MahƒÅmati, if these words were different from conceptualization, they would not arise from the cause of conceptualization.

original: de ste gcig pa zhig yin na ni tshig de don gsal bar byed par yang mi 'gyur na /üîΩde @122a * //
analyzed: de ste gcig pa zhig yin na ni tshig de don gsal bar byed par yang mi 'gyur na / de @122a * //
translated: If they were the same, that word would not clarify the meaning.

original: ni byed de de bas na tha dad pa yang ma yin gcig pa yang ma yin no zhes pa gal te rnam par rtog pa rgyu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ni byed de de bas na tha dad pa yang ma yin gcig pa yang ma yin no zhes pa gal te rnam par rtog pa rgyu ma yin gyi /
translated: But it does. Therefore, they are neither different nor the same.

original: gzhan pa zhig las 'byung bar 'gyur na ni de'i tshe tshig gi rnam par rtog pa las skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan pa zhig las 'byung bar 'gyur na ni de'i tshe tshig gi rnam par rtog pa las skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If conceptualization were not the cause, but words arose from something else, then at that time words would not arise from conceptualization.

original: 'on te skye ba na de las tha dad pa ma yin na ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i khyad par med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te skye ba na de las tha dad pa ma yin na ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i khyad par med par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is not different from the cause, then there is no difference between cause and effect.üîΩIf they are identical, then it is neither the effect nor the cause.

original: gcig pa yin na ni 'bras bu ma yin la rgyu yang ma yin te rnam par rtog pa ni yid kyi yin la /
analyzed: gcig pa yin na ni 'bras bu ma yin la rgyu yang ma yin te rnam par rtog pa ni yid kyi yin la /
translated: For conceptualization is mental,

original: sgra ni rgan la sogs pa'i las kyis bskyed la /
analyzed: sgra ni rgan la sogs pa'i las kyis bskyed la /
translated: and sound is produced by the action of the vocal organs.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pas gzung ba'i phyir des na de dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag tu so sor snang ngo //
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pas gzung ba'i phyir des na de dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag tu so sor snang ngo //
translated: And since sound is apprehended by auditory consciousness, they appear as distinct in terms of cause and effect.

original: ji ltar lung ston pa'i gtsug lag las 'byung ba /üîΩsgra rnams len pa sgra dag ni //
analyzed: ji ltar lung ston pa'i gtsug lag las 'byung ba / sgra rnams len pa sgra dag ni //
translated: As it is said in the scriptures of the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas:

original: sgra mkhas dag gis gnyis rig ste //
analyzed: sgra mkhas dag gis gnyis rig ste //
translated: ‚ÄúThe grammarians know two kinds of sound:üîΩOne is the sound-sign,

original: gcig ni sgra yi mtshan ma dang // gnyis pos don du sbyor bar byed //
analyzed: gcig ni sgra yi mtshan ma dang // gnyis pos don du sbyor bar byed //
translated: and the other is the sound that conveys meaning.

original: gtsub shing me gnas ji bzhin du //
analyzed: gtsub shing me gnas ji bzhin du //
translated: Just as fire is produced by rubbing two sticks together,

original: rgyu gzhan gyis ni snang ba ste //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan gyis ni snang ba ste //
translated: so too, sound is produced by other causes.

original: de bzhin blo la gnas pa'i sgra //
analyzed: de bzhin blo la gnas pa'i sgra //
translated: Sound that abides in the mind

original: nyan pa rnams kyi rgyu yin te //
analyzed: nyan pa rnams kyi rgyu yin te //
translated: is the cause for the listeners.

original: thog ma tha dad blos brtags te //
analyzed: thog ma tha dad blos brtags te //
translated: The mind first imagines the difference,

original: kha cig don la gzung ba ste //
analyzed: kha cig don la gzung ba ste //
translated: Some say that the meaning is grasped.

original: rgyu rnams rnam par bzlog pa dang // sgras ni rjes su don mi 'dzin //
analyzed: rgyu rnams rnam par bzlog pa dang // sgras ni rjes su don mi 'dzin //
translated: The causes are eliminated, and the sound does not grasp the meaning.

original: zhes pa de de tsam zhig thams cad mkhyen pa'i gsung lus pa la 'bral te /
analyzed: zhes pa de de tsam zhig thams cad mkhyen pa'i gsung lus pa la 'bral te /
translated: That is just a little bit of the teaching of the Omniscient One left.

original: lhag ma rgyas pa'i sgrar ston pa ni /
analyzed: lhag ma rgyas pa'i sgrar ston pa ni /
translated: The remainder is taught as the sound of expansion.

original: sgra tshangs par smra ba rnams kyis brtags pa nyid de sgra dang don tha dad pa med pa las tha dad par byed pa dang / gang yang sgra dang don dam pa gcig par gnas so zhes pa la /
analyzed: sgra tshangs par smra ba rnams kyis brtags pa nyid de sgra dang don tha dad pa med pa las tha dad par byed pa dang / gang yang sgra dang don dam pa gcig par gnas so zhes pa la /
translated: The sound of Brahma is imagined by the Brahmins themselves. From the non-difference of sound and meaning, they make a difference, and also that sound and meaning ultimately abide as one.

original: tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin par bsams te /
analyzed: tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin par bsams te /
translated: Thinking of difference and non-difference,

original: de'i phyir de ltar 'phags pa blo gros chen pos gsol pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar 'phags pa blo gros chen pos gsol pa'o //
translated: therefore it is thus requested by the noble Mahamati.

original: sgra tshangs par smra ba rnams kyi grub pa'i mtha' ni /
analyzed: sgra tshangs par smra ba rnams kyi grub pa'i mtha' ni /
translated: The tenet of the Brahmins who speak of Brahma as sound is:

original: thog ma med pa'i sgra tshangs rtag / yang dag yig 'bru gang yin pa //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i sgra tshangs rtag / yang dag yig 'bru gang yin pa //
translated: Brahma, the beginningless sound, is permanent, and the syllables are real.

original: don gyi dngos por 'byung ba ste //
analyzed: don gyi dngos por 'byung ba ste //
translated: They arise as the entity of the meaning,

original: gang la 'gro ba'i rab byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang la 'gro ba'i rab byed pa'o //
translated: and are the creators of the world.

original: zhes de de ltar chud pa ma gtogs par yid kyi rnam par rtog pa dang / rkan la sogs pa'i byed pas bsgrub cing rna ba'i rnam par shes pas sgra gsal bar byed pa de dag tha dad pa ma yin te rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang /
analyzed: zhes de de ltar chud pa ma gtogs par yid kyi rnam par rtog pa dang / rkan la sogs pa'i byed pas bsgrub cing rna ba'i rnam par shes pas sgra gsal bar byed pa de dag tha dad pa ma yin te rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang /
translated: In this way, apart from the fact that the sound is heard, the mental conception and the production by the palate, etc., and the clarification of the sound by the auditory consciousness are not different.

original: rab rib can gnyis kyis zla ba gnyis mtshungs @122b pa'i tha snyad ni snang ba 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab rib can gnyis kyis zla ba gnyis mtshungs @122b pa'i tha snyad ni snang ba 'byed pa'o //
translated: The convention of the two is like that of a dream, a magical creation, and the two moons seen by one with an eye disease.

original: de bas 'khor ba 'di ni sems nyid de /
analyzed: de bas 'khor ba 'di ni sems nyid de /
translated: Therefore, this cyclic existence is just the mind itself.

original: rgyud gzhan gyi dbang gi mthus rang gi rgyud la 'khrug pa la 'dzin pa dang / brjod pa dang rjod pa po dang / byed pa dang byed pa por 'brel bar bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan gyi dbang gi mthus rang gi rgyud la 'khrug pa la 'dzin pa dang / brjod pa dang rjod pa po dang / byed pa dang byed pa por 'brel bar bstan par bya'o //
translated: The disturbance in one‚Äôs continuum by the power of another continuum is to be taught as the connection of the grasped and grasper, the expressed and expounder, the acted upon and actor.

original: gang gi tshe na shes rab kyis dpyad de shes par bya ba rnam par phye ba de'i tshe na mi dmigs pas bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa gnyis su med pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba dngos po dang dngos po
analyzed: gang gi tshe na shes rab kyis dpyad de shes par bya ba rnam par phye ba de'i tshe na mi dmigs pas bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa gnyis su med pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba dngos po dang dngos po
translated: When one analyzes with wisdom and gains understanding, at that time, since one does not observe anything, there is no thought, no appearance, and the ultimate truth of nonduality, which is natural luminosity, is realized.üîΩ

original: med par rnam par mi rtog pa'i chud pa bdag nyid kyis gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: med par rnam par mi rtog pa'i chud pa bdag nyid kyis gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: When one analyzes with wisdom and understands the distinctions, at that time, due to non-observation, the inconceivable, appearance-free, non-dual ultimate truth, the naturally luminous, non-conceptual wisdom that is free from entities and non-entities, will abide within oneself.

original: thugs rje'i bag chags kyis bskul pa na snang ba dang bcas pa dag pa 'jig rten gyi ting nge 'dzin la thams cad mkhyen pa bzhugs par gyur pa na /
analyzed: thugs rje'i bag chags kyis bskul pa na snang ba dang bcas pa dag pa 'jig rten gyi ting nge 'dzin la thams cad mkhyen pa bzhugs par gyur pa na /
translated: When the Omniscient One abides in the pure worldly samadhi with appearances, due to the impulsion of the latent tendencies of compassion,

original: sems can rnams la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi gtsang ba dang / stong pa'i chos rnams ston par byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi gtsang ba dang / stong pa'i chos rnams ston par byed do //
translated: he teaches sentient beings the dharmas of impermanence, suffering, impurity, and emptiness.

original: da ni gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi dbang pos /
analyzed: da ni gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi dbang pos /
translated: Now, with the various sense faculties of form,

original: rtsod pa'i gnas rnams kyi don rgyu dang / dpe'i khyad par rnams kyis rgya cher bsgrub par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gnas rnams kyi don rgyu dang / dpe'i khyad par rnams kyis rgya cher bsgrub par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they extensively prove the meaning of the topics of dispute and the distinctions of the examples.

original: yang blo gros chen pos gsol pa /
analyzed: yang blo gros chen pos gsol pa /
translated: Again, MahƒÅmati said:

original: bcom ldan 'das tshig nyid don dam pa lags sam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das tshig nyid don dam pa lags sam /
translated: Blessed One, is the word itself the ultimate?

original: 'on te tshig gis gang brjod par bgyi ba de don dam pa lags sam /
analyzed: 'on te tshig gis gang brjod par bgyi ba de don dam pa lags sam /
translated: Or is that which is to be expressed by the word the ultimate?

original: ci lags zhes te /
analyzed: ci lags zhes te /
translated: What is it?

original: dgongs pa ni zhi ba pa dang / rig sngags 'dzin pa'i mthar smra ba rnams sngags kyi rang bzhin gyi sgra la don dam pa kho nar rtog par byed pa ni /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni zhi ba pa dang / rig sngags 'dzin pa'i mthar smra ba rnams sngags kyi rang bzhin gyi sgra la don dam pa kho nar rtog par byed pa ni /
translated: The intention is that the proponents of peace and the extreme views of the holders of mantras conceive the sound of the nature of mantras as only the ultimate.

original: sngags kyi bdag nyid sems pa can //
analyzed: sngags kyi bdag nyid sems pa can //
translated: The one with the nature of mantra,

original: de bzhin skyes bu rnam gnyis brjod //
analyzed: de bzhin skyes bu rnam gnyis brjod //
translated: and likewise, two kinds of beings are expressed.

original: sngags las 'das dang sngags dang ni //
analyzed: sngags las 'das dang sngags dang ni //
translated: Beyond mantra and mantra,

original: dbang phyug mchog la rnam gnyis nyid //
analyzed: dbang phyug mchog la rnam gnyis nyid //
translated: and two kinds regarding the supreme lord.

original: rig sngags 'dzin pa rnams kyis aom la sogs pa ni don dam pa zhes pa /
analyzed: rig sngags 'dzin pa rnams kyis aom la sogs pa ni don dam pa zhes pa /
translated: The holders of mantras say that Om and so forth are the ultimate.

original: ji ltar gtogs 'dod kyis smras pa //
analyzed: ji ltar gtogs 'dod kyis smras pa //
translated: As it is said by the one who desires to belong:

original: aom zhes yi ge gcig pos tshangs //üîΩgang gis brjod cing nga la ni //
analyzed: aom zhes yi ge gcig pos tshangs // gang gis brjod cing nga la ni //
translated: By the single syllable O·πÉ, BrahmƒÅ

original: rjes su dran par gyur pa de //
analyzed: rjes su dran par gyur pa de //
translated: is uttered and recollects me.

original: lus kyis yongs su spangs nas ni //
analyzed: lus kyis yongs su spangs nas ni //
translated: Having completely abandoned the body,

original: 'gro ba mchog tu 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'gro ba mchog tu 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: he goes to the supreme destination.

original: zhes so // don dam pa dang 'brel pas ni don dam pa zhes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: zhes so // don dam pa dang 'brel pas ni don dam pa zhes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: In connection with the ultimate, it is called the ultimate. The Blessed One said:

original: blo gros chen po tshig @123a * //
analyzed: blo gros chen po tshig @123a * //
translated: MahƒÅmati, words

original: kyang don dam pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kyang don dam pa ma yin no //
translated: are not the ultimate.

original: tshig gis gang brjod par bya ba de yang don dam pa ma yin zhes pa la thams cad mkhyen pas cis dgongs she na /
analyzed: tshig gis gang brjod par bya ba de yang don dam pa ma yin zhes pa la thams cad mkhyen pas cis dgongs she na /
translated: What is expressed by words is also not the ultimate. What did the Omniscient One intend by this?

original: sgra dang don ni gnyis kyi rnam pa'i phyir don dam pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra dang don ni gnyis kyi rnam pa'i phyir don dam pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not the ultimate because it has the form of both sound and meaning.

original: snang ba dang bcas pa'i phung po'i rang bzhin ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib la sogs pa'i snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: snang ba dang bcas pa'i phung po'i rang bzhin ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib la sogs pa'i snang ba bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the aggregates with appearances is like appearances in dreams, illusions, and cataracts, etc.

original: dam pa'i bden pa ni don dam pa ste /
analyzed: dam pa'i bden pa ni don dam pa ste /
translated: The ultimate truth is the ultimate.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi bde ba gang la brjod par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi bde ba gang la brjod par 'jug pa ste /
translated: That which is the bliss of the noble ones is the entrance into expression.

original: don dam pa 'phags pa'i bden pa gang la yod pa de ni bsgom pas spyod pa'i don dam pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa 'phags pa'i bden pa gang la yod pa de ni bsgom pas spyod pa'i don dam pa'o //
translated: That which has the ultimate, the noble truth, is the ultimate of the practice of meditation.

original: tshig gis ni spyi'i rnam par don dam pa bsnyad par byed pas na don dam pa ma yin no zhes te /
analyzed: tshig gis ni spyi'i rnam par don dam pa bsnyad par byed pas na don dam pa ma yin no zhes te /
translated: It is not the ultimate because it is expressed by words that are general in meaning.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas bsgrub par mdzad pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas bsgrub par mdzad pa /
translated: It is accomplished by the Omniscient One.

original: 'phags pa so so rang gi rig pa'i ye shes kyis rtogs par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa so so rang gi rig pa'i ye shes kyis rtogs par bya ba yin te /
translated: It is to be realized by the noble one‚Äôs wisdom of individual intuitive awareness.

original: tshig gi rnam par rtog pa'i blo'i spyod yul ni ma yin no zhes te /
analyzed: tshig gi rnam par rtog pa'i blo'i spyod yul ni ma yin no zhes te /
translated: It is not the domain of the conceptual mind.

original: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med cing rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa ni don dam pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med cing rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa ni don dam pa'o //
translated: The ultimate truth, which is free from thought and appearance, is nondual, and its nature is luminosity.

original: de yang dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pas na rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul ma yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pas na rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul ma yin zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, since it is free from the concepts of entity and nonentity, it is said to be not the domain of conceptual thought.

original: tshig ni skyes nas 'jig cing mi brtan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pas skad cig tu 'jig pa ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: tshig ni skyes nas 'jig cing mi brtan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pas skad cig tu 'jig pa ston par mdzad de /
translated: The words having arisen, it disintegrates and is not stable and so on are taught by the Omniscient One to demonstrate momentary disintegration.

original: se gol gyi sgra lta bur tshig skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa ni mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: se gol gyi sgra lta bur tshig skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa ni mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Buddha has shown that words are momentary and perish as soon as they are uttered, because they are not perceived after they have perished, just like the sound of a finger snap.

original: tshig gi don gzhan 'dra bar 'byung ba la de nyid 'di 'dra'o zhes phyir shes pa 'byung gi /
analyzed: tshig gi don gzhan 'dra bar 'byung ba la de nyid 'di 'dra'o zhes phyir shes pa 'byung gi /
translated: The meaning of the words is perceived as similar in the past and future, but not the words themselves.

original: rtag pa las ma yin pa ni skra dang rtsva la sogs pa bcad nas kyang skyes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rtag pa las ma yin pa ni skra dang rtsva la sogs pa bcad nas kyang skyes pa bzhin no //
translated: The words are not permanent, because they are produced again after being cut off, as in the case of grass and hair.

original: gnas pa la mngon par gsal ba yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: gnas pa la mngon par gsal ba yang mi rung ste /
translated: It is also not possible for them to be manifest in the present,

original: thog ma dang tha ma'i dus su de'i 'bras bu mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma'i dus su de'i 'bras bu mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: because their effect is not perceived at the beginning and end.

original: ji ltar na gnas pa yang rtog par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar na gnas pa yang rtog par 'gyur /
translated: How could they be imagined to be present?

original: de'i phyir mu stegs byed pa gzhon nu can gyis smras pa'i lan smras pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mu stegs byed pa gzhon nu can gyis smras pa'i lan smras pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is the response to the assertion of the young brahmin VƒÅlmƒ´ka.

original: des bya ba ni /
analyzed: des bya ba ni /
translated: The Buddha has also said:

original: gcig pu shes gyur su zhig ltar //
analyzed: gcig pu shes gyur su zhig ltar //
translated: Who would know that the self is one,

original: yang dang yang du 'dris pa ni //
analyzed: yang dang yang du 'dris pa ni //
translated: and that it is acquainted with itself again and again?

original: dus kyi tha dad dbyer med pa //
analyzed: dus kyi tha dad dbyer med pa //
translated: And the difference of time is not different.

original: de ltar sgra ni dbyer med do //
analyzed: de ltar sgra ni dbyer med do //
translated: Thus, the word is not different.

original: ji ltar rim @123b gyis gcig pu nyid //
analyzed: ji ltar rim @123b gyis gcig pu nyid //
translated: Just as the same person

original: tha dad yul du 'gro na yang //
analyzed: tha dad yul du 'gro na yang //
translated: Goes to different places in sequence,

original: yul gyi tha dad mi 'byed pa //
analyzed: yul gyi tha dad mi 'byed pa //
translated: And the difference of place is not distinguished,

original: de ltar sgra yang mi 'byed do //üîΩzhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar sgra yang mi 'byed do // zhes bya ste /
translated: So the word is not distinguished.

original: ring ba dang thung ba'i yig 'bru de nyid 'di yin pa dang / nyams che ba dang nyam chung ba'i lha sbyin de nyid 'di yin pa dang / chos tha dad pa'i phyir chos can la tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: ring ba dang thung ba'i yig 'bru de nyid 'di yin pa dang / nyams che ba dang nyam chung ba'i lha sbyin de nyid 'di yin pa dang / chos tha dad pa'i phyir chos can la tha dad pa med do //
translated: The very same long and short letters, the very same Yaj√±adatta who is strong and the very same one who is weak, are not different in the basis of characteristic because of the difference of characteristics.

original: dngos po rang bzhin du ma lags //
analyzed: dngos po rang bzhin du ma lags //
translated: Things are not multiple by nature.

original: 'dod pa'i gzugs su rtag pa ni //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i gzugs su rtag pa ni //
translated: The permanent form of desire

original: rim dang cig car 'jug pa ste //
analyzed: rim dang cig car 'jug pa ste //
translated: Is engaged in sequentially and simultaneously,

original: tshig gi rnam pa gzhan med do //üîΩji ltar kha dog 'dres pa la //
analyzed: tshig gi rnam pa gzhan med do // ji ltar kha dog 'dres pa la //
translated: But there is no other type of expression.üîΩJust as one grasps a color

original: 'dod pa bzhin du 'dzin par byed //
analyzed: 'dod pa bzhin du 'dzin par byed //
translated: As one wishes, mixing it,

original: dngos po sna tshogs ji bzhin yang //
analyzed: dngos po sna tshogs ji bzhin yang //
translated: So also, although things are various,

original: tha dad tha dad mi dmigs pa //
analyzed: tha dad tha dad mi dmigs pa //
translated: They are not observed as different.

original: snang med tshig la rag lus phyir //
analyzed: snang med tshig la rag lus phyir //
translated: Because of the absence of appearance and dependence on words,

original: yul der de ni gzung ba ste //
analyzed: yul der de ni gzung ba ste //
translated: In that place, it is the object.üîΩThe words are in the sky, in a continuous

original: tshig rnams nam mkha' rgyun chags par //
analyzed: tshig rnams nam mkha' rgyun chags par //
translated: stream,

original: khyad par nus pa byed pa'o //üîΩzhes pa de la /
analyzed: khyad par nus pa byed pa'o // zhes pa de la /
translated: with a particular capacity for action.

original: sun dbyung ba ni tshig dang yi ge rnams la tha dad par mi snang bas na bslab par bya ba med do //
analyzed: sun dbyung ba ni tshig dang yi ge rnams la tha dad par mi snang bas na bslab par bya ba med do //
translated: In response to that, the refutation is this: Since the words and letters do not appear as different, there is nothing to be learned.

original: chos can la nyams che chung la sogs pa'i tha dad pa'i chos kyi dbye ba ni ji ltar rtag par 'gyur /
analyzed: chos can la nyams che chung la sogs pa'i tha dad pa'i chos kyi dbye ba ni ji ltar rtag par 'gyur /
translated: How could there be a difference of attributes, such as greater or lesser, in the basis of attributes, if it is permanent?

original: 'on te chos rnams kyis de'i khyad par mi ston na ni de la thog ma dang tha ma'i dus su khyad par 'byed pa'i chos su ji ltar na 'gyur /üîΩde ste khyad par 'byed par 'gyur ba ma yin pa nyid na ni chos can de la chos de dag gi khyad par med na tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: 'on te chos rnams kyis de'i khyad par mi ston na ni de la thog ma dang tha ma'i dus su khyad par 'byed pa'i chos su ji ltar na 'gyur / de ste khyad par 'byed par 'gyur ba ma yin pa nyid na ni chos can de la chos de dag gi khyad par med na tha dad pa'am /
translated: But if the attributes do not indicate a difference in it, then how could it be a basis of attributes, since it is not differentiated in terms of earlier and later times?

original: tha dad pa ma yin par ji ltar gdags /
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin par ji ltar gdags /
translated: If it is not differentiated, then if it is without difference in those attributes, how could it be designated as different or non-different from those attributes?

original: de bas na chos dang chos can tha dad pa dbye bas 'byed na ji ltar na gcig smras ba /
analyzed: de bas na chos dang chos can tha dad pa dbye bas 'byed na ji ltar na gcig smras ba /
translated: Therefore, if the difference of the attributes and the basis of attributes is differentiated, how could it be said to be one?

original: gzugs gcig pa ni gcig ma yin no zhes dbang pos bsgo ba med pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs gcig pa ni gcig ma yin no zhes dbang pos bsgo ba med pa ste /
translated: The form is not one, and it is not many.

original: zhes pa gal te gzugs de ltar gcig po nyid gcig pu yin na ni /
analyzed: zhes pa gal te gzugs de ltar gcig po nyid gcig pu yin na ni /
translated: If that form were one,

original: du ma yang ji ltar na du ma yin na de'i phyir gcig dang du ma'i tha snyad 'chad pa'i glags su 'gyur te /
analyzed: du ma yang ji ltar na du ma yin na de'i phyir gcig dang du ma'i tha snyad 'chad pa'i glags su 'gyur te /
translated: how could it be many? Therefore, the conventions of one and many would be impossible.

original: dgongs pa yang tha dad par mi 'gyur ba ni tshig gi don rnams kyis don gyi bya ba tha dad par snang bar 'byed do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa yang tha dad par mi 'gyur ba ni tshig gi don rnams kyis don gyi bya ba tha dad par snang bar 'byed do zhes pa'o //
translated: The intention is that the meanings of the words are distinguished as appearing to have different functions.

original: yi ge dang / tshig dang / brjod pa dang / ngag rnams ni gcig la gcig brten te don la spyir 'jug pa'i mtshan ma la ltos te 'byung gi don dam pa mi gnyis pa kho na snang bar byed pa de ni ma yin @124a * //
analyzed: yi ge dang / tshig dang / brjod pa dang / ngag rnams ni gcig la gcig brten te don la spyir 'jug pa'i mtshan ma la ltos te 'byung gi don dam pa mi gnyis pa kho na snang bar byed pa de ni ma yin @124a * //
translated: The letters, words, expressions, and speech are mutually dependent. They arise in dependence on the sign that generally engages with the meaning. They do not illuminate the ultimate, which is nondual.

original: te ; de tshig gi yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: te ; de tshig gi yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because the ultimate is not the domain of words.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: mtshan mar byas pa'i don spyir bsnyad par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan mar byas pa'i don spyir bsnyad par byed pa'o //
translated: It is expressed as the meaning that is the universal of the signified.

original: gzhan du byed dang 'brel pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhan du byed dang 'brel pa'i phyir //
translated: because it is related to the other,

original: nga ni tshig ces tshor par byed //
analyzed: nga ni tshig ces tshor par byed //
translated: the word is produced by the idea of the thing.

original: tshig pa'i sgras ni gzhan par yang //
analyzed: tshig pa'i sgras ni gzhan par yang //
translated: The word is also related to the other,

original: tshig gi don ni shes par byed //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni shes par byed //
translated: the object of the word.

original: des na rang gi mtshan nyid mi gnyis pa ni brjod du med de /
analyzed: des na rang gi mtshan nyid mi gnyis pa ni brjod du med de /
translated: Thus, the particular, which is not twofold, is inexpressible.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas kyang spyir sgro btags te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas kyang spyir sgro btags te /
translated: The Omniscient One, by means of a universal superimposed on it,

original: mngon pa'i tshul gyis thabs rnam pa sna tshogs ni chud par mdzad pa'i thabs so //
analyzed: mngon pa'i tshul gyis thabs rnam pa sna tshogs ni chud par mdzad pa'i thabs so //
translated: by means of the method of the Abhidharma, has recourse to a method of expression.

original: rig sngags pa skyes bus smras pa ma yin pa rnams ni nags tshal gyi sgra dang / rlung gi stobs kyis bsgul ba'i smyug ma'i sgra la sogs pa bzhin du don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig sngags pa skyes bus smras pa ma yin pa rnams ni nags tshal gyi sgra dang / rlung gi stobs kyis bsgul ba'i smyug ma'i sgra la sogs pa bzhin du don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The words of the incantations are not uttered by a person, because they are without meaning, like the sound of the forest, the sound of bamboo shaken by the force of the wind, etc.

original: de lta bas na phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams snang ba dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: de lta bas na phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams snang ba dang bcas pa dang /
translated: Therefore, the teachings on the aggregates, elements, sense bases, dependent origination, thirty-seven factors of awakening, ten powers, four forms of fearlessness, and so on, are both apparent and

original: snang ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / 'gog pa la mnyam par 'jog pa dang / de bzhin du gzugs med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / gnyis dang mi gnyis par ston pa'i chos ni spyir sgro btags te gsung rab mdzad pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid du sgra mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / 'gog pa la mnyam par 'jog pa dang / de bzhin du gzugs med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / gnyis dang mi gnyis par ston pa'i chos ni spyir sgro btags te gsung rab mdzad pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid du sgra mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: empty, signless, wishless, and absorbed in cessation, and likewise, the teachings on the formless absorptions and the non-dual are generally proclaimed with superimposition, because it is impossible to express their intrinsic characteristics with words.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: don dang sgra yi khyad par ni //
analyzed: don dang sgra yi khyad par ni //
translated: The distinction between meaning and words

original: brjod dang rjod pa 'dod pa min //
analyzed: brjod dang rjod pa 'dod pa min //
translated: is not asserted to be expressible or expression.

original: des de sngar ni ma mthong phyir //
analyzed: des de sngar ni ma mthong phyir //
translated: Because that was not seen before,

original: spyir ni brjod par bya'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: spyir ni brjod par bya'o zhes pa ste /
translated: it should be generally expressed.

original: 'dogs pa dang tha snyad kyi dus su spyi nyid du sgra'i don gzugs brnyan du snang ngo //
analyzed: 'dogs pa dang tha snyad kyi dus su spyi nyid du sgra'i don gzugs brnyan du snang ngo //
translated: At the time of designation and convention, the universal itself appears as the reflected object of the word.

original: de la tha snyad ni rang gi mtshan nyid la'o //
analyzed: de la tha snyad ni rang gi mtshan nyid la'o //
translated: Convention is in regard to the particular.

original: 'dogs pa'i dus na mthong yang mthong ba med pa ste /
analyzed: 'dogs pa'i dus na mthong yang mthong ba med pa ste /
translated: At the time of designation, although one sees, one does not see.

original: dus gnyis kar yang spyir snang ba gang rva dang mjug ma la sogs pa gang dang ldan pa de de lta bu la ba lang zhes smra bar bya'o //
analyzed: dus gnyis kar yang spyir snang ba gang rva dang mjug ma la sogs pa gang dang ldan pa de de lta bu la ba lang zhes smra bar bya'o //
translated: In both cases, the universal appears. One should say that a cow is that which possesses horns, a tail, and so on.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni rva la sogs pa dang ldan te /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni rva la sogs pa dang ldan te /
translated: Therefore, it is endowed with horns and so on.

original: de'i phyir ba lang gi sgrar brjod do zhes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ba lang gi sgrar brjod do zhes so //
translated: For that reason, it is expressed by the word cow.

original: de rang gi mtshan nyid mngon sum du zin kyang rva yo ba dang / khong gso ba la sogs pa'i bye brag phye bar mi rtog gi spyir nye bar rtog @124b go //
analyzed: de rang gi mtshan nyid mngon sum du zin kyang rva yo ba dang / khong gso ba la sogs pa'i bye brag phye bar mi rtog gi spyir nye bar rtog @124b go //
translated: Even though one directly perceives the particular, one does not conceive the distinctions of crooked horns, a full belly, and so on. One only conceives the universal.

original: mngon sum du lkog tu rjes su song ba 'jug pa'i mtshan ma de ni sgra'i don zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mngon sum du lkog tu rjes su song ba 'jug pa'i mtshan ma de ni sgra'i don zhes bya ste /
translated: The direct perception of the universal, which is hidden in the particular, is the sign of engagement. That is called the object of the word.

original: zhib tu ni bar ti ka dang / rtog pa'i rgyan la sogs pa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhib tu ni bar ti ka dang / rtog pa'i rgyan la sogs pa las rig par bya'o //
translated: For a detailed explanation, see the Vartika and the Aloka.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa ye shes dpal bzang pos bshad pa sbyar ba'i le'u gnyis pa las sgra'i don dpyad pa drug pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa ye shes dpal bzang pos bshad pa sbyar ba'i le'u gnyis pa las sgra'i don dpyad pa drug pa'o /
translated: This concludes the sixth chapter of the Entry into Lanka, called ‚ÄúThe Analysis of Sound.‚Äù

original: // / de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: // / de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then again the bodhisattva mahasattva Mahamati made a request to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad kyi rang gi sems snang ba'i spyod yul rtog pas rnam par phye ba'i mtshan nyid mchis pa dang / ma mchis pa dang / gcig pa dang / tha dad pa dang / gnyis ka dang / gnyis ka ma lags pa dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad kyi rang gi sems snang ba'i spyod yul rtog pas rnam par phye ba'i mtshan nyid mchis pa dang / ma mchis pa dang / gcig pa dang / tha dad pa dang / gnyis ka dang / gnyis ka ma lags pa dang /
translated: ‚ÄúBlessed One, the domain of the appearances of one‚Äôs own mind of all phenomena is characterized by conceptual distinctions, and it is not, and it is both, and it is neither, and it is not one thing and not many things, and it is not a thing and not a non-thing, and it is not a thing and not a non-thing, and it is not a thing and not a non-thing, and it is not a thing and not a non-thing, and it is not a thing and not a non-thing, and it is not a thing and not a non-thing, and it is not a thing and not a non-thing, and it is not a thing and not a non-thing, and it is not a thing and not a non-thing, and it is not a thing and not a non-thing, and it is not a thing and not a non-thing, and it is not a thing and not a non-thing, and it is not a thing and not a non-thing, and it is not a thing and not a non-thing, and it is not a thing and not a non-thing, and it is not a thing and not a non-thing, and it is not a thing and not a non-thing, and it is not a thing and not a non-thing, and it is not a thing and not a non-thing, and it is not a thing and not a non-thing, and it is not a thing and not a non-thing, and it is not a thing and not a non-thing, and it is not a thing and not a non-thing, and it is not a thing and not a non-thing, and it is not a thing and not a non-thing, and it is not a thing and not a non-thing, and it is not a thing and not a non-thing, and it is not a thing and not a non-thing, and it is not a thing and not a non-thing, and it is not a thing and not a non-thing, and it is not a thing and not a non-thing, and

original: mchis pa yang ma lags pa dang / ma mchis pa yang ma lags pa dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa spangs pa mu stegs can gyi rtog pa mi rgyu ba 'phags pa so so rang gi ye shes kyis mkhyen par bgyi ba kun brtags pa'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid las rnam par log pa /
analyzed: mchis pa yang ma lags pa dang / ma mchis pa yang ma lags pa dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa spangs pa mu stegs can gyi rtog pa mi rgyu ba 'phags pa so so rang gi ye shes kyis mkhyen par bgyi ba kun brtags pa'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid las rnam par log pa /
translated: It is not existent, nor is it nonexistent, and it is free from permanence and impermanence. It is not the domain of tƒ´rthikas‚Äô concepts, but is to be known by the wisdom of the noble ones. It is the opposite of the imagined characteristics of universals and particulars.

original: don dam pa de kho na nyid la 'jug pa sa'i mtshams sbyor zhing gong nas gong du rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la rjes su 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid sngon gyi smon lam gyis lhun gyis grub pa /
analyzed: don dam pa de kho na nyid la 'jug pa sa'i mtshams sbyor zhing gong nas gong du rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la rjes su 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid sngon gyi smon lam gyis lhun gyis grub pa /
translated: It is the entry into ultimate suchness, the characteristic that connects with the stages, and the characteristic that engages the stage of the tathƒÅgatas, which is increasingly pure. It is spontaneously accomplished by previous aspirations.

original: gzugs sna tshogs kyi nor bu lta bur 'jug pa yul mtha' yas par skad cig tu rab tu rgyu ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa de lta bu'i rtsod pa dang / the tsom du ma la thams cad mkhyen pas rig pa bzhin du lan du bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gzugs sna tshogs kyi nor bu lta bur 'jug pa yul mtha' yas par skad cig tu rab tu rgyu ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa de lta bu'i rtsod pa dang / the tsom du ma la thams cad mkhyen pas rig pa bzhin du lan du bka' stsal pa /
translated: It is like a jewel of various forms, and it is the instantaneous engagement in infinite objects. The Omniscient One has given answers to such disputes and doubts in accordance with his knowledge.

original: blo gros chen po byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis rang gi sems snang ba tsam du khong du ma chud pa dang / phyi rol gyi dngos po rnam pa sna tshogs la mngon par zhen pas yod pa dang / med pa dang / gcig pa dang /
analyzed: blo gros chen po byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis rang gi sems snang ba tsam du khong du ma chud pa dang / phyi rol gyi dngos po rnam pa sna tshogs la mngon par zhen pas yod pa dang / med pa dang / gcig pa dang /
translated: They cling to the various appearances of external things, and so they conceptualize in terms of existence and nonexistence, sameness and difference,üîΩboth and neither, neither existent nor nonexistent, and the nature of permanence and impermanence.

original: tha dad pa dang / gnyis ka dang / gnyis ka ma yin pa dang / yod pa'ang ma yin pa dang / med pa'ang ma yin pa dang / rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin gyis bag chags kyi rgyu rnam par rtog pa la mngon par zhen pas rnam par rtog go zhes te /
analyzed: tha dad pa dang / gnyis ka dang / gnyis ka ma yin pa dang / yod pa'ang ma yin pa dang / med pa'ang ma yin pa dang / rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin gyis bag chags kyi rgyu rnam par rtog pa la mngon par zhen pas rnam par rtog go zhes te /
translated: Clinging to conceptual thoughts as causes of habitual tendencies, they conceptualize.

original: phyi rol gyi don la mngon par zhen nas med pa po rnams yang dag pa ma yin par @125a * //üîΩkun tu rtog par byed de /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don la mngon par zhen nas med pa po rnams yang dag pa ma yin par @125a * // kun tu rtog par byed de /
translated: Clinging to external objects, nihilists conceive of what is not realüîΩas real.

original: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa rnams te /
analyzed: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa rnams te /
translated: Earth, water, fire, and wind are real.

original: de dag las sems can no zhes rang gi sems snang ba tsam du khong du chud pa'i phyir de ltar rtog go //
analyzed: de dag las sems can no zhes rang gi sems snang ba tsam du khong du chud pa'i phyir de ltar rtog go //
translated: But since he understands that sentient beings are merely the appearance of his own mind, he thinks in this way.

original: sems ni de ma thag pa'i sems las shes rab la sogs pa dang ldan par skye ba yin te /
analyzed: sems ni de ma thag pa'i sems las shes rab la sogs pa dang ldan par skye ba yin te /
translated: The mind arises endowed with wisdom and so on from the mind that immediately precedes it.

original: skyes ma thag pa la yul kha cig nyid du dga' ba dang / 'jigs pa dang / mya ngan yang dag par rtog par byed pa'i phyir de bas na 'jig rten pa'i goms pa thams cad yod par rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: skyes ma thag pa la yul kha cig nyid du dga' ba dang / 'jigs pa dang / mya ngan yang dag par rtog par byed pa'i phyir de bas na 'jig rten pa'i goms pa thams cad yod par rjes su dpag go //
translated: Since it immediately upon arising conceives some objects as pleasant, some as unpleasant, and some as neutral, one can infer that all mundane habits exist.

original: de bas na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba rnam par gzhag pa las /
analyzed: de bas na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba rnam par gzhag pa las /
translated: Therefore, in the context of the presentation of affliction and purification,

original: las dang 'bras bu so sor nges par rung ngo //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu so sor nges par rung ngo //
translated: it is possible to posit the definite relation between karma and its result.

original: grangs can rnams yod pa skye ba yod pa 'gag go zhes rtog pa ni mi shes pa yod pa la ni yongs su zad pa med la /
analyzed: grangs can rnams yod pa skye ba yod pa 'gag go zhes rtog pa ni mi shes pa yod pa la ni yongs su zad pa med la /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas imagine that existence arises and that existence ceases. But if existence is not exhausted,

original: sngon med pa'i ye shes skye ba med pas ji ltar thar /
analyzed: sngon med pa'i ye shes skye ba med pas ji ltar thar /
translated: and if the nonarising of pristine wisdom that did not exist before does not occur, how can there be liberation?

original: ksha pa na ka rnams yod par 'gyur ba dang / med par 'gyur ba dang / gnyis kar 'gyur ba dang / gnyis ka ma yin par 'gyur bar smra bar mi bya ba yang rtog go //
analyzed: ksha pa na ka rnams yod par 'gyur ba dang / med par 'gyur ba dang / gnyis kar 'gyur ba dang / gnyis ka ma yin par 'gyur bar smra bar mi bya ba yang rtog go //
translated: and that it would be necessary to say that the sevenfold analysis exists, does not exist, both exists and does not exist, and neither exists nor does not exist.

original: de lta bas na bdun du phye ba la spyi'i bdag nyid du yod par 'gyur ba dang / khyad par gyi bdag nyid du med par 'gyur ba dang / spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du yod pa dang med par yang 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: de lta bas na bdun du phye ba la spyi'i bdag nyid du yod par 'gyur ba dang / khyad par gyi bdag nyid du med par 'gyur ba dang / spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du yod pa dang med par yang 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Therefore, it would be necessary to say that the general nature exists and the specific nature does not exist, and that the general and specific natures both exist and do not exist.

original: spyi'i bdag nyid du yod par 'gyur ba yang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du smra bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: spyi'i bdag nyid du yod par 'gyur ba yang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du smra bar mi bya'o //
translated: It would be necessary to say that the general nature exists and the specific nature does not exist.

original: khyad par gyi bdag nyid du med par 'gyur ba yang spyi'i bdag nyid du smra bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi bdag nyid du med par 'gyur ba yang spyi'i bdag nyid du smra bar mi bya'o //
translated: It would be necessary to say that the specific nature does not exist and the general nature exists.

original: spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du yod pa dang me dpar 'gyur ba yang cig car smra bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du yod pa dang me dpar 'gyur ba yang cig car smra bar mi bya'o //
translated: It would be necessary to say that the general and specific natures both exist and do not exist simultaneously.

original: yul dang dus dang / rim pa dang / rnam pa la ltos te thams cad smra bar mi bya'o zhes pa ni gang don gyi bya ba byed pa de ni tshad ma'i tha snyad kyi rjes su mthun pas na yod do //
analyzed: yul dang dus dang / rim pa dang / rnam pa la ltos te thams cad smra bar mi bya'o zhes pa ni gang don gyi bya ba byed pa de ni tshad ma'i tha snyad kyi rjes su mthun pas na yod do //
translated: That which performs the function of an object is said to exist, because it accords with the conventions of valid cognition.

original: lhag ma spyir brtags pa ni don gyi byed pa mi nus pas na kun brtags pa nyid de /
analyzed: lhag ma spyir brtags pa ni don gyi byed pa mi nus pas na kun brtags pa nyid de /
translated: The rest, which are generally imagined, are only imagined, because they are incapable of performing the function of an object.

original: dpyod pa can rnams kyi gcig pa dang / tha dad par gnyis su smra ba yang gcig po la rang bzhin gnyis su mi rung ngo //üîΩrtag pa dang mi rtag ces bya ba ni ne yi ya yi ka dang khyad par can smra ba brtsams pa yan @125b lag can gyi rdzas ni mi rtag la /
analyzed: dpyod pa can rnams kyi gcig pa dang / tha dad par gnyis su smra ba yang gcig po la rang bzhin gnyis su mi rung ngo // rtag pa dang mi rtag ces bya ba ni ne yi ya yi ka dang khyad par can smra ba brtsams pa yan @125b lag can gyi rdzas ni mi rtag la /
translated: The two assertions of the Vai≈õe·π£ikas, that a thing is both one and different, are also untenable, because a single thing cannot have two natures.üîΩThe assertion of the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas that a thing is both permanent and impermanent is also untenable.üîΩThe permanent is the subtle particles of the elements that are the beginningless and endless constituents of things.

original: rtsom pa'i rdul phra mo rnams ni rtag ste /
analyzed: rtsom pa'i rdul phra mo rnams ni rtag ste /
translated: The impermanent is the substance that is the possessor of parts, which is the beginning of creation.

original: de dag gi yan lag rnam par phye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi yan lag rnam par phye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because its parts are not divisible.

original: sbyor ba rnam par phye ba la sogs pa tha dad par dbye ba ni rtag go zhes pa g-yo ba med pa'i chos de dag gi rang bzhin yang gzhan du g-yo ba'i chos nyid ni mi rtog pa kho na ste gsal bar gnas kyi rim par 'byed na
analyzed: sbyor ba rnam par phye ba la sogs pa tha dad par dbye ba ni rtag go zhes pa g-yo ba med pa'i chos de dag gi rang bzhin yang gzhan du g-yo ba'i chos nyid ni mi rtog pa kho na ste gsal bar gnas kyi rim par 'byed na
translated: It is clearly present, but if it is differentiated in sequence,

original: shing dang thal ba lta bur gcig par mi rigs so //
analyzed: shing dang thal ba lta bur gcig par mi rigs so //
translated: it is not reasonable to be the same as wood and ashes.

original: mi gnyis par smra ba rnams kyis tshig pa du ma par smra ba 'jig rten mtha' dag ni tshangs pa dang dbang po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin bar kun rtog pa ste /
analyzed: mi gnyis par smra ba rnams kyis tshig pa du ma par smra ba 'jig rten mtha' dag ni tshangs pa dang dbang po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin bar kun rtog pa ste /
translated: The many who speak of nonduality, the entire world speaks of the nature of Brahma, Ishvara, etc., as imagination.

original: de lta bur yang grol ba dang ma grol ba dang / phyug dbul la sogs pa gcig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bur yang grol ba dang ma grol ba dang / phyug dbul la sogs pa gcig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the error of oneness would occur for the liberated and the unliberated, the wealthy and the poor, etc.

original: des na thams cad mkhyen pas bsgrub par mdzad pa sems tsam du khong du ma chud pa'i phyir gnyis pa dang / mi gnyis par smra ba rnams sems kyi rgyud la phyi rol gyi don du rnam par rtog pa dang / rtag pa dang / gcig pur rnam par rtog go //
analyzed: des na thams cad mkhyen pas bsgrub par mdzad pa sems tsam du khong du ma chud pa'i phyir gnyis pa dang / mi gnyis par smra ba rnams sems kyi rgyud la phyi rol gyi don du rnam par rtog pa dang / rtag pa dang / gcig pur rnam par rtog go //
translated: Those who speak of non-duality imagine external objects in the mind-stream, and they imagine permanence and unity.

original: des na sems kyi rgyud la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba rnam par gzhag tu rung ngo //
analyzed: des na sems kyi rgyud la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba rnam par gzhag tu rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not possible for them to posit the mind-stream as being either afflicted or purified.

original: de la bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang gi mthu las khyad par du bya ba rung ngo //
analyzed: de la bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang gi mthu las khyad par du bya ba rung ngo //
translated: In this regard, it is possible to posit a distinction based on the power of one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô mind-streams.

original: sems 'di ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste /
analyzed: sems 'di ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste /
translated: This mind is naturally luminous.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i mngon par 'du byed pa rnams kyis sus ji ltar yongs su sbyong ba de de ltar 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i mngon par 'du byed pa rnams kyis sus ji ltar yongs su sbyong ba de de ltar 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is accomplished in whatever way it is purified by the formative forces of virtue and nonvirtue.

original: de de ltar stong pa'i 'du byed rnams la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i las kyi 'bras bur 'brel par rnam par gzhag go //üîΩsnang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa rnams ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de /üîΩyod pa dang / med pa dang / gcig pa dang / tha dad pa dang / gnyis ka dang / gnyis ka ma yin pa dang / yod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: de de ltar stong pa'i 'du byed rnams la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i las kyi 'bras bur 'brel par rnam par gzhag go // snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa rnams ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de / yod pa dang / med pa dang / gcig pa dang / tha dad pa dang / gnyis ka dang / gnyis ka ma yin pa dang / yod pa yang ma yin /
translated: Thus, in regard to compounded things which are empty of intrinsic reality, the result of the action of defilement and purification is established as being related.üîΩThose who abide in the meditative absorption of appearance and non-appearance are non-dual, having abandoned conceptual thoughts such as existence and non-existence, one and different, both and neither, neither existence nor non-existence, permanence and impermanence, and so on.

original: med pa yang ma yin pa dang / rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs te rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i mi gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin pa dang / rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs te rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i mi gnyis pa'o //
translated: The all-knowing one is non-dual.

original: sa'i mtshams sbyor zhing zhes bya ba ni snang ba med pa la rim pa ga la zhig ces der gsungs mod kyi /
analyzed: sa'i mtshams sbyor zhing zhes bya ba ni snang ba med pa la rim pa ga la zhig ces der gsungs mod kyi /
translated: The connection of the stages of the levels is stated there, ‚ÄúHow is there a sequence in non-appearance?‚Äù

original: snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis sa'i rim pa'i mtshams sbyor @126a * //
analyzed: snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis sa'i rim pa'i mtshams sbyor @126a * //
translated: The connection of the stages of the levels is by the meditative absorption of appearance.

original: te ; mdo sde 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa sa bcu gnyis por 'jug go //
analyzed: te ; mdo sde 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa sa bcu gnyis por 'jug go //
translated: In this Sutra, the Tathagata enters the twelve stages.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs las dben pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba mi gnyis par zhugs pa rnams ni byed pa dang / byed pa po las skye bar smra ba po ma yin no //üîΩne yi ya yi ka la sogs pa ni med pa las 'bras bu 'byung zhing yod pa yang rkyen dbyig pa la sogs pas gzhig par rtog pa la rmi lam bzhin du dngos po rnams ma skyes pa'am /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs las dben pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba mi gnyis par zhugs pa rnams ni byed pa dang / byed pa po las skye bar smra ba po ma yin no // ne yi ya yi ka la sogs pa ni med pa las 'bras bu 'byung zhing yod pa yang rkyen dbyig pa la sogs pas gzhig par rtog pa la rmi lam bzhin du dngos po rnams ma skyes pa'am /
translated: The phrase isolated from the position of existence and non-existence means that those who have entered the non-dual state, free from the discrimination of entity and non-entity, do not speak of arising from action and agent.

original: skyes pa smra bar bya'o //
analyzed: skyes pa smra bar bya'o //
translated: In the case of the Nyaya, Vaisheshika, and so forth, one should say that things are either unarisen or arisen like a dream, since they imagine that effects arise from non-existence and existence is destroyed by conditions such as a stick.

original: blo gros chen po rgol ba pha rol po rnams kyi tshad ma gsum gyi yan lag gi phyir glags tshol bar 'gyur bas na chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes thog ma nyid du yi dam bca' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen po rgol ba pha rol po rnams kyi tshad ma gsum gyi yan lag gi phyir glags tshol bar 'gyur bas na chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes thog ma nyid du yi dam bca' bar mi bya'o //
translated: Mahamati, one should not initially make the assertion all phenomena are empty because opponents will seek an opportunity based on the three means of valid cognition.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i dgongs pa ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i dgongs pa ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is the intention of the Omniscient One?

original: tshad ma la rang bzhin gsum gyi mtshan ma rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: tshad ma la rang bzhin gsum gyi mtshan ma rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: The characteristics of the three kinds of valid knowledge are to be established.

original: gang la dgongs she na /
analyzed: gang la dgongs she na /
translated: With what intention?

original: gzhal bas na de mtshungs pa dang / dngos po yod min med par nges //
analyzed: gzhal bas na de mtshungs pa dang / dngos po yod min med par nges //
translated: Because of the evaluation, the similarity of that, and the ascertainment of the existence and non-existence of things.

original: yi dam gyis ni bsgrub par mi rung ste /
analyzed: yi dam gyis ni bsgrub par mi rung ste /
translated: It is not suitable to establish it by mere assertion,

original: the tshom skye bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: the tshom skye bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would give rise to doubt.

original: rang bzhin gsum gyi mtshan ma dang 'brel par khyab par smra bas ni rtogs par byed pas na bsgrun pa dang bsdu ba dag ni mi dgongs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gsum gyi mtshan ma dang 'brel par khyab par smra bas ni rtogs par byed pas na bsgrun pa dang bsdu ba dag ni mi dgongs so //
translated: One who speaks of pervasion in connection with the characteristics of the three kinds of valid knowledge does not intend the proof and inclusion, because it is understood.

original: de de ltar de'i bdag nyid dang de ltar skyes par 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de de ltar de'i bdag nyid dang de ltar skyes par 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Thus, the characteristic of the connection of identity and origination.

original: rang bzhin gsum gyis chud par byed pa yin gyi /üîΩyang 'brel pa ma gtogs par mthong ba dang / ma mthong ba tsam gyis bsgrub pa kho na'am /
analyzed: rang bzhin gsum gyis chud par byed pa yin gyi / yang 'brel pa ma gtogs par mthong ba dang / ma mthong ba tsam gyis bsgrub pa kho na'am /
translated: It is pervaded by the three kinds of valid knowledge,

original: sun 'byin pa kho na mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa kho na mi rung ngo //
translated: but apart from the connection, mere seeing or non-seeing is not suitable as proof or refutation alone.

original: gang dag stong pa yin bde ba dag la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang pa dang / rnam par gzhag tu med de /
analyzed: gang dag stong pa yin bde ba dag la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang pa dang / rnam par gzhag tu med de /
translated: purification, or establishment.

original: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du stong la /
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du stong la /
translated: Like the son of a barren woman and so on, they are empty.üîΩ‚ÄúThings do not exist‚Äù is a response that appears in all philosophical systems.

original: dngos po med ces slar rgol ba de grub pa'i mtha' thams cad kyi tshul gyis snang ba tsam la rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul lta bur chos dang chos can rnam par gzhag gi nam mkha'i me tog ltar stong pa ma yin te /üîΩbyis pas dngos por rnam par brtags pa de lta bur med do zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs nas byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis rang gi sems snang ba tsam du khong du ma chud @126b pa'i phyir rtag pa dang / bdag dang /
analyzed: dngos po med ces slar rgol ba de grub pa'i mtha' thams cad kyi tshul gyis snang ba tsam la rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul lta bur chos dang chos can rnam par gzhag gi nam mkha'i me tog ltar stong pa ma yin te / byis pas dngos por rnam par brtags pa de lta bur med do zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs nas byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis rang gi sems snang ba tsam du khong du ma chud @126b pa'i phyir rtag pa dang / bdag dang /
translated: The mere appearance is like a dream or an illusion. Phenomena and subjects are established. They are not empty like a sky flower.

original: phyi'i don du kun rtog par byed do //
analyzed: phyi'i don du kun rtog par byed do //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn, thinking that the childish do not exist in the way they are imagined to be substantial entities, said, ‚ÄúChildish, ordinary beings do not understand that the appearances of their own minds are mere appearances. Therefore they imagine external objects to be permanent, a self,üîΩand substantial entities.‚Äù

original: de yang rtag pa dang / gcig pa dang / gnyis ka dang / gnyis ka ma yin pa dang / yod pa dang / med pa la sogs pa rtsod pa'i gnas lngar smras pa rnams so //
analyzed: de yang rtag pa dang / gcig pa dang / gnyis ka dang / gnyis ka ma yin pa dang / yod pa dang / med pa la sogs pa rtsod pa'i gnas lngar smras pa rnams so //
translated: The five topics of dispute are permanence, unity, both, neither, existence, nonexistence, and so on.

original: snang ba tsam de la tshad ma dang / gzhal bya'i tha dad dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por rung ngo //
analyzed: snang ba tsam de la tshad ma dang / gzhal bya'i tha dad dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por rung ngo //
translated: In that mere appearance, valid knowledge and the distinction between objects of valid knowledge and the cause and effect of things are suitable.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mi 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mi 'byung ba ste /
translated: Dependent origination does not occur.

original: lhag pa'i byed pa dang / byed pa po dang / skyed pa dang / skyed pa po la sogs pa'i chos dang 'brel pa med cing bral ba ni de ma thag pa tsam gyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'ba' zhig ste snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod pas 'di yod par 'gyur ro zhes pa ste /
analyzed: lhag pa'i byed pa dang / byed pa po dang / skyed pa dang / skyed pa po la sogs pa'i chos dang 'brel pa med cing bral ba ni de ma thag pa tsam gyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'ba' zhig ste snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod pas 'di yod par 'gyur ro zhes pa ste /
translated: The absence of connection with and separation from phenomena such as the additional action, the agent, the produced, and the producer are merely the cause and effect of the mere antecedent condition, which is ‚Äúbecause this exists, this occurs‚Äù in the aftermath of the previous.

original: cig car dang rim du 'jug pa dang / 'brel pa med pa ni gang gi tshe na skad cig pa gcig yod pa de'i tshe na gzhan med de /
analyzed: cig car dang rim du 'jug pa dang / 'brel pa med pa ni gang gi tshe na skad cig pa gcig yod pa de'i tshe na gzhan med de /
translated: Simultaneous and sequential engagement and the absence of connection are when one instant exists, at that time the other does not exist.

original: skad cig pa gcig ni su dang yang 'brel pa med do //
analyzed: skad cig pa gcig ni su dang yang 'brel pa med do //
translated: One moment is not related to anything else.

original: de bas na skad cig pa'i rang bzhin ma rtogs par kun tu brtags pa'i chos rnams brjod du med pa'i rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba la sogs pa dang / bdag med pa gnyis la yang mi srid do zhes lan du mar bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na skad cig pa'i rang bzhin ma rtogs par kun tu brtags pa'i chos rnams brjod du med pa'i rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba la sogs pa dang / bdag med pa gnyis la yang mi srid do zhes lan du mar bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, without understanding the nature of momentariness, it is impossible to express the imagined phenomena in terms of the inexpressible dependent origination, etc., and the two selflessnesses. This has been explained many times.

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba dang / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa la sogs pa bsgoms pas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa yongs su zad pa'i phyir 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal zad par 'jug go //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba dang / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa la sogs pa bsgoms pas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa yongs su zad pa'i phyir 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal zad par 'jug go //
translated: By cultivating dependent origination, impermanence, suffering, ugliness, etc., the sufferings of cyclic existence are brought to an end because the afflictions such as attachment are completely extinguished.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa bsgom pa na shes rab kyis dpyad de snang ba med pa dang / snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin snying rjes nye bar bzung ba thob pa dang / gzhan la phan pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'jug go //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa bsgom pa na shes rab kyis dpyad de snang ba med pa dang / snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin snying rjes nye bar bzung ba thob pa dang / gzhan la phan pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'jug go //
translated: When cultivating emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, one analyzes with wisdom, and attains the samƒÅdhi that is free from appearances and endowed with appearances, and one enters omniscience in order to benefit others.üîΩOmniscience teaches that one should engage with signs by way of the mode of the pervasion of the probandum and the probans through many causes and examples with regard to the individual appearances.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas so sor snang ba la rgyu dang dpe rnam pa mang po rnams kyis bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa khyab pa'i tshul gyis mtshan mar 'jug pa nyid du gsungs pa mya ngan gyi smig rgyu chur snang ba la phyin ci logüîΩtu sgro btags te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas so sor snang ba la rgyu dang dpe rnam pa mang po rnams kyis bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa khyab pa'i tshul gyis mtshan mar 'jug pa nyid du gsungs pa mya ngan gyi smig rgyu chur snang ba la phyin ci log tu sgro btags te /
translated: Just as one who is deluded by a mirage of water in the desert superimposes a mistake,

original: lhag par chags par byed pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa la mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du phyi'i don @127a * //üîΩdu 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: lhag par chags par byed pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa la mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du phyi'i don @127a * //üîΩdu 'khrul pa'o //
translated: and becomes attached to it, in the same way, one is confused about external objects, like one who is dizzy or fainting.

original: de lta bus ngas yang dri za'i grong khyer dang / rab rib can dang / mgal me'i 'khor lo dang / gzugs brnyan dang / chu'i chu bur dang / rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / brag ca la sogs pa'i snang ba'i chos can la tshad ma dang gzhal bya'i tha snyad du slu ba dang mi slu ba gdon mi za ba ni ji ltar rmi lam gyi dus na phyi'i don med par yang mya ngan gyi smig rgyu la sogs pa'i chus 'khru
analyzed: de lta bus ngas yang dri za'i grong khyer dang / rab rib can dang / mgal me'i 'khor lo dang / gzugs brnyan dang / chu'i chu bur dang / rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / brag ca la sogs pa'i snang ba'i chos can la tshad ma dang gzhal bya'i tha snyad du slu ba dang mi slu ba gdon mi za ba ni ji ltar rmi lam gyi dus na phyi'i don med par yang mya ngan gyi smig rgyu la sogs pa'i chus 'khru
translated: In the same way, I will explain the conventional terms of valid knowledge and objects of comprehension in regard to deceptive and non-deceptive phenomena such as the city of gandharvas, a mirage, a firebrand circle, a reflection, a water bubble, a dream, an illusion, an echo, and so on.

original: ba dang / btung ba la sogs pa ni slu ba med /
analyzed: ba dang / btung ba la sogs pa ni slu ba med /
translated: Undoubtedly, at the time of a dream, even though external objects do not exist, the appearance of water in a mirage and so on is not deceptive in terms of washing, drinking, and so on.

original: mtsho la sogs pa ni slu ba med /
analyzed: mtsho la sogs pa ni slu ba med /
translated: A lake and so on is not deceptive.

original: de bzhin du gnyid kyis log pa'i dus na yang 'khrul ba rnam pa sna tshogs las slu ba dang slu ba med par nges pas tha snyad pa rnams la tshad ma dang gzhal bya rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyid kyis log pa'i dus na yang 'khrul ba rnam pa sna tshogs las slu ba dang slu ba med par nges pas tha snyad pa rnams la tshad ma dang gzhal bya rnam par gzhag go //
translated: In the same way, even at the time of sleep, one should ascertain the deceptive and nondeceptive aspects of various illusions.

original: rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pas rtog pa gsal ba mngon sum du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pas rtog pa gsal ba mngon sum du gsungs pa ste /
translated: The statement non-conceptuality in accordance with the conditions is the direct statement of the clarity of the conception of omniscience.

original: ji ltar slob dpon dharma k'irtis sgrub par byed pa /
analyzed: ji ltar slob dpon dharma k'irtis sgrub par byed pa /
translated: As master Dharmika Kirti establishes:

original: mthong ba bzhin du 'di nyid ni //
analyzed: mthong ba bzhin du 'di nyid ni //
translated: Just as it is seen,

original: gzung ba 'dzin pa rig pa rnams //
analyzed: gzung ba 'dzin pa rig pa rnams //
translated: the awareness of the apprehended and the apprehender

original: yod pa min gang tshad ma dang // gzhal bya 'bras bu gzhag par bya //
analyzed: yod pa min gang tshad ma dang // gzhal bya 'bras bu gzhag par bya //
translated: is posited as the result of the valid cognition and the object of comprehension.

original: zhes te / sems can rnams kyi rang gi chud pa'i rgyu 'dus pa 'khor ba dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyus 'dus pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang dang / rkyen gyi khyad par dang / 'khrul pa'i sa bon las las byung ba ni rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa'i mgo 'khor ba dang /
analyzed: zhes te / sems can rnams kyi rang gi chud pa'i rgyu 'dus pa 'khor ba dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyus 'dus pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang dang / rkyen gyi khyad par dang / 'khrul pa'i sa bon las las byung ba ni rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa'i mgo 'khor ba dang /
translated: The cause of the samsara of the collection of one's own continuum of sentient beings, the collection of the cause of self and other, the special power of the continuum of self and other, and the seed of delusion arising from karma is the various types of the head of samsara.

original: brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin pa dang / rmi lam bzang po dang / rmi lam ngan pa rnam par smin pa ltar bsod nams dang sdig par snang ba'i las dang 'bras bur nges par 'brel pa las sems can rnams kyi 'khor ba byung ba ni shes rab gyis  dpyad de /
analyzed: brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin pa dang / rmi lam bzang po dang / rmi lam ngan pa rnam par smin pa ltar bsod nams dang sdig par snang ba'i las dang 'bras bur nges par 'brel pa las sems can rnams kyi 'khor ba byung ba ni shes rab gyis  dpyad de /
translated: Just as in the case of fainting, etc., and just as in the case of the ripening of good and bad dreams, samsara arises for sentient beings from the connection of the cause and effect of virtuous and sinful actions.üîΩHaving understood this through the wisdom of analysis, and having cultivated the understanding of impermanence, suffering, ugliness, and emptiness, one turns away from samsara.

original: rnam par shes nas mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa dang / stong par bsgoms pas log nas bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal pa'i chud pa na thugs rje'i bag chags bskul ba ni thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes nas mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa dang / stong par bsgoms pas log nas bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal pa'i chud pa na thugs rje'i bag chags bskul ba ni thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one enters into the non-conceptual, non-apparent ultimate truth, which is non-dual and naturally luminous, the latent tendencies of compassion are activated and one becomes omniscient.

original: de'i phyir de ltar sems kyi rgyud nyid la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam @127b par byang ba rnam par gzhag par mdzad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar sems kyi rgyud nyid la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam @127b par byang ba rnam par gzhag par mdzad do //
translated: Therefore, the continuum of mind itself is posited as being both afflicted and purified.

original: gang dang gang rnam par dag par 'gyur ba de dang de dngos po ste gos bzhin no //
analyzed: gang dang gang rnam par dag par 'gyur ba de dang de dngos po ste gos bzhin no //
translated: Whatever is purified is a thing, like a cloth.üîΩAnd since the mind is also purified, it is a thing.

original: sems kyang rnam par dag par 'gyur bas na de'i phyir de yang dngos po yin zhes rang bzhin gsum gyi mtshan mas dngos po par bden pa'i don du phyir rgol bar byed do //
analyzed: sems kyang rnam par dag par 'gyur bas na de'i phyir de yang dngos po yin zhes rang bzhin gsum gyi mtshan mas dngos po par bden pa'i don du phyir rgol bar byed do //
translated: Thus, the opponent argues that things exist in reality, characterized by the three natures.

original: gang dang gang stong pa yin pa de dang de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: gang dang gang stong pa yin pa de dang de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang bral ba ste /
translated: Whatever is empty is devoid of defilement and purification.üîΩIt is empty like the horn of a rabbit.

original: ri bong gi rva ltar mi gnyis par stong ngo zhes de rang bzhin gsum gyi tshad ma de gsum gyis rgol ba spong bar thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa ;
analyzed: ri bong gi rva ltar mi gnyis par stong ngo zhes de rang bzhin gsum gyi tshad ma de gsum gyis rgol ba spong bar thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa ;
translated: Thus, the Omniscient One has said that the three valid cognitions of the three natures refute the opponent.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi ye shes la ni dngos pa dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa med de /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi ye shes la ni dngos pa dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa med de /
translated: The wisdom of the noble ones does not conceive of things and non-things.

original: sems pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa tsam der dngos po'i rnam par rtog pa med la /
analyzed: sems pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa tsam der dngos po'i rnam par rtog pa med la /
translated: There are no conceptual thoughts about entities,

original: dngos po ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang med do //
analyzed: dngos po ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang med do //
translated: nor are there conceptual thoughts about nonentities.üîΩIt is naturally luminous, like gold and so on, and it is always connected.

original: de rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ni gser la sogs pa lta bur rgyun du 'brel cing glo bur gyi dri ma spangs te /
analyzed: de rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ni gser la sogs pa lta bur rgyun du 'brel cing glo bur gyi dri ma spangs te /
translated: It is stainless, free of adventitious contaminants,

original: dri ma med cing sus kyang ma byas pas na 'dus ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: dri ma med cing sus kyang ma byas pas na 'dus ma byas pa ste /
translated: and it is uncompounded, not created by anyone.

original: ji ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las 'byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las 'byung ba /
translated: As the S≈´tra Unraveling the Intention says:

original: skad cig pa'i phyir 'dus byas so //
analyzed: skad cig pa'i phyir 'dus byas so //
translated: Because it is momentary, it is compounded.

original: sus kyang ma byas shing rgyun du gnas pas na 'dus ma byas pa dang rtag par dgongs pa ste /üîΩde bzhin gshegs pa byung yang rung /
analyzed: sus kyang ma byas shing rgyun du gnas pas na 'dus ma byas pa dang rtag par dgongs pa ste / de bzhin gshegs pa byung yang rung /
translated: Because it is not created by anyone and remains continuously, it is uncompounded and permanent.üîΩThis is the intention.

original: ma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: Whether a tathƒÅgata appears or not,

original: chos nyid de ni gnas pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs par ro //
analyzed: chos nyid de ni gnas pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs par ro //
translated: the reality of phenomena remains.

original: chos nyid kyang rtag pas sgra'i don gyi khyad par du 'byed pa ni gsher ba dang / dro ba dang / sra ba dang / g-yo ba dang / gzugs can dang / gzugs med pa mi rtag pa rnams kyi mi rtag pa nyid gzhan pa'i chos ma yin pa lta bur ro //
analyzed: chos nyid kyang rtag pas sgra'i don gyi khyad par du 'byed pa ni gsher ba dang / dro ba dang / sra ba dang / g-yo ba dang / gzugs can dang / gzugs med pa mi rtag pa rnams kyi mi rtag pa nyid gzhan pa'i chos ma yin pa lta bur ro //
translated: Reality is also permanent, so it is not a distinct object of the word.

original: gang dag yang blo mkhas pa rnams kyis chos dang chos can dang / yon tan dang / yon tan can gyi dngos por gleng bar byed pa de dag la yang chos ni chos can dang bral ba dang / chos can yang chos dang bral bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gang dag yang blo mkhas pa rnams kyis chos dang chos can dang / yon tan dang / yon tan can gyi dngos por gleng bar byed pa de dag la yang chos ni chos can dang bral ba dang / chos can yang chos dang bral bar mi rung ngo //
