translated: And in the case of those things that are discussed by the wise as the property and the possessor of the property, the quality and the possessor of the quality, it is not tenable that the property is separate from the possessor of the property, or the possessor of the property is separate from the property.

original: de bzhin du mtshan nyid dang / mtshan mar bya ba yang gcig dang tha dad pa ma yin pa bzhin du @128a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du mtshan nyid dang / mtshan mar bya ba yang gcig dang tha dad pa ma yin pa bzhin du @128a * //
translated: In the same way, the characteristic and the characterized are not the same or different.

original: sems kyis stong pa nyid bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyis stong pa nyid bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: In this way, the emptiness of mind is established.

original: phyi dang nang gi tshig gi don rnams la yon tan dang yon tan can pa'i dngos por mi rung ba ni 'dus pa la 'di ni gzugs dang ldan pa dang / 'di ni reg pa dang ldan pa'o zhes yon tan dang / yon tan can par smra ba la rdzas kyis rdzas gzhan rtsom pa dang /
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi tshig gi don rnams la yon tan dang yon tan can pa'i dngos por mi rung ba ni 'dus pa la 'di ni gzugs dang ldan pa dang / 'di ni reg pa dang ldan pa'o zhes yon tan dang / yon tan can par smra ba la rdzas kyis rdzas gzhan rtsom pa dang /
translated: The meaning of the words ‚Äúouter‚Äù and ‚Äúinner‚Äù is not suitable as a thing that is a quality and a possessor of qualities, because in the case of a composite, it is said that this is endowed with form and that is endowed with contact.

original: yon tan gyis yon tan gzhan zhes khyad par can rtog go //
analyzed: yon tan gyis yon tan gzhan zhes khyad par can rtog go //
translated: In the case of a possessor of qualities, it is conceived that a substance composes another substance, and in the case of a quality, it is conceived that a quality composes another quality.

original: gcer bu pa rnams rnam pa bdun du 'byed pa'i rtsod pa'i gnas lung bstan du med pa yod par 'gyur ba dang / med par 'gyur ba la sogs pa sngar bshad pa rnams dang / yod pa las skye ba dang med pa las skye ba grangs can dang khyad par can gyi rtag pa las bde bar gshegs pa'i grub pa'i mtha' theg pa chen por yod pa dang med pa las mi skye'o zhes thams cad mkhyen pas bsgrub par mdzad pa rten cing
analyzed: gcer bu pa rnams rnam pa bdun du 'byed pa'i rtsod pa'i gnas lung bstan du med pa yod par 'gyur ba dang / med par 'gyur ba la sogs pa sngar bshad pa rnams dang / yod pa las skye ba dang med pa las skye ba grangs can dang khyad par can gyi rtag pa las bde bar gshegs pa'i grub pa'i mtha' theg pa chen por yod pa dang med pa las mi skye'o zhes thams cad mkhyen pas bsgrub par mdzad pa rten cing
translated: The naked ascetics have seven types of debate, such as the unstated, the stated, the existent, the nonexistent, and so on, as previously explained.

original: 'brel te 'byung ba byed pa dang / byed pa po dang mngon par 'brel ba dang bral ba thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'brel te 'byung ba byed pa dang / byed pa po dang mngon par 'brel ba dang bral ba thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
translated: The omniscient one established that arising from existence and arising from nonexistence are refuted in the MahƒÅyƒÅna tenets of the Sugata, and that dependent origination is free from activity, agent, and so on.

original: gang gi tshe na skad cig ma yod pa de'i tshe na skad cig ma phyi ma med de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na skad cig ma yod pa de'i tshe na skad cig ma phyi ma med de /
translated: When an instant exists, the subsequent instant does not exist.

original: ji ltar na dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis 'brel par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar na dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis 'brel par 'gyur /
translated: How could existence and nonexistence be related?

original: de'i phyir skad cig pa gcig pu dang yang mi 'brel to //
analyzed: de'i phyir skad cig pa gcig pu dang yang mi 'brel to //
translated: Therefore, it is not related to a single moment.

original: khyad par can dang lung ston pa rnams kyi skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams byed pa dang byed pa po dang mngon par 'brel par kun tu brtag pa ni tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: khyad par can dang lung ston pa rnams kyi skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams byed pa dang byed pa po dang mngon par 'brel par kun tu brtag pa ni tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin par mi rung ngo //
translated: The arising, ceasing, cessation, etc. of the special and the prophesied are not related to the agent and action, whether they are different or not different.

original: gal te byed pa dang tha dad pa zhig na ni su zhig sprel bar byed /
analyzed: gal te byed pa dang tha dad pa zhig na ni su zhig sprel bar byed /
translated: If they are different from the agent, who is related to them?

original: 'on te tha dad pa ma yin na ni byed pa dang byed pa por mchis na tha dad pa zhes bya /
analyzed: 'on te tha dad pa ma yin na ni byed pa dang byed pa por mchis na tha dad pa zhes bya /
translated: If they are not different, then the agent and action exist, but are called different.

original: de de ltar thams cad mkhyen pas yod pa dang med pa rim dang cig car du skye bas na byed pa dang / byed pa po mngon par 'brel par kun brtags pa ni bkag go //
analyzed: de de ltar thams cad mkhyen pas yod pa dang med pa rim dang cig car du skye bas na byed pa dang / byed pa po mngon par 'brel par kun brtags pa ni bkag go //
translated: Thus, the Omniscient One refutes the relation of the agent and action, whether they arise simultaneously or successively, whether they exist or not.

original: snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod pas 'di yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba 'ba' zhig ste /
analyzed: snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod pas 'di yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba 'ba' zhig ste /
translated: Only the dependent origination is stated: ‚ÄúWhen this exists, this will come to be.‚Äù

original: de ltar na las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa so sor nges pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de ltar na las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa so sor nges pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, the connection between action and effect is established as having a specific nature.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba yang dag par rig par gsungs pa la theg pa chen po pa rnams la dkar @128b po'i phyogs rtsa ba nas phyung ba yin gyis /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba yang dag par rig par gsungs pa la theg pa chen po pa rnams la dkar @128b po'i phyogs rtsa ba nas phyung ba yin gyis /
translated: With regard to the statement that the completely afflicted and the completely purified are real, the MahƒÅyƒÅna is the extraction of the root of the white side.

original: legs pa 'dod pa rnams kyis spang bar bya'o zhes pa blun po dag gis ci'i phyir na spong bar byed /
analyzed: legs pa 'dod pa rnams kyis spang bar bya'o zhes pa blun po dag gis ci'i phyir na spong bar byed /
translated: Why do fools reject it, saying, ‚ÄúThose who desire what is good should abandon it‚Äù?

original: des na rnam pa de lta bu ba ni sems can dmyal bar gzhol bar 'gyur ro zhes thams cad mkhyen pas lung bstan to //
analyzed: des na rnam pa de lta bu ba ni sems can dmyal bar gzhol bar 'gyur ro zhes thams cad mkhyen pas lung bstan to //
translated: Therefore the Omniscient One declared, ‚ÄúThose of this type will fall into the hells.‚Äù

original: mu stegs can smra ba'i lung du mi ston pa ni chos dang chos can bzhin du tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin du med de /
analyzed: mu stegs can smra ba'i lung du mi ston pa ni chos dang chos can bzhin du tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin du med de /
translated: With regard to the non-Buddhist scriptures, the self is not of the nature of being different or not different from the aggregates, just as the dharma is not different from the dharmin.

original: gcer bu pa rnams kyi srog de ni lus zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gcer bu pa rnams kyi srog de ni lus zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The Jains say that the self is the body and so on.

original: 'du ba dang ni rgyas pa dang // srog ni lus kyi tshad can te //
analyzed: 'du ba dang ni rgyas pa dang // srog ni lus kyi tshad can te //
translated: and it is the soul that is the cause of the growth and increase of the body.

original: de ni rigs pas 'dir smras te //
analyzed: de ni rigs pas 'dir smras te //
translated: This is the argument that is advanced here,

original: phra ba gang yang ma yin no //üîΩmar me'i 'od ni snod yangs pa //
analyzed: phra ba gang yang ma yin no // mar me'i 'od ni snod yangs pa //
translated: and it is not at all subtle.üîΩJust as the light of a lamp spreads

original: 'phros pa bzhin du 'dod pa de //üîΩchu yi snod la til mar thigs //
analyzed: 'phros pa bzhin du 'dod pa de // chu yi snod la til mar thigs //
translated: in a large vessel,

original: gang zhig 'phros pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: gang zhig 'phros pa bzhin du'o //
translated: so does the soul spreadüîΩin a large body.

original: zhes so // ne yi ya yi ka dang / grangs can dang / khyad par can rnams kyi srog ni gzhan la lus ni gzhan no //
analyzed: zhes so // ne yi ya yi ka dang / grangs can dang / khyad par can rnams kyi srog ni gzhan la lus ni gzhan no //
translated: The soul of the NaiyƒÅyikas, SƒÅ·πÉkhyas, and Vai≈õe·π£ikas is one thing, and the body is another.

original: rig sngags 'dzin pa'i mthar smra ba dang / zhi ba mi gnyis par smra ba rnams kyis bdag ni rtag pa gcig pu khyab pa'o //
analyzed: rig sngags 'dzin pa'i mthar smra ba dang / zhi ba mi gnyis par smra ba rnams kyis bdag ni rtag pa gcig pu khyab pa'o //
translated: The VedƒÅntins, who propound the end of the mantra, and the Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsakas, who propound non-duality, say that the self is permanent, one, and all-pervading.

original: de de ltar rtag pa gcig pu dang / tha dad pa dang / gnyis ka ma yin pa dang / yod pa dang / med pa la sogs pa smra ba po gzhan rnams kyi mtha' rnam pa bzhir smra ba bsgrub pa'i mtha' tha dad pa thams cad do //
analyzed: de de ltar rtag pa gcig pu dang / tha dad pa dang / gnyis ka ma yin pa dang / yod pa dang / med pa la sogs pa smra ba po gzhan rnams kyi mtha' rnam pa bzhir smra ba bsgrub pa'i mtha' tha dad pa thams cad do //
translated: Thus, those who propound permanence, oneness, difference, both, neither, existence, non-existence, and so on, all have different philosophical positions that propound the four extremes.

original: bdun pa ni sngar dpyad pa'o //
analyzed: bdun pa ni sngar dpyad pa'o //
translated: The seventh is the previous analysis.

original: rtag pa ni ma skyes pas na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rtag pa ni ma skyes pas na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Permanence is unborn, like the son of a barren woman and so on.

original: bdag med pa gnyis la shes rab kyis dpyad de /
analyzed: bdag med pa gnyis la shes rab kyis dpyad de /
translated: The two kinds of selflessness are analyzed by wisdom.

original: rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa ni de bzhin nyid dmigs pa'i bsam gtan no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa ni de bzhin nyid dmigs pa'i bsam gtan no //
translated: Conceptualization and so on are the concentration of observing suchness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa sgrib pa med par shes par bya ba thams cad kyi de kho na nyid kyi rnam pa la 'jug cing snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par gzhog pas ye shes kyi mtshan nyid grub nas gnyis su med pa stong zhing ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa sgrib pa med par shes par bya ba thams cad kyi de kho na nyid kyi rnam pa la 'jug cing snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par gzhog pas ye shes kyi mtshan nyid grub nas gnyis su med pa stong zhing ma skyes pa'o //
translated: On the stage of the Tathagata, all that is to be known without obstruction enters the aspect of the reality of that, and by entering into the concentration of light and no light, having accomplished the characteristic of wisdom, it is nondual, empty, and unborn.

original: bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyis stong pa ma skyes pas na dngos po med pas ji ltar na gnod par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyis stong pa ma skyes pas na dngos po med pas ji ltar na gnod par mi 'gyur /
translated: Since the Sugatas are empty and unborn, how can they be harmed by nonentities?

original: de ni skyon ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni skyon ma yin te /
translated: That is not a fault.

original: sgra pa la sogs pa'i kun tu brtags pa'i byed pa dang / byed pa po mngon par 'brel pa @129a * //
analyzed: sgra pa la sogs pa'i kun tu brtags pa'i byed pa dang / byed pa po mngon par 'brel pa @129a * //
translated: because there is no relation of action and agent imagined by grammarians, etc.

original: med pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ni mi 'byung ba med de /
analyzed: med pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ni mi 'byung ba med de /
translated: Therefore, dependent origination is not non-existent.

original: snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod pas 'di zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod pas 'di zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig go //
translated: It is only that this exists after that.

original: skad cig mar 'jig pa la cig car skad cig pa gcig pu dang 'brel pa med de /
analyzed: skad cig mar 'jig pa la cig car skad cig pa gcig pu dang 'brel pa med de /
translated: In momentary destruction, there is no simultaneous relation with a single moment.

original: gang zag la bdag med pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa la yang ngo //
translated: In the selflessness of persons,

original: chos la bdag med pa la ni rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du gnyis kyi rnam pa mi skye ba ste /
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa la ni rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du gnyis kyi rnam pa mi skye ba ste /
translated: in the selflessness of dharmas, the aspect of duality does not arise, like a dream, a magical creation, etc.

original: de de lta bur na dngos po rnam gnyis kyi rnam pas stong pa'i chud pa rnams yin gyis /
analyzed: de de lta bur na dngos po rnam gnyis kyi rnam pas stong pa'i chud pa rnams yin gyis /
translated: Thus, they are empty of the two kinds of entities,

original: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams yongs su grub pas med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams yongs su grub pas med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not non-existent through complete non-existence like the son of a barren woman, etc.

original: ji ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las 'byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las 'byung ba /
translated: As it is said in the Samdhinirmocana Sutra:

original: rigs kyi bu rang bzhin med pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu rang bzhin med pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Son of noble family, there are three kinds of absence of intrinsic nature:

original: mtshan nyid rang bzhin med pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid rang bzhin med pa ste /
translated: The absence of intrinsic nature in terms of characteristics,

original: skye ba rang bzhin med pa dang / don dam pa rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba rang bzhin med pa dang / don dam pa rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: the absence of intrinsic nature in terms of arising, and the absence of intrinsic nature in terms of the ultimate.

original: de la rtag pa ni rtag pa dang / bdag dang / phyi rol gyi dang / rdul phra mos brtsams pa dang / rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las dang / spyi la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gang gis kun brtags par byed pa de dag gis de la rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: de la rtag pa ni rtag pa dang / bdag dang / phyi rol gyi dang / rdul phra mos brtsams pa dang / rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las dang / spyi la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gang gis kun brtags par byed pa de dag gis de la rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: Regarding that, the imagined nature is the absence of intrinsic nature in terms of characteristics, because it is imagined to exist by way of the characteristics of permanence, self, external things, being composed of subtle particles, substance, quality, action, universals, and so on.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi rnam pa rnams ni skye ba med pa nyid rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi rnam pa rnams ni skye ba med pa nyid rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: The dependent nature is the absence of intrinsic nature in terms of arising.

original: don dam pa la yang gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rang bzhin med cing bsam pa med pa /
analyzed: don dam pa la yang gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rang bzhin med cing bsam pa med pa /
translated: The ultimate is the absence of intrinsic nature in terms of the absence of the duality of the two kinds of absence of intrinsic nature and the absence of conceptualization.

original: snang ba med pa /
analyzed: snang ba med pa /
translated: It is the absence of intrinsic nature in terms of the absence of appearance.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba dngos po dang dngos po med pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i chud par dgongs pa la gang yang brtags pa med pa bzhin pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dngos po med pa bzhin du yongs su grub pa yang med ces smra ba de ni dam pa'i chos dang bral bar 'byung ba'i las sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba dngos po dang dngos po med pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i chud par dgongs pa la gang yang brtags pa med pa bzhin pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dngos po med pa bzhin du yongs su grub pa yang med ces smra ba de ni dam pa'i chos dang bral bar 'byung ba'i las sgrub par byed do //
translated: The other-dependent nature is like a nonentity, and the thoroughly established nature is also non-existent. Those who say this are free from the excellent Dharma and will create karma that leads to suffering.

original: de 'di ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i tshul gyis khrid pa'i don gyis lang kar gshegs pa dam pa'i chos kyi 'grel par rtsod pa'i gnas mdo sde'i don bkri bar ma lus pa rgya cher bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de 'di ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i tshul gyis khrid pa'i don gyis lang kar gshegs pa dam pa'i chos kyi 'grel par rtsod pa'i gnas mdo sde'i don bkri bar ma lus pa rgya cher bshad par bya'o //
translated: In this way, I will explain in detail, using the method of the definitive meaning of the intention, the entire content of the sutra that is the basis of the debate, the meaning of the sutra that is the commentary on the excellent Dharma of the Descent into La·πÖkƒÅ.

original: ji ltar ni rtag pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdag dang bdag gir la sogs par rnam par rtog pa ltar gnyis su med pa rang dang spyi'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar ni rtag pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdag dang bdag gir la sogs par rnam par rtog pa ltar gnyis su med pa rang dang spyi'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: How is it not permanent? etc. It is not dual, like the discriminations of self and possession, etc. It is free from the discriminations of generality and particularity.

original: de la chad pa ma yin pa ni ye @129b shes kyi skad cig pas gong ma'i don bya ba byed pa'i phyir thugs rje'i bag chags kyis bskul nas snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis sems can gyi don sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la chad pa ma yin pa ni ye @129b shes kyi skad cig pas gong ma'i don bya ba byed pa'i phyir thugs rje'i bag chags kyis bskul nas snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis sems can gyi don sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therein, it is not annihilated, because the function of the object of the moment of intuition is performed by the next moment, since it is impelled by the instinct of compassion, because it is applied to the benefit of sentient beings by means of concentration accompanied by appearance.

original: 'jig pa ma yin pa ni se gol la sogs pa'i sgra la sogs pa bzhin du ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig pa ma yin pa ni se gol la sogs pa'i sgra la sogs pa bzhin du ma yin te /
translated: It is not destroyed, like the sound of a finger snap, etc.

original: 'dus byas kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is compounded.

original: mi gnyis pa'i chud pa'i rgyun la nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir 'chi ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mi gnyis pa'i chud pa'i rgyun la nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir 'chi ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not death, because there is no affliction in the stream of the one who has entered the nondual.

original: spangs pa med pa dang thob pa med pa ni chud pa rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i phyir der cung zad kyang spang ba dang / thob pa yang med do //
analyzed: spangs pa med pa dang thob pa med pa ni chud pa rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i phyir der cung zad kyang spang ba dang / thob pa yang med do //
translated: Non-abandonment and non-attainment are because of the natural luminosity of the perfected nature, there is nothing whatsoever to be abandoned or attained.

original: skad cig ma'i rgyun 'brel pas chad pa dang rtag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma'i rgyun 'brel pas chad pa dang rtag pa ma yin no //
translated: It is neither annihilated nor eternal because of the continuity of the momentary stream.

original: don gcig pa ma yin pa ni bdag la sogs pa bzhin du rtag pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: don gcig pa ma yin pa ni bdag la sogs pa bzhin du rtag pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not the same meaning because it is not permanent like a self and so on.

original: don dam pa tha dad pa ma yin pa ni gzhan gyi dbang ltar gnyis kyi rnam pa ma yin pas mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis su med do //
analyzed: don dam pa tha dad pa ma yin pa ni gzhan gyi dbang ltar gnyis kyi rnam pa ma yin pas mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis su med do //
translated: It is not a different ultimate because, unlike the relative, it is not a dualistic aspect, and thus nirvana is nondual.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni sra ba dang / gsher pa dang / dro ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni sra ba dang / gsher pa dang / dro ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The specific characteristics are solidity, fluidity, heat, and so on.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The general characteristics are impermanence, suffering, and so on.

original: de khong du chud pa ni phung po rnams la'o //
analyzed: de khong du chud pa ni phung po rnams la'o //
translated: The comprehension of that is in regard to the aggregates.

original: 'du 'dzi med pa ni gcig pu dga' ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'du 'dzi med pa ni gcig pu dga' ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Freedom from distraction is the characteristic of delighting in solitude.

original: yul la phyin ci log med pa ni mi rtag pa dang bdag med pa la sogs par shes pas srid pa dang / longs spyod la mdzes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: yul la phyin ci log med pa ni mi rtag pa dang bdag med pa la sogs par shes pas srid pa dang / longs spyod la mdzes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ste /
translated: The absence of error with respect to objects is the non-occurrence of the conceptualization of the aspects of beauty, etc. with respect to existence and enjoyments, through the knowledge of impermanence, selflessness, etc.üîΩTherefore, there is the idea of nirvana.

original: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'i blor 'gyur ro zhes pa rnam pa gnyis ni snang ba med par yang bdag rtag pa la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'i blor 'gyur ro zhes pa rnam pa gnyis ni snang ba med par yang bdag rtag pa la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The two kinds of conceptualization are with respect to the permanent self, etc. even without appearance.

original: sngon po la sogs par snang ba la ni phyi rol gyi don du rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs par snang ba la ni phyi rol gyi don du rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The conceptualization of external objects is with respect to the appearance as blue, etc.üîΩThe verse says, ‚Äúthrough the blessing of the lord of men,‚Äù etc.

original: mi'i dbang po'i byin rlabs las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs /
analyzed: mi'i dbang po'i byin rlabs las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs /
translated: The buddhas bless them.

original: smon lam rnams kyis rnam par sbyangs pa ste /
analyzed: smon lam rnams kyis rnam par sbyangs pa ste /
translated: They are purified by the vows.

original: smon lam gnyis chud par byed do //
analyzed: smon lam gnyis chud par byed do //
translated: They fulfill the two vows.

original: gang gis bdud la sogs pa'i las kyis bar chad du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gis bdud la sogs pa'i las kyis bar chad du mi 'gyur te /
translated: They are not obstructed by the actions of Mara, etc.

original: dang por zhal la sogs pa mthong ba dang / bcu por phyag gis dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: dang por zhal la sogs pa mthong ba dang / bcu por phyag gis dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: First, they see the face, etc. and finally they are consecrated by the hand.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di yod na 'di yod do zhes pa ni rtag pa'i rgyu la gleng ba ni ma yin gyis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di yod na 'di yod do zhes pa ni rtag pa'i rgyu la gleng ba ni ma yin gyis /
translated: The Blessed One said, ‚ÄúWhen this exists, that comes to be,‚Äù but he was not referring to a permanent cause.

original: skad cig mar 'jig pa yang gang gi tshe na 'bras bu yod pa @130a * //
analyzed: skad cig mar 'jig pa yang gang gi tshe na 'bras bu yod pa @130a * //
translated: When something is momentary and disintegrates, if the effect exists at the time the cause exists, then the cause would be without a cause.

original: de'i tshe na rgyu med ce na phrad pa med pa pa la 'di yod na 'di yod do zhes bya ba ji ltar na rung /
analyzed: de'i tshe na rgyu med ce na phrad pa med pa pa la 'di yod na 'di yod do zhes bya ba ji ltar na rung /
translated: How could it be that ‚Äúwhen this exists, that comes to be‚Äù in the absence of contact?

original: yang lan du bsnyen pa ni mur byed pa rnams rang gi sems snang ba nyid la phyi rol gyi rgyu rdul phra mo dang / yan lag can dang dbang po la sogs pa smra ba ni phyi rol dang rtag pa'i rgyu med do //
analyzed: yang lan du bsnyen pa ni mur byed pa rnams rang gi sems snang ba nyid la phyi rol gyi rgyu rdul phra mo dang / yan lag can dang dbang po la sogs pa smra ba ni phyi rol dang rtag pa'i rgyu med do //
translated: The response to this is that the proponents of subtle particles, wholes, sense faculties, and so on, who assert that external objects are appearances of one‚Äôs own mind, say that there is no external cause or permanent cause.

original: thog ma dang tha ma'i rgyun blo la bzhag nas 'di yod na 'di yod do zhes brjod par bya'i /
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma'i rgyun blo la bzhag nas 'di yod na 'di yod do zhes brjod par bya'i /
translated: The Omniscient One intended the meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúWhen this exists, that comes to be,‚Äù to be understood in terms of a beginning and an end of a continuum.

original: de lta bur rgyu med par smra ba ni ma yin no zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bur rgyu med par smra ba ni ma yin no zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don to //
translated: He did not intend it to be understood as a statement of causelessness.

original: blo gros chen po de dag ni dngos po yang ma yin /
analyzed: blo gros chen po de dag ni dngos po yang ma yin /
translated: MahƒÅmati, these are not things.

original: dngos po med pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Nor is it non-existent.

original: dngos po yang ma yin pa ni phyi rol gyi brjod par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po yang ma yin pa ni phyi rol gyi brjod par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not existent, because the external object of expression does not exist.

original: dngos po med pa ma yin pa ni blo la yod pa'i sgra'i don brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ma yin pa ni blo la yod pa'i sgra'i don brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not non-existent, because the meaning of the word that exists in the mind is expressed.

original: brjod pa ni byas pa ste zhes bya ba mtshan mar byed pas don snyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod pa ni byas pa ste zhes bya ba mtshan mar byed pas don snyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Expression is produced, because the meaning is obtained by the one who makes the sign.

original: de lta bas na sngon gyi mtshan ma dang mig zur la sogs pas don rtogs par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na sngon gyi mtshan ma dang mig zur la sogs pas don rtogs par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is understood by the previous sign, the corner of the eye, etc.

original: de bas na sgra dang don du 'brel pa rtag par nges pa thams cad mkhyen pas bsal to //
analyzed: de bas na sgra dang don du 'brel pa rtag par nges pa thams cad mkhyen pas bsal to //
translated: Thus, the eternal connection between word and meaning is refuted by the Omniscient One.

original: spyod pa can la sogs pa rnams kyis ni sgra rtag pa'o zhes rtogs so //
analyzed: spyod pa can la sogs pa rnams kyis ni sgra rtag pa'o zhes rtogs so //
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ikas, etc. think that the word is eternal.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa phyin ci log ma yin par shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa phyin ci log ma yin par shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But the noble ones know impermanence, etc. without error.

original: nor pa ni rnam pa du mar so sor snang ngo //
analyzed: nor pa ni rnam pa du mar so sor snang ngo //
translated: Error appears in many ways.

original: nor pa med pa la ni rang gi dngos po gcig ste /
analyzed: nor pa med pa la ni rang gi dngos po gcig ste /
translated: In the absence of error, there is one own-nature.

original: rtag pa la sogs pa nor pa la mi rtag par yang byed de /
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs pa nor pa la mi rtag par yang byed de /
translated: In error, such as permanence, one makes the impermanent permanent,

original: rtag pa'i yul med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa'i yul med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object of permanence does not exist.üîΩBecause of the abandonment of entity and non-entity.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa rnam par spang ba'i phyir ro zhes pa ni byis pas nor pa gzugs brnyan la sogs pa la lhag par ji ltar chags pa de ltar dngos po med do //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa rnam par spang ba'i phyir ro zhes pa ni byis pas nor pa gzugs brnyan la sogs pa la lhag par ji ltar chags pa de ltar dngos po med do //
translated: The error of the childish is like the attachment to a reflection, etc. as if it were an entity.

original: ji ltar so sor snang ba de ltar dngos po med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar so sor snang ba de ltar dngos po med pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that there is no entity as it appears.

original: de ltar nor pa ni zhes bya ba 'phags pa rnams la ni de ni rtag pa'i phyin ci log ma yin pa la mi rtag pa'i phyin ci log kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar nor pa ni zhes bya ba 'phags pa rnams la ni de ni rtag pa'i phyin ci log ma yin pa la mi rtag pa'i phyin ci log kyang ma yin no //
translated: Thus, error is not the error of permanence in the absence of permanence, nor is it the error of impermanence in the absence of impermanence.

original: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba /üîΩgzugs ni rtag pa zhes pa'am /
analyzed: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba / gzugs ni rtag pa zhes pa'am /
translated: As it is said in the Perfection of Wisdom:üîΩForm is not seen as permanent

original: mi rtag pa zhes par kun tu mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa zhes par kun tu mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs te /
translated: or as impermanent.

original: de ltar de'i phyir rtag par rtogs pa ni nor pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar de'i phyir rtag par rtogs pa ni nor pa ste /
translated: Thus, therefore, the realization of permanence is a mistake.

original: rtag pa la sogs pa'i yul med pa @130b na skad cig mar 'jig pa rab tu 'byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs pa'i yul med pa @130b na skad cig mar 'jig pa rab tu 'byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the absence of an object of permanence, etc., the momentary destruction is distinguished.

original: tha dad du mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni rnam pa de lta bur snang ba la rtag pa dang / bdag la sogs pa'i mtshan ma tha dad pas mi 'byed de /
analyzed: tha dad du mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni rnam pa de lta bur snang ba la rtag pa dang / bdag la sogs pa'i mtshan ma tha dad pas mi 'byed de /
translated: It does not become different. That is, it does not become differentiated by the different signs of permanence, self, etc., in the appearance of that kind.

original: mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pa yongs su smin pa las de ltar gang gi phyir snang ba 'ba' zhig bas na de'i phyir nor brtag pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pa yongs su smin pa las de ltar gang gi phyir snang ba 'ba' zhig bas na de'i phyir nor brtag pa'o //
translated: Because of the mere appearance, therefore, it is a mistake.

original: nor pa de kho na nyid ma yin pa'o zhes pa ni don dam pa'i rang bzhin ma yin te zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nor pa de kho na nyid ma yin pa'o zhes pa ni don dam pa'i rang bzhin ma yin te zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That mistake is not reality. The meaning is that it is not the nature of the ultimate.

original: byis pa rnams kyi blo ni rtag pa la sogs pa'i dngos por sgro btags pa'i phyin ci log tu'o //
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyi blo ni rtag pa la sogs pa'i dngos por sgro btags pa'i phyin ci log tu'o //
translated: The minds of the childish are mistaken in the superimposition of things such as permanence.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi blo ni skad cig mar 'jig pa la sogs pa yongs su shes pas phyin ci log ma yin par ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi blo ni skad cig mar 'jig pa la sogs pa yongs su shes pas phyin ci log ma yin par ro //
translated: The minds of the noble ones are not erroneous, because they understand the momentary destruction of things and so forth.

original: dngos po ma yin pa so sor snang ba mi rtag pa yang ma yin pa dang / rtag pa ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po ma yin pa so sor snang ba mi rtag pa yang ma yin pa dang / rtag pa ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The appearance of things that are not real is neither impermanent nor permanent.

original: de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, the Omniscient One said:

original: phyin ci log gi blo yang mi 'jug / phyin ci log ma yin pa'i blo yang mi 'jug ste zhes pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi blo yang mi 'jug / phyin ci log ma yin pa'i blo yang mi 'jug ste zhes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe erroneous mind does not engage, nor does the non-erroneous mind engage.‚Äù

original: gzhan du med de zhes pa ni byis pas sgro btags te kun brtags pa'i yul du blo 'jug pas na /
analyzed: gzhan du med de zhes pa ni byis pas sgro btags te kun brtags pa'i yul du blo 'jug pas na /
translated: ‚ÄúElsewhere‚Äù means that the mind engages in the object imagined by the childish, which is imagined to exist.

original: de ji lta zhe na gyi na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ji lta zhe na gyi na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: How is that? It is said:

original: gang cung zad 'phags pa'i 'du shes su 'gyur ba 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi dmigs pa'i dngos po ji lta bu de ni rnam par 'khrul pa'i gzugs de lta bu ma yin zhes so //
analyzed: gang cung zad 'phags pa'i 'du shes su 'gyur ba 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi dmigs pa'i dngos po ji lta bu de ni rnam par 'khrul pa'i gzugs de lta bu ma yin zhes so //
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever is the object of the noble ones‚Äô wisdom, which becomes the noble ones‚Äô perception, that is not the form of error.‚Äù

original: nor pa de yang phyin ci log dang phyin ci log ma yin par zhes bya ba ni nor pa nyid la rtag pa dang / mdzes pa la sogs par sgro 'dogs pas phyin ci log go //
analyzed: nor pa de yang phyin ci log dang phyin ci log ma yin par zhes bya ba ni nor pa nyid la rtag pa dang / mdzes pa la sogs par sgro 'dogs pas phyin ci log go //
translated: Moreover, that error is called ‚Äúerroneous‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-erroneous‚Äù because of the superimposition of permanence, beauty, etc. on error itself.

original: der yang dag pa ji lta bu yin pa'i mi rtag pa dang / mi gtsang ba la sogs pa snang ba ni phyin ci log ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: der yang dag pa ji lta bu yin pa'i mi rtag pa dang / mi gtsang ba la sogs pa snang ba ni phyin ci log ma yin pa'o //
translated: The appearance of impermanence, impurity, etc. as they really are is non-erroneous.

original: don dam par na rang bzhin med pa'i phyir smras pa lta bur de'i rang bzhin rnam pa gnyis su med mod kyis /
analyzed: don dam par na rang bzhin med pa'i phyir smras pa lta bur de'i rang bzhin rnam pa gnyis su med mod kyis /
translated: In the ultimate sense, there is no intrinsic reality, as has been said, and so there is no intrinsic reality of that error in either of the two ways.

original: 'on kyang byis pa rnams la rtag pa dang bdag dang bdag gis sogs pa'i phyin ci log pa rnams kyis 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal du snang ba thob par byed do //
analyzed: 'on kyang byis pa rnams la rtag pa dang bdag dang bdag gis sogs pa'i phyin ci log pa rnams kyis 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal du snang ba thob par byed do //
translated: Nevertheless, the childish, by the errors of permanence, self, mine, etc., acquire the appearance of the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: de nyid 'phags pa rnams la yang mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa la sogs pa bden par smra ba mngon sum du byed pa las thar pa thob par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid 'phags pa rnams la yang mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa la sogs pa bden par smra ba mngon sum du byed pa las thar pa thob par byed do //
translated: That very thing, for the Noble Ones, by the direct realization of impermanence, suffering, and the in-attractiveness, etc. of that, causes the attainment of liberation.

original: de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni sra ba @131a * //
analyzed: de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni sra ba @131a * //
translated: Its own characteristic is solidity,

original: dang / gsher ba dang / dro ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dang / gsher ba dang / dro ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: fluidity, heat, and movement.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The general characteristic is impermanence, etc.

original: 'du 'dzi med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gcig po gnas par mos pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'du 'dzi med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gcig po gnas par mos pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because of being free from crowds means because of being devoted to solitude.

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams ni phal dang mi gnas zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams ni phal dang mi gnas zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Pratyekabuddhas do not live in the company of many.

original: byis pa dang mkhas pa dag la snang ba'i khyad par yod de /
analyzed: byis pa dang mkhas pa dag la snang ba'i khyad par yod de /
translated: There is a difference in the light of the ignorant and the wise.

original: de la byis pa dngos por sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la byis pa dngos por sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: The ignorant superimpose existence on things.

original: mkhas pa la ni stong pa nyid khong du chud pa sangs rgyas kyi rigs thob pa yin no //
analyzed: mkhas pa la ni stong pa nyid khong du chud pa sangs rgyas kyi rigs thob pa yin no //
translated: The wise, who have realized emptiness, have attained the lineage of the Buddha.

original: byis pa rnams kyis nor pa'i mtshan nyid rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bdag gi dngos po dang / byed pa po dang / las dang byed pa po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du ji ltar kun brtags pa gal te de ltar yod na ni de'i tshe nga'i bstan pa la rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba mu stegs byed pa'i rgyu las 'byung ba dang mtshungs par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyis nor pa'i mtshan nyid rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bdag gi dngos po dang / byed pa po dang / las dang byed pa po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du ji ltar kun brtags pa gal te de ltar yod na ni de'i tshe nga'i bstan pa la rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba mu stegs byed pa'i rgyu las 'byung ba dang mtshungs par yang 'gyur te /
translated: The characteristics of error that childish beings imagine, such as permanence, a self, a real entity that is an ‚ÄúI‚Äù or ‚Äúmine,‚Äù an agent, an object of an agent, and so on, if they existed in that way, then my teaching of dependent origination would be similar to the cause propounded by the tƒ´rthikas.

original: de ltar yang mi rung ba ni rtag pa dang / bdag la sogs pa'i rgyu rnams kyi 'bras bu shes par bya ba la tshad mas gnod do zhes thams cad mkhyen pa'i gsung gi don rtog go //
analyzed: de ltar yang mi rung ba ni rtag pa dang / bdag la sogs pa'i rgyu rnams kyi 'bras bu shes par bya ba la tshad mas gnod do zhes thams cad mkhyen pa'i gsung gi don rtog go //
translated: The meaning of the statement of the Omniscient One is understood as follows: ‚ÄúIt is not suitable for the effects of causes such as permanence and a self to be known by a valid means of knowledge.‚Äù

original: gal te nor pa dang / sgyu ma 'dra ba ni sgyu ma lta bur gzhan gyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te nor pa dang / sgyu ma 'dra ba ni sgyu ma lta bur gzhan gyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: If error is like an illusion, it would be the cause of another illusion.

original: des kyang cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des kyang cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What would be the result of that?

original: mu stegs byed pa rnams kyis rtag pa dang / bdag la sogs pa ni nor pa ji ltar na rgyur mi 'gyur zhes blo gros chen pos dgongs par brtag go //
analyzed: mu stegs byed pa rnams kyis rtag pa dang / bdag la sogs pa ni nor pa ji ltar na rgyur mi 'gyur zhes blo gros chen pos dgongs par brtag go //
translated: The tƒ´rthikas‚Äô views of permanence, self, and so on are errors. Why would they not be causes?

original: thams cad mkhyen pas kyang spong bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas kyang spong bar gsungs pa /
translated: The Omniscient One also taught that they are to be abandoned.

original: nor pa ni sgyu ma lta bu ma yin no //
analyzed: nor pa ni sgyu ma lta bu ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúError is not like an illusion.‚Äù

original: rgyu gsungs pa nor pa ni gnas ngan len gyi nyes pa 'thob pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu gsungs pa nor pa ni gnas ngan len gyi nyes pa 'thob pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause is taught: ‚ÄúError does not cause the faults of negative propensities to be obtained.‚Äù

original: de sgyu ma de lta bur 'gyur ba ma lags sam zhes pa la blags te gsungs pa /
analyzed: de sgyu ma de lta bur 'gyur ba ma lags sam zhes pa la blags te gsungs pa /
translated: ‚ÄúIs that illusion not like that?‚Äù

original: blo gros chen po sgyu ma ni gnas ngan len gyi nyes pa thob par mi byed do //
analyzed: blo gros chen po sgyu ma ni gnas ngan len gyi nyes pa thob par mi byed do //
translated: He said, ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, an illusion does not cause the faults of negative propensities to be obtained.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúHow is it that it does not cause them to be obtained?‚Äù

original: ji ltar na thob par byed pa ma yin zhes pa dang / khyad par du gsungs pa rnam par ma brtags na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar na thob par byed pa ma yin zhes pa dang / khyad par du gsungs pa rnam par ma brtags na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: He taught the distinction: ‚ÄúIf it is not analyzed.‚Äù

original: ji ltar lung las 'byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar lung las 'byung ba /
translated: As it is said in the scriptures:

original: 'jig rten sna tshogs de gang de 'dod min //
analyzed: 'jig rten sna tshogs de gang de 'dod min //
translated: The various worlds are not what they desire.

original: kun rtog 'dod chags skyes bu'i 'dod pa ste //
analyzed: kun rtog 'dod chags skyes bu'i 'dod pa ste //
translated: Imagination is the desire of a person born from desire.

original: sna tshogs 'jig rten du ni lus bzhin du //
analyzed: sna tshogs 'jig rten du ni lus bzhin du //
translated: Just as the body is in the various worlds.

original: des na dpa' bo der 'dod 'dul bar byed //
analyzed: des na dpa' bo der 'dod 'dul bar byed //
translated: Therefore, the hero is said to be the subduer of that.

original: ces pa'o // de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pas 'di skad gsungs pa /
analyzed: ces pa'o // de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pas 'di skad gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, the Omniscient One has said this:

original: blo @131b gros chen po sgyu ma ni skyes bu gzhan gyi rig sngags kyi mthu las 'byung ste /
analyzed: blo @131b gros chen po sgyu ma ni skyes bu gzhan gyi rig sngags kyi mthu las 'byung ste /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, an illusion arises from the power of another person‚Äôs spells,

original: rang gi log pa'i rnam par rtog pa las ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi log pa'i rnam par rtog pa las ma yin te /
translated: not from one‚Äôs own false imagination.

original: rtag pa dang bdag la sogs pa'i nor pa ltar sgyu ma 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rtag pa dang bdag la sogs pa'i nor pa ltar sgyu ma 'byung ngo //
translated: An illusion arises like the error of permanence, self, and so on.

original: de bas na nor pa ni gnas ngan len gyi nyes pa'i bag chags byed kyi /
analyzed: de bas na nor pa ni gnas ngan len gyi nyes pa'i bag chags byed kyi /
translated: Therefore, error creates the latent tendencies of the fault of negative tendencies,

original: sgyu ma tsam du rnam par rtog pas ni ma yin no zhes so //
analyzed: sgyu ma tsam du rnam par rtog pas ni ma yin no zhes so //
translated: but mere conceptualization does not.‚Äù

original: skabs der zhes pa ni nor pa'i nang du ste /
analyzed: skabs der zhes pa ni nor pa'i nang du ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIn that context‚Äù means within error.

original: nor pa dang 'dres zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: nor pa dang 'dres zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Up to ‚Äúmixed with error.‚Äù

original: ji ltar mu stegs nor pa'i rang bzhin snang ba la rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las la sogs pa yang dag par kun rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mu stegs nor pa'i rang bzhin snang ba la rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las la sogs pa yang dag par kun rtog pa'o //
translated: Just as the tƒ´rthikas imagine real substance, qualities, actions, and so on in the appearance of error.

original: 'phags pa gang dag gis mi gnyis pa'i stong pa nyid la sogs pa rnam par thar pa thob pa de dag ni nor pa'i rang bzhin snang ba la mdzes pa dang / mi mdzad pa la sogs pa yang dag par kun tu mi mthong ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa gang dag gis mi gnyis pa'i stong pa nyid la sogs pa rnam par thar pa thob pa de dag ni nor pa'i rang bzhin snang ba la mdzes pa dang / mi mdzad pa la sogs pa yang dag par kun tu mi mthong ste /
translated: The noble ones who have attained the liberation of non-dual emptiness and so forth do not see the appearances of error as beautiful or not beautiful, and so forth.

original: ji ltar 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las gsungs pa'o //
translated: As it is said in the noble Perfection of Wisdom.

original: nor pa spangs nas shes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa snang ba rnams shes rab kyis rnam par gzhigs te khang pa la sogs pa bzhin du stong par byas pa na mi gnyis pa'i ye shes la yod pa dang / med pa'i mtshan mar rnam par rtog na de'i tshe mtshan mar rtog pa de nyid nor pa yin te /
analyzed: nor pa spangs nas shes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa snang ba rnams shes rab kyis rnam par gzhigs te khang pa la sogs pa bzhin du stong par byas pa na mi gnyis pa'i ye shes la yod pa dang / med pa'i mtshan mar rnam par rtog na de'i tshe mtshan mar rtog pa de nyid nor pa yin te /
translated: When knowledge, having abandoned error, analyzes forms and so forth that appear with wisdom, and makes them empty like a house and so forth, if at that time one imagines the sign of existence or non-existence in non-dual wisdom, then that imagination of signs is itself error.

original: rab rib legs par ma gsos pas ma dag pa lta bur mtshan mas ye shes glongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab rib legs par ma gsos pas ma dag pa lta bur mtshan mas ye shes glongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Like a cataract that is not well healed, the wisdom is impaired by signs.

original: bzhin zhes bya ba ni dpe'i don to //
analyzed: bzhin zhes bya ba ni dpe'i don to //
translated: The word like is for the purpose of example.

original: sgyu ma ni shes rab kyis dpyad pa na phyi rol gyi dngos por byis pa rnams kyis rnam par rtog pa ltar med de /
analyzed: sgyu ma ni shes rab kyis dpyad pa na phyi rol gyi dngos por byis pa rnams kyis rnam par rtog pa ltar med de /
translated: When illusion is analyzed by wisdom, it does not exist as external things as imagined by the childish.

original: de dang chos mthun par khyab pas gnyis kyi rnam pa'i dngos po thams cad sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: de dang chos mthun par khyab pas gnyis kyi rnam pa'i dngos po thams cad sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: Since it is pervaded by that, all things having the aspect of duality are like an illusion.

original: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba /
translated: As it is said in the Perfection of Wisdom:

original: gzugs las brtsams te sangs rgyas nyid kyi bar du yang gzugs la sogs par snang ba ni sgyu ma dang mtshungs /
analyzed: gzugs las brtsams te sangs rgyas nyid kyi bar du yang gzugs la sogs par snang ba ni sgyu ma dang mtshungs /
translated: ‚ÄúBeginning with form and up to buddhahood, the appearance of form and so on is like an illusion.

original: rmi lam dang mtshungs zhes so //
analyzed: rmi lam dang mtshungs zhes so //
translated: It is like a dream.‚Äù

original: ji ltar byis pa rnams sna tshogs la mngon par chags pas mtshan nyid kun rtog par byed pa ji de lta bu dngos po rnams sgyu ma lta bu lags sam zhes gsol pa /
analyzed: ji ltar byis pa rnams sna tshogs la mngon par chags pas mtshan nyid kun rtog par byed pa ji de lta bu dngos po rnams sgyu ma lta bu lags sam zhes gsol pa /
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúJust as the childish, through attachment to variety, conceive of characteristics, are things like illusions?‚Äù

original: gzugs rnams sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid rnams su phyi rol gyi la sogs par byis pas brtags pa rnams kyis @132a * //
analyzed: gzugs rnams sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid rnams su phyi rol gyi la sogs par byis pas brtags pa rnams kyis @132a * //
translated: The characteristics of various forms and so on are imagined by the childish as external and so on.

original: rgyu med par mthong ba'i slad du zhes pa sgrub par byed pa rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu mi mthong ba ni shes rab kyis sbom po dang / phra mo rnam pa'i chur dbye ba na stong pa kho na'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med par mthong ba'i slad du zhes pa sgrub par byed pa rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu mi mthong ba ni shes rab kyis sbom po dang / phra mo rnam pa'i chur dbye ba na stong pa kho na'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is seen to be without cause. The non-seeing of the cause of inference, the proof, is the grossness by wisdom. When divided into the coarse and subtle aspects, it is only emptiness.

original: skyes bu dang sngags la sogs pa'i sgyu ma la phyi rol gyi khyis pas brtags pa ni shes pa so sor snang ba tsam nyid do zhes so //
analyzed: skyes bu dang sngags la sogs pa'i sgyu ma la phyi rol gyi khyis pas brtags pa ni shes pa so sor snang ba tsam nyid do zhes so //
translated: The magical creations of persons, mantras, and so forth, which are imagined to be external, are only the individual appearances of consciousness.

original: de bas na thams cad rig pas 'di skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bas na thams cad rig pas 'di skad du gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, the knower of all has said this:

original: log pa myur ba'i glog dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: log pa myur ba'i glog dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: False, like a quickly moving flash of lightning.

original: des na sgyu ma dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: des na sgyu ma dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is like a magical creation.

original: log pa'i phyir sgyu ma dang 'dra ba ni /
analyzed: log pa'i phyir sgyu ma dang 'dra ba ni /
translated: Because it is false, it is like a magical creation.

original: stong pa rnams te /
analyzed: stong pa rnams te /
translated: The empty ones

original: chos la bdag med pa'i tshad ma'o //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa'i tshad ma'o //
translated: are the valid cognition of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: myur ba'i glog dang 'dra ba des ni skad cig ma rnams te /
analyzed: myur ba'i glog dang 'dra ba des ni skad cig ma rnams te /
translated: By that which is like a quickly moving flash of lightning, the moments are

original: gang zag la bdag med par ro //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med par ro //
translated: the selflessness of persons.

original: gang gis rmi lam dang / sgyu ma dang / gzugs brnyan la sogs pa stong pa cung zad cig khong du chud pa de la shes rab kyis dpyad de /
analyzed: gang gis rmi lam dang / sgyu ma dang / gzugs brnyan la sogs pa stong pa cung zad cig khong du chud pa de la shes rab kyis dpyad de /
translated: Whoever understands emptiness a little bit, in terms of dreams, illusions, reflections, and so on, should analyze it with wisdom.

original: de dang chos mthun par gzugs su snang ba ni gzugs ma yin no zhes par ri la sogs pa stong par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de dang chos mthun par gzugs su snang ba ni gzugs ma yin no zhes par ri la sogs pa stong par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Whoever understands that a dream, an illusion, a reflection, etc. are empty, should investigate with wisdom and understand that the appearance of form is not form, like a reflection, etc.

original: byis pas kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid phyi rol dang rtag pa la sogs pa'i dngos po de gnyis ka yang stong pa nyid ces par ro //
analyzed: byis pas kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid phyi rol dang rtag pa la sogs pa'i dngos po de gnyis ka yang stong pa nyid ces par ro //
translated: Both of those are empty, i.e., the imagined characteristic of the naive, and the external, permanent, etc. entity.

original: dngos po rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po shes rab kyis rab tu rnam par 'byed pa med pas mi snang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po shes rab kyis rab tu rnam par 'byed pa med pas mi snang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The entity of the general and specific characteristics of entities does not appear, i.e., is not evident, due to the absence of the discrimination of wisdom.

original: sgyu ma ni yang dag par yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sgyu ma ni yang dag par yod pa ma yin te /
translated: An illusion does not exist in reality.

original: de med pa'i chos dang mthun par dngos po rnams yod par brjod par bya ba ni sgyu ma ltar dngos po rnams yod do zhes par ro //
analyzed: de med pa'i chos dang mthun par dngos po rnams yod par brjod par bya ba ni sgyu ma ltar dngos po rnams yod do zhes par ro //
translated: Like an illusion, entities should be said to exist in conformity with the non-existence of that, i.e., entities should be said to exist like an illusion.

original: gang yang mdo sde shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa du mar chos thams cad ni ma skyes pa dang sgyu ma lta bur gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang yang mdo sde shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa du mar chos thams cad ni ma skyes pa dang sgyu ma lta bur gsungs pa /
translated: Moreover, in many s≈´tras, such as the Perfection of Wisdom, all phenomena are said to be unborn and like illusions.

original: de sems can rnams la gdon mi za ba'i slad du 'phags pa blo gros chen po dam pa'i chos 'dir gleng bar mdzad do //
analyzed: de sems can rnams la gdon mi za ba'i slad du 'phags pa blo gros chen po dam pa'i chos 'dir gleng bar mdzad do //
translated: In order to definitely teach that to sentient beings, the noble NƒÅgƒÅrjuna took up this Dharma.

original: chos gang ma skyes pa de dag la ni mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i so sor snang ba med la /
analyzed: chos gang ma skyes pa de dag la ni mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i so sor snang ba med la /
translated: For those phenomena that are unborn, like the son of a barren woman, there is no appearance of form and so on.

original: sgyu ma'i rang bzhin ni rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i rang bzhin ni rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba ste /
translated: The nature of an illusion appears in various aspects.

original: ji ltar na ma skyes pa rnams sgyu ma lta bur lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na ma skyes pa rnams sgyu ma lta bur lags /
translated: How can the unborn be like an illusion?

original: de bas na 'di 'gal lo zhes de ltar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di 'gal lo zhes de ltar dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, this is contradictory.

original: der thams cad mkhyen pa'i phyi ma'i phyogs la byis pas kun @132b brtags pa'i byis pa dang / byed pa por mngon par 'brel te skye ba ni skye ba med do //
analyzed: der thams cad mkhyen pa'i phyi ma'i phyogs la byis pas kun @132b brtags pa'i byis pa dang / byed pa por mngon par 'brel te skye ba ni skye ba med do //
translated: In this way, the childish conception of the childish is connected to the creator in the position of the Omniscient One, but birth is not born.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang gi sems snang ba tsam du rtogs pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba tsam du rtogs pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause for realizing that appearances are one‚Äôs own mind.

original: rang gi sems ma rtogs pa ni byis pa rnams kyis phyi rol gyi don skye ba kun tu rtog par byed do //
analyzed: rang gi sems ma rtogs pa ni byis pa rnams kyis phyi rol gyi don skye ba kun tu rtog par byed do //
translated: Those who have not realized their own mind imagine that external objects arise.

original: yod pa dang med pa las mi skye bar mthong bas na zhes bya ba dang 'brel te /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa las mi skye bar mthong bas na zhes bya ba dang 'brel te /
translated: Since they see that things do not arise from existence or nonexistence,üîΩthey say that external things do not exist.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po med pa'i phyir zhes pa ni sgyu ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po med pa'i phyir zhes pa ni sgyu ste /
translated: This is a deception.

original: phyi rol gyi don de yang gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po tha dad par 'dzin gyi /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don de yang gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po tha dad par 'dzin gyi /
translated: External objects are apprehended as the cause and effect of consciousness that has the aspect of duality.

original: rnam pa med pas ni ma yin pas na phyi rol gyi don de yang sus sun phyung /
analyzed: rnam pa med pas ni ma yin pas na phyi rol gyi don de yang sus sun phyung /
translated: Since they are not apprehended as being without aspects, who refutes external objects?

original: yod pa ni yod pas na mi skye'o //
analyzed: yod pa ni yod pas na mi skye'o //
translated: Since they exist, they do not arise.

original: med pa yang bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir 'di yod pas 'di yod ces bya ste /
analyzed: med pa yang bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir 'di yod pas 'di yod ces bya ste /
translated: Since nonexistence is incapable of action, it is said that when this exists, that comes to be.

original: chos thams cad ni bya ba med pa'i phyir de ma thag pa tsam 'ba' zhig pas sgyu ma skye ba ni yang dag par skye ba med pa bzhin du de dag kyang skye ba ni skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni bya ba med pa'i phyir de ma thag pa tsam 'ba' zhig pas sgyu ma skye ba ni yang dag par skye ba med pa bzhin du de dag kyang skye ba ni skye ba med pa'o //
translated: All things are like the arising of an illusion, because they are not really arisen, since they are devoid of activity, and are merely a succession.

original: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa rnams kyi snang ba med pa'i phyir de dag gi rang bzhin med pa lta bur sgyu ma lta bu'i dngos po rnams mi skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa rnams kyi snang ba med pa'i phyir de dag gi rang bzhin med pa lta bur sgyu ma lta bu'i dngos po rnams mi skye ba ma yin no //
translated: But things that are like illusions are not non-arisen, because they are not like the son of a barren woman, etc., which are non-existent even as appearances.

original: mu stegs byed pa rnams kyis rtag pa dang / tshangs pa dang / dbang po dang / rdul phra mo'i rdzas la sogs pa rgyu las byed pa dang / byed pa po la sogs pa dang 'brel te 'bras bu skye bar rtog pa ni rtag pa dang /
analyzed: mu stegs byed pa rnams kyis rtag pa dang / tshangs pa dang / dbang po dang / rdul phra mo'i rdzas la sogs pa rgyu las byed pa dang / byed pa po la sogs pa dang 'brel te 'bras bu skye bar rtog pa ni rtag pa dang /
translated: The non-Buddhists imagine that a permanent cause, such as Prakriti, Purusha, atoms, or God, is related to an effect as an agent to an action, and that the effect arises from that cause.

original: phyi rol gyi rgyu med pa'i phyir sems tsam du snang bas dngos po rnams sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rgyu med pa'i phyir sems tsam du snang bas dngos po rnams sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: But things are like illusions, because they appear as mere mind, since there is no external cause.

original: slu ba'i rgyu las 'byung bas yang dag par na skye ba med pa'o zhes brjod pas na skye ba med pa'i tshig tu brjod do //
analyzed: slu ba'i rgyu las 'byung bas yang dag par na skye ba med pa'o zhes brjod pas na skye ba med pa'i tshig tu brjod do //
translated: Since it arises from a cause of deception, it is ultimately non-arisen.üîΩSince things are similar to illusions, they are non-arisen.üîΩSince all things are like illusions, they are non-arisen.üîΩThus, it is said that all things are non-arisen.üîΩIn order to understand external objects, it is said that all things are like illusions.üîΩIn order to express the difference between things, it is said that all things are like illusions and non-arisen.

original: sgyu ma dang chos mthun pas dngos po rnams skye ba med do zhes bya bas ni phyi rol gyi don du chud par byed pa dang / dngos po thams cad sgyu ma lta bur ma skyes pa zhes bya bas dngos po rnams tha dad par brjod pa lags so zhes de skad du dogs nas thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa /üîΩyang dngos po bstan pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /üîΩdngos po bstan pa la ni las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: sgyu ma dang chos mthun pas dngos po rnams skye ba med do zhes bya bas ni phyi rol gyi don du chud par byed pa dang / dngos po thams cad sgyu ma lta bur ma skyes pa zhes bya bas dngos po rnams tha dad par brjod pa lags so zhes de skad du dogs nas thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa / yang dngos po bstan pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste / dngos po bstan pa la ni las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: Thus, it is said that all things are non-arisen.üîΩThe meaning of the summary is as follows:

original: 'di ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: In order to understand the connection between action and effect, things are taught.

original: rtag pa dang bdag la sogs pa dang / phyi rol gyi don du chags pa dgag pa'i phyir dngos po rnams sgyu ma lta bur mi skye'o zhes @133a * //
analyzed: rtag pa dang bdag la sogs pa dang / phyi rol gyi don du chags pa dgag pa'i phyir dngos po rnams sgyu ma lta bur mi skye'o zhes @133a * //
translated: In order to refute attachment to permanence, self, etc., and to external objects, it is taught that things are like illusions, not produced.

original: bstan to // mu stegs can yang dag pa ji lta ba ma yin pa nyid la yang dag pa lta bur phyin ci log pa'i phyir rtag pa dang / bdag dang phyi rol la sogs pa dang / byed pa po dang las su sgro btags te bdag dang gzhan la slu bar byed pa de dag la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems tsam bshad par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: bstan to // mu stegs can yang dag pa ji lta ba ma yin pa nyid la yang dag pa lta bur phyin ci log pa'i phyir rtag pa dang / bdag dang phyi rol la sogs pa dang / byed pa po dang las su sgro btags te bdag dang gzhan la slu bar byed pa de dag la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems tsam bshad par bya'o zhes so //
translated: The tƒ´rthikas, due to error, as if seeing reality in what is not reality, superimpose permanence, self, external objects, etc., and agent and action, and deceive themselves and others. For them, the mind-only should be explained as it is.

original: sgra dang don la 'khrul pa'i smra ba po mang ste /
analyzed: sgra dang don la 'khrul pa'i smra ba po mang ste /
translated: There are many speakers who are confused about words and meanings.

original: la las phyi rol gyi brjod pa yod pa'i steng du der yang sgra dang don rtag par 'brel te zhes rtog par byed pa de dag rmongs pa bsal ba'i don du sgra dang don yang dag pa kho na ji lta ba yin pa thams cad mkhyen pas bshad
analyzed: la las phyi rol gyi brjod pa yod pa'i steng du der yang sgra dang don rtag par 'brel te zhes rtog par byed pa de dag rmongs pa bsal ba'i don du sgra dang don yang dag pa kho na ji lta ba yin pa thams cad mkhyen pas bshad
translated: Some, in addition to the external expression, imagine that the word and the object are related as permanent entities. In order to dispel the confusion of those people, the Omniscient One has explained that the word and the object are only real in the sense of a correct designation.

original: par mdzad pa /üîΩdngos po gang la gnas te zhes pa ste /
analyzed: par mdzad pa / dngos po gang la gnas te zhes pa ste /
translated: The verse states:

original: gang brjod pa dang / 'jug pa'i mtshan ma dang / de las gzhan pa log pa dang / rnam pa de lta bu ni ming ste /
analyzed: gang brjod pa dang / 'jug pa'i mtshan ma dang / de las gzhan pa log pa dang / rnam pa de lta bu ni ming ste /
translated: The name is the sign of the expressed, the engaging, and the opposite of that, and it has that aspect.

original: tshogs dang / lus dang / gnas zhes bya ba rnam grangs so //
analyzed: tshogs dang / lus dang / gnas zhes bya ba rnam grangs so //
translated: The collection, the body, and the basis are synonyms.

original: de ni gzhan dag gi tshig ces bya ba'i ming ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni gzhan dag gi tshig ces bya ba'i ming ni ma yin no //
translated: That is not the name called ‚Äúthe words of others.‚Äù

original: tshig gi tshogs ni tshig gi don rnams kyi tshogs te /
analyzed: tshig gi tshogs ni tshig gi don rnams kyi tshogs te /
translated: The collection of words is the collection of the meanings of the words.

original: brjod pa'i don zhes bya ba'i tha tshig par thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs par brtag go //
analyzed: brjod pa'i don zhes bya ba'i tha tshig par thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs par brtag go //
translated: The Omniscient One should be understood to intend the meaning of ‚Äúthe expressed‚Äù as the ultimate meaning.

original: de bas na de gnyis las don rnams gdon mi za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na de gnyis las don rnams gdon mi za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the objects are necessarily included in those two.

original: rtag pa'i don du rab tu sbyar ba'i 'bru mang po ni yi ge'i tshogs te /
analyzed: rtag pa'i don du rab tu sbyar ba'i 'bru mang po ni yi ge'i tshogs te /
translated: The collection of letters is the collection of syllables that are applied to the meaning of permanence.

original: 'bru'i tshogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'bru'i tshogs zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the collection of syllables.

original: snang bar byed pa ni de dag 'brel pa dang / don rnam pa sna tshogs su 'dogs pa'i mtshan ma ste /
analyzed: snang bar byed pa ni de dag 'brel pa dang / don rnam pa sna tshogs su 'dogs pa'i mtshan ma ste /
translated: The illuminator is the sign that connects them and designates the various aspects of the meaning.

original: rnam pa tha dad par go rims kyis 'khod pa ni mtsho dang / bro dang / lcug ma dang / shing ta la lta bur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa tha dad par go rims kyis 'khod pa ni mtsho dang / bro dang / lcug ma dang / shing ta la lta bur ro //
translated: It is arranged in order with different aspects, like a lake, a dance, a vine, or a palm tree.

original: de lta bas na rim des ming dang / tshig gi tshogs rnams snang bar byed do //
analyzed: de lta bas na rim des ming dang / tshig gi tshogs rnams snang bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, by that order, the collection of names and phrases is illuminated.

original: des ni rtag pa rtogs par byed kyi /üîΩlung ston pas sgra gsal bar snang bar byed pa kun brtags pa dang / spyod pa can gying ros yi ge snang bar byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des ni rtag pa rtogs par byed kyi / lung ston pas sgra gsal bar snang bar byed pa kun brtags pa dang / spyod pa can gying ros yi ge snang bar byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: By that, permanence is understood,üîΩbut not the imagined sound that illuminates the appearance of the revealed sound, nor the sound that illuminates the appearance of the letters of the grammarians.

original: nga ro dang / yi ge yang tha dad par mi dmigs pas na spyod pa can rnams kyis rnam grangs su skye bo rnams slu bar byed do //
analyzed: nga ro dang / yi ge yang tha dad par mi dmigs pas na spyod pa can rnams kyis rnam grangs su skye bo rnams slu bar byed do //
translated: Since the sound and the letters are not perceived separately, the grammarians deceive people with synonyms.

original: yi ge'i rim ma gtogs par sgra rgyas pa la rim med pa la rim rjes su bzung bas don brjod par yid mi ches so //
analyzed: yi ge'i rim ma gtogs par sgra rgyas pa la rim med pa la rim rjes su bzung bas don brjod par yid mi ches so //
translated: Except for the order of the letters, there is no order in the sound, which is extensive. Since the order is not taken into account, one does not believe that the meaning is expressed.

original: tshig ni ming du 'jug / ming las don @133b gsal bar 'gyur ro zhes skad /
analyzed: tshig ni ming du 'jug / ming las don @133b gsal bar 'gyur ro zhes skad /
translated: It is said that the word is the name, and that the meaning is expressed by the name.

original: phyogs gang dag kun du rtog pa yang tshig dang yi ge ni rnam grangs pas na de ma gtogs par ming med de /
analyzed: phyogs gang dag kun du rtog pa yang tshig dang yi ge ni rnam grangs pas na de ma gtogs par ming med de /
translated: In any case, since the word and the letter are synonyms, there is no name apart from them.

original: rtags la ltos te /
analyzed: rtags la ltos te /
translated: It is in dependence on the sign.

original: der 'dus pa las ming la sogs par 'du shes so //
analyzed: der 'dus pa las ming la sogs par 'du shes so //
translated: From the collection of those, there is the notion of name, etc.

original: yang dag pa ni yi ge ma gtogs par ming la sogs pa med pa'i phyir mtshan ma la ltos te de'i go rims kyi ming la sogs pa'i tshig tu gdags so //
analyzed: yang dag pa ni yi ge ma gtogs par ming la sogs pa med pa'i phyir mtshan ma la ltos te de'i go rims kyi ming la sogs pa'i tshig tu gdags so //
translated: Since there is no name, etc. apart from the letter, it is in dependence on the sign that the order of the name, etc. is designated.

original: tshig gi dbang po ting nge 'dzin la thams cad mkhyen pa bzhugs na dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor du brjod pa'i don 'byed pa bsgrub par mdzad de /
analyzed: tshig gi dbang po ting nge 'dzin la thams cad mkhyen pa bzhugs na dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor du brjod pa'i don 'byed pa bsgrub par mdzad de /
translated: When the Lord of the Word, the SamƒÅdhi, is present in the Omniscient One, he accomplishes the expression of the meaning in the circle of sound.

original: snga ma ni smras pa bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid du brtag go //
analyzed: snga ma ni smras pa bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid du brtag go //
translated: The former is considered to be the characteristic of the collection of statements.

original: gnyis pa ni 'dus pa smra ba'i brjod par brtag go //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'dus pa smra ba'i brjod par brtag go //
translated: The second is the expression of the assemblage.

original: de dag brtag pa'i khyad par ni brjod pa'i don blangs te /
analyzed: de dag brtag pa'i khyad par ni brjod pa'i don blangs te /
translated: The difference in the investigation of these is as follows: Having taken up the meaning of the expression,

original: brjod pa'i nang gi yan lag dang chos mthun pa dang / chos mi mthun pa las tshig dgar te /
analyzed: brjod pa'i nang gi yan lag dang chos mthun pa dang / chos mi mthun pa las tshig dgar te /
translated: one analyzes the expression into its component parts and into its similar and dissimilar properties,

original: tshig dang tshig gi don rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: tshig dang tshig gi don rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: and one understands the words and their meanings.

original: gnyis po ni tshig dang tshig gi don blangs te 'dus pa'i brjod pa'i don du yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis po ni tshig dang tshig gi don blangs te 'dus pa'i brjod pa'i don du yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The two, having taken up the words and their meanings, understand the meaning of the expression of the assemblage.

original: des ni 'di skad ces smras pa yin te /
analyzed: des ni 'di skad ces smras pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said:

original: spyir ni tshig khyad par du ni brjod pa ste /
analyzed: spyir ni tshig khyad par du ni brjod pa ste /
translated: In general, it is the word, and in particular, it is the expression.

original: tshig gzhan dang 'brel par de ltar smras pa las gang lhag pa de ni brjod pa'i don zhes so //
analyzed: tshig gzhan dang 'brel par de ltar smras pa las gang lhag pa de ni brjod pa'i don zhes so //
translated: From the expression, which is said to be related to other words, that which remains is the meaning of the expression.

original: yang na 'brel pa ni brjod pa'i don no zhes pa'o //üîΩgzhan sel bar byed pa la ni spyi dang khyad par du brjod de /
analyzed: yang na 'brel pa ni brjod pa'i don no zhes pa'o // gzhan sel bar byed pa la ni spyi dang khyad par du brjod de /
translated: Or else, the relation is the meaning of the expression.üîΩIn the exclusion of other, the general and the particular are expressed.

original: de las gzhan pa log pa ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa log pa ni khyad par ro //
translated: The negation of what is other than that is the particular.

original: tshig thug pa zhes bya ba ni tshig rtogs par gyur pa na brjod par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: tshig thug pa zhes bya ba ni tshig rtogs par gyur pa na brjod par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The meeting of words is when the words are understood, they are expressed.

original: tshig gi tshogs 'ba' zhig dbye bar ma zad de ming gi tshogs dbye bar yang ston pa /
analyzed: tshig gi tshogs 'ba' zhig dbye bar ma zad de ming gi tshogs dbye bar yang ston pa /
translated: Not only is the collection of words distinguished, but also the collection of names is shown to be distinguished.

original: blo gros chen po ming ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po ming ni 'di lta ste /
translated: MahƒÅmati, name is as follows:

original: yi ge rnams kyis zhes so //
analyzed: yi ge rnams kyis zhes so //
translated: by the letters.

original: aa la sogs pa nas ha'i mthar thug gi bar du so sor re re'i ming du 'du shes pa ste /
analyzed: aa la sogs pa nas ha'i mthar thug gi bar du so sor re re'i ming du 'du shes pa ste /
translated: From a to ha, each is recognized as a name.

original: aa zhes bya ba dang / ka zhes bya ba dang / ha zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: aa zhes bya ba dang / ka zhes bya ba dang / ha zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The a is called, the ka is called, up to the ha is called.

original: kha cig gis yi ge'i tshogs ni aa las brtsams te ha'i mthar thug pa la sogs par so sor 'brel ba'i 'bru rnams ni ming gi 'du shes su sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: kha cig gis yi ge'i tshogs ni aa las brtsams te ha'i mthar thug pa la sogs par so sor 'brel ba'i 'bru rnams ni ming gi 'du shes su sbyor bar byed do //
translated: Some connect the collection of letters, beginning with a and ending with ha, to the individual syllables, applying the notion of name.

original: thung ngu dang / 'dren pa dang / ring du 'dren pa'i dbyangs rnams la yi ge'i ming du thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: thung ngu dang / 'dren pa dang / ring du 'dren pa'i dbyangs rnams la yi ge'i ming du thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
translated: The Omniscient One intends the names of the letters for the short, drawn-out, and prolonged vowels.

original: yi ge rnams @134a * //
analyzed: yi ge rnams @134a * //
translated: The letters

original: kyi mtshan nyid gsal bar byed pas na snang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: kyi mtshan nyid gsal bar byed pas na snang bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is illuminating because it illuminates the characteristics of those.

original: 'di lta ste tshig ni thug pa'o zhes gang gsungs pa tshig de'i bde rnams ni glang po che dang / rta la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste tshig ni thug pa'o zhes gang gsungs pa tshig de'i bde rnams ni glang po che dang / rta la sogs pa'o //
translated: The words are the elephants, horses, etc. that were mentioned in the verse.

original: ming dang yi ge zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa'i phung po rnams so //
analyzed: ming dang yi ge zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa'i phung po rnams so //
translated: The names and letters are the formless aggregates.

original: ming gis brjod pa'i phyir zhes pa ni sgra'i don du brtags pa la don du ma ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: ming gis brjod pa'i phyir zhes pa ni sgra'i don du brtags pa la don du ma ston par mdzad do //
translated: Because they are expressed by names means that the names are applied to the objects that are designated by words.

original: yi ge rang gi mtshan nyid kyis snang bar byed pas zhes bya ba la mtshan nyid ni mtshan ma dang rnam grangs so //
analyzed: yi ge rang gi mtshan nyid kyis snang bar byed pas zhes bya ba la mtshan nyid ni mtshan ma dang rnam grangs so //
translated: The letters are illuminating by their own characteristics. The characteristics are the signs and synonyms.

original: ming tshig gis brjod pa zhes bya ba ni ming gi tshig gis brjod ces bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: ming tshig gis brjod pa zhes bya ba ni ming gi tshig gis brjod ces bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The words are expressed by the words for the names means that the words are expressed by the words for the names.

original: sgra rnams kyi don du ma yod pas na khyad par du bshad pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid tshad ma'o //
analyzed: sgra rnams kyi don du ma yod pas na khyad par du bshad pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid tshad ma'o //
translated: Since the words have many meanings, the explanation of the distinction is omniscience is the authority.

original: rig pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu ni rang bzhin gsum gyi ste /
analyzed: rig pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu ni rang bzhin gsum gyi ste /
translated: The cause of knowledge is the three natures.

original: der blo med ces bya ba'i don to //
