analyzed: der blo med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the expression ‚Äúwithout thought‚Äù is ‚Äúwithout mind.‚Äù

original: 'di ni dri ba ma yin no zhes ji ltar smra bar byed ce na /
analyzed: 'di ni dri ba ma yin no zhes ji ltar smra bar byed ce na /
translated: How can you say that this question is not legitimate?

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis gzugs la sogs pa mi rtag pa ci gzhan nam /üîΩ'on te ci gzhan pa ma yin nam zhes dris pa la /üîΩbcom ldan 'das la smos te /
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis gzugs la sogs pa mi rtag pa ci gzhan nam / 'on te ci gzhan pa ma yin nam zhes dris pa la / bcom ldan 'das la smos te /
translated: The wise ask whether the impermanent is other than form, etc.üîΩThe Blessed One was asked whether impermanence is other than form, etc.üîΩThe Blessed One did not answer.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la mi rtag pa nyid gzhan pa dang / gzhan ma yin zhes bya bar dris pa 'di ni bcom ldan 'das lung ma bstan pas na gzhag par bya'o zhes 'dzer to //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la mi rtag pa nyid gzhan pa dang / gzhan ma yin zhes bya bar dris pa 'di ni bcom ldan 'das lung ma bstan pas na gzhag par bya'o zhes 'dzer to //
translated: The wise say that this question should be set aside.

original: lung mi ston par smra ba ni mu stegs can rnams kyi yin te /
analyzed: lung mi ston par smra ba ni mu stegs can rnams kyi yin te /
translated: The non-Buddhists, the Tƒ´rthikas, say that the question should not be answered.

original: ji ltar phyogs gos pa rnams 'gyur bar smra ba ni ji srid du srog yod pa de srid du lus shes te /üîΩsrog ji tsam pa lus de tsam pa nyid de /
analyzed: ji ltar phyogs gos pa rnams 'gyur bar smra ba ni ji srid du srog yod pa de srid du lus shes te / srog ji tsam pa lus de tsam pa nyid de /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say that the body is transformed, that it is modified as long as life exists.üîΩThe body is as large as life is.

original: 'du pa dang ni gyes pa dang // srog ni lus kyi tshad can te //üîΩde ni rigs pa rnams kyis smras //
analyzed: 'du pa dang ni gyes pa dang // srog ni lus kyi tshad can te //üîΩde ni rigs pa rnams kyis smras //
translated: The body is the measure of life.üîΩThe SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say that the body is the measure of life.

original: nams kyang phra mo yod ma yin //
analyzed: nams kyang phra mo yod ma yin //
translated: There is never a subtle particle that exists.

original: zhes so // rgyu la rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang / bdag dang / tshangs pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa rgyu kun tu rtog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes so // rgyu la rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang / bdag dang / tshangs pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa rgyu kun tu rtog par byed pa'o //
translated: The conception of a cause is the conception of a permanent, self, BrahmƒÅ, ƒ™≈õvara, and so on as a cause.

original: de dag las 'bras bu 'byung ba dang / gcig pa dang / tha dad par lung bstan du med ces rtog go //
analyzed: de dag las 'bras bu 'byung ba dang / gcig pa dang / tha dad par lung bstan du med ces rtog go //
translated: They think that the effect arises from them, and that it is inexpressible whether it is identical to or different from them.

original: nga'i gsung rab la ma yin no zhes pa ni ji skad du gsungs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: nga'i gsung rab la ma yin no zhes pa ni ji skad du gsungs pa yin zhe na /
translated: But not in my scriptures.

original: gnyis ka dang gnyis ka ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gnyis su lung bstan du med pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i gsung @134b rab las ni thams cad bsam du med par brjod pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis ka dang gnyis ka ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gnyis su lung bstan du med pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i gsung @134b rab las ni thams cad bsam du med par brjod pa ste /
translated: The inexpressible nature of both and neither and so on is stated in the scriptures of the Omniscient One, who declares that everything is inconceivable.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dang mi ldan pa rnam par rtog cing snang ba med par mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa la yod pa dang / med pa dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / gnyis ka dang / gnyis ka ma yin pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug go //
analyzed: gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dang mi ldan pa rnam par rtog cing snang ba med par mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa la yod pa dang / med pa dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / gnyis ka dang / gnyis ka ma yin pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug go //
translated: Conceptualization does not engage in the characteristics of existence, non-existence, permanence, impermanence, both, and neither.

original: gang na 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i dngos po yod pa der rnam par rtog pa 'jug gi /
analyzed: gang na 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i dngos po yod pa der rnam par rtog pa 'jug gi /
translated: Conceptualization engages where there is the entity of apprehendeds and apprehenders.

original: nga'i tshul gyis mi gnyis par smra ba de dag la lung mi ston pa zhes bya ba'i gzhag pa lta ga la yod /
analyzed: nga'i tshul gyis mi gnyis par smra ba de dag la lung mi ston pa zhes bya ba'i gzhag pa lta ga la yod /
translated: How could there be a placement called ‚Äúnot teaching the scriptures‚Äù for those who speak non-dually in the manner of my system?

original: chos thams cad ni byed pa med pas na zhes bya ba ni rang dang skad cig pa'i phyir lhag pa'i bya ba dang / byed pa dag mngon par 'brel te 'bras bu mi skye bas na de'i phyir chos thams cad ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni byed pa med pas na zhes bya ba ni rang dang skad cig pa'i phyir lhag pa'i bya ba dang / byed pa dag mngon par 'brel te 'bras bu mi skye bas na de'i phyir chos thams cad ma skyes pa ste /
translated: Since all phenomena are without activity, since they are momentary, the superimposition of activity and agent is not established, and since the effect is not produced, therefore all phenomena are unproduced.

original: de ma thag pa tsam gyis 'di yod na 'di yod do zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: de ma thag pa tsam gyis 'di yod na 'di yod do zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig go //
translated: By the mere fact of its being immediately antecedent, it is said: If this exists, that comes to be.

original: ngo bo nyid med ces bya ba ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid gzhan pa dang / gzhan ma yin pa rnam par dpyad pa na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med ces bya ba ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid gzhan pa dang / gzhan ma yin pa rnam par dpyad pa na /
translated: As for without own-being, this is because, when the specific and general characteristics are investigated as being either different or non-different,

original: mi rigs pas na des ni der sngar dpyad zin to //
analyzed: mi rigs pas na des ni der sngar dpyad zin to //
translated: it is not tenable. Therefore, it has already been investigated above.

original: de la blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde mang por rab tu dgrol ba la ltos te don chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de la blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde mang por rab tu dgrol ba la ltos te don chud par bya'o //
translated: As for without acceptance and without rejection, their meaning should be understood in dependence upon the extensive explanation in many Sutras.

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid blang na zhes pa ni yongs su brtag pa na'o //
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid blang na zhes pa ni yongs su brtag pa na'o //
translated: As for if the specific and general characteristics are accepted, this is in the case of thorough investigation.

original: blang du med pa ni sgo rnam pa du mas kyang khong du mi chud do //
analyzed: blang du med pa ni sgo rnam pa du mas kyang khong du mi chud do //
translated: As for unacceptable, it is not comprehensible by means of many doors.

original: phyi rol gyi 'am gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rnam pa sna tshogs su kun rtog pa de ni gcig pa dang tha dad par mi rigs so //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi 'am gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rnam pa sna tshogs su kun rtog pa de ni gcig pa dang tha dad par mi rigs so //
translated: As for the imagination of what is unreal in the form of the variety of specific and general characteristics of the other-dependent, it is not tenable as being either identical or different.

original: gcig pa rang bzhin gnyis su med pa'i phyir mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i 'du byed rnams la /
analyzed: gcig pa rang bzhin gnyis su med pa'i phyir mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i 'du byed rnams la /
translated: Because they are the same, they are not different in nature.üîΩ

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because of the oneness of the nature, which is nondual, impermanent formations and so on do not have any other characteristics such as impermanence.

original: rnam pa cis kyang chos thams cad la rang bzhin gyis gnyis par gsungs pas na rang bzhin gnyis pa'i mtshan nyid med de /
analyzed: rnam pa cis kyang chos thams cad la rang bzhin gyis gnyis par gsungs pas na rang bzhin gnyis pa'i mtshan nyid med de /
translated: Because it is said that all phenomena are essentially nondual in every way, they do not have the characteristics of a dual nature.

original: dngos po gcig la gnyis su mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po gcig la gnyis su mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not logical for a single thing to be dual.

original: 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid du 'ong ba med pas na blang du med do //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid du 'ong ba med pas na blang du med do //
translated: Since there is no coming as a characteristic of arising, there is nothing to take up.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin med pas na 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid can dor bar yang med do //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin med pas na 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid can dor bar yang med do //
translated: Since there is no nature of variety, there is also nothing to discard, which is the characteristic of destruction.

original: chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad kyis 'ong ba dang 'gro ba @135a * //üîΩdang bral ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad kyis 'ong ba dang 'gro ba @135a * // dang bral ba'o //
translated: All phenomena are free from coming and going in every way.

original: ji ltar dbu ma las 'byung ba //
analyzed: ji ltar dbu ma las 'byung ba //
translated: As it is said in the Madhyamaka scriptures:üîΩWithout cessation, without arising,

original: 'gag med skye ba med pa dang // rtag med chad pa med pa dang // 'ong ba med pa 'gro ba med //
analyzed: 'gag med skye ba med pa dang // rtag med chad pa med pa dang // 'ong ba med pa 'gro ba med //
translated: without annihilation, without permanence, without coming, without going,

original: gang rten brten par 'byung ba ni //
analyzed: gang rten brten par 'byung ba ni //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which arises in dependence on something else‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la'o //
translated: and so on.

original: dngos po rnams gzhan du ni 'gag par rtog ste /
analyzed: dngos po rnams gzhan du ni 'gag par rtog ste /
translated: One imagines that things cease to exist in another place.

original: re zhig na dngos pa'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid ni yod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: re zhig na dngos pa'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid ni yod pa ma yin te //
translated: But the nature of things is not existent,

original: yod pa dang med pa gnyis kyi rnam par snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir brjod du med pa la su'i 'gag pa rtog par byed /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa gnyis kyi rnam par snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir brjod du med pa la su'i 'gag pa rtog par byed /
translated: because it is free from the conceptual differentiation of the appearance of both existence and nonexistence.üîΩOne imagines that the cessation of things is due to the existence of the characteristics of origination and impermanence.

original: mtshan nyid skye ba mi rtag pa yod pas zhes pa ni skad cig pa'i 'du byed rnams la skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / rga ba dang / mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid rim gyis 'byung ba ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: mtshan nyid skye ba mi rtag pa yod pas zhes pa ni skad cig pa'i 'du byed rnams la skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / rga ba dang / mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid rim gyis 'byung ba ni mi rung ngo //
translated: But it is not possible that the characteristics of origination, duration, change, and impermanence of momentary formations occur sequentially.

original: 'on te yang de ltar 'gyur na ni skad cig pa gzhan du gnas pa'i phyir de dag skad cig pa ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te yang de ltar 'gyur na ni skad cig pa gzhan du gnas pa'i phyir de dag skad cig pa ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: But if that were so, they would not be momentary, because they would endure in another moment.

original: de ni 'di skad ces smras pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad ces smras pa yin te /
translated: This is what he says.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid skye ba ni mi rtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid skye ba ni mi rtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since arising is the characteristic of the conditioned, it is called impermanent.

original: des na skad cig ma drug tu gnas par yang lan smras par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: des na skad cig ma drug tu gnas par yang lan smras par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that lasting for six moments is also an answer.

original: gsol bar gyur pa mgo gcig cig lung ston to //
analyzed: gsol bar gyur pa mgo gcig cig lung ston to //
translated: When the question is in the form of a request, it is called a question to be answered categorically.

original: kha cig tu spyir lung bstan pas som nyi rnam par ma log pa'i phyir khyad par cung zad tsam zhig dri ba yod pa ni 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: kha cig tu spyir lung bstan pas som nyi rnam par ma log pa'i phyir khyad par cung zad tsam zhig dri ba yod pa ni 'dri ba'o //
translated: In some cases, when a general answer does not remove doubt, a question is asked to remove a small distinction.

original: de bzhin du bsdus pa'i don rnam par phye ste gzung ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsdus pa'i don rnam par phye ste gzung ba'o //
translated: In the same way, the meaning of the summary is distinguished and grasped.

original: rtsod pa'i skye bo la ltos te cung zad kyang gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i skye bo la ltos te cung zad kyang gzhag pa'o //
translated: In relation to disputatious people, it is said that nothing is established.

original: shes rab la ltos te gang zab mo'i mtshan nyid kyi chos thams cad lung bstan par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab la ltos te gang zab mo'i mtshan nyid kyi chos thams cad lung bstan par mdzad pa'o //
translated: In relation to wisdom, it is said that all phenomena with profound characteristics are to be answered.

original: grangs can dang khyad par can la sogs pas lung mi ston pa rnams ji lta bur smras pa de bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: grangs can dang khyad par can la sogs pas lung mi ston pa rnams ji lta bur smras pa de bshad par bya ste /
translated: The non-answers of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya, Vai≈õe·π£ika, and others should be explained as follows.

original: gnas dang gnas pa gzhan pa ni lung bstan du med do zhes so //
analyzed: gnas dang gnas pa gzhan pa ni lung bstan du med do zhes so //
translated: And the place and the located are not declared to be other.

original: so sor grub pa'i rnams sbyor ba dang / so sor grub pa ma yin pa'i rnams ni phrad pa ste zhes pa la /
analyzed: so sor grub pa'i rnams sbyor ba dang / so sor grub pa ma yin pa'i rnams ni phrad pa ste zhes pa la /
translated: Those that are joined in a particular way are said to be in contact. Those that are not joined in a particular way are not in contact.

original: phrad pa'i rgyu ma gtogs par de la gnas pa'i rdzas dang yon tan la sogs pa phyogs gzhan du grub po zhes smra bar mi nus so //
analyzed: phrad pa'i rgyu ma gtogs par de la gnas pa'i rdzas dang yon tan la sogs pa phyogs gzhan du grub po zhes smra bar mi nus so //
translated: Apart from the cause of contact, it is not possible to say that the substance, quality, etc. located in that are established in another place.

original: phrad pa'i rgyu'i rang bzhin yang lung bstan du med do //
analyzed: phrad pa'i rgyu'i rang bzhin yang lung bstan du med do //
translated: And the nature of the cause of contact is not declared.

original: so sor grub pa rnams la ni bum pa dang / snam bu la sogs pa tha dad du lung bstan du yod do zhes so //
analyzed: so sor grub pa rnams la ni bum pa dang / snam bu la sogs pa tha dad du lung bstan du yod do zhes so //
translated: But those that are established in a particular way are declared to be different, as in the case of a pot, a cloth, etc.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'i rnam par @135b shes shing gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes nas chos la bdag med pa yongs su shes par gyur te /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'i rnam par @135b shes shing gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes nas chos la bdag med pa yongs su shes par gyur te /
translated: Having fully understood the fruit of stream-entry, etc., and the selflessness of persons, one fully understands the selflessness of phenomena.

original: sa nas sa'i mtshan nyid las 'das pa rtogs par khong du chud pas zhes bya ba ni sa dang po la sogs pa'i rang gi phyogs dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: sa nas sa'i mtshan nyid las 'das pa rtogs par khong du chud pas zhes bya ba ni sa dang po la sogs pa'i rang gi phyogs dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How does one know that?

original: de la sbyin pa la sogs pa ni rang gi phyogs kyi mtshan nyid du 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa la sogs pa ni rang gi phyogs kyi mtshan nyid du 'byed pa'o //
translated: Therein, generosity and so forth are distinguished as the characteristics of one's own stage.

original: 'jungs pa la sogs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: 'jungs pa la sogs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: Stinginess and so forth are the opposing stage.

original: sa dang sar mtshan nyid gang yin pa des sa'i phyogs kyi mi mthun pa las 'da' ba rtogs par khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: sa dang sar mtshan nyid gang yin pa des sa'i phyogs kyi mi mthun pa las 'da' ba rtogs par khong du chud pa'o //
translated: By the characteristics of the stages, one comprehends the realization of the transcendence of the opposing stage of one's own stage.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'i mi shes pa chung ngu dang / 'bring po dang / chen po sa bcur gtogs pa ye shes chen po dang / 'bring po dang chung du'i mtshan nyid kyi spang bar bya'o zhes de ltar rnam par shes par gyur pa dang /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'i mi shes pa chung ngu dang / 'bring po dang / chen po sa bcur gtogs pa ye shes chen po dang / 'bring po dang chung du'i mtshan nyid kyi spang bar bya'o zhes de ltar rnam par shes par gyur pa dang /
translated: One should eliminate the small, medium, and great ignorance of the absence of afflictions belonging to the ten stages, which have the characteristics of great, medium, and small wisdom, thinking in this way.

original: chos thams cad kyi yul 'gro ba'i lus longs spyod par nye bar 'tsho bar 'gyur ro zhes te ;
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi yul 'gro ba'i lus longs spyod par nye bar 'tsho bar 'gyur ro zhes te ;
translated: The body that goes to the domain of all objects will be the sustenance of enjoyment.

original: ; de la chos thams cad kyi yul la 'gro ba'i lus ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i chud pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: ; de la chos thams cad kyi yul la 'gro ba'i lus ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i chud pa'i sku ste /
translated: Therein, the body that goes to the domain of all objects is the body of the Omniscient One.

original: gnyis pa dang mi gnyis pa'i ting nge 'dzin mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa dang mi gnyis pa'i ting nge 'dzin mkhyen pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the samƒÅdhi that is both dual and non-dual.

original: de bzhin du yang sems can thams cad la yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bur chos bshad pa la sogs pa'i longs spyod kyi 'tsho bas nye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang sems can thams cad la yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bur chos bshad pa la sogs pa'i longs spyod kyi 'tsho bas nye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, it becomes the sustenance of enjoyment, such as teaching the Dharma like a wish-fulfilling jewel to all sentient beings.

original: tha ma dang / bar ma dang / mchog ces bya ba ni shes rab kyi khyad par gyis chung ngu dang / 'bring po dang / chen po'i mtshan nyid du brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: tha ma dang / bar ma dang / mchog ces bya ba ni shes rab kyi khyad par gyis chung ngu dang / 'bring po dang / chen po'i mtshan nyid du brtag par bya'o //
translated: The inferior, middling, and superior should be understood as the characteristics of small, medium, and great, respectively, due to the distinction of wisdom.

original: ji ltar 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: As stated here:

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi myos pas bslad pa ni zag pa med pa'i dbyings su gnas zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi myos pas bslad pa ni zag pa med pa'i dbyings su gnas zhes pa'o //
translated: One intoxicated by samƒÅdhi abides in the uncontaminated realm.

original: 'o na ji ltar yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya /
translated: Then, how is it called nirvƒÅ·πáa?

original: dam pa'i chos punda ri ka las /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos punda ri ka las /
translated: Pundarika says:üîΩI say that the cause of appearance is nirvana.

original: snang ba'i rgyu ni mya ngan las 'da' bar nga smra'o zhes gsungs pas na de 'di nyes pa med do //
analyzed: snang ba'i rgyu ni mya ngan las 'da' bar nga smra'o zhes gsungs pas na de 'di nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault in this.üîΩLiberation is the exhaustion of the suffering of cyclic existence

original: sred pa la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs te /
analyzed: sred pa la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs te /
translated: through the abandonment of the afflictions such as craving.

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal zad pa nyid ni thar pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal zad pa nyid ni thar pa'o //
translated: Liberation is connected with the appearance of the body

original: ma rig pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / las las skyes pa'i lus kyi snang ba dang 'brel te /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / las las skyes pa'i lus kyi snang ba dang 'brel te /
translated: that arises from the afflictions of ignorance and karma.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob nas de dag gi thar pa ni 'gog pa la mnyam par gzhag pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob nas de dag gi thar pa ni 'gog pa la mnyam par gzhag pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: Having attained the inconceivable uncontaminated concentration, their liberation is similar to equipoise in cessation.

original: @136a * // thams cad mkhyen pa'i mdas snying rje'i bag chags kyi sa bon gyis sad de /
analyzed: @136a * // thams cad mkhyen pa'i mdas snying rje'i bag chags kyi sa bon gyis sad de /
translated: Awakened by the arrow of omniscience, the seed of the latent tendencies of compassion,

original: snang ba dang bcas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin thob nas sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snang ba dang bcas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin thob nas sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: they attain the bodhisattva concentration that is accompanied by appearance and become buddhas.

original: bye brag gis gong nas gong du zhes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa kun tu spyod pa dang bral te //
analyzed: bye brag gis gong nas gong du zhes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa kun tu spyod pa dang bral te //
translated: The phrase in particular, higher and higher means that one becomes free from the practice of desire and so on.

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bye brag gi lam gyis chen po dang / bar ma dang / chung ngu'i sbyor ba rnams rnyog pa'i mtshan nyid spong bas 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bye brag gi lam gyis chen po dang / bar ma dang / chung ngu'i sbyor ba rnams rnyog pa'i mtshan nyid spong bas 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
translated: The path characterized by seeing and cultivation, in particular, is the result of the abandonment of the characteristics of the great, middling, and small afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: de dag dang bral nas chu rnams kyi rnyog pa rab tu dang ba bzhin du dgra bcom pa rnams kyi 'bras bur 'gyur ro zhes pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad do //
analyzed: de dag dang bral nas chu rnams kyi rnyog pa rab tu dang ba bzhin du dgra bcom pa rnams kyi 'bras bur 'gyur ro zhes pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad do //
translated: When one is free from those, one becomes an arhat, like water that is clear of turbidity. This is the conventional expression of the world.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gsal ba'i gzugs su snang ba la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gsal ba'i gzugs su snang ba la /
translated: The dependent nature appears as the form of clarity.

original: gang snang ba med pa'i rtag pa dang / bdag dang / rdul phra mo la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa de ni gzhan gyi dbang la yongs su brtags pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gang snang ba med pa'i rtag pa dang / bdag dang / rdul phra mo la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa de ni gzhan gyi dbang la yongs su brtags pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The imagined nature is the conceptualization of that which appears as permanent, a self, subtle particles, and so on.

original: de bzhin du phung po lnga'i dag nyid la khyab pa dang phra ba la sogs par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du phung po lnga'i dag nyid la khyab pa dang phra ba la sogs par rtog pa'o //
translated: Likewise, there are the concepts of the five aggregates as pure, pervasive, subtle, and so on.

original: gzhan gyi dbang der kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin de yang yod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang der kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin de yang yod pa yang ma yin /
translated: The imagined nature in that dependent nature does not exist,

original: med pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin /
translated: nor does it not exist.

original: yod med kyang ma yin zhes pa ni gnyis ka'i rang bzhin du yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yod med kyang ma yin zhes pa ni gnyis ka'i rang bzhin du yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor does it both exist and not exist as the nature of both.

original: yod pa ma yin pa'i rgyu gsungs pa /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa'i rgyu gsungs pa /
translated: The reason for its non-existence is stated:

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid pas na zhes te /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid pas na zhes te /
translated: Because it is the characteristic of the imagined, which is not real.

original: gang gis rtag pa dang / bdag dang / phyi rol gyi rdzas la sogs pa yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa des na kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin la mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis rtag pa dang / bdag dang / phyi rol gyi rdzas la sogs pa yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa des na kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin la mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: By that imagination of what is unreal, the imagined nature is clung to as permanent, a self, external substances, and so on.

original: yod pa yang ma yin pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba'i don ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa yang ma yin pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba'i don ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not exist because it is not the meaning of reality as it is.

original: gang gis yang chud pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa tsam du snang ba'i phyir med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis yang chud pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa tsam du snang ba'i phyir med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not non-existent because it appears as mere conceptual thought, which is not entirely non-existent.

original: gnyis kyi rang bzhin med pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa gsum po yang yul med pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis kyi rang bzhin med pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa gsum po yang yul med pa ste /
translated: Because they do not have the nature of duality, the three kinds of conceptualization also do not have an object.

original: des na yang dag pa ma yin par kun rtog pa'o //
analyzed: des na yang dag pa ma yin par kun rtog pa'o //
translated: Therefore, they are unreal ideation.

original: rang bzhin gsum gyi mtshan nyid ni thams cad mkhyen pas 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: rang bzhin gsum gyi mtshan nyid ni thams cad mkhyen pas 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: The defining characteristics of the three natures were taught by the Omniscient One in this very text:

original: brtags pa yi ni rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: brtags pa yi ni rang bzhin gyis //
translated: By the imagined nature,

original: dngos po thams cad ma skyes te //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ma skyes te //
translated: all things are non-arisen.

original: gzhan dbang la ni brten nas su //
analyzed: gzhan dbang la ni brten nas su //
translated: In dependence on the relative,

original: mi rnams rnam par rtog pa skye //
analyzed: mi rnams rnam par rtog pa skye //
translated: the conceptualization of people arises.

original: rnam par rtog pas rnam spangs te //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas rnam spangs te //
translated: When conceptualization is abandoned,

original: gang tshe gzhan dbang dag pa ni //
analyzed: gang tshe gzhan dbang dag pa ni //
translated: the pure relative

original: grub pa de bzhin nyid bshad par //
analyzed: grub pa de bzhin nyid bshad par //
translated: is explained to be reality.

original: mdo sde mdo sder ngas smras so //
analyzed: mdo sde mdo sder ngas smras so //
translated: I have taught this in the s≈´tras.

original: ji ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Just as it is taught by the Lord himself in the S≈´tra Unraveling the Intention:

original: rigs kyi bu rang bzhin med pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu rang bzhin med pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family, there are three types of naturelessness:

original: mtshan nyid rang bzhin med @136b pa dang / skye ba rang bzhin med pa dang / don dam pa rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rang bzhin med @136b pa dang / skye ba rang bzhin med pa dang / don dam pa rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: and the ultimate is essencelessness.

original: byis pa rnams kyis rtag pa dang / phyi rol gyi rdzas la sogs pa mtshan nyid gang dag gis kun rtog pa'i mtshan nyid de dag gis kun brtags pa'am /
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyis rtag pa dang / phyi rol gyi rdzas la sogs pa mtshan nyid gang dag gis kun rtog pa'i mtshan nyid de dag gis kun brtags pa'am /
translated: The characteristic that fools imagine to be the permanent, external, substantial world and so forth is imagined to exist by way of its own characteristic.

original: ma skyes pa na mtshan nyid rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa na mtshan nyid rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: But since it does not arise in that way, the characteristic is essenceless.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa rnams kyi skye ba'i rang bzhin med de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa rnams kyi skye ba'i rang bzhin med de /
translated: The various aspects of the dependent are essenceless in terms of arising,üîΩbecause although they arise in various aspects, like dreams, magical illusions, and so forth, they are undermined by rational analysis, like houses, armies, forests, and so forth.

original: rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis rnam par gsal bar skyes su zin kyang shes rab kyis dpyad de khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du gnod pa'i phyir skye ba rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis rnam par gsal bar skyes su zin kyang shes rab kyis dpyad de khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du gnod pa'i phyir skye ba rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, arising is essenceless.

original: don dam pa grub pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal zhing ro gcig par 'gyur ba'i chud pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung ste //
analyzed: don dam pa grub pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal zhing ro gcig par 'gyur ba'i chud pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung ste //
translated: The ultimate reality, which is the luminous nature of the perfected, is the same taste, whether the Tathagatas arise or not.

original: chos nyid rgyun du gnas pa la ni 'dzin pa dang gzung ba rnam pa gnyis kyi rang bzhin med do //
analyzed: chos nyid rgyun du gnas pa la ni 'dzin pa dang gzung ba rnam pa gnyis kyi rang bzhin med do //
translated: The nature of reality, which is always present, is not of the nature of the duality of the grasped and the grasper.

original: ji ltar 'phags pa btsun gtso byams pas bshad pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa btsun gtso byams pas bshad pa /
translated: As it is explained by the noble Maitreya:

original: gnyis med pa yid dngos po ni //
analyzed: gnyis med pa yid dngos po ni //
translated: The non-dual mind is

original: stong pa yi ni mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: stong pa yi ni mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of emptiness.

original: zhes so // dngos po med pa'i stong pa'i mtshan nyid ci zhe na /
analyzed: zhes so // dngos po med pa'i stong pa'i mtshan nyid ci zhe na /
translated: What is the characteristic of the emptiness of non-existence?

original: dngos po nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po nyid do //
translated: It is existence itself.

original: ji ltar na mtshan nyid ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na mtshan nyid ce na /
translated: How is it a characteristic?

original: gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral ba'i chud pa yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin ni chos can no //
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral ba'i chud pa yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin ni chos can no //
translated: The perfected nature, which is the reality free from the aspects of duality, is the subject.

original: de la de'i 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i bral ba nyid ni chos nyid ces bya ste grub pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de la de'i 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i bral ba nyid ni chos nyid ces bya ste grub pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The freedom from the grasped and the grasper in that is called the nature of reality, which is the perfected nature.

original: de ste lang kar gshegs pa dang dgongs pa nges par 'grel par thams cad mkhyen pas bshad pa'i tshul du rang bzhin gsum du rnam par gzhag pa mi rung na ni de'i tshe rang rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzo 'ba' zhig ste /
analyzed: de ste lang kar gshegs pa dang dgongs pa nges par 'grel par thams cad mkhyen pas bshad pa'i tshul du rang bzhin gsum du rnam par gzhag pa mi rung na ni de'i tshe rang rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzo 'ba' zhig ste /
translated: If it is not suitable to posit the three natures in the way they are explained by the Omniscient One in the Lak·π£a·πáa S≈´tra and the Samdhinirmocana S≈´tra, then at that time it is just the individual‚Äôs own fabrication.

original: rtog pas smra bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtog pas smra bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be a theory of the mind.

original: gang dag yang gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin gang yin pa de grub pa zhes smra zhing gzhan gyis skyed par byed pas na gzhan gyi dbang ngo zhes pa don 'di ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dag yang gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin gang yin pa de grub pa zhes smra zhing gzhan gyis skyed par byed pas na gzhan gyi dbang ngo zhes pa don 'di ni ma yin te /
translated: Those who say that the dependent nature is established and that it is dependent because it is produced by other causes are not speaking of the meaning of this term.

original: de ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: de ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gzhan gyi dbang gis gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gis gnas pa ste /
translated: It is dependent because it is dependent on other causes.üîΩIt is dependent because it is dependent on other conditions.üîΩIt is dependent because it is dependent on other conceptualizations.üîΩIt is dependent because it is dependent on other imputations.üîΩIt is dependent because it is dependent on other designations.üîΩIt is dependent because it is dependent on other elaborations.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pas rnam pa sna tshogs kyi gzugs su spros par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pas rnam pa sna tshogs kyi gzugs su spros par byed pa'o //
translated: It is dependent because it is dependent on other forms of various types, such as ignorance.

original: gnyis kyi rnam pa gsal bar snang ba ni shes pa nyid rig pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam pa gsal bar snang ba ni shes pa nyid rig pa ste /
translated: The appearance of the aspect of duality is consciousness itself.

original: de ni 'di skad ces smras pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad ces smras pa yin no //
translated: This is what is said.

original: gang rkyen gzhan dag gi dbang du gyur cing 'dra ba'i skad cig ma gzhan la ltos pa ma gtogs par dam pa dang dam pa ma yin pa'i chos bstan pa la sogs pas rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa skye ba'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa
analyzed: gang rkyen gzhan dag gi dbang du gyur cing 'dra ba'i skad cig ma gzhan la ltos pa ma gtogs par dam pa dang dam pa ma yin pa'i chos bstan pa la sogs pas rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa skye ba'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa
translated: It is dependent on other conditions, and it is dependent on other similar moments, except for the teaching of the holy Dharma and so on, which are born in various aspects.

original: de ni gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
translated: That is the dependent.

original: mi g-yo ba de @137a * //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba de @137a * //
translated: That is immovable.

original: ni ro gcig par 'ba' zhig yang dag par rig pa tsam po rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid thams cad kyi rjes su song ba gser lta bu rkyen gzhan gyis 'phangs pa'i glo bur gyi nyes pa yongs su zad de yongs su grub pa ni
analyzed: ni ro gcig par 'ba' zhig yang dag par rig pa tsam po rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid thams cad kyi rjes su song ba gser lta bu rkyen gzhan gyis 'phangs pa'i glo bur gyi nyes pa yongs su zad de yongs su grub pa ni
translated: It is the only taste, the mere knowledge of reality, the nature of all things, which is naturally radiant, like gold, and is the perfected, in which the adventitious faults that are projected by other conditions are completely exhausted.

original: gsum pa'o // ji ltar 'phags pa de kho na nyid bsdus pa las 'byung ba /
analyzed: gsum pa'o // ji ltar 'phags pa de kho na nyid bsdus pa las 'byung ba /
translated: As it is said in the Compendium of Truth

original: rigs kyi bu sems 'di ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu sems 'di ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family, this mind is naturally radiant.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa rnams kyis sus ji ltar yongs su sbyong ba de de ltar grub par 'gyur ro zhes tshig gi don du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa rnams kyis sus ji ltar yongs su sbyong ba de de ltar grub par 'gyur ro zhes tshig gi don du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Whoever purifies it in whatever way, that one will be established in that way.

original: gzhan gyi dbang de la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang de la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The other-dependent also has two aspects:

original: 'khor ba rnams kyis ni ma rig pa dang / las las byung ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyis 'gro ba snang ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba rnams kyis ni ma rig pa dang / las las byung ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyis 'gro ba snang ba'o //
translated: for those in cyclic existence, it appears as the various kinds of transmigration that arise from ignorance and karma.

original: rnal 'byor ba rnams kyis ni dge ba'i 'du byed la sogs pa rnam pa dag pa rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba rnams kyis ni dge ba'i 'du byed la sogs pa rnam pa dag pa rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba'o //
translated: For yogins, it appears as the various kinds of magical emanations that arise from pure formative forces, such as virtue.

original: de gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral zhing yang dag par rig pa tsam ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal zhing 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i yongs su grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral zhing yang dag par rig pa tsam ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal zhing 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i yongs su grub pa yin no //
translated: The perfected nature is free from the aspects of both of those and is simply the correct understanding that is naturally radiant and is neither compounded nor uncompounded.

original: ji ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las 'byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las 'byung ba /
translated: As the S≈´tra Unravelling the Intended Meaning teaches:

original: rigs kyi bu 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba de ni ston pa'i btags pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba de ni ston pa'i btags pa'i tshig go //
translated: Son of noble family, ‚Äòconditioned‚Äô and ‚Äòunconditioned‚Äô are terms that the Teacher has designated.

original: dbang po la sogs pa sus kyang ma byas pas na 'dus ma byas te /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa sus kyang ma byas pas na 'dus ma byas te /
translated: Since it is not created by any faculty, etc., it is unconditioned.

original: chos nyid 'di ni ye gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos nyid 'di ni ye gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This reality is called ‚Äòprimordially present.‚Äô

original: skad cig pa'i phyir 'dus byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skad cig pa'i phyir 'dus byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it is momentary, it is called ‚Äòconditioned.‚Äô This is the meaning.

original: de yang gang zag la bdag med pa'i dngos por 'dzin pa med pas zhes bya ba ni skad cig pa 'jig pa khong du chud par gyur pa'i 'og tu rtag pa'i bdag tu lta ba spong ngo //
analyzed: de yang gang zag la bdag med pa'i dngos por 'dzin pa med pas zhes bya ba ni skad cig pa 'jig pa khong du chud par gyur pa'i 'og tu rtag pa'i bdag tu lta ba spong ngo //
translated: Moreover, it is said that because there is no grasping at things as real in the absence of a self of persons, after one has understood that things are momentary and perishable, one abandons the view of a permanent self.

original: dngos por 'dzin pa med pas zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi dngos por 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir chos la bdag med pa ste zhes par der bstan to //
analyzed: dngos por 'dzin pa med pas zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi dngos por 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir chos la bdag med pa ste zhes par der bstan to //
translated: Because there is no grasping at things as real, there is no self in phenomena. This is what is taught there.

original: gzhan du dngos por 'dzin pa med par mi rung ste /
analyzed: gzhan du dngos por 'dzin pa med par mi rung ste /
translated: Otherwise, it would not be possible to be without grasping at things as real.

original: gang zag la bdag med pa ni phyi rol gyi don du lta ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa ni phyi rol gyi don du lta ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the absence of a self of persons is viewed as an external object.

original: de'i phyir rdo rje gcod pa las 'di skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir rdo rje gcod pa las 'di skad du gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, the Diamond Cutter says:

original: gzugs la'ang ma zhugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la'ang ma zhugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDo not settle on form, etc.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na mdo sde 'dir lhan cig tu skyes pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na mdo sde 'dir lhan cig tu skyes pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, this sutra says: ‚Äúarisen together,‚Äù etc.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni chos la bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni chos la bdag med pa ste /
translated: The view of the transitory collection is the selflessness of phenomena.

original: phyi rol gyi don sun dbyung bar rab tu byed pa'i don gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don sun dbyung bar rab tu byed pa'i don gyi phyir ro //
translated: The purpose is to refute external objects.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi lus mnyam pa nyid ni yang dag @137b par rig pa tsam du mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi lus mnyam pa nyid ni yang dag @137b par rig pa tsam du mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sameness of one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô bodies is the same in being mere cognition.

original: phung po bzhi gzugs kyi mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po bzhi gzugs kyi mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The four aggregates are the characteristics of form.

original: gang las gzugs med pas shes par byed pa'i rgyur gsungs so //
analyzed: gang las gzugs med pas shes par byed pa'i rgyur gsungs so //
translated: The cause that generates consciousness is said to be form.

original: skye bar byed pa'i rgyur gsungs pa la 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: skye bar byed pa'i rgyur gsungs pa la 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The cause that generates is said to be the elements and the element-derivatives, etc.

original: so sor snang ba zhes par 'brel to //
analyzed: so sor snang ba zhes par 'brel to //
translated: The individual appearances are connected.

original: de yang phan tshun gyi rgyu'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir zhes pa ni 'byung ba rnams tshogs par 'dus pa'i gzugs ni reg pa la sogs pas gzugs kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de yang phan tshun gyi rgyu'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir zhes pa ni 'byung ba rnams tshogs par 'dus pa'i gzugs ni reg pa la sogs pas gzugs kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: Moreover, because they are the characteristics of each other‚Äôs causes, the form that is the collection of the elements is the characteristic of form by way of contact, etc.

original: de la brten pa la sogs pa'i las kyis ni 'byung ba rnams rjes su dpag go zhes so //
analyzed: de la brten pa la sogs pa'i las kyis ni 'byung ba rnams rjes su dpag go zhes so //
translated: The elements are inferred by the function of supporting, etc.

original: 'byung ba rnams phan tshun du rgyu byed pa ni rim du mi skye'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams phan tshun du rgyu byed pa ni rim du mi skye'o //
translated: The elements do not act as causes for each other in a sequential order.

original: gsungs pa bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: This should be understood as stated.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos por lhan cig tu skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba bzlog pa ni phyi rol gyi sgra dang / rtag pa yod pa'i phyogs la phyogs ma yin pa'i lta ba mthong ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i ye shes kyis spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos por lhan cig tu skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba bzlog pa ni phyi rol gyi sgra dang / rtag pa yod pa'i phyogs la phyogs ma yin pa'i lta ba mthong ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i ye shes kyis spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The simultaneous arising of external things is averted by the view of the transitory collection. The view that is not the position of the existence of permanence is seen. It is abandoned by correct pristine wisdom.

original: de kho na nyid kyi don du ni thams cad mkhyen pas mkhyen to //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi don du ni thams cad mkhyen pas mkhyen to //
translated: The meaning of reality is known by the Omniscient One.

original: the tshom gyi mtshan nyid ni yang dag pa'i ye shes ma gtogs par mi rtogs so //
analyzed: the tshom gyi mtshan nyid ni yang dag pa'i ye shes ma gtogs par mi rtogs so //
translated: The definition of doubt is that it is not understood except through correct knowledge.

original: 'bras bu thob pa'i phyir lam gyi chos khong du chud par bya ba shin tu mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu thob pa'i phyir lam gyi chos khong du chud par bya ba shin tu mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the result is attained, the Dharma of the path is fully understood, and because it is seen.

original: dag kyang ma dag pa'i phyir zhes pa ni rgyu'i tshig ste /
analyzed: dag kyang ma dag pa'i phyir zhes pa ni rgyu'i tshig ste /
translated: The phrase even though pure, it is impure is a causal statement.

original: ston pa gzhan gyis sdug bsngal dang mi mdzes pa la sogs pa 'khor ba las skyo ba'i rgyu smras pa la /
analyzed: ston pa gzhan gyis sdug bsngal dang mi mdzes pa la sogs pa 'khor ba las skyo ba'i rgyu smras pa la /
translated: Other teachers speak of the causes of weariness with cyclic existence, such as suffering and ugliness.

original: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / tshangs pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa'i rgyu las byung zhes te /
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / tshangs pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa'i rgyu las byung zhes te /
translated: They say, It arises from the causes of permanence, self, Brahman, the lord, and so on.

original: dag tu zin kyang dag pa ma yin zhes pa ni rgyu'i tshig ste /
analyzed: dag tu zin kyang dag pa ma yin zhes pa ni rgyu'i tshig ste /
translated: The phrase even though pure, it is impure is a causal statement.

original: de dag gi gtsug lag la yon tan du mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi gtsug lag la yon tan du mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They do not see the qualities in their scriptures.

original: sdug bsngal skye ba'i gnas zhes bya ba ni des rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bdag gir chags pa'i ma rig pa dang / las kyi mtshan nyid kyi kun 'byung ba de shin tu mthong ba'i phyir snyems pa mi byed do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal skye ba'i gnas zhes bya ba ni des rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bdag gir chags pa'i ma rig pa dang / las kyi mtshan nyid kyi kun 'byung ba de shin tu mthong ba'i phyir snyems pa mi byed do //
translated: The phrase the basis for the arising of suffering refers to the fact that one does not become conceited because of the thorough knowledge of the reality of the origin of suffering, which is to say, the ignorance that consists of the notions of I and mine and the actions that are rooted in that ignorance.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa zag pa med pa ni theg pa chen por chos la bdag med par rab tu sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa zag pa med pa ni theg pa chen por chos la bdag med par rab tu sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The nonconceptual intuition that is free from the outflows should be applied to the universal vehicle, because it is the intuition that realizes the insubstantiality of things.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi yan lag ni sa'i khyad par du 'gro bar ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi yan lag ni sa'i khyad par du 'gro bar ro //
translated: The limb of morality of the bodhisattva is the progress to the stages.

original: gzugs su snang ba'i skye ba lan cig pas na lan cig phyir 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs su snang ba'i skye ba lan cig pas na lan cig phyir 'ong ba'o //
translated: The once-returner is so called because he is reborn only once in the form realm.

original: dus gsum gyi mnyam pa nyid dang ldan pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba ste /
analyzed: dus gsum gyi mnyam pa nyid dang ldan pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba ste /
translated: The non-returner is so called because he is endowed with the sameness of the three times.

original: de'i phyir 'di skad du gsungs pa /üîΩ'das pa dang / @138a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di skad du gsungs pa / 'das pa dang / @138a * //
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi mtshan nyid yod pa dang / med par mi 'jug pas te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi mtshan nyid yod pa dang / med par mi 'jug pas te /
translated: The past, future, and present are not engaged by the notions of existence and nonexistence.

original: gang gis don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa'i gnas su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa'i gnas su 'jug pa'o //
translated: He enters the state of the correct knowledge of ultimate truth as non-duality.

original: des dus gsum gyi gnyis kyi mnyam pa'i tshig gi don mi snang ngo //
analyzed: des dus gsum gyi gnyis kyi mnyam pa'i tshig gi don mi snang ngo //
translated: By that, the meaning of the word ‚Äúequality‚Äù in the three times does not appear.

original: ji ltar zhes pa dang / de'i phyir gsungs pa dang / lta ba'i nyes pa bag la nyal ba phyir mi 'ong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes pa dang / de'i phyir gsungs pa dang / lta ba'i nyes pa bag la nyal ba phyir mi 'ong ba'i phyir te /
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúTherefore, because the fault of view is not latent, it does not return.‚Äù

original: rgyu med pas na 'bras bu'ang med do //
analyzed: rgyu med pas na 'bras bu'ang med do //
translated: Because there is no cause, there is also no result.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: That itself is said:

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i tshe na de spangs pa na'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i tshe na de spangs pa na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen it does not return, it is abandoned at that time.‚Äù

original: dgra bcom pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe Arhat‚Äù and so on.

original: chos la bdag med pa rtogs pa'i phyir so sor re rer bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan du bya ba la sogs pa gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pas na mi gnyis pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa ni de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa rtogs pa'i phyir so sor re rer bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan du bya ba la sogs pa gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pas na mi gnyis pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa ni de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Because of realizing the selflessness of phenomena, each one is called ‚Äúabiding in non-dual samƒÅdhi‚Äù because of abandoning the conceptualization of the two aspects of each one, such as concentration and the object of concentration.

original: zhib phyogs gcig ces bya ba ni bdag la phan par zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: zhib phyogs gcig ces bya ba ni bdag la phan par zhugs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúOne side‚Äù means engaging in benefitting oneself.

original: zhi ba'i mtshan nyid kyi mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis byang chub tu smon lam btab pas /
analyzed: zhi ba'i mtshan nyid kyi mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i don to // byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis byang chub tu smon lam btab pas /
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúnirvana with the nature of nonfabrication‚Äù is that the remainder of the aggregates exists.üîΩThe meaning of the term ‚Äúnirvana with the nature of being unconditioned‚Äù is that the remainder of the afflictions does not exist.üîΩThe meaning of the term ‚Äúnirvana with the nature of being unarisen‚Äù is that the remainder of the aggregates does not exist.

original: gang dge ba'i rtsa ba la goms pa der 'phags pa'i nyan thos der rmongs zhes bya'o //üîΩji ltar sdong po brgyan las 'byung ba /
analyzed: gang dge ba'i rtsa ba la goms pa der 'phags pa'i nyan thos der rmongs zhes bya'o // ji ltar sdong po brgyan las 'byung ba /
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúnirvana with the nature of being unarisen‚Äù is that the remainder of the aggregates does not exist.üîΩThe meaning of the term ‚Äúnirvana with the nature of being unarisen‚Äù is that the remainder of the aggregates does not exist.üîΩThe meaning of the term ‚Äúnirvana with the nature of being unarisen‚Äù is that the remainder of the aggregates does not exist.üîΩThe meaning of the term ‚Äúnirvana with the nature of being unarisen‚Äù is that the remainder of the aggregates does not exist.üîΩThe meaning of the term ‚Äúnirvana with the nature of being unarisen‚Äù is that the remainder of the aggregates does not exist.

original: mnyan du yod pa na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yod pa ma smin pa'i phyir nyan thos de dag gis mi mthong ba ni lta ste /üîΩdmus long bzhin no zhes rgya cher ro //
analyzed: mnyan du yod pa na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yod pa ma smin pa'i phyir nyan thos de dag gis mi mthong ba ni lta ste / dmus long bzhin no zhes rgya cher ro //
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúnirvana with the nature of being unarisen‚Äù is that the remainder of the aggregates does not exist.üîΩThe meaning of the term ‚Äúnirvana with the nature of being unarisen‚Äù is that the remainder of the aggregates does not exist.üîΩThe meaning of the term ‚Äúnirvana with the nature of being unarisen‚Äù is that the remainder of the aggregates does not exist.üîΩThe meaning of the term ‚Äúnirvana with the nature of being unarisen‚Äù is that the remainder of the aggregates does not exist.üîΩThe meaning of the term ‚Äúnirvana with the nature of being unarisen‚Äù is that the remainder of the aggregates does not exist.üîΩThe meaning of the term ‚Äúnirvana with the nature of being unarisen‚Äù is that the remainder of the aggregates does not exist.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad pa can zhes bya ba ni gang zag la bdag med pa rtogs pas 'khor ba dang 'brel ba'i 'dod chags pa la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad pa can zhes bya ba ni gang zag la bdag med pa rtogs pas 'khor ba dang 'brel ba'i 'dod chags pa la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs par 'gyur te /
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúnirvana with the nature of being unarisen‚Äù is that the remainder of the aggregates does not exist.üîΩThe meaning of the term ‚Äúnirvana with the nature

original: gang dag la snying rje'i sa bon yod pa de dag de las rab tu sad de byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pas sangs rgyas kho na bya bar nus kyi /
analyzed: gang dag la snying rje'i sa bon yod pa de dag de las rab tu sad de byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pas sangs rgyas kho na bya bar nus kyi /
translated: Those who have the seed of compassion awaken from that and, by practicing the bodhisattva deeds, are able to become buddhas alone,

original: thams cad kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: but not all.

original: zhi ba'i phyogs gcig pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ni dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhi ba'i phyogs gcig pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ni dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa bzhin no //
translated: Those who are free from attachment to the one-sided peace of nirvana are like those in the Sutra Unraveling the Intention.

original: sangs rgyas 'phrul pas sprul pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gsungs pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'phrul pas sprul pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gsungs pa /
translated: Emanations of emanation bodies are as stated:

original: nyan thos dang ni rgyal ba yi //
analyzed: nyan thos dang ni rgyal ba yi //
translated: Emanations of hearers and victors

original: gang de gzugs su snang ba ni //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa'i brtse bdag gis //
analyzed: gang de gzugs su snang ba ni // byang chub sems dpa'i brtse bdag gis //
translated: appear in various forms

original: sprul pa de dag ston pa'o //
analyzed: sprul pa de dag ston pa'o //
translated: to those who are to be trained.

original: zhes te / 'phrul pas sprul pa ni nyan thos kyi bye brag go //
analyzed: zhes te / 'phrul pas sprul pa ni nyan thos kyi bye brag go //
translated: Emanations of emanation bodies are emanations of hearers.
